source: あっという間
references: ['Nothing.']
hypothesis: the time it takes to say "Ah!

source: 覚えてる　あっという間の出来事
references: ['As I recall it ended much too soon You look marvelous.']
hypothesis: I remember. It happened so fast.

source: 先生ならあっという間よ
references: ['Doctor Mixter have you stitched up in no time.']
hypothesis: You'll be up and running in no time.

source: ほら　ほら　あっという間に過ぎ去る 取るに足らないことだ
references: ['Look, look, it was fleeting, inconsequential.']
hypothesis: See, see, it goes by so fast, it's insignificant.

source: もしこれが本当に最後のチャンスなら、 何かあっと言わせるようなものを見つけないと。
references: ['If this really is your last chance, we need to find you something spectacular.']
hypothesis: If this really is our last chance, we need to find something to wow.

source: - 違うんだ - あっと言わせたくて
references: ["You're just trying to make me say something nice."]
hypothesis: - I just wanted to surprise you.

source: この新しいパートナーシップの早い成功を 互いに喜んでいます あっと言う間の２年、ヤムラに 最初のＧＰ勝利をもたらしました
references: ['Both delighted with the quick success of this new partnership which has brought Yamura his first Grand Prix victory after two years of flying.']
hypothesis: We are both pleased with the early success of this new partnership, which, in the blink of an eye, has brought the Yamura its first GP victory in two years.

source: あっと言う間だ
references: ['In a heartbeat']
hypothesis: It goes by in a blink of an eye.

source: 炎よ あっと言う間に 骨まで燃え尽きる
references: ["He'll melt the flesh off your bones in the blink of an eye."]
hypothesis: The flames, they'll burn you to the bone in the blink of an eye.

source: （哲希） プハーッ そりゃそうだ このまんまだと うちのクラスは 吉森のいいようにされちまうね
references: ["Well, that's right. If this continues, it will only benefit Yoshimori."]
hypothesis: （That's right... If things continue as they are... Our class will be made to do Yoshimori's bidding.

source: 奉公に行かなくていいようにする
references: ["I promise thee, you'll need not leave to serve the Tildens nor any family else."]
hypothesis: Make sure you don't have to go to serve.

source: 勝手なまねをした罰だ いい気味だ
references: ["Enough! They've had their fun!"]
hypothesis: I'm punished for my own selfishness. It's a nice touch.

source: - 全くいい気味だな メリー
references: ['-Not too happy at all, Merry.']
hypothesis: - That's a real nice touch, Merry.

source: いい気味だね
references: ['Crying like a sucky baby.']
hypothesis: That's a nice touch.

source: さあさあ いい目が出でてくれよ
references: ['CROUPIER: All right, boys. Come on, now.']
hypothesis: Come on, come on, come on, come on, come on, come on, come on, come on, come on, come on.

source: 奴を見て... 奴の 大きくて かわいい目を見て... 答えてくれよ
references: ['Look into his eyes those big, pretty eyes and tell me yes or no.']
hypothesis: Look at him... Look at his big, pretty eyes. Answer me.

source: まわりの連中は　いい迷惑だな 自分が間違ってることを 君は決して認めない
references: ['You know, it must be very difficult for people around you, the fact you can never admit to being wrong.']
hypothesis: It's a pain in the ass for those around you, because you'll never admit you're wrong.

source: 患者さん　いい迷惑だな。
references: ['What a nuisance it must be for the patient.']
hypothesis: Patient Good inconvenience.

source: 彼はいい顔をしないわ
references: ["I'd tell him myself, but he wouldn't understand."]
hypothesis: He won't look good.

source: いい子になるのも・・
references: ['I was free.']
hypothesis: And being a good boy...

source: あなたは走り続けた　スー いい子になりたくてね 大学生になるのを夢見て そして理想のボーイフレンドと 素晴らしいプロムを
references: ["You kept running, Sue, little Suze, because you've been dreaming about senior year and the perfect boyfriend and the perfect prom your whole goddamned life."]
hypothesis: You kept running, Sue, because you wanted to be a good girl, dreaming of being a college student and having a great prom with the boyfriend of your dreams.

source: では いい子になるのよ
references: ['Now remember, Pinocchio, be a good boy.']
hypothesis: Then be a good girl.

source: 問題児だったけど― いざという時は勇敢だった
references: ['He was a real handful... but when it came down to it, he was very brave.']
hypothesis: He was a troubled kid, but when push came to shove, he was brave.

source: いざという時が来たら― 君はどのくらいで ラボを引き継げるかな
references: ['If push came to shove, I was wondering how soon you might be able to take over the lab yourself.']
hypothesis: When the time comes, how long do you think it will take you to take over the lab?

source: いざという時　やり返す
references: ["I'm going out like I came in: screaming and kicking."]
hypothesis: When push comes to shove, we'll fight back.

source: おじゃんになった
references: ['Mm. Now, that blows.']
hypothesis: already finished

source: ほぉ　お世辞でも嬉しいな
references: ["Whoa. Well, I'm flattered."]
hypothesis: Well, I'm flattered.

source: お先真っ暗だな 勝手にやってろ
references: ["'Cause you just blew the best thing you had going for you."]
hypothesis: You've got a dark future ahead of you. You're on your own.

source: - お安い御用
references: ["- You're welcome."]
hypothesis: - easy task

source: あなたが勝って― お山の大将になったら―
references: ["And once you've won, once you're king of the mountain,"]
hypothesis: If you win, if you're the king of the hill...

source: お手の物ね
references: ["You're so good with him."]
hypothesis: You're good.

source: 反対尋問で陪審員は 銃はお手の物だった事が判りますし
references: ['So on cross-examination the jury could hear about how well he handled a gun?']
hypothesis: On cross-examination, the jury found that the gun was a piece of cake.

source: お手上げね
references: ['Allergies. Nothing you can do.']
hypothesis: I'm out of ideas.

source: お手上げだよ
references: ['I wish to hell we did.']
hypothesis: I can't help you.

source: あぁ　基本的なことはね 君にはお手上げだろ
references: ['Yeah, I got the basics. Wow. You are so in over your head.']
hypothesis: Yeah, the basics. You're in over your head.

source: とんだところでお目に掛かったな
references: ["- It's great to see you, Leslie!"]
hypothesis: I'm surprised to see you here.

source: すこし戸惑われたかもしれませんが お目に掛かれて大変光栄です
references: ["I'm very pleased, if slightly puzzled, to make your acquaintance."]
hypothesis: I know this may seem a little confusing, but it's a great honor to meet you.

source: 礼はする、またお目に掛かろう 近いうちにな
references: ["I'm gonna make a problem for you. I'm gonna be seeing you again, real soon."]
hypothesis: I thank you, and I'll see you again... soon.

source: 私たちにお誂え向きの仕事だわ
references: ["So we've got our work cut out for us."]
hypothesis: It's a job tailor-made for us.

source: お誂え向きだわ
references: ["We're not going to get a better window."]
hypothesis: It's just what I was looking for.

source: 財務長官だったんだよ お門違いどころか
references: ["I was the US Treasury Secretary. I'm in some position to make that call."]
hypothesis: He was the Secretary of the Treasury. Not only is that wrong, it's wrong.

source: そもそも、お門違いだし
references: ["'Cause you shouldn't be, anyway."]
hypothesis: And it's not the right thing to do in the first place.

source: 身分の違い 願うのは　お門違い
references: ["Because you'd be barking up the wrong beanstalk."]
hypothesis: It's not right to wish for a difference in status.

source: あいつ等のおべっかで 満足しました？ Kiss your(my) ass おべっかを使う、誰々のゴマをする
references: ['Did they kiss your ass to your satisfaction?']
hypothesis: Are you satisfied with their sycophancy? Kiss your(my) ass, who's sesame

source: かっとなって言っただけだよ
references: ["Listen, I'm sure your sister didn't mean what she said."]
hypothesis: I just said that in a fit of pique.

source: きまりが悪かったか？
references: ['You embarrassed about me?']
hypothesis: Was it too embarrassing?

source: ひどくきまりが悪かったよ たった５分間なのに
references: ['It was fucking embarrassing. It was only for five minutes.']
hypothesis: I was terribly embarrassed. It was only for five minutes.

source: きまりが悪いわ
references: ["It's embarrassing."]
hypothesis: It's embarrassing.

source: 始めた事の けじめを付けたいよ
references: ["I'll finish what I started."]
hypothesis: I just want to finish what we started.

source: おい　けりを付けたくないなら やめろ？
references: ["Hey, don't start this if you don't want to finish it."]
hypothesis: Hey, if you don't want to finish this, why don't you stop?

source: しょうもない酔っぱらいが
references: ['You fucking drunk.']
hypothesis: I'm just a stupid drunk.

source: しょうもない男と 関係を持ったんだ
references: ['Hooked up with this guy. He was no good. His name was...']
hypothesis: I had an affair with a guy who was a complete asshole.

source: - トレントしょうもないやつだ
references: ['Trent was a dick.']
hypothesis: - Trent, you're such a dick.

source: だが そうは問屋が卸さない
references: ["I just don't get it, Spock."]
hypothesis: But that's not how it works.

source: 笑顏も見せてくれないし 直ぐそっぽを向くし
references: ['Never give me a smile, or even a shrug.']
hypothesis: He doesn't even give me a smile. He just turns his back on me.

source: その手は食わないわ
references: ["Oh, no, I'm not falling for that."]
hypothesis: I'm not gonna eat that hand.

source: その手は食わない
references: ["I know what you're doing."]
hypothesis: I am not going to fall for that trick

source: もうその手は食わないわ
references: ["I'm not falling for this shit."]
hypothesis: I won't eat that hand anymore.

source: それはそれは、ほれぼれすること 目元が引き立って素晴らしいことね
references: ['Okay. Well, you look adorable. It really brings out your eyes.']
hypothesis: It's just so smitten. It's just so wonderful to see your eyes stand out.

source: めっちゃ うれしかった それは それは普通にうれしかった 俺は
references: ['-Yeah, it made me super happy. It made me happy.']
hypothesis: I was so happy. I was so happy. I was just happy.

source: 前回までのFringe... そ知らぬ顔で 成りすましたせいでしょ
references: ["Just because you walked in my shoes, don't you think that you know me."]
hypothesis: Previously on Fringe... You're pretending to be someone you're not.

source: そ知らぬ顔で 私の人生を奪ったせいでしょ
references: ["Just because you walked in my shoes don't you think for a moment that you know me."]
hypothesis: You took my life away from me like you didn't even know I was there.

source: 知られたら あなたは、ただでは済まないのよ
references: ["The point is, if he finds out about this, he's gonna transfer your ass to juneau so fast,"]
hypothesis: If they find out, you won't get away with it.

source: ちゃんちゃら　おかしいよ
references: ['That was a stupid idea.']
hypothesis: This is ridiculous.

source: ちょっかいを出してるんじゃないよ
references: ["I'm not bothering them none."]
hypothesis: I'm not trying to mess with you.

source: オオカミにちょっかいを出すと 群れでやって来るぜ さっきの仕返しだ
references: ['Guess nobody told you, if you mess with the wolf, you get the fangs.']
hypothesis: You mess with the wolves, they'll come to you in packs, just to get back at you.

source: ちょっかいを出したくなかったけど
references: ["I didn't mean to interfere, you know. Silly girl."]
hypothesis: I didn't want to mess with him.

source: デイブ　目に付く女全てに ちょっかいを出すのはやめてくれないか?
references: ['Dave, would you quit bothering every girl you see?']
hypothesis: Dave, would you please stop bothering every girl you see?

source: ちょっとした金
references: ['A little money. No, sorry.']
hypothesis: a little money

source: より汁気の多い料理を作れるし、 ちょっとした見栄えと演出も 料理に加えられる。
references: ['It creates a more succulent dish and adds a little theatricality to dinner.']
hypothesis: It allows you to make soupier dishes and adds a bit of visual flair and presentation to your food.

source: 私が冒険中 ちょっとした相棒を得るなら それは 感情や 気まぐれからではありません 多くの素晴らしい資質を 持っているということです
references: ['If I burden myself with a little helpmate during my adventures, this is not out of sentiment or caprice, it is that he has many fine qualities of his own that he has overlooked in his obsession with me.']
hypothesis: If I get a little sidekick during my adventures, it's not out of emotion or whim, it's that I have a lot of great qualities.

source: もし私が力を貸すと いったらどうかしら 貴方の抱えるクラウス問題と ちょっとしたネタを 引き換えに?
references: ['What if I told you that I could help you out with your Klaus problem in exchange for the tiniest bit of gossip?']
hypothesis: What if I offered to help you with your Klaus problem in exchange for a little story?

source: とてもじゃないが
references: ["No, he's taking it pretty hard."]
hypothesis: (before a negative form) simply (cannot)

source: とどのつまりだな　ジョン 我々が心と頭を奉げる対象とは 一人の男ではなく　理想なのだよ
references: ['Ultimately, John, we owe our hearts and our minds not to any one man but to an idea, and that idea is under threat.']
hypothesis: The bottom line, John, is that the object of our hearts and minds is not a man, but an ideal.

source: とどのつまりは 殺されるってのに
references: ['And you are en route to getting yourself killed,']
hypothesis: I mean, the end result is that you're gonna get killed.

source: とどのつまりはな
references: ['Eventually, yeah.']
hypothesis: after all is said and done

source: ない知恵を絞ってね
references: ['You know, in case you got displaced.']
hypothesis: Keep your wits about you.

source: そして、ほとぼりが冷めるまで、あなたはココに隠れています。 あなたがそれを知っているから。
references: ["And you're hiding out here until things cool down because you know it."]
hypothesis: And you will hide in Coco until the dust settles. Because you know it.

source: あんたは見てみぬ振りで 満足だっただろうが あんたには口がある
references: ["You were more than happy to turn a blind eye, but... you're not dumb."]
hypothesis: You were content to turn a blind eye, but you have a mouth.

source: 見て見ぬ振りをしています ただ...
references: ['I stay out of the way.']
hypothesis: I'm turning a blind eye. I just...

source: 見て見ぬ振りをした
references: ['You just looked the other way.']
hypothesis: I turned a blind eye.

source: 今から起きることは 見るに堪えない
references: ["What's about to happen is gonna be hard to watch."]
hypothesis: What's about to happen now is unbearable to watch.

source: 見るに堪えないわ
references: ["I can't watch."]
hypothesis: I can't bear to look at it.

source: 見るに堪えなかった？
references: ['Was it painful to see?']
hypothesis: Couldn't bear to see it?

source: 見るに忍びないか？
references: ["Can't stand the sight of a little blood?"]
hypothesis: Can't bear to look?

source: よく言うよ
references: ['He pressed you. Come on.']
hypothesis: Give me a break!

source: 生徒と寝といて よく言うな
references: ['Says the teacher who sleeps with his students.']
hypothesis: How dare you? You slept with one of my students.

source: 盗んだ女の分際で よく言うわ
references: ["That's pretty rich coming from the woman who stole Alex to begin with."]
hypothesis: How can you say that about a woman who stole from you?

source: 彼の "アキレス腱" だ
references: ['His Achilles heel.']
hypothesis: It's his Achilles heel.

source: 良いニュースは 彼女のアキレス腱は
references: ["Yes, the good news, she may have her own Achilles' heel."]
hypothesis: The good news is that her Achilles heel is.

source: 私の "アキレス腱"
references: ['My Achilles heel.']
hypothesis: My "Achilles heel."

source: アンテナを張ってればドクターはあちこち登場する
references: ['If you dig deep enough and keep a lively mind, this Doctor keeps cropping up all over the place.']
hypothesis: If you keep your antenna up, doctors will appear here and there.

source: オブラートに包んで言おうとしたんだ
references: ["I'm just- - I'm just trying to wrap my mind around it."]
hypothesis: I was trying to wrap my head around it.

source: 社長、これ以下の表現はオブラートに包む方が
references: ["Mr. Reid, do you understand that's kind of hitting it delicately?"]
hypothesis: Mr. President, it is better to wrap the expression below this in an oval.

source: 君たち　キャフリーは　我々より４時間も前に 有利なスタートを切ったことを忘れるな
references: ['Gentlemen, might I remind you that Caffrey has a four-hour head start?']
hypothesis: Gentlemen, don't forget that Caffrey got a head start less than four hours before us.

source: 新しいスタートを切り　古いしがらみも絶った
references: ['Fresh start, no old ties.']
hypothesis: A new start, a new beginning, old ties severed.

source: いつか 君の復帰する日が 来ることを願おう 初めから　支配人とは いかないだろうが 再スタートを切り 信頼を回復しろ
references: ['And one day when all this is ancient history, I hope you can come back, maybe not as a building manager at first, but somewhere where you can start over, earn our trust.']
hypothesis: Hopefully one day you'll be back, maybe not as a manager at first, but you'll get a fresh start and regain my trust.

source: ベッドの下に潜む怪物に スポットを当ててるだけさ
references: ["We're shining a light on the monster under the bed."]
hypothesis: I'm just trying to spot the monster lurking under the bed.

source: でも スポットライトを 浴びることになれば―
references: ["But Kate... you're stepping into the spotlight now."]
hypothesis: But if I'm ever in the spotlight...

source: スポットライトを浴びたいが パートナーが必要さ
references: ['I guess I crave the spotlight. All I need is a proper partner.']
hypothesis: I want the spotlight, but I need a partner.

source: 特に公衆のスポットライトを浴びる のが好きな人物はね
references: ['Especially one who enjoys the public spotlight so much.']
hypothesis: Especially someone who likes to be in the public spotlight.

source: タオルを投げる選択肢はない 私たちにあるのは ２つの道だ
references: ['But seeing as throwing in the towel is not an option that leaves us with a total of two choices.']
hypothesis: We don't have the option of throwing in the towel, we have two paths.

source: 全てについてタオルを投げちゃうかな
references: ["Maybe I'll just listen to the universe and... and throw the towel in on the whole thing."]
hypothesis: I guess I'll throw in the towel on the whole thing.

source: タオルを投げる
references: ["- So I'm gonna call the fight."]
hypothesis: throw in the towel

source: 私を縛ってたテープを切るから
references: ['He said he would cut me free.']
hypothesis: I'll cut the tape that ties me up.

source: 意外とミーハーなんだよなあ
references: ['You are pretty oldfashioned, despite your looks.']
hypothesis: It's surprisingly meek.

source: 紗絵子さんは ミーハーな ノリで 新しいものに 飛び付くけど 商品に対しては シビアだよ｡
references: ["Saeko-san jumps at new things like a trendhopper, but she's a harsh judge of products."]
hypothesis: Saeko-san jumps at new things with a meek and easygoing attitude, but she is very serious about her products.

source: 案外ミーハーなんだよね
references: ["She's oldfashioned despite her looks, right?"]
hypothesis: It's more meek than you might think.

source: 大学病院の腐った院内政治に 鋭くメスを入れますよ。 ちょっ　ちょっ...
references: ['I plan to delve deeply into the rotten politics at university hospitals.']
hypothesis: I'm going to take a hard look at the corrupt hospital politics at the university hospital. Hey, hey...

source: ダビデ像が無事だと？ ... モナリザの微笑みは？
references: ["Who would make sure that the Statue of David is still standing, or that Mona Lisa's still smiling?"]
hypothesis: You think the statue of David is safe? ... What about the Mona Lisa's smile?

source: ユリイカ！
references: ['Eureka!']
hypothesis: Eureka!

source: 一種のユートピアの創造さ つまり...
references: ['I sort of created a utopian society where we all sort of...']
hypothesis: The creation of a kind of utopia, in other words...

source: 私達は夢中でユートピアを作ったよ
references: ['We were jamming, man, building utopia.']
hypothesis: We went crazy and created a utopia.

source: 私たちは毒を持った宿命の人たちの中にい- ます。 常にユートピアです...
references: ['We are among those whose fate is a poison We are constantly utopia ...']
hypothesis: We are among those who are destined to be poisoned. It is always a utopia...

source: それでもあんた　有罪にしたい？ なにがなんでも彼女に犯罪者のレッテルを貼りたい
references: ['You still want to stamp a mark of conviction on her?']
hypothesis: You still want to convict her? You want to label her a criminal at all costs.

source: あんたは レッテルを貼ってるだけだ
references: ['These are all labels. You just label everything.']
hypothesis: You're just putting a label on it.

source: 起業して軌道に乗るまでかかった、でもローマは一日にしてならずだよ
references: ["It took a while to get up and running, but Rome wasn't built in a day."]
hypothesis: It took me a while to get my business off the ground, but Rome wasn't built in a day.

source: 情報部の幹部は いつも一か八かなんです
references: ["Intelligence officers usually hedge their bets. It's..."]
hypothesis: Intelligence officers are always at the mercy of the fickle.

source: 一か八かだが シスコと私でやってみる
references: ["It's a bit of a hail mary, But Cisco and I are going to give it a try."]
hypothesis: It's a toss-up, but Cisco and I will give it a shot.

source: 一か八かしかない
references: ["Risk is all I've got left."]
hypothesis: all or nothing

source: 一つ間違えれば殺される
references: ['One mistake, I die.']
hypothesis: One wrong move and you're dead.

source: 一つ間違えば大勢の命が
references: ['We make one mistake, thousands of people die.']
hypothesis: One wrong move and a lot of lives will be lost.

source: 年に１度 コウノトリが一堂に会する
references: ['Once a year, storks come together for one thing. Storkcon!']
hypothesis: Once a year, storks come together

source: 一寸先は闇だな
references: ["So, I've been thinking about those thousand razors."]
hypothesis: You know, it's always darkest at the end of the day.

source: 一寸先は闇だ
references: ["You're dying the death of a thousand razors up there and you don't even know it."]
hypothesis: No one knows what the future holds

source: 一寸先は闇だ つらい毎日だったよ
references: ["I don't know. I don't know what happened. Tough couple of days."]
hypothesis: It's always darkest when you're in the dark. It's been a tough couple of days.

source: 気付かれたら 全員が一巻の終わりよ
references: ["Because if they see you coming, we're all dead."]
hypothesis: If they find out, we're all dead.

source: 一巻の終わり
references: ["But if Torus gets the ARQ... they'll be unstoppable."]
hypothesis: the end of the line

source: 一巻の終わりだな
references: ['We are so dead.']
hypothesis: The end of a chapter.

source: 一本取られたな、中尉。
references: ['Fair point, Lieutenant.']
hypothesis: You got one, Lieutenant.

source: 一本取られた
references: ["- She's got you there."]
hypothesis: you've got me there

source: 一本取られたようですな
references: ['You win.']
hypothesis: Looks like you got one.

source: 一杯食わせやがったな！
references: ['You swindled me!']
hypothesis: You made me eat one!

source: ああ　一杯食わされた だが　失敗した
references: ['Yeah, you took your shot, but you missed.']
hypothesis: Yeah, I got my fill, but it didn't work out.

source: 一杯食わされたな
references: ['You should have seen your face.']
hypothesis: You've had your fill.

source: お人よし過ぎた だから一杯食わされた
references: ["I've been gullible, all right, letting him make a fool of me."]
hypothesis: He was too good-natured. That's why he took the bait.

source: 当然彼も一枚噛んでる
references: ['Of course he was involved.']
hypothesis: Of course he's in on it.

source: いや　お前は一筋縄では行かない
references: ['No, nothing with you is easy.']
hypothesis: No, you're not a straight shooter.

source: - 奴は　一筋縄では行かないからな
references: ["- He's not playing with a straight bat?"]
hypothesis: - He's not a one-trick pony.

source: ええ 彼はもっと上手に対処すべきだ でも　彼は友人で 彼の為にひと肌脱ぐつもりだ
references: ["But he's my friend, and I'm gonna bat for him."]
hypothesis: Yes, he should handle it better, but he's my friend, and I'm willing to put my skin on the line for him.

source: 私が持ってきた情報は 一刻を争うものです
references: ['The Intel that I brought back is time sensitive.']
hypothesis: The information I bring to you is time sensitive.

source: 一刻を争う事態でしたので 報告が遅れたことはお詫びします (浅野)結局 国税に持っていかれたら 元も子もないですね
references: ['but it was a race against time. it was all for naught.']
hypothesis: It was a time-sensitive situation and I apologize for the delay in reporting it. it's all for naught if the Taxation Bureau takes it after all.

source: 一刻を争ってる
references: ["Father, they don't have a lot of time."]
hypothesis: We're running out of time.

source: どう　一口乗らない？
references: ['So, what do you say?']
hypothesis: How about a bite?

source: 僕も　今度 一席　設けるから。
references: ["I'd love to meet him sometime. I will."]
hypothesis: I'll set up a table for you sometime.

source: 今夜は特別だ、まず一張羅に着替えろ
references: ['You have a feast tonight. First change your clothes.']
hypothesis: Tonight is special. First, change into your one-piece suit.

source: 彼の一張羅の上着だぞ
references: ['He only wears that one damn jacket.']
hypothesis: It's his one jacket.

source: （逮捕に一役買ったので 俺達の違法行為は見逃されたのだ）
references: ['But since we led the cops to Harken they ultimately agreed to let our other offenses slide.']
hypothesis: （We helped make the arrests, so our illegal activities went unnoticed.)

source: ジェーンはオレたちには トラブル メーカーだ 粛正に一役買っても良い
references: ['Now, what befell Jane is very troubling to all of us, and we would like to help you to set it right.']
hypothesis: Jane's a troublemaker for us, and I'm willing to do my part to clean it up.

source: 私が君の記憶に一役買うとしたら？
references: ['What if I help your memory?']
hypothesis: What if I play a part in your memory?

source: 大丈夫 一息入れて　落ち着いて
references: ['Okay. Just breathe and relax.']
hypothesis: It's okay. Take a breath. Calm down.

source: 俺達が　一息入れるころ 船はダイヤを乗せて　パリに向かう
references: ['When we come up for air, that ship will be headed to Paris and the diamond will be gone forever.']
hypothesis: By the time we catch our breath, the ship will be headed to Paris with the diamonds.

source: - 一息入れろよ、マイク
references: ['- Get some ice cream, Mike.']
hypothesis: - Take a breath, Mike.

source: 僕は今日１日　この２３人の前容疑者の 一言一句漏らさず 一挙手一投足から　無意識な反応まで 観察し続けていた
references: ['I spent today soaking in every word, every gesture, every involuntary reaction of these 23 former suspects.']
hypothesis: I have spent the day observing these 23 former suspects, watching their every word, their every move, their every involuntary reaction.

source: 地域外では大規模な掘削活動が 行われていて - -我々は一挙手一投足を見張られている
references: ['There has been massive digging activity out there and they undoubtedly monitor our every move.']
hypothesis: There is a massive drilling operation going on outside the area and we are being watched every step of the way.

source: 仕事に戻ったばかりの 君にしてみれば 情緒が不安定な状態にもなるし 君の一挙手一投足を観察してる 上の奴らに対して
references: ["I understand your precarious emotional state, given you've just gotten your job back, and your sensitivity to the bureaucrats that are watching your every move."]
hypothesis: And it can be emotionally unstable for you, given that you just got back to work, and you're being watched every move you make by the people above you.

source: つかまってろ 小惑星帯に入るぞ これで一泡吹かせてやる
references: ["We'll move into the asteroid field... and we'll have a couple of surprises for him."]
hypothesis: Hang on, we're about to enter the asteroid field. I'm gonna give this one a whirl.

source: 自殺行為だ アンナに一泡吹かせてやりたいが
references: ["It's a suicide mission."]
hypothesis: It's a suicide mission. I'd love to give Anna a shot, but...

source: 配置についた 一泡吹かせてやる
references: ["We're on point, ready to give them some of their own medicine."]
hypothesis: I'm in position. I'm gonna give him a shot.

source: - アルフォンには一目置かれている - おう　そうか？
references: ['I saw Alphonse respected me back there.']
hypothesis: - Alfons has his eyes on me.

source: 彼はお前を一目置いている
references: ['He sees something in you.']
hypothesis: He's got his eye on you.

source: 皆が一目置いてる NYの私立学校関係者も
references: ['That sort of thing means something to people in private schools in New York City.']
hypothesis: Everyone has a crush on him, even the New York City private school officials.

source: "教会は 考えられる限りの" あらゆる医療に 多大な努力を払っていますが 心理学的な説明は お祓い前には一笑に付されます
references: ['The church takes great pains to make sure every conceivable medical or psychological explanation can be ruled out before moving forward.']
hypothesis: "The Church makes a great effort to provide every conceivable" medical treatment, but the psychological explanations are laughed out of the equation before the exorcism.

source: 一笑に付され 自分の首を絞めるだけだ
references: ["They'd laugh at the truth, and I'd have my head in a noose."]
hypothesis: You'll be laughed out of here, and you'll only be strangling yourself.

source: お前達とは問題を起こしたことがなかった 反逆の一翼を担うまではな
references: ['I never had a problem with your people... until they became a part of this rebellion.']
hypothesis: I never had a problem with you people until you became part of the rebellion.

source: 私は偉大な愛国戦争の 一翼を担う事を 誇りに思います
references: ['I am proud to be part of this mission in the great patriotic war.']
hypothesis: I am proud to be a part of the great patriotic war.

source: 近づく為に一芝居打つよ
references: ["I want to get close to Latimer. And I'll need a cover story."]
hypothesis: I'll put on a show to get closer.

source: 彼は一言もなく 何週間も行方をくらましたんです
references: ['He has been gone for weeks.. Not a single word.']
hypothesis: He disappeared for weeks without a word.

source: 一言もなく死亡しました
references: ['And did not live to tell about it.']
hypothesis: He died without a word.

source: 私に一言も無く？
references: ['Without telling me?']
hypothesis: Without a word to me?

source: うん　三度目の正直ね
references: ['Yeah, maybe three times is a charm.']
hypothesis: Yeah. Third time's a charm.

source: - 三度目の正直か？
references: ['"Third time\'s a charm?"']
hypothesis: - Third time's the charm?

source: 長官たちが 党大会の壇上に立って― 犯人逮捕を アピールするんだぞ
references: ["The entire top tier of the Bureau's in town to stand onstage and show the world that we prevailed."]
hypothesis: The secretaries of state are going to be on stage at the party convention to show that we've caught the killer.

source: そこの上げたり下げたりしている人
references: ["Well? What's your vote?"]
hypothesis: Who's raising and lowering there.

source: 実験の成功の為 私は上手に出るしかなかった
references: ['For the experience to succeed. I had to get the upper hand,']
hypothesis: I had to come out on top to make the experiment a success.

source: CIAの一つ上手を行きたいの？ そうだ CIAの現状を暴露したい
references: ["Yes, I want to expose the CIA for what it's become, but... mainly, I want to catch him."]
hypothesis: You want to go one better than the CIA? Yes, I want to expose the CIA for what it is.

source: 真剣にやれ 下手すると怪我するぞ
references: ["Take this serious, because you can get hurt if you're not strong enough, okay?"]
hypothesis: Take it seriously. If you're not careful, you could get hurt.

source: 下手すると 誰かの人生を台無しに
references: ["If I fuck up I can ruin somebody's whole life."]
hypothesis: If you're bad, you can ruin someone's life.

source: 今､上手くいってますが下手をすると終わりです
references: ["Now, we walk in there like this, with this, we're done."]
hypothesis: It's working now, but if it's not, it's over.

source: 真剣に言ってる 下手をすると これから20年は監獄だぞ
references: ["Preston, if you're not careful, you're going to spend 20 years in prison."]
hypothesis: I'm serious. If you're not careful, you'll spend the next 20 years in jail.

source: あの高さじゃ不幸中の幸いだった
references: ['Not bad, considering the height.']
hypothesis: It was a blessing in disguise at that height.

source: "それを知られてないのは 不幸中の幸いだ"
references: ["Yeah, well, I'm glad they don't know that."]
hypothesis: "It's a blessing in disguise that they don't know that."

source: それでも不幸中の幸いだ
references: ["We're lucky they got out when they did."]
hypothesis: Still, it's a blessing in disguise.

source: 花火は不発に終わり 最悪の事態に
references: ["Only Fitzpatrick didn't explode, it was far worse than that."]
hypothesis: The fireworks were a dud. The worst of it.

source: だが不発に終わった
references: ["That's the only reason why I'm still here."]
hypothesis: But it was a dud.

source: 不肖の父親だがやらない
references: ["Look, I'm not the world's best dad, but I would never do that."]
hypothesis: I'm an unworthy father, but I won't do it.

source: 息子の不興を買うのが怖いんでしょ？
references: ["Terrified of displeasing him, aren't you? I know how my son can be."]
hypothesis: You're afraid of displeasing your son, aren't you?

source: 掛けて 悲しむべき事に 世に出る前に死んだ
references: ['Sadly, fredrick died without ever being published.']
hypothesis: Sadly, he died before he could be introduced to the world.

source: この写真が世に出たら ＤＥＡは終わりだ
references: ["The DEA's worst nightmare is that face out in public."]
hypothesis: Once this picture gets out to the world, the DEA is done.

source: 君が怒る必要は　無い これが世の習いって　やつだ
references: ['Maybe angry is just the way of the world.']
hypothesis: There's no need for you to be angry. That's the way of the world.

source: 栄光は長子のもの それが世の習いだが
references: ["You're the elder, you reap the glory. This is the way of the world."]
hypothesis: Glory belongs to the firstborn. That's the way of the world.

source: 世も末だ
references: ['Even for the apocalypse.']
hypothesis: The end of the world.

source: 俺がこんな事をするとは 世も末だ
references: ['Of all the horrible things I have had to do in the apocalypse,']
hypothesis: I never thought I'd do something like this. It's the end of the world.

source: そんなに誉れ高き王たちが運び屋に用があるとは世も末だ
references: ['What is the world coming to when smugglers must vouch for the honor of kings?']
hypothesis: It's the end of the world when so honorable kings have no use for couriers.

source: 悲劇にも 若くしてこの世を去った...
references: ['...who was snuffed out... tragically early.']
hypothesis: Tragically, he passed away at a young age...

source: 全員笑いで息を詰まらせるまで この世を去るつもりはない
references: ["And I'll not leave this world until they all choke on that laughter."]
hypothesis: I will not leave this world until we all choke on our laughter.

source: 何年も前に世を去った
references: ['Lost for many years.']
hypothesis: He left the world many years ago.

source: ほんとに世話が焼ける人
references: ['Your uselessness is epic.']
hypothesis: A real pain in the ass.

source: 来年　僕はずっと家にいる 世話が焼けて ママも大変だ
references: ["I guess I'll just be home, which sucks for you because it's gonna be so hard for you to go through all my stuff."]
hypothesis: Next year, I'll be home all the time. It'll be hard on her, too.

source: ポッポちゃんは　世話が焼ける
references: ['You must admit she works hard with those chicken feathers!']
hypothesis: Poppo is a pain in the ass.

source: 俺は人の世話になったことない 自分のことは自分でする
references: ["I've always paid my way. You know I send what I can."]
hypothesis: I've never taken care of anyone. I take care of myself.

source: 残りを昔世話になった遺伝学の教授に送ったの
references: ['I sent on to my old genetics professor.']
hypothesis: I sent the rest to my old genetics professor.

source: 世話を焼いてくれんでも 自分で出来る
references: ["Why must you always mother-hen me? I'm quite capable of looking after myself."]
hypothesis: You don't have to take care of me. I can do it myself.

source: レノックス･ヒル病院前です ヴァン･ルーンとの合併が 世間を騒がせてますが
references: ['Outside Lenox Hill Hospital today, more twists and turns in the Van Loon-Atwood merger.']
hypothesis: I'm here in front of Lenox Hill Hospital, where the Van Loon merger is making headlines.

source: ああ　だが　あの銃は両刃の剣だ
references: ["Yeah, the gun's a double-edged sword, kind of."]
hypothesis: Yeah, but that gun is a double-edged sword.

source: 歯止めとして働きますが 両刃の剣です
references: ["Besides, he's hot."]
hypothesis: It works as a deterrent, but it's a double-edged sword.

source: ダンスフロアでは 両手に花で踊つたものだ
references: ['On the dance floor I used to dance with girls on each arm.']
hypothesis: On the dance floor, we used to dance with flowers in both hands.

source: だから、私は中に入る チャップルが何を 隠しているのか見つけて下さい
references: ["So, I'll go back in, see what exactly Chapple's hiding."]
hypothesis: So I go in, find out what Chapple is hiding.

source: さあ　中に入って 何かお口に合う物を探さなくては 文明国から来たお友達にね
references: ["Oh, come inside, and we'll see if we can't get you some food, and some civilized company."]
hypothesis: Come on, we have to go inside and find something to eat for our friends from the civilized world.

source: じゃあ　気が済んだら― 中に入って貰えるかな？
references: ['Well, now that you have, can I politely invite you to step off my fucking porch?']
hypothesis: Well, when you're done, would you mind coming inside?

source: 注目の的になることは 彼女にとって　荷が重すぎて 悪い仲間の中に入ってしまった
references: ['The attention was too much for her, and she fell in with the wrong crowd.']
hypothesis: Being the center of attention was too much for her, and she fell in with the wrong crowd.

source: このバカは７，８人の ゾンビの真ん中に立ってた
references: ['This prick stands right in the mix, while seven or eight of them turn Zeke all at the same time.']
hypothesis: This idiot was standing in the middle of seven or eight zombies.

source: ｳﾞｫｰｹﾞﾙはどのように丸くなった How the fuck did that happen ?
references: ['How did Vogel come round? How the fuck did that happen?']
hypothesis: How did Vogel get round How the fuck did that happen ?

source: でも、あなたの可愛い娘は九死に一生を得ましたよ。
references: ["But your little darling's got nine lives."]
hypothesis: But your lovely daughter has had nine lives.

source: 知ってるのは未来の運命 予断を許さない状態 あなたは役割を果たせばいい
references: ['All I know is that the fate of the future hangs in the balance, and you have some role to play.']
hypothesis: All I know is that the future is unpredictable, and you have to do your part.

source: 銃で撃たれ 予断を許さない状態です
references: ['Hancock is in serious condition with multiple gunshot wounds.']
hypothesis: He's been shot. We don't know what to expect.

source: ナショナル・シティ総合病院にて 昏睡状態で― 予断を許さない状態が続いていますが スーパーガールのタイムリーな 到着が無ければ...
references: ['Willis is currently in a coma at National City General, although her fate would have been much more grim had it not been for the timely arrival of Supergirl...']
hypothesis: She remains in a coma at National City General Hospital, and her condition remains unpredictable, but without the timely arrival of Supergirl...

source: あんな美しい人とは争えない
references: ['I cannot vie with such beauty and such sorrow.']
hypothesis: I can't fight with someone that beautiful.

source: りんごは木から離れた所に落ちない （血統は争えない）
references: ["The apple doesn't fall far from the tree, my friend."]
hypothesis: The apple doesn't fall far from the tree. (You can't fight the bloodline.)

source: 血は争えない
references: ['Blood runs true.']
hypothesis: Like father, like son

source: 簡単に事が運ぶとは言ってない
references: ['I never told you it was gonna be easy.']
hypothesis: I never said things would be easy.

source: そう簡単に 事が運ぶわけないじゃない？
references: ["You didn't think that'd be that easy, did you?"]
hypothesis: It's not that easy, is it?

source: シンプルに事が運べば 人間 苦労しないよ
references: ['If things were that simple, no one would ever suffer.']
hypothesis: If things were that simple, people wouldn't have a hard time.

source: ゾーイ・バーンズの 記事によると デュラント上院議員が― カーン退場後の 新たな国務長官候補に...
references: ["Zoe Barnes of the Washington Herald now reporting, quoting a source close to the President, as saying that Senator Catherine Durant will likely be the new nominee for Secretary of State after Michael Kern's withdrawal earlier this week."]
hypothesis: Zoe Barnes reports that Senator Durant is the new nominee for Secretary of State after Kern's exit...

source: この記事によると あなたが ブラック・マウンテン警備 の事件に関わっていたらしい
references: ['Listen, this paper talks about you being in this Black Mountain Security thing.']
hypothesis: According to this article, you were involved in the Black Mountain Security case.

source: 地方記事によると、スーザン ジョーンズさん、二人の子供の母．．．
references: ['Locals reported Susan Jones, an American mother of two...']
hypothesis: According to a local article, Susan Jones, mother of two children ...

source: AV業界の多くの女性は 私生活と仕事を 分けているわ
references: ['A lot of the women in the adult film industry completely separate their porn lives from their personal lives.']
hypothesis: Many women in the adult film industry keep their personal and professional lives separate.

source: そして、僕は関与を 非難される事を好まない... 人類の大虐殺の罪を、たった一言... それも僕がすでに指摘した サイロンであろう女性の言葉で
references: ["And I don't like to be accused of participating in the genocide of the human race based solely on the word of a woman whom I have already indicated to you may well be a Cylon agent."]
hypothesis: And I don't like to be accused of involvement... For the crime of human genocide, with just one word... And that too in the words of the woman I've already pointed out, who may well be a Cylon.

source: " 事を構えずに済んだ "
references: ['We have one chance for peace...']
hypothesis: "I didn't have to take matters into my own hands."

source: シフターが事を起こした後は 俺たちのシマを奪い 侮辱したら
references: ['After what those shifters have done -- chipping away at our territory, insulting us...']
hypothesis: After what the shifters have done, after they've taken our territory, after they've insulted us.

source: ご存知通りです　陛下 老師の責務はご希望通りに事を運ぶだけに及びません 戦時には　助言を申し上げることも責務
references: ['As you know, Your Grace, it is not only the sworn duty of a Maester to carry out the wishes of the house he serves, but also to offer guidance and counsel in times of war.']
hypothesis: As you know, Your Majesty, a Maester's duty is not only to carry out your wishes, but also to offer his advice in time of war.

source: 食事を運ぶ者もなく
references: ['Nobody to bring her food.']
hypothesis: No one to carry the food.

source: 警部 私は頭越しに事を運ぶのは 好みませんし
references: ["Look, captain, I don't like going over anybody's head,"]
hypothesis: Captain, I don't like to go over your head.

source: さて、捕虜を取らないとすると、 残る選択肢は二つに一つだ
references: ['Now, that leaves two ways we can play this out.']
hypothesis: Now, if we take no prisoners, that leaves us with one of two options.

source: 死ぬか生きるか、二つに一つだ
references: ['I am killing us, or saving us.']
hypothesis: You either die or you live. It's one of two things.

source: タイヤン・シェンは両方に必要だ 二つに一つの選択だ
references: ['Both plans require the Taiyang Shen. So, we have to choose.']
hypothesis: The Taiyang Shen needs to go both ways. It's a choice between the two.

source: 二つ返事だったわね
references: ["That didn't take long."]
hypothesis: That was two words.

source: 彼と一緒に過ごすために 自分のキャリアは　二の次にした
references: ['I put my career on hold to be with him.']
hypothesis: I put my career on the back burner to spend time with him.

source: 君がお別れが言えなかった 二の舞いにしないでくれ
references: ["It's wrong that you didn't get to say goodbye to your sister. Give them what you deserved."]
hypothesis: Don't make it a repeat of when you didn't get to say goodbye.

source: ２００８年の二の舞はごめんだ！
references: ['Squirrel.. I am not going to have a repeat of 2008!']
hypothesis: We don't want a repeat of 2008!

source: スタークの二の舞を踏むつもりはない
references: ["I don't mean to follow Ned Stark to the grave."]
hypothesis: I'm not going to play second fiddle to Stark.

source: 離婚の費用を考えると　いつも 二の足を踏んできたが フリックとの浮気のお陰で 彼女への支払い金額が半分になる
references: ["The cost of divorce always deterred me but her infidelity with Fricke cut the payout she'd receive in half."]
hypothesis: I've always second-guessed the cost of a divorce, but thanks to my affair with Frick, I'm cutting my payments to her in half.

source: 男達の描写の方に力を入れてた それは何故 私はモンローに惹かれてるのに
references: ["I keep writing men better than the woman, which is so strange, because Marilyn is who I'm most captivated by, just like they were, I guess."]
hypothesis: I was more focused on the men. Why is that? I'm attracted to Marilyn.

source: はやく、もっと力を入れてくれ！
references: ['Now! Oome on!']
hypothesis: Quick, put more effort into it!

source: 寝返っては居ない 安心材料を必要としてる 力を落としてる
references: ["He's still with us, but he needs to feel a sense of control, power."]
hypothesis: He's not turning. He needs reassurance. He's losing power.

source: 一休みしろ　海軍の仲間達が 俺達のために抵抗力を落としてくれる
references: ['Take a breather. Our pals in the Navy are going to soften them up for us.']
hypothesis: Take a break, our Navy buddies are gonna drop the resistance for us.

source: それを見直して　少し認めてくれるなら 喜んで　私の洞察力を貸してあげるわ
references: ["If they'd review it, grant me a few, well, then I'd be happy to lend my insights."]
hypothesis: If you're willing to review it and give it a little credit, I'd be happy to lend you my insight.

source: ちょっぴり私達に 力を貸すだけでいいの 追跡呪文でお兄様を 見つけ出すのに
references: ['We need you to perform a teeny, tiny locator spell to help us find our brother.']
hypothesis: All you need to do is help us out a little bit to find your brother with a tracking spell.

source: 私に何してもいいが、 この悪に力を貸さないよ！
references: ["You can do what you want with me. I won't be a part of this... this this evil any longer."]
hypothesis: You can do whatever you want to me, but I will not help you with this evil!

source: 身動きが取れなくなっちゃった
references: ["I'm screwed up."]
hypothesis: I'm stuck.

source: 図書館で身動きが取れなくなってる 分隊が有ります
references: ['We got a squad pinned down in a library.']
hypothesis: We have a squad stuck in the library.

source: 最近の出来事も 勘定に入れなくてはなるまい
references: ['However, recent events must be taken into account.']
hypothesis: I suppose we have to take recent events into account as well.

source: だが彼は勝手を知ってるし 君は関わらないのが一番だ
references: ['And safe and cautious is you not being involved in this at all.']
hypothesis: But he knows what he's doing, and it's best if you stay out of it.

source: 勝負は時の運
references: ['You win some, you lose some.']
hypothesis: victory depends on the luck of the day (i.e. it isn't always the strongest who wins)

source: 僕の経験では　勤勉は成功の母だ
references: ['My experience-- diligence is the mother of luck.']
hypothesis: In my experience, hard work is the mother of success.

source: 難問を 突きつけるのは あなたの 十八番
references: ['You always told me to ask the tough questions.']
hypothesis: You know, posing the hard questions is your specialty.

source: - 千里の道も一歩から
references: ['- You have to start somewhere.']
hypothesis: - a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step

source: 千里の道も一歩からだ
references: ['Every journey begins with a first step.']
hypothesis: a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step

source: "千里の道も一歩から 最初の一歩から "始まる
references: ['"A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step."']
hypothesis: "A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step, the first step."

source: それは分ってるが お前なら 銀河間　超空間　千里眼で 誰か探せるんだろ
references: ['I know that, but maybe you can use your intergalactic, hyperspace, X-ray eyeballs to find someone else.']
hypothesis: I know that, but I'm sure you can find someone with your intergalactic, hyperspace, clairvoyant eyesight.

source: 千里眼があるのか 霊能者なのか
references: ["You're either a clairvoyant... a psychic, a seer, a soothsayer, or something."]
hypothesis: Are you clairvoyant or psychic?

source: 千里眼だ
references: ['Clairvoyant.']
hypothesis: Clairvoyance.

source: そう何度も危ない橋を 渡ることはできん
references: ["It's one thing if my employer gets iced. It's another if it happens in his bedroom."]
hypothesis: We can't keep going over the edge like that.

source: 見物はしたためしがない ロックフェラーのように 危ない橋を渡るタイプだ　カラ
references: ['Never pictured you as a Rockefeller ice-skating type, Kara.']
hypothesis: I've never been a spectator, but I'm a risk-taker like Rockefeller, Kara.

source: この上ご厄介に なる訳にはいきません
references: ["I couldn't impose on your hospitality any longer, sir."]
hypothesis: I can't afford to be a nuisance on top of this.

source: - シアトルへと厄介払い
references: ['- Shipped off to Seattle.']
hypothesis: - Good riddance to Seattle.

source: あのクソ女は俺を厄介払いしようってのか
references: ['God,that bitch pisses me off.']
hypothesis: That bitch is trying to get rid of me.

source: 彼は厄介払いだと思うだろう
references: ["I think he'd take it as an affront, like I'm trying to get rid of him."]
hypothesis: You'd think good riddance to him.

source: わしは奴を厄介払いし 指環と財宝を手に入れる
references: ['I can finish him off with ease, and the ring and the hoard are mine!']
hypothesis: I'll dispose of him and take the ring and the hoard

source: バートレイの推進してた事業で 反りが合わなくて ガブリエルは クビにされてる
references: ['Seems Gabrielle was fired for apparently being difficult to work with while Bartley went on to be promoted several times and make a small fortune.']
hypothesis: Gabriel was fired because of a disagreement over a project Bartley was promoting.

source: お前には反吐が出るよ
references: ['And that is why I have nothing but contempt for you.']
hypothesis: You make me want to vomit.

source: 反吐が出るほどだ わしが働くすべてに何時も 自分ばかり見出す
references: ['To my disgust I find only myself in all I bring about']
hypothesis: It's repulsive, everything I work for, I always see myself in it.

source: 反吐が出る
references: ['Makes me sick.']
hypothesis: give oneself up (esp. to someone of low social standing, circumstances, etc.)

source: ジェダイは　元老院に 反旗を翻すでしょう
references: ["The council's next move will be against the senate."]
hypothesis: The Jedi will turn against the Senate.

source: 人々が反旗を翻した時 お父上は彼らの舌を切って燃やしました
references: ['When the people rose in revolt against him your father set their towns and castles aflame.']
hypothesis: When the people rebelled, your father cut out their tongues and burned them.

source: アンナの種族にも 反旗を翻す者が
references: ['Even her own kind are turning on Anna now.']
hypothesis: There are those of Anna's tribe who have risen up against her.

source: 引き止めたが 取り付く島もなかった
references: ['I tried to stop him, but he definitely wanted to get the hell out of here.']
hypothesis: I tried to stop him, but there was nothing I could do.

source: 多分　マシンに聞くべきだ サイラス・ウェルズに関する 詳細については あなたは彼を考える前に 取るに足りない
references: ['Perhaps you should ask the machine for a bit more information about Cyrus Wells before you deem him insignificant.']
hypothesis: Maybe you should ask the machine for more information about Cyrus Wells before you consider him insignificant.

source: 我々の取るに足りない努力を 見つめることは 帰るのに遠いと言う 注意として役に立つだけだった
references: ['And to gaze upon our paltry efforts only served as a reminder that we were a long way from going home.']
hypothesis: Staring at our insignificant efforts only served as a reminder that we were a long way from home.

source: あまりに取るに 足らないことだ。 玉皇大帝に話しておこう。
references: ["It's too trivial to mention to Jade Emperor"]
hypothesis: It is too insignificant. I will talk to Jade Emperor.

source: 少なくとも君は取るに足らない ヒモのように見える　合ってるか？
references: ['At least you look like a two-bit pimp to me. Am I right?']
hypothesis: At least you look like an insignificant pimp to me. Am I right?

source: もちろん、あなたのような取るに足らない 人物に伝えるのは簡単ではない。
references: ["Of course, it's not easy to tell for small potatoes like you."]
hypothesis: Of course, it is not easy to tell such an insignificant person like you.

source: 「"アンナがハルマゲドンを 呼び起こすのなら"」 「"受けて立つ覚悟だ" と」
references: ['"if Anna\'s bringing Armageddon, I\'m going out fighting. "']
hypothesis: "If Anna is going to bring about Armageddon," he said, "I'm ready to take the fall."

source: 口が過ぎるぜ
references: ['You talk too much.']
hypothesis: You talk too much.

source: ようは　彼女を愛している だが　彼女はいつも口が過ぎる
references: ['I eventually loved her, but every time she got out of line,']
hypothesis: I mean, I love her, but she always talks too much.

source: 本当に口が堅いぞ
references: ["They're real cagey types."]
hypothesis: You're really tight-lipped.

source: 口が堅いしね
references: ['Yeah, so keep it to yourself.']
hypothesis: And he's tight-lipped.

source: ああ 俺は口が堅い 相棒も まあまあ口が堅い
references: ["Oh, we're very discreet. I mean, me so, more than him. But, you know, him too."]
hypothesis: Yeah, I'm tight-lipped. My partner's not so tight-lipped.

source: まず人口が多いだろ センター試験で君は
references: ["Well, first, an awful lot of people live in China, but here's my question."]
hypothesis: First of all, you've got a large population. You're the one with the center test.

source: 賢いが 口が悪い
references: ['Sure.']
hypothesis: Smart, but foul-mouthed.

source: 匂うし　ベタベタだし 口が悪くなって ザーメンがそこらじゅうに！
references: ['They smell, they are sticky, they say things that are horrible, and there is semen all over everything, okay?']
hypothesis: It smells, it's sticky, it's got a bad taste in my mouth, and there's semen all over the place!

source: 口が悪くて すみません
references: ['- Rene. Pardon my language, Miss Maxine.']
hypothesis: I'm sorry for my language.

source: おお... この子は口が減らないわね
references: ["Well, this girl's got a mouth on her."]
hypothesis: Oh... This girl's got a mouth on her.

source: 私は口が滑るかもしれん
references: ["Or I'm gonna have to."]
hypothesis: I might slip up.

source: 私からは口が裂けても 申し上げれません
references: ['Such words have never passed my lips, sire.']
hypothesis: I will not speak for myself.

source: 若い娘は口が軽い
references: ['Young girls are notorious for keeping their fucking mouths shut.']
hypothesis: Young girls are not so talkative

source: 口が重いもう1つの理由
references: ['Another reason for my reticence.']
hypothesis: Another reason for the heavy mouth.

source: さようなら　ギャビン "地獄の王子"の事は 口にするなよ
references: ['Goodbye, Gavin. Oh, uh... Don\'t go mentioning that whole "Prince of Hell" thing.']
hypothesis: Goodbye, Gavin. Don't mention the Prince of Hell.

source: わしの前で その名を口にするな！
references: ['Do not speak to me of Radagast the Brown.']
hypothesis: Do not speak that name in my presence!

source: ちょっと情緒不安のようだね 怒りのあまり君は・・ 私の忘れたい事を口にした
references: ["Now, you've had your little tantrum and you said some things in anger that I am willing to forget."]
hypothesis: You seem a little emotionally unbalanced. In a fit of rage, you... said something I'd rather forget.

source: それでは　ついに　最後に皆さんの 1部は口に出してるかもしれません 私の特権　私の名誉であり 私の個人的な喜びです 忘れられない時の人
references: ['And now, finally, at long last, as some of you may be saying, it is my honor, my privilege, my personal pleasure to present to you the man of every hour,']
hypothesis: So, finally, finally, finally, some of you may have uttered my privilege, my honor, my personal pleasure, the unforgettable man of the hour.

source: ありがたい 口に出すのも はばかる妄想をした
references: ["Well, that's good to hear, because what I'm thinking is pretty damn awful."]
hypothesis: Thank you. I had a fantasy I'm not supposed to mention.

source: パン職人か料金収受人より重要であると 口に出してほのめかしてはいない
references: ["Not to imply that it's any more important than, say, a baker or a toll collector."]
hypothesis: I'm not implying out loud that it's more important than being a baker or a toll collector.

source: ≪(沙苗)お口に合うかしら？
references: ['I hope it suits your palate.']
hypothesis: ≪do you think it's good for your palate?

source: 口に合わなかったでしょ？
references: ['It was such a bad sandwich.']
hypothesis: It wasn't to your taste, was it?

source: バーボンは口に合うかい？ 女性は強い酒は好まないから
references: ["Is the bourbon smooth enough? Women don't usually like a harsh whiskey."]
hypothesis: Is bourbon for your palate? Women don't like strong drinks.

source: 「口は　災いの元」とか言うし
references: ['Loose lips sink ships and all that.']
hypothesis: As they say, "Out of the mouth comes evil."

source: 聞かれない限り 口を出すな
references: ["-Or tell 'em unless they ask."]
hypothesis: Don't speak unless asked.

source: いや　口を出すなクローバー
references: ["Your Majesty, if you're having cold feet--"]
hypothesis: No, keep your mouth shut, Clover.

source: 化学やら何やらの事は知らん お前もビジネスには口を出すな
references: ["I don't tell you how to mix your chemicals and whatnot, and you do not tell me how to take care of business."]
hypothesis: I don't know anything about chemistry and whatnot. You stay out of my business too.

source: 口を割らせないと 殺すのではなく
references: ['Our instructions were to break him down not kill him.']
hypothesis: We need to get him to talk, not kill him.

source: 弾を食らう前に 口を割ったか？
references: ['He explain this before he ate the bullet?']
hypothesis: Did he crack before he took the bullet?

source: 刑務所で17年間 口を割らなかった男が―
references: ['Kept his mouth shut for 1 7 years in San Quentin.']
hypothesis: A man who had not spoken for 17 years in prison...

source: それで　誰かが 彼女の口を封じる為に殺した
references: ['So someone at Infinince killed her to shut her up, and they framed Chad for her murder.']
hypothesis: So someone killed her to keep her quiet.

source: 彼らがクーパーをひき逃げした 口を封じるためにね
references: ['They wanted to hold the hit-and-run over Cooper so that they could force him to do what they wanted.']
hypothesis: They hit and ran Cooper to keep him from talking.

source: なのに　今朝　ハンク・ジェラルドは 一言も口を挟まなかった
references: ["Yet this morning, Hank Gerrard doesn't even get a syllable in edgeways."]
hypothesis: And yet, Hank Gerrard didn't say a word this morning.

source: この事件は　長引けば長引くほど 誰も彼もが余計な口を挟んで
references: ['The longer this goes on the more everyone wants to get involved, stick their oar in.']
hypothesis: The longer this case drags on, the more everyone will be interrupting to make sure it doesn't go any further.

source: 口を挟むな
references: ['Just relax. - Kaley... stay out of it.']
hypothesis: Don't interrupt me.

source: 全員 口を揃えて人命救助か
references: ['You all sound very noble.']
hypothesis: All talking about saving lives.

source: 彼を知るすべての人に インタビューをしたが、 みんな、口を揃えて 彼を褒めた。
references: ['And I interviewed everyone who knew him and they all told me how great he was.']
hypothesis: I interviewed everyone who knew him, and they all spoke highly of him.

source: みんな口を揃えて 褒めてるよ 君とサシャをね
references: ['I know people are saying things -- nice things about you and Sasha, hmm?']
hypothesis: Everyone is singing your praises, you and Sasha.

source: みんな あいつの名前 聞いたら 固く口を閉ざしおる
references: ['they all clam up.']
hypothesis: When they hear his name, they clam up.

source: じゃ　なぜ　ヨルムンガンドが言っただけで みんな口を閉ざしてしまうんだ？
references: ['Why would they just fall silent just because "Jormungandr" says to?']
hypothesis: Then why does everyone clam up at the mere mention of Jormungandr?

source: いや　口を閉ざしたままだ
references: ["-...out of him? - No. He wouldn't spill the beans."]
hypothesis: No, he's keeping his mouth shut.

source: 偉そうに口を開くな
references: ['Shut up,shopkeeper. Be still.']
hypothesis: Don't open your big mouth.

source: また口を開いたら もっとひどい状態にしてやる
references: ['Sherlock, one more word and you will not need morphine.']
hypothesis: You open your mouth again, I'll make it worse.

source: パイセルは口数が多いな
references: ['Pycelle talks too much.']
hypothesis: Pycelle is a man of many tongues.

source: あんたは 口数が多くて言う事がでかいね
references: ["You've got a big mouth, girl, and too many teeth."]
hypothesis: You're a big talker and a big talker.

source: 抗争の口火を切ることになるかもしれない
references: ['Pardillo quick, this might just be the first shot fired.']
hypothesis: It could be the opening salvo in a feud.

source: 私が口火を切る前に 立ち寄って会おうと思いました
references: ["I just thought I'd stop by and see him before I get the ball rolling."]
hypothesis: I thought I'd stop by and see you before I start talking.

source: ジョンが彼女の口火を切った
references: ['Well, John always could push her buttons.']
hypothesis: John was her mouthpiece.

source: 親しげな話の口車に乗せて 小僧をたぶらかす
references: ['With fawning flattery I must win the trust of the foolish, obstinate boy.']
hypothesis: He'll use the mouthpiece of a friendly conversation to deceive the boy.

source: 結局は口車に乗せられた 児童サービスについて
references: ['I sweet-talked this from a guy in child services.']
hypothesis: In the end, I was talked into it. About children's services.

source: 台風の目 中心は安全だ
references: ['In a hurricane, the center is said to be the safest spot.']
hypothesis: Eye of the typhoon. The center is safe.

source: これが台風の目だ
references: ['This is it. This is the eye of the storm.']
hypothesis: This is the eye of the typhoon.

source: 新人ながらファッション業界の 台風の目となり 旋風を巻き起こし 日々　進化を遂げています
references: ['The rookie sensation who has burned his way into the eye sockets of the fashion world, and left them clawing their faces for more.']
hypothesis: Although she is a newcomer, she has become the eye of the storm in the fashion industry, creating a whirlwind and evolving day by day.

source: オズへの魔法の入口がある 竜巻　台風の目　渦 でもこの鍵はどんなドアも オズへの入り口にする
references: ['There are magical ways into Oz -- tornado, eye of a hurricane, whirlpool -- but this key will turn any locked door into a portal to Oz.']
hypothesis: There is a magic portal to Oz, a tornado, the eye of a typhoon, a whirlpool, but this key will turn any door into a portal to Oz.

source: - 右から左へ流した？
references: ['- I had to ask you everything that I do? No....']
hypothesis: - Flushed right to left?

source: 大間違いだった 合わす顔がなかったんだ
references: ["It's the biggest mistake I ever made. I just... I couldn't face you after that."]
hypothesis: I was so wrong. I didn't have the right face.

source: 2度と合わす顔がない
references: ['I can never show my face again.']
hypothesis: We'll never meet again.

source: プロのアスリートの名が泣くよ
references: ['Certainly screams out "professional athlete".']
hypothesis: The name of a professional athlete will make you weep.

source: 退屈してるかと 思ったのよ... こんな名もない場所の 主婦なんかが相手じゃ
references: ["No, just maybe it's a little dull for you... sitting here telling this to some housewife in the middle of nowhere."]
hypothesis: I thought you might be bored. I thought you'd be bored... with a housewife from some random place.

source: 名も無い所から出てきた若い女性は 成功しようと必死になるものだ
references: ['A girl from nowhere will desperate to make it big,']
hypothesis: A young woman from a place with no name, desperate to succeed.

source: ここは貴女の家です 名もない場所じゃない
references: ["This is your home. This isn't nowhere."]
hypothesis: This is your home, not some nameless place.

source: ジャーナリストとして 名を上げようとするかぎり
references: ['"just so long as you can make a name for yourself "as an investigatory journalist,']
hypothesis: As long as I'm trying to make a name for myself as a journalist.

source: こんな事になるなんて思わなかったわ 私はいつも自分の名を 上げることに終始してたから 今回も自分が何とかしなきゃって
references: ["It's something I never thought would happen to me because I've been so busy making a name for myself, and now I'm this close to making captain."]
hypothesis: I didn't see this coming, because I've always been all about making a name for myself, and this time I had to do something about it.

source: - 俺は名を成したい
references: ['- I want my 15 seconds of fame.']
hypothesis: - I want to make a name for myself.

source: だた君の立場は違う 名を成すチャンスだ
references: ['You, on the other hand, have a chance to make a name for yourself.']
hypothesis: But you're in a different position. This is your chance to make a name for yourself.

source: アンソニー･アマド 名を成す為に容赦ない
references: ['RICHIE: Anthony Amado had a major hard-on to make a name for himself.']
hypothesis: Anthony Amado, relentless in his quest to make a name for himself.

source: 「コミュニケーション連鎖に あなたの本名を残さない様に」
references: ['"so we don\'t have a clear record of your true name in our final communication chain.']
hypothesis: "Don't leave your real name in the communication chain."

source: "レンジャー"の名を残す 小さな証だ。
references: ['Somebody named Ranger might need a little proof.']
hypothesis: It's a small testament to the Ranger name.

source: 歴史に名を残すような偉大な 人物になれば、永遠に保存しますよ
references: ['Of course. Just be a historical document worthy of storing for all eternity.']
hypothesis: If you become a great historical figure, we'll save you forever.

source: 神の名を汚したのよ 鍵を渡すなら
references: ['On the name of the lord himself.']
hypothesis: You have dishonored God's name if you give me the key.

source: FBIの名を汚さなければ、 麻薬を使わなければ 昇進は当たり前だ。
references: ["When you're neither a disgrace to the Bureau nor a drug addict, good things can happen."]
hypothesis: If you don't tarnish the name of the FBI, if you don't use drugs, you deserve to be promoted.

source: それで名を汚すことに
references: ['You decided to ruin it.']
hypothesis: And that's how I made a name for myself.

source: シーザーの誘いに答えて－ ローマの歴史に名を留める－ 無敗のチャンピオン
references: ['Caesar is pleased to bring you... the only undefeated champion... in Roman history:']
hypothesis: Caesar's invitation was answered- Rome's history is marked- Undefeated Champion

source: 聞いたぞ！ 我が息子の一人が ペルシャの勇者に名を連ねたそうだな
references: ["I'm told that another of my sons has joined the rank of great Persian Warrior."]
hypothesis: I have heard! I hear that one of my sons has been named one of the Persian heroes.

source: おまけに投資先も 探しとる 新規事業の出資者に 名を連ねたいと
references: ["He has some venture capital that's burning a hole in his pocket... he says he might be willing to invest some start-up cash in a fleet of limos."]
hypothesis: He's also looking for a new investor for his new business.

source: 惜しむらくは ２年前に 名を馳せた探偵にとって 遅すぎたということです
references: ["'Sadly, all this comes too late for the detective, 'who became something of a celebrity two years ago.'"]
hypothesis: Regrettably, it was too late for the detective who made his name two years ago.

source: オセアニアの海で 勇気と力と青春が 残虐に名を馳せた 蛮族の犠牲になった
references: ['On the oceans of Australasia, courage, strength and youth are sacrificed, sacrificed to barbarians whose only honour is atrocity.']
hypothesis: In the seas of Oceania, courage, strength, and youth were sacrificed to barbarians renowned for their brutality.

source: 今後は　名を馳せることだろう "ダース・ヴェイダー"として
references: ['Henceforth you shall be known as... Darth... Vader.']
hypothesis: From now on, he will be known as "Darth Vader."

source: あなたが言う " 変化 " に期待し、オレは名乗りを上げました。
references: ['I volunteered because you said things would change.']
hypothesis: I am looking forward to the "change" as you call it, and I have come forward.

source: ニキ･ラウダが再び 表舞台へ戻ってきました 世界チャンピオン争いに 名乗りを上げます
references: ['Niki Lauda is a major step closer to retaining the World Championship.']
hypothesis: Niki Lauda is back on the stage again, this time as a contender for the world championship.

source: 完成したら私が実験台に 名乗りを上げようじゃないか
references: ['I must admit I, I sampled it and ended up drinking it all.']
hypothesis: When it's finished, I'll be the one to test it.

source: 後ろ向きになって 足の裏を見せて
references: ['All right, turn around, stick your feet up.']
hypothesis: Turn around. Let me see the soles of your feet.

source: 彼女は何か僕に 含む所があるんだ。
references: ["She's got a thing for me."]
hypothesis: She has something in her heart for me.

source: たいていの刑事の服は　味も素っ気もないぞ
references: ['Most of you have no taste.']
hypothesis: Most of the detectives' clothes are plain and tasteless.

source: 一度、味を占めたら 後戻りはできない
references: ["Once you get a taste of that, there's no looking back."]
hypothesis: Once you get a taste, there's no turning back.

source: あなた自身が　彼が中毒をぶり返す 呼び水になりうると考えたことある？
references: ['Have you considered that you yourself could be the catalyst for a relapse?']
hypothesis: Did you ever consider that you yourself could be the catalyst for his relapsing addiction?

source: 当然だ　命の綱だからな
references: ["- Don't forget to pick up the water ration. - I'll do that. I'll die if I don't get water."]
hypothesis: Of course. It's our lifeblood.

source: このバッグを隠せ 俺達の命の綱だからな
references: ["Hide this bag, it's our life insurance."]
hypothesis: Hide this bag. It's our lifeline.

source: アル・プロウン・タガートの 最後の存命の親戚で タガート博物館を今のまま正確に 保存することを主張している
references: ["She's an advocate for preserving the Taggart Museum exactly as it is."]
hypothesis: The last surviving relative of Al-Prooun Taggart, who insists that the Taggart Museum be preserved exactly as it is now.

source: 命を懸けて人々に伝えてやる
references: ['The only way to make people listen is to give our lives.']
hypothesis: I will risk my life to tell people.

source: 君たちは 我々を守るため... 戦ってくれている 命を懸けて だが君たちをヒーローだと 言う者もいれば...
references: ['You have fought for us... protected us, risked your lives... but while a great many people see you as heroes... there are some... who would prefer the word "vigilantes."']
hypothesis: You fight to protect us. But while some would call you heroes...

source: サミーンは 証券取引所で命を懸けた
references: ['Sameen risked everything at the stock exchange.']
hypothesis: Sameen risked his life on the stock exchange.

source: 仕事もなく 生活は厳しい でも息子のためなら 命を投げ出すわ
references: ["I don't have a job and life for me is hard, but I would still die for him, you know."]
hypothesis: I have no job, life is hard, but I would give my life for my son.

source: 力が足りないと 分かっても― 犠牲を払っても― 命を投げ出しても...
references: ["Even when it's not perfect, even if it costs you something, even if it costs you everything."]
hypothesis: Even when we know we are not strong enough... even when we sacrifice... even when we give our lives... even when we know we are not strong enough... even when we know we are not strong enough.

source: 奴らのために 命を投げ出そうとしてた
references: ["You was willin' to get killed for 'em."]
hypothesis: I was willing to give my life for theirs.

source: 私は部下の命を 預かっている
references: ["I'm responsible for these men's lives."]
hypothesis: I owe my men their lives.

source: 命を預かった
references: ['We own your lives.']
hypothesis: I owe you my life.

source: 体調が悪い人に 命を預ける気にはなれない
references: ["I'm not putting my life in your hands if you're not 100%."]
hypothesis: I'm not willing to put my life in the hands of someone in such poor health.

source: お前なんかに 世界や 人類や 自分の命を預けなきゃなんねぇオレ達への見返りがこれかよ
references: ["Is this our payback for placing mankind's future and our very survival in your hands?"]
hypothesis: This is what we get in return for entrusting the world, humanity, and our own lives to you?

source: ここで命を預けてくれないか?
references: ['Could you throw me a bone here, man?']
hypothesis: Would you trust your life to me here?

source: 俺の貞節は、問われるかもしれない。 それで問題にならなければいいなと思ってる。
references: ['loyalty issues going on, and I do not want to end up rn between my fidelity to you and the reality of having to keep my nose clean.']
hypothesis: My fidelity may be questioned. I hope that won't be a problem.

source: この数キロのかばんは、 数千キロの飛行機と比べると、 問題にならないでしょ？ その上貨物としても手荷物としても 重さは、変わらないはずでしょ？
references: ["What difference does a few extra pounds make on a three-ton aircraft, whether that's up above or underneath?"]
hypothesis: A bag weighing a few kilograms is nothing compared to a plane weighing a few thousand kilograms, right? Besides, it weighs the same as cargo or baggage, right?

source: これ以上問題にならないよう
references: ["So you shouldn't have any more... Problems."]
hypothesis: To avoid further problems.

source: 政府は　喉から手が出るほど あのリストが欲しいんだろ
references: ['Your government must be salivating over that list.']
hypothesis: I'm sure the government would love to have that list by the throat.

source: 喉から手が出るほど 哀れだね
references: ["Need one, desperately. It's quite sad, really."]
hypothesis: That's throatily pathetic.

source: 喧嘩を売る気か
references: ['We gonna fight, Raymond?']
hypothesis: You're trying to pick a fight.

source: 政府に喧嘩を売った 女の発言とは思えないね？
references: ["Aren't you the same woman who told the government to kiss her ass a few years ago?"]
hypothesis: That doesn't sound like the kind of thing a woman would say to the government, does it?

source: 何で俺に喧嘩を売ってるんだ？ そっちこそ 何で俺に喧嘩を売ってるんだ？
references: ['Why you been acting so messed up towards me?']
hypothesis: Why are you fighting me? Why are you fighting me?

source: 嘘で固めるなら もっと上手くやることだ
references: ["You know, for somebody who lies all the time, I'd think you'd be better at it."]
hypothesis: If you're going to lie your way out of this, you're going to have to do better than that.

source: 一回だけで済むだろうって ...そうなると騙し行為の 嘘で固めた人生の始まりだ
references: ['What I hoped would be a one-time event was just the beginning of a life consumed with lies, intrigue and deception.']
hypothesis: You think you'll only have to do it once... And so begins a life of deception and lies.

source: 嘘で固めた人生だな
references: ['A life that is a big fat lie.']
hypothesis: Your life is a pack of lies.

source: 嘘をつくならもっとマシな 嘘をつけ
references: ["But you'll have to spin a better story than that if you expect it to get you off the hook."]
hypothesis: If you're gonna lie, you're gonna have to lie better than that.

source: 島を出るのならば すべて嘘をつけ
references: ['If you have to go, then you have to lie about everything.']
hypothesis: If you're leaving the island, you're gonna have to lie about everything.

source: あのテロ以降 何度俺に嘘をつけば気が済むんだ
references: ["How come every time we've talked since that bomb went off, you lie to me?"]
hypothesis: How many times have you lied to me since the attack?

source: 私達はシャンプーのボトルを突っ込んだの 嘘を言うな！
references: ['- I fell down on the shampoo ... - You lie!']
hypothesis: We shoved a bottle of shampoo in there. Don't lie to me!

source: 俺が死体を見つけた朝のことで 聞きたいことがあるから来いと 俺に嘘を言ったことか？ それとも
references: ['Lying and telling me you needed me to come here to answer questions about the morning I found the corpse, or plotting against my boss?']
hypothesis: Or that you lied to me and told me to come over here to ask you some questions about the morning I found the body? Or...

source: 嘘を言うな 腹から脳まで切り裂くぞ そして自分の臓物を食わせる
references: ["Lie to me again and I'll open you from your belly to your brain and feed you your intestines."]
hypothesis: Don't lie to me. I'll cut you open from belly to brain and feed you your own guts.

source: 先日君は私に　嘘八百を並べたくせに 今日は　君のパートナーを助けろと 言うのか？
references: ['You lie to me the other day about everything, and now you expect me to help save your partner.']
hypothesis: The other day you told me a bunch of lies, and today you want me to help your partner?

source: （山里） "四の五の言ってんじゃねえ"と "好きだったら好きでね お互い動きなさいよ"と
references: ['She basically told them both to make a move if they like each other.']
hypothesis: （"Don't talk to me like this," and "If you like each other, you like each other, so make a move on each other."

source: 四の五の言わずに働け
references: ["Why don't you shut the fuck up and get back to work, okay?"]
hypothesis: Don't say "yes" or "no", just go to work.

source: 因果応報を示さないとな
references: ['Whatever the play, it has to do double-duty.']
hypothesis: We need to show cause and effect.

source: お前の功徳は因果応報で
references: ['What merits and retribution are you looking to?']
hypothesis: Your merit is cause and effect.

source: 因果応報を信じなければな
references: ['unless you believe in karma.']
hypothesis: Unless you believe in karma.

source: そんなに固くならないで
references: ["Don't be so horrified."]
hypothesis: Don't be so hard.

source: もう彼のガードは　固くなるだろう 何回言わせりゃ気が済む？
references: ['How many times I got to say it?']
hypothesis: How many times do I have to tell you?

source: 国王によりリヴァランは フレイの領土となった
references: ['Riverrun was granted to the Freys by royal decree.']
hypothesis: By the king, Riverrun became a Frey territory.

source: カンザス州が 領土になった時...
references: ['--when Kansas became a territory?']
hypothesis: When Kansas became a territory...

source: 常識的で足が土を踏んでる。
references: ['Sensible girl with her feet on the ground.']
hypothesis: Common sense and feet in the dirt.

source: 即、攻撃は無い 先ずは圧力を掛けるだろ？
references: ['All they have to do is hint. Vaguely insinuate.']
hypothesis: No immediate attack.

source: 不必要な圧力を 掛ける気じゃないよ 君にね
references: ['Just not wanting to put any unnecessary pressure on-- on you.']
hypothesis: I'm not trying to put unnecessary pressure on you.

source: もう少しの圧力を掛けてくれ ちょうどいいくらいの
references: ['Give me a little more pressure. Just what I need.']
hypothesis: Apply a little more pressure. Just enough.

source: 圧巻は、 彼女がすべて世界と共有するために、
references: ['Now the best part, in the interest of sharing everything she can with the world,']
hypothesis: The best part is, she's all for sharing with the world,

source: 彼のキャリアも地に落ちました
references: ['The nail in the coffin of a career. And Powers kicks his glove.']
hypothesis: His career also fell to the ground.

source: 地に落ちた者. . そいつの名は.
references: ['And his name, for ever more, was the Fallen.']
hypothesis: He who has fallen to the ground . . His name is...

source: ラングとハッチの2人の将軍が権力を争い ラングが勝利しハッチは地下に潜った
references: ['Two generals claim power. Lang wins the war. Hatch hides in the shadows.']
hypothesis: Two generals, Lang and Hatch, vied for power, Lang won, and Hatch went underground.

source: それで、俺たちは地下に潜ったのさ
references: ['So, my team went dark.']
hypothesis: So we went underground.

source: 私の所に来たら 地下に潜って
references: ["If they get to me, you're going down, too, remember that."]
hypothesis: If you come to me, go underground.

source: 地獄に仏だ
references: ['There is a God.']
hypothesis: Hell hath no fury

source: 地獄に仏とは　このことだ
references: ['Talk about a Good Samaritan.']
hypothesis: This is what I mean when I say "hell hath no fury.

source: ちょっと、堅くなってる
references: ["Maybe they're a little tight."]
hypothesis: It's getting a little tight.

source: そうお堅くなるな
references: ["You're just too tense, man."]
hypothesis: Don't get so uptight.

source: 堅くなる必要はない。 全体を解決しようと思うな。
references: ["You don't need to come up with the whole solution."]
hypothesis: There is no need to be rigid. Don't think you are going to solve the whole problem.

source: いつからそんなに 口が堅くなったの？
references: ['Since when, Mr. Blabbermouth?']
hypothesis: When did you become so tight-lipped?

source: 堪忍袋の緒が切れるぜ
references: ["But you're really pushing my buttons."]
hypothesis: You're going to lose your patience.

source: 高速道路の近くにある会社の ペーパーカンパニーの壁に ぶち当たった
references: ['What I got was a wall of shell companies that dead-ends at some corporation off the Dulles Toll Road.']
hypothesis: I was up against a wall of corporate shell companies near the highway.

source: 壁に耳があるのは心得ていたが どうやら庭の植え込みにもある
references: ['I know the walls have ears, but apparently the shrubbery does, too.']
hypothesis: I knew by heart that there were ears on the walls, but apparently there are some in the garden plantings as well.

source: 壁に耳ありだ
references: ['Walls have ears.']
hypothesis: Walls have ears.

source: 壁を作って 抑えつけろ
references: ['Create a mental block, repress them.']
hypothesis: Build a wall. Hold them back.

source: 心に壁を作るな
references: ['Let down the walls.']
hypothesis: Don't build walls around your heart.

source: 声を大にして言いたいわ
references: ['Maybe I just need to say it out loud.']
hypothesis: I just want to say this out loud.

source: 今朝は仕事で早く出たので 起こしたくないのもあって 声を掛けていません
references: ["Uh, I left early this morning for work, so I didn't want to wake her up, so I didn't check on her."]
hypothesis: I left early for work this morning and didn't want to wake him up, so I didn't call out to him.

source: 日曜か月曜に会ってる 彼と会話中に 君は声を掛けただろ？ ああ
references: ['You met him last Sunday or Monday, we were talking and a guy came to get me.']
hypothesis: You're meeting him on Sunday or Monday, and you approached him while you were talking to him, right? Yes, I did.

source: 絶対に声を掛けて
references: ['No, of course call Ivy.']
hypothesis: Definitely talk to him.

source: 立ち上がって声を揃えて宣言するんだ
references: ['Standing up and declaring with one voice']
hypothesis: Stand up and proclaim it out loud.

source: 何で声を潜める？ 灯りも消えてるし
references: ['Why I should remain silent, and this darkness?']
hypothesis: Why are you keeping your voice down? The lights are out.

source: 声を立てるなよ
references: ['- Hush.']
hypothesis: Don't raise your voice.

source: - 声を落とせ
references: ['- Keep your voice down.']
hypothesis: - Keep your voice down.

source: シー 声を落として
references: ['Shh. Keep your voice down.']
hypothesis: Shh. Keep your voice down.

source: 声を落とせ 奴等が来ている
references: ["Keep your voice down. They're coming."]
hypothesis: Keep your voice down. They're coming.

source: ええ　声を限りに絶叫してます
references: ["Yeah. He's screaming his head off."]
hypothesis: Yes, he's screaming his head off.

source: 多かれ少なかれ
references: ['- More or less.']
hypothesis: a greater or lesser extent (degree)

source: 多かれ少なかれな
references: ['Some just hide them better than others.']
hypothesis: More or less.

source: 多勢に無勢だ
references: ["We're outnumbered five to one."]
hypothesis: We're outnumbered.

source: 多勢に無勢よ.
references: ["We're outnumbered."]
hypothesis: You're outnumbered.

source: 多勢に無勢です
references: ['They beat us in number.']
hypothesis: We're outnumbered.

source: 夢から覚めたように 素晴らしい展望が開けると聞いているが
references: ["I'm told it gives the feeling of great perspective, like waking from a dream."]
hypothesis: I'm told it's like waking up from a dream with a wonderful prospect.

source: 悪夢から覚めたようだわ 信じられない
references: ['Like I just woke up from a nhtmare. It was unbelievable, Ethan.']
hypothesis: I think I just woke up from a nightmare. Unbelievable.

source: その夢が覚めなかったら？
references: ['What if you were unable to wake from that dream?']
hypothesis: What if that dream never wakes up?

source: 夢が覚めた
references: ["Good feeling's gone."]
hypothesis: I woke up from a dream.

source: エレボールの再建なぞ 夢のまた夢
references: ["If they'd come to me, I might have spared them this disappointment."]
hypothesis: Rebuilding Erebor is a pipe dream.

source: たどり着くことは 決してない その夢の世界に...
references: ['We shall never find that lovely land of Might-Have-Been.']
hypothesis: You'll never reach that dream world...

source: - 形の無い夢の世界
references: ['- Unconstructed dream space.']
hypothesis: - The Formless World of Dreams

source: - そうだ、 夢を見たよ
references: ['- Well, you... I was dreaming.']
hypothesis: - Yes, I had a dream.

source: イカれた、2重の夢を見た
references: ['I just had a crazy double dream.']
hypothesis: Crazy, I had a double dream.

source: 気を失っている間 すごく異様な夢を見た
references: ['I had the weirdest dream when I was out.']
hypothesis: I had the most bizarre dream while I was unconscious.

source: 亡くなる二ヶ月ほど前に 母は僕の夢を見た 目を覚ますとここに来て
references: ['A couple months before she died, she had this dream about me, and she... woke up, she came out here and she just started painting this as fast as she could.']
hypothesis: About two months before she died, she had a dream about me. When she woke up, she came here.

source: 女王は 夢を見ます 少女が窓に座っています 女王が目を覚ますと 私は そこにいます
references: ['The Queen will dream, that a little girl is sitting on her window sill.']
hypothesis: The queen dreams that a little girl is sitting in her window, and when she wakes up, I am there.

source: どんな夢を描いてる？
references: ['What do you dream of?']
hypothesis: What dreams do you have?

source: 我々は圧力を受けながら 勢力を結集した 我々が夢を描いていた以上に 成功した
references: ['We joined forces under pressure but were successful beyond our wildest dreams']
hypothesis: We rallied our forces under pressure, and we succeeded beyond our wildest dreams.

source: 夢を描かなければならなかった時 それを社会の周辺に捨ててしまった
references: ['When I had to leave them as dreams']
hypothesis: When I had to dream, I dumped it on the periphery of society.

source: 反抗し イカれてて 夢を追う
references: ['Rebels, lunatics, dreamers.']
hypothesis: Rebel, crazy, chasing a dream.

source: いつも夢を追う人なら
references: ['When your heart is in your dream']
hypothesis: If you've always been a dreamer.

source: エディの邪魔をしたくないし 夢を追って欲しいからって
references: ["She was pregnant, said she didn't want Eddie to deal with the responsibility, wanted him to pursue his music."]
