hypothesis: I don't want to get in Eddie's way, and I don't want him to follow his dreams.

source: 亡くなった女房が毎夜 夢枕に立つんだ
references: ['I have a past wife that comes to me in dreams.']
hypothesis: My late wife stands in my dreams every night.

source: 大目玉を食らうよ あのドロイドは困ったやつだ
references: ["That little droid's going to cause me a lotta trouble."]
hypothesis: I'm gonna get in big trouble for that droid.

source: 大きなお世話
references: ['None of your business.']
hypothesis: None of your business!

source: だから大口を叩く前に その事を思い出してね
references: ['So keep that in mind before you even think about opening your big mouth.']
hypothesis: So before you go running your big mouth, remember that.

source: 大口を叩いてるけど無害ね
references: ["The guy's got a big mouth, but he's harmless."]
hypothesis: You have a big mouth, but it's harmless.

source: それは無理です 聞きましたよ あなたは生化学学会で 大口を叩いて
references: ["I hear you like to get sauced at biochemistry conventions and brag about how you're gonna win the Nobel Prize for the work you're doing here, research that has been entirely funded by my late husbands money."]
hypothesis: I've heard you're a big talker at the biochemical society.

source: えぇ 大手を振ってね - 銃だ！
references: ['- Yeah, we will.']
hypothesis: Yeah, with a big gun!

source: これは皆さんへの警告です こんな怪物が 大手を振って街中をかっ歩しています
references: ['Let this be a warning to you, ladies and gentlemen, that there are monsters amongst us in the world.']
hypothesis: This is a warning to all of you, that monsters like this are roaming the streets of our city.

source: 先ず 犯罪が大手を振って まかり通る最悪の都市になった
references: ['First off, this is the worst damn city in the world to commit a crime.']
hypothesis: First of all, we have become the worst city in the world for crime.

source: 大概にして下さい
references: ['Come on.']
hypothesis: in general

source: 進歩は大海の一滴
references: ['The advance would be a drop in the bucket.']
hypothesis: Progress is a drop in the ocean

source: 彼は店で大盤振る舞いを
references: ['He came into that bar. He was waving his money all around.']
hypothesis: He made a big show of it at the store.

source: １度くらいなら大目に見る トイレ休憩が１回だけ
references: ["Maybe we can have one stop for a coke and a pee, and that's it."]
hypothesis: I'll tolerate it once. One bathroom break.

source: だから 大目に見て かばってきた そしてリスボンに 惨めな思いもさせてきた
references: ["So I tolerate you and I protect you and I let you make Lisbon's life a misery."]
hypothesis: So I've tolerated it, I've covered for it, and I've made Lisbon's life miserable.

source: 大目に見ると言ったわ
references: ["You said you'd cut them some slack. I know."]
hypothesis: I said I would tolerate it.

source: 膵臓では第一人者の 鳥井教授が執刀しますので→ 大船に乗ったつもりで いてください。
references: ["Professor Torii, who's considered a pancreatic expert, is your primary surgeon so rest easy and leave it to him."]
hypothesis: Professor Torii, who is a leading expert in pancreatic surgery, will be your primary surgeon, so please make as if you were on a big boat.

source: 大丈夫 大船に乗ったつもりでいろ
references: ["It's all right, male. Relax to the max. Take a chill pill."]
hypothesis: It's okay. Just stay in the big boat.

source: 天下分け目を収められた 大御所様なれば　おわかりのはず
references: ['Your Highness, as the leader of this new realm, I am sure you understand this.']
hypothesis: As the Supreme Prince of Japan, you know what I'm talking about.

source: 私は　天下晴れて それだけだと思う 私はこれを外務大臣に確認する
references: ['I think it is only right and proper that I refer this up to the Foreign Secretary.']
hypothesis: I think it's only right that I confirm this with the Foreign Minister.

source: すでにほかの地区で御覧頂いておりますように 「子供の城」プロジェクトは三年前のスタート以来 天井知らずの利益を上げております
references: ["As you can see, since launching the first Kiddie Kastle project three years ago we've had nothing but unencumbered profit margins."]
hypothesis: As you have already seen in other areas of the country, the Children's Castle project has been generating unlimited profits since its inception three years ago.

source: 資産価値は天井知らず
references: ['With the rumors of gambling going legal, property values are going through the roof.']
hypothesis: Property values are through the roof.

source: 彼が死ねば　その価値は 天井知らずに上がるわね
references: ['He dies, the prices go through the roof.']
hypothesis: If he dies, that value goes through the roof.

source: それができて ぼくは天狗になった
references: ["And then, when I finally got there, it wasn't me anymore."]
hypothesis: I'm a big fan of the idea. I'm a big fan of the idea.

source: 当然だと思うよ｡ それで 天狗になるわけでもなく｡ 性格もいいし アイデアも 豊富だし｡
references: ["And you're not stuck up about it, you have a good personality, and tons of good ideas, you work really hard."]
hypothesis: I think it's natural, and it doesn't make him a tengu, but he has a good personality and a lot of ideas.

source: 傭兵では太刀打ちできない
references: ["They'll beat any mercenary army."]
hypothesis: Mercenaries can't compete.

source: For there's no man in town half as manly 誰も太刀打ちできない
references: ["For there's no man in town half as manly"]
hypothesis: For there's no man in town half as manly 誰も太刀打ちできない

source: 警察も太刀打ち出来ない
references: ['Maybe way beyond them, too.']
hypothesis: The police can't even compete.

source: 太鼓を叩いて道路を行進して旗をなびかせる
references: ['You march down the road banging drums and waving banners?']
hypothesis: They beat drums, march down the street and wave flags.

source: 先月衛生指導員が来て 太鼓判を押して帰った
references: ['Look, we had the county health inspector here last month, and he gave us perfect scores.']
hypothesis: The health inspector came by last month and gave me the thumbs up and left.

source: わが社も彼に 太鼓判を押すよ
references: ['And the way I feel, my company will underwrite him anytime.']
hypothesis: I'll give him my seal of approval.

source: しかし、愛のために全てを 放棄した頭のいい女性は、 必然的に自分自身を 見つめ奈落の底へ、 男性や、赤ちゃんでは、 単純に埋められない。
references: ['But a woman with brains who gives up everything for love inevitably finds herself staring into an existential abyss that men, babies and cardio bars simply cannot fill.']
hypothesis: But a smart woman who gives up everything for love inevitably finds herself staring into an abyss that men and babies simply cannot fill.

source: 奈落の底まで突き落とされるわ
references: ['You will end up at the bottom of a hole.']
hypothesis: They'll push you into the abyss.

source: 司祭の前で契りを結び
references: ['We say our vows in front of the high septon.']
hypothesis: Covenant in the presence of the priest

source: - それは血で兄弟の契りを結んだんだ
references: ['It was a Blood Pact! Like brothers!']
hypothesis: - It was blood that bonded us as brothers.

source: 奥行きがない！
references: ["- Depth! I'm lacking depth!"]
hypothesis: There is no depth!

source: ケンカしても始まらない
references: ["Come on. Now we're not gonna get anywhere fighting."]
hypothesis: You can't start a fight.

source: さっさと立って 外で始末を 付けようじゃないか
references: ["You're gonna get up, and we're gonna settle this outside."]
hypothesis: Why don't you get up and let's go outside and take care of this?

source: 安心しな　刑事さん 俺にエディを殺った奴の 始末を付けさせれば− 手間をかけない
references: ["Rest assured, Detective, if I find the person responsible for Eddie's murder, you'll never know."]
hypothesis: Don't worry, Detective, you just let me take care of Eddie's killer, and I'll make this easy for you.

source: 始末を付けるに十分な
references: ['We could pay you to have it cleaned up.']
hypothesis: Enough to take care of it.

source: やつらが姑息な手を使って 隠した事実さ
references: ['They use static electricity to... to mask the changes.']
hypothesis: It's a fact that they've been using some very clever tricks to hide.

source: 俺と向き合ったらどうだ 操り人形で 姑息な手段を使わないで
references: ["Face me like a real man, not with your hand up another's ass like a bloody puppet."]
hypothesis: Why don't you face me, instead of being a puppet, and using your own tricks?

source: 姑息な連中だよ
references: ['Even for this group, that takes nerve.']
hypothesis: They're a bunch of sissies.

source: 知ってる？ 人生、姿勢を正して真直ぐ 立てと言われた続けた
references: ["Do you know... all my life I've been told to stand up straight, turn out posture, and now..."]
hypothesis: You know what? All my life, I've been told to stand up straight, keep my posture straight.

source: 証拠は もう嫌というほど
references: ["Boss, we've already been through all this. I mean, I got no leads;"]
hypothesis: I've had enough of this evidence.

source: もし、生きていないなら、 イザベル・ロシェフは遠慮せずに 嫌というほど見せつけてるさ 信じろ、彼は生きている
references: ["If he wasn't, Isabel Rochev wouldn't be so shy about rubbing it in our faces."]
hypothesis: If he wasn't, Isabel Rochev wouldn't be afraid to show him off. Trust me, he's alive.

source: かなり訓練を受けた 嫌というほど
references: ['I trained you well.']
hypothesis: I've had quite a bit of training. I hate it.

source: 嬉しい悲鳴よ
references: ['- Good! So good!']
hypothesis: That's a good scream.

source: 完璧に身柄を奪取 騒ぎも無く 無傷で
references: ['Clean lift. Nothing broken, nothing split.']
hypothesis: Perfectly clean takeover, no fuss, no muss, no fuss, no muss, no muss.

source: すべて完璧です
references: ['The pede looks perfect.']
hypothesis: Everything is perfect.

source: 体育館に通ったり、整形手術を せずに、完璧な容姿が手に入る...
references: ['To have perfect looks without trips to the gym or plastic surgery']
hypothesis: You don't have to go to the gym or have plastic surgery to look perfect...

source: 早い話が 1943年9月3日... でも完璧じゃなかった
references: ["The point is, September the 3rd, 1943... wasn't perfect."]
hypothesis: Fast forward to September 3, 1943... But it wasn't perfect.

source: 気が合ったんだ 彼女は美しく完璧だった
references: ["We click. She's perfect. She's beautiful, she's smart, she's well-read... she's got an ass like a 20-year-old stripper."]
hypothesis: We hit it off. She was beautiful and perfect.

source: 宙に浮く？
references: ['- Can you levitate?']
hypothesis: Floating in the air?

source: 逆フラッシュが何かすれば 液体が宙に浮くんだ
references: ['Whenever something happens with the Reverse-Flash, liquid floats in the air.']
hypothesis: If the Reverse-Flash does anything, the liquid floats in the air.

source: 宙に浮いてるよ
references: ["She's not touching the floor."]
hypothesis: It's floating in the air.

source: 目撃者証言とも合わん モノが宙に舞い...
references: ["That wouldn't explain some of the stranger events described by witnesses. Objects suspended in midair..."]
hypothesis: It doesn't match any of the eyewitness accounts. The object is in the air.

source: 俺らは宇宙を飛んでる
references: ["I can feel it, we're falling through Space, you and me."]
hypothesis: We're flying through space.

source: 宇宙を飛ぶのは 非常に危険だ
references: ['Makes flying through space very dangerous.']
hypothesis: Flying in space is very dangerous.

source: 宇宙を飛んでるわ 完璧な弧を描いて
references: ['She flew through space in perfect arcs.']
hypothesis: He's flying through space in a perfect arc.

source: その努力が実を結び 悪の拠点がまた一つ消滅
references: ['It was a textbook operation, Mr. Chairman.']
hypothesis: The effort has paid off, and another evil stronghold has been eliminated.

source: 苦労が実を結んだと感じる
references: ['and I say, "that\'s good, I have learned."']
hypothesis: I feel my hard work has paid off.

source: 私には 寝耳に水の話だ
references: ["I must admit, it's the first I'm hearing of it."]
hypothesis: This is news to me.

source: 丸２日寝食を忘れ 生存者を避難させた
references: ["It took two whole days to evacuate everyone. Didn't sleep. We didn't eat."]
hypothesis: For two whole days they forgot to eat or sleep and evacuated the survivors.

source: 察しが付くと思うけど 彼は長いこと病気でね
references: ["Well, as you probably know, he's had this for a long time."]
hypothesis: As you can probably guess, he's been sick for a long time.

source: リサと寸分違わぬ外観に
references: ['Make sure she looks exactly like Lisa.']
hypothesis: She looks every bit as good as Lisa.

source: 寸暇を惜しんでね
references: ["She doesn't stop."]
hypothesis: Every little bit counts.

source: "射程距離に入った"
references: ['I need help! He appears to be held at gunpoint but...']
hypothesis: We're in range.

source: 後５分で 山が射程距離に入ります
references: ['Saddle Ridge will be in weapons range in five minutes.']
hypothesis: In five minutes, the mountain will be within range.

source: くしゃみ程度でも ハンカチを持たせるのよ ? 小事は大事？ わかりません?
references: ['If they so much as sneeze, they better have a handkerchief.']
hypothesis: If he even sneezes, make him carry a handkerchief. Is it important to be petty? Don't you understand?

source: 小耳に挟んだだけ
references: ["Oh,I shouldn't have been listening."]
hypothesis: I just overheard it.

source: 小耳に挟みましたよ あなたの大切な秘密も
references: ["I've heard the chatter about this private initiative."]
hypothesis: I overheard you... and your precious secret.

source: 小耳に挟んだのさ
references: ['- I hear stories.']
hypothesis: I overheard something.

source: あなたの尻を叩くため？
references: ['Give you a swift kick in the butt if you need it?']
hypothesis: To beat your ass?

source: "私の尻を押してくれ"と言ったんだ
references: ['He said, \'Pull back, my ass. We just got here. "']
hypothesis: I said, "Push my ass."

source: "私の尻を押してくれ"って どういう意味ですか？
references: ['What does that mean, "Pull back, my ass"?']
hypothesis: What do you mean, "push my ass?"

source: 奴は気付いてなかった 尻尾を出すのを待ってるんだ
references: ['Clearly, he has no idea.']
hypothesis: He didn't see it coming. He's just waiting for me to put my tail between my legs.

source: 終に尻尾を出したな
references: ["So you're finally revealing your foxtail."]
hypothesis: You got your tail between your legs at the end of the day.

source: 感謝するのね CDCが尻拭いをする
references: ['Thank God the CDC arrived to do your job for you.']
hypothesis: You thank them. The CDC will clean up the mess.

source: あるいは、シモンズの尻拭いを しなきゃ いけないのか・・・ またな？
references: ["Or am I gonna have to save Simmons' ass... again?"]
hypothesis: Or do I have to clean up Simmons' mess... again?

source: バブル時代に やりたい放題やった 上の連中の尻拭いをするために 俺達は 銀行員になったわけじゃない こんなところで追い出されてみろ
references: ["We didn't become bankers to clean up after the mess of the folks at the top who did whatever they pleased during the bubble era. all our efforts will remain unrewarded."]
hypothesis: We didn't become bankers to clean up the mess of those at the top who did whatever they wanted during the bubble era.

source: 長く尾を引く彗星も 勇気を取り戻した ピエールの心には 新しい未来の象徵に 思われた
references: ['It seemed to him that this dazzling comet was the perfect symbol of what he felt in his compassionate soul which brimmed with the blossom of a new life.']
hypothesis: The comet, with its long tail, had regained its courage, and in Pierre's mind it was a symbol of a new future.

source: あの宝の山が見えるか？
references: ['Do you see the hoard heaped up?']
hypothesis: You see that treasure trove?

source: 岐路に立ったというか 現実に直面し 目が覚めた
references: ["I'm at something of a crossroads and it's brought me to a realization."]
hypothesis: I'm at a crossroads, or rather, I'm waking up to reality.

source: 私が強力に推進した結果 パイプライン問題は峠を越して この州の経済に 恩恵をもたらす様に成ります
references: ["Well as I've always maintained, the corner turn oil line would be a boon to this state's economy."]
hypothesis: As a result of my strong advocacy, the pipeline issue will pass and become a boon to the economy of this state.

source: 嵐の前の静けさは最高だな
references: ['I like these calm little moments before the storm.']
hypothesis: I love the calm before the storm.

source: 嵐の前の静けさを楽しんでる
references: ['Oh, just, uh, enjoying the calm before the storm.']
hypothesis: Enjoying the calm before the storm.

source: 嵐の前の静けさじゃ
references: ["It's the deep breath before the plunge."]
hypothesis: The calm before the storm.

source: "鍵は左前輪の上にある
references: ['"The key is on the left front wheel.']
hypothesis: "The key is on the left front wheel.

source: 彼を左遷したら 今より状況が悪くなる
references: ['The danger is, uh, replacing him with someone worse than the original.']
hypothesis: If we move him to the left, things will be worse than they are now.

source: 左遷もええとこですね 大左遷ですわ　これ
references: ['This is a demotion, huge demotion']
hypothesis: It's a big left turn.

source: 彼女も巻き添えを食います
references: ["She's collateral damage."]
hypothesis: She'll be collateral damage.

source: 巻き添えを食うのは ごめんだ
references: ["- But I'm not gonna let your bullshit take me down."]
hypothesis: I don't want to get dragged into this.

source: 君たち2人も その巻き添えを食って殺される
references: ['He also made it very clear that you two would be caught in the crossfire.']
hypothesis: And you two will be killed as collateral damage.

source: 席を外して下さい
references: ['Leave me.']
hypothesis: Please leave your seat.

source: 席を外して 悪いけど
references: ["Reg, step out. It's okay."]
hypothesis: I'm sorry to interrupt.

source: ロブ、席を外してくれる？
references: ['Rob, could we have the room?']
hypothesis: Rob, can you give us a minute?

source: フロイド･マネー･ メイウェザー 銅メダリスト フロイド･マネー･ メイウェザー 銅メダリスト かつてアメリカは オリンピックを席巻
references: ['The Olympics used to be where USA beat the crap out of the world, where we proved we were the best boxers.']
hypothesis: Floyd Money Mayweather, bronze medalist Floyd Money Mayweather, bronze medalist The U.S. once dominated the Olympics.

source: そして罪のない人々が 帰らぬ人となるかも
references: ['And neither do a lot of innocent people back home.']
hypothesis: And innocent people may never return.

source: 見直すのを忘れてた 帳尻を合わせないと
references: ["Obviously, we forgot or didn't go back and adjust the revenue entries."]
hypothesis: I forgot to review it. We need to get the books back on track.

source: 幕が上がったな
references: ['The curtain rises.']
hypothesis: The curtain has risen.

source: 幕が上がったら すぐ女神を殺す
references: ['Soon as that curtain rises, we are gonna be there to take out this Calliope.']
hypothesis: As soon as the curtain rises, we kill the goddess.

source: 幕が上がってしまうぞ
references: ['The curtain is about to go up.']
hypothesis: The curtain is about to rise.

source: 今や 幕が開いたのだ 過去は序章にすぎぬのだ
references: ["Now that we're in this time, what's past is prologue."]
hypothesis: Now the curtain has opened, and the past is only the beginning.

source: その時、どうでも良い 別の芝居の幕が開いた
references: ['At that moment, the curtain rose on a parenthetical, domestic drama...']
hypothesis: Then the curtain opened on another play that didn't matter.

source: 連続殺人犯 ジョー・キャロルの人生は 今朝早く幕を下ろしました
references: ["Serial killer Joe Carroll's life came to an end early this morning."]
hypothesis: Serial killer Joe Carroll's life came to an end early this morning.

source: 残念だけど　幕を下ろさなきゃならなくなった ・・・・早々とね
references: ['Sorry we had to close early, but you get the general idea.']
hypothesis: Unfortunately, the curtain has to come down. ・・・・ sooner rather than later.

source: もう幕を下ろすときだ
references: ['This is what takes us down.']
hypothesis: It's time to bring the curtain down.

source: 彼らの自由は 剥ぎ取られてる... 1度に1台のカメラ　1台の電話 1度に1メガバイト 今こそ 幕を引くべき時だ
references: ['That their freedoms have been stripped away... one camera, one cell phone, one megabyte at a time.']
hypothesis: Their freedom is being stripped away... One camera at a time, one phone at a time, one megabyte at a time, it's time to pull the curtain back.

source: 俺達のやり方で 派手に幕を閉じるんだ
references: ['We have to end it on our own terms... with a grand gesture.']
hypothesis: We're gonna end this thing our way, with a bang.

source: 青年が行くはずだ
references: ['The boy will meet you there.']
hypothesis: The young man should go.

source: 年には勝てない
references: ['It is a perishable skill.']
hypothesis: You can't win in old age.

source: 年を追うごとに偽造は 精巧になっている
references: ['Every year, forgers get more and more sophisticated.']
hypothesis: Forgeries are getting more sophisticated with each passing year.

source: 年を食ったら。 私のモットも理解できる。
references: ["Deb, later in life, you'll appreciate my motto."]
hypothesis: When you get older. I can understand my motto.

source: 幸か不幸か、 うまくいくに違いないと信じています-
references: ['Gentlemen, unfortunately, we must be going as well.']
hypothesis: Fortunately or unfortunately, I believe it must work.

source: そりゃ、幸先がいいな
references: ['Well, so much for our head start.']
hypothesis: Well, that's a good start.

source: 幸先がいい
references: ['The gods favor you.']
hypothesis: promising (rosy, bright) future

source: 幸先がいいな
references: ['A good start.']
hypothesis: That's a good start.

source: この船のほうが 船底が浅いのよね？
references: ["- We're shallower on the draft, right?"]
hypothesis: This boat has a shallower bottom than this one, right?

source: あと１〜２ヵ月で 資本金は底を突く
references: ["What can we do? We've only got capital to last a month, maybe two."]
hypothesis: In another month or two, our capital will run out.

source: 店を畳んでたら こうはなってないわ
references: ["If you'd just quit the restaurant, none of this would've happened."]
hypothesis: If we'd have closed up store, we wouldn't be in this mess.

source: だが それでお前が 店を畳んだだろ
references: ["You made the right choice, though, didn't you, by choosing to close the restaurant?"]
hypothesis: But that's why you closed the store.

source: 店を畳んでないのが 見えませんか？
references: ['What, you want me to close the shop?']
hypothesis: Don't you see that they haven't closed up store?

source: - 店を閉める時は死ぬ時 - 良い知らせがあります
references: ["- I'll close the shop only when I croak."]
hypothesis: - When you close up store is when you die - I have good news!

source: それから店を閉めて 退勤しろ
references: ['Then close up the shop. Clock out.']
hypothesis: Then I want you to close up store and go home.

source: 危険を承知で弓を引いた
references: ['Sorry, Harv, I know you have a thing for her.']
hypothesis: He knew the risks. He drew his bow.

source: I wasn't referring to the wheelchair 私 車椅子を 引き合いに 出すつもりは なかった
references: ["I wasn't referring to the wheelchair."]
hypothesis: I wasn't referring to the wheelchair.

source: あなたはうんざりしてる 彼はローレルを引き合いに出した
references: ["Ok, you're pissed he invoked the almighty Laurel."]
hypothesis: You're fed up. He cited Laurel.

source: それに対して　君の本では 虐待をアニスが自分に打ち明けたと言う 隣人を匿名で　引き合いに出した
references: ['Your book, on the other hand, you quoted an anonymous source, a neighbor who claimed that Ennis had confided in him about the abuses.']
hypothesis: In contrast, in your book, you anonymously cite a neighbor who says Ennis confided in him about the abuse.

source: オリバー・クィーン並みの 大金持ちよ 彼が大金持ちだから 引き合いに出しただけ 気にしないで
references: ["I would be as rich as Oliver Queen, who I mention because he's the richest person I know, or used to be."]
hypothesis: He's as rich as Oliver Queen, and I'm only quoting him because he's rich.

source: トレーラーが引き金になって 全て思い出す可能性があるが
references: ["If going to the trailer helps bring back her memories, then there's a chance that she's gonna remember everything."]
hypothesis: Although it's possible that the trailer triggered a recall of everything.

source: ３年前の手術で頭部を傷つけて 早期発症の引き金になっていたかも
references: ["The head trauma that put him in surgery three years ago could've triggered an early onset."]
hypothesis: The surgery three years ago could have caused a head injury that triggered the early onset of the disease.

source: 引き金になる
references: ['It all triggers it.']
hypothesis: act as a trigger

source: 最悪な時こそ誰にも引けを取らない
references: ['Called the best by one of the worst on the planet.']
hypothesis: In the worst of times, we are second to none.

source: そこで中野渡さんに引導を渡して
references: ["and he'll sit in the chairman's seat. Is that it?"]
hypothesis: So I gave Mr. Nakanowatari the go-ahead.

source: ロルカが引導を渡されるのを見たい
references: ['Hector lorca being sent away for life.']
hypothesis: I'd like to see Lorca get the boot.

source: 〈大学病院の医局は弱体化し→ 命のやりとりをする医療も→ ついに 弱肉強食の時代に突入した〉
references: ["University hospitals' medical offices were losing power, and even medicine, which deals with life and death, plunged into an era where the law of jungle prevailed."]
hypothesis: University hospitals' medical offices have been weakened, and medicine, which deals with the exchange of life and death, has finally entered an era where the law of the jungle has become the law of the jungle.

source: 弱音を吐いている
references: ['- Whi... Whinier than I thought. - Hmm.']
hypothesis: Weakness.

source: 君がした中で　当を得た陳述は これが初めてだ
references: ["That's the first correct statement you've made."]
hypothesis: That's the first reasonable statement you've ever made.

source: いや　当を得てるでしょ
references: ["No, that was a bull's eye."]
hypothesis: No, you've got a point.

source: いい感じだろ? 口当たりがいいな
references: ["It's pretty good, huh?"]
hypothesis: It's nice, isn't it? It's got a nice mouth feel.

source: "当たって砕けろ" よ
references: ["Well, it can't hurt to ask."]
hypothesis: "Take a shot at it."

source: 臆病で影が薄かった
references: ['He was quiet, timid, almost invisible.']
hypothesis: He was timid and shadowy.

source: ホタルの影も形もない
references: ['No sign of Firefly.']
hypothesis: Not a shadow of a firefly to be seen.

source: 影も形もなく隠せるわよ
references: ['And you will never find this again until I want you to find it.']
hypothesis: You can hide in plain sight.

source: 大統領は影も形もない
references: ['No sign of the President yet.']
hypothesis: The president is not a shadow of his former self.

source: それがお前に 影を落としてる
references: ['Cast a long shadow, I bet.']
hypothesis: It's casting a shadow over you.

source: そうだなぁ 魔獣の呪文が 何にでも 影を落としているからなぁ
references: ['Yeah, well, the spell of a hexenbiest does tend to put a damper on the good times.']
hypothesis: Yes, because the spell of the hexenbiest casts a shadow over everything.

source: ねぇ　ハロルド 男の人ってどうしてこんなに 往生際が悪いのかしら?
references: ['Really, Harold, why do men always seek to delay the inevitable?']
hypothesis: Hey, Harold, why are men so slow to make a move?

source: 往生際が悪いわね
references: ['Too bad.']
hypothesis: You're in for a rude awakening.

source: どのみち 今の俺には もう後がない あッ...
references: ["it's sink or swim for me."]
hypothesis: Anyway, there's nothing left for me now.

source: 彼に逆らったのは 後にも先にもキミだけだよ
references: ["You're the only one who's ever stood up to him."]
hypothesis: You're the only one who's ever crossed him.

source: いくら謝っても足りないわ 後の祭りだけど...
references: ["You know I'm going to be apologizing forever, right? Just so you know."]
hypothesis: No amount of apologies will suffice. I'll get to that later...

source: "開けたら空だった"じゃ 後の祭りよ
references: ["We crack it, it's empty, the gold's somewhere else."]
hypothesis: "I opened it and it was empty." That's not going to happen.

source: ネットに載せたら もう後の祭りだ
references: ['As Miss Adler remarks in her masthead, know when you are beaten.']
hypothesis: Once it's on the Internet, it's too late.

source: あれは後を引いたよ 止められなくなる
references: ["That's become a real whore to me. I can't shake it."]
hypothesis: That one left a lasting impression. You can't stop.

source: 後れを取るわけには いきません
references: ['I would be ashamed to be left behind.']
hypothesis: We can't afford to fall behind.

source: トミーが去ってから 俺達は後れを取ってる
references: ["We're way behind since Tommy left."]
hypothesis: Since Tommy left, we've been falling behind.

source: 後ろを見せるな ハリー・ポッター！
references: ["Don't you turn your back on me, Harry Potter!"]
hypothesis: Don't show your back, Harry Potter!

source: 後味が悪い
references: ["I don't feel good with it."]
hypothesis: aftertaste (e.g. of alcohol)

source: ハートは回収の後押しをした
references: ['Hart was the force behind the recall.']
hypothesis: Hart pushed for collection.

source: にわか仕込みの信心で わしの後釜に座る気か？
references: ['Does he seek to humble me with his new found piety?']
hypothesis: Are you going to take my place with your newfound piety?

source: 俺はお前の後釜に座って さらにハッピーさ
references: ["And I'll be more than happy to fill your shoes."]
hypothesis: I'll be happy to take your place. I'll be even happier.

source: 私を今の地位から追い出して 自分が後釜に座ろうと 画策しているのよ
references: ["You're trying to drive me from my position, so you can take over."]
hypothesis: He's planning to oust me from my position and replace me with himself.

source: 服従心の事？
references: ['About their obedience?']
hypothesis: You mean obedience?

source: 得体が知れないわ
references: ["We don't even know what that is."]
hypothesis: I don't get it.

source: だが, 得心が行かぬ.
references: ['But something bothers me...']
hypothesis: But I am not convinced.

source: 彼らは すべてを殺す・・・ 慈悲や後悔は微塵も無い
references: ["They'll kill everything... without mercy or remorse."]
hypothesis: They kill everything ... without a shred of mercy or remorse.

source: 心が乱れてるんだ
references: ["He's got a lot on his mind."]
hypothesis: My mind is disturbed.

source: ワシの申し出に心が動いておる
references: ["That's why I put a special wimp clause in my will."]
hypothesis: My offer has moved him.

source: チャーリーは あの馬鹿なカードを受け取ってから 心が洗われたようだった 彼女は　セラピーに来て
references: ['Charlie had this, this... moment of clarity... after she got that stupid card.']
hypothesis: Charlie seemed to have a clean slate after receiving that stupid card, and she came to therapy.

source: 最高のオモチャを見つけて 久しぶりに心が躍りました
references: ['I had found the perfect plaything. My heart danced with joy for the first time in a long time.']
hypothesis: I found the best toy I've had in a long time, and it made my heart sing.

source: ♪ 心が躍るの
references: ["There 'll be magic There 'll be fun"]
hypothesis: # My heart's a-flutter

source: ゾーンと心が 通いあう人間ですから
references: ['You see, being a stalker is some sort of calling.']
hypothesis: I'm a human being with a heart to heart with the Zone.

source: 心が通い合えば　治療に役立つ。
references: ["If you can connect with each other, it's easier to treat them."]
hypothesis: A heart-to-heart can be therapeutic.

source: 何週間、何ヶ月離れていても 地球の裏側にいても 心が通っていました
references: ['The weeks away lengthened to months, but every day would bring his thoughts from some distant part.']
hypothesis: Weeks, months apart, even on the other side of the world, our hearts were still connected.

source: 訓練生仲間とは 心が通じあってると思っていた
references: ['These people were my friends... or at least I thought they were.']
hypothesis: I thought I was in touch with my fellow trainees.

source: そして目を合わせるだけで 心が通じ合う気がします
references: ['And I feel I can communicate with you with simply a look.']
hypothesis: And just by looking into each other's eyes, I feel as if our hearts are connected.

source: 俺が言いたいのは 心に刻んでくれ 仕事には ケガが付きまとう
references: ['So the upside of this... it is a stark reminder injuries do not get swept under the rug on this job.']
hypothesis: What I'm trying to say is, you got to keep in mind, you're gonna get hurt in the line of duty.

source: ルーディがロボットを 解体しているのを見てたら- ふと こう思ったんです 誰が僕のことを心に 刻んでくれるんだろう ってね
references: ["Just looking at that bot on Rudy's table makes me think, who is going to remember me?"]
hypothesis: I was watching Rudy dismantle the robot, and it occurred to me, "Who's going to remember me in their hearts?

source: メイザー･ラッカムの勇気を 君らの心に刻んで欲しい
references: ['Let the courage of Mazer Rackham be your inspiration.']
hypothesis: I want Mazer Rackham's courage to be etched in your hearts and minds.

source: パキスタンの音楽は 一生心に残るらしいね
references: ["I've heard enough Pakistani music to last a lifetime, if you don't mind."]
hypothesis: I hear Pakistani music stays with you forever.

source: ジョンの面白い話を知っているか？ （本： 心に残る結婚式のスピーチ）
references: ['Do you know any funny stories about John?']
hypothesis: Do you know any funny stories about John? (Book: Memorable Wedding Speeches)

source: どうしよう 心に残りすぎ
references: ["She's on my mind."]
hypothesis: I don't know what to do. It's too haunting.

source: 初めに心に浮かんだ言葉です
references: ["It's the word that came to mind."]
hypothesis: These are the first words that came to mind.

source: 人が観察できるのは 既に心に浮かんでいるものだけだ。
references: ['One observes only things which are already on the mind.']
hypothesis: One can only observe what is already in one's mind.

source: 二つのことが心に浮かぶって言ったでしょ
references: ['You said two things occur to you.']
hypothesis: I told you two things come to mind.

source: -犠牲を心に留め -我々がそうすることを望むだろう
references: ['Be mindful... it may well be hoping we do this.']
hypothesis: -Be mindful of the sacrifices you make... and you'll wish we did.

source: 彼女の警告を 心に留めて
references: ["Keep her warning' with you, nail it to your memory."]
hypothesis: Take her warning to heart.

source: 女神に触るな 彼女の言葉を心に留めよ
references: ['Touch not the noble one. Heed her words!']
hypothesis: Don't touch the goddess. Take her words to heart.

source: 心を乱していた 内陸でさえも..."
references: ['"and deranged the public mind, even far inland, it must be said that professional seamen were especially alarmed."']
hypothesis: It was disturbing, even inland..."

source: 夜は心を乱すものです
references: ['Night changes many thoughts.']
hypothesis: The night can be disturbing.

source: トレントは、僕らの関係に妬いてて、 彼女の心を乱そうとしてる。
references: ["Trent Preston is gonna mindfuck her into thinking she's too good for me."]
hypothesis: Trent is jealous of our relationship and is trying to mess with her mind.

source: 心を入れ替えたと 会いたいと 付け加えろ
references: ["Tell him you've changed your mind and you need to see him."]
hypothesis: Add that you've changed your mind and you'd like to see him.

source: 心を入れ替えるよ
references: ["I'll do better."]
hypothesis: I'm gonna change my mind.

source: 古風な恋愛が とても人の心を動かすんだね〜
references: ["I find old-fashioned romance so touching, don't you?"]
hypothesis: I guess old-fashioned romance is very inspiring.

source: 人の心を動かす
references: ['It is a human calculation.']
hypothesis: Inspiring people's hearts and minds

source: マペットたちと一緒の この場所にある カーミットの心を 動かしたのは君だ
references: ["Hey, you're the one who got Kermit to do this."]
hypothesis: It's here, in this place with the Muppets, that Kermit's heart was moved by you.

source: 私はずっと君に 関心を寄せていた キエラやリバー８がやって来て
references: ['Alec, I have always had an abiding interest in you, and when Liber8 and Kiera arrived in this time']
hypothesis: I've always had an interest in you, Kiera, and Liber8 came to me.

source: ［私たち聖職者はみな　まず何よりも］ ［ラティマー家の方々に心を寄せています］
references: ["'Well, first and foremost, all of our prayers are with the Latimer family."]
hypothesis: ［All of us in the ministry have our hearts first and foremost with the Latimer family.

source: 艦内生活体験プログラムに 皆様が大きな関心を寄せて下さって
references: ['People are so excited about the live-aboard program.']
hypothesis: I'm very pleased with the great interest you've shown in the Live Aboard Program.

source: それを見たときに 何かが心を打ったのでしょう
references: ['Just sort of hit her in some personal way when she saw the play.']
hypothesis: Something must have struck him when he saw it.

source: それでいて 心を打つ物は
references: ['And still, where it strikes me...']
hypothesis: And yet, what strikes me is...

source: 貴女には人間性が無い 貴女の心を打つものが無い
references: ['Nothing human would ever enter your mind.']
hypothesis: You have no humanity. You have no heart.

source: これ以上良心を痛めたくない
references: ["I don't want any more on my conscience."]
hypothesis: I don't want to hurt my conscience any more than I already have.

source: エミリ ダグのことでまだ心を痛めているのは わかるし・・・ ディエゴのこともあったから 混乱するのはわかるさ
references: ["Emily, you're grieving for Doug and you're still confused about what Diego did."]
hypothesis: Emily, I know you're still hurting over Doug and... and Diego, so I understand your confusion.

source: 君があの患者を亡くした時 どんなに心を痛めたかは　知ってる でも　今その仕事を懺悔のつもりで しているなら・・・
references: ["I know how much it hurt when you lost that patient, but if you're doing all this as some kind of penance..."]
hypothesis: I know how heartbreaking it must have been for you to lose that patient, but if you're doing that job now as penance...

source: 心を砕くのは個人的
references: ['Crushed hearts are personal.']
hypothesis: Breaking the heart is personal.

source: 心を許したからだ
references: ["'Cause you gave it up to me."]
hypothesis: Because you let your heart be in it.

source: ヴェイルの美しさは豪家の気品にのみ、 その心を許すのです
references: ['The beauty of the Vale is matched only by the nobility of its great families.']
hypothesis: The beauty of the Vale is only allowed to be appreciated by the nobility of the great families.

source: 家族とは互いに心を配るということだ
references: ['And family means we take care of each other.']
hypothesis: Family means looking out for one another.

source: ウィルに心を配って
references: ['Take care of Will.']
hypothesis: Be mindful of Will.

source: お言葉ですが、私たちのコレクションです 私が心血を注いで 10年以上かけて集めたんです その労力を思えば...
references: ["No, you know what I think I'm actually entitled to say Our collection, considering the time that I've put in over 10 years curating that."]
hypothesis: With all due respect, it's our collection, and I've poured my heart and soul into it for over a decade, and when you think of all the work that went into it...

source: 世界を正そうと 心血を注いでるじゃない
references: ["I've watched you. Working with the Fringe Division, you've done everything in your power to heal the damage."]
hypothesis: You're putting your heart and soul into making the world a better place.

source: 別に ちょっと念を押しただけです
references: ['Nothing. Just clearing something up.']
hypothesis: Nothing. I was just reminding you.

source: ワグナー将軍に町の秩序を回復することを 最優先するように念を押すように
references: ['Make sure general wagner understands our priority is to maintain order in the streets.']
hypothesis: Remind General Wagner to make restoring order in the town his top priority.

source: 何を念頭に置いていますか？
references: ['What have you in mind?']
hypothesis: What do you have in mind?

source: 私たちはすべて自分自身に保ちます。 私はそれを念頭に置いています 決して捕らえられません。
references: ['And I try to keep that in mind and never get caught short.']
hypothesis: We all keep to ourselves. I keep it in mind never be caught.

source: 私は より協力的なものを 念頭に置いている
references: ['I have something more collaborative in mind.']
hypothesis: I have something more collaborative in mind.

source: ご主人様のお怒りを買って 分解されてから... 通訳がいなくて困ってたのよ
references: ['We have been without an interpreter... since our master got angry with our last protocol droid... and disintegrated him.']
hypothesis: The master was furious. He disassembled it, and then... I've been having trouble finding an interpreter.

source: こうして お姫様を連れ去ろうとした ２人の悪い魔女たちは― 王の怒りを買うと―
references: ["'And so the two bad witches who tried to take the princess away... 'invited the king's wrath."]
hypothesis: And so, the two wicked witches who had attempted to take the princess away from the king's court, incurring his wrath...

source: 放置しておくと FBIの 怒りを買う それにあなたを信じている人が 軽蔑されるわ
references: ["You leave it up, and you're just waving a red flag in front of the FBI and thumbing your nose at all the people who believed in you."]
hypothesis: Leaving it alone will bring the wrath of the FBI and the disdain of those who believe in you.

source: 悲しいときは去り 思いも寄らない幸運が来る
references: ['And I predict all the sad and dark times are over and you are going to be beyond happy.']
hypothesis: Sad times pass and unexpected good fortune comes your way.

source: 思いも寄らない　ダンさんは ウイザートン保険の為に働いた 6年間... 定職について
references: ['Unlikely, Mr. Dang has worked for Witherton Insurance for six years... a steady job, no drug or alcohol problems, not so much as a speeding ticket.']
hypothesis: Unexpectedly, Ms. Dunn worked for Witherton Insurance for six years... about a regular job.

source: そんな事 思いも寄らなかった
references: ["I didn't know you couldn't do that. I dealt with the various animal rights groups,"]
hypothesis: It never occurred to me.

source: 私は別の男性に 思いを寄せていますが 理由は判らず 納得もしていません 何かが狂った様に 私を突き動かしていて...
references: ["I am having feelings for another man, and I don't know why, and I gotta admit, it's kind of starting to drive me a little bit crazy, and..."]
hypothesis: I have feelings for another man, but I don't know why, and I'm not convinced, because something is driving me crazy...

source: けど、あなたは以前の人生にしがみついている。 思いを寄せる人にしがみついている、 それこそ地獄よ。
references: ["But trying to hold on to this life, clinging to the person you thought you could be, that's hell."]
hypothesis: But you're holding on to your old life. You're holding on to someone you care about, and that's hell.

source: 寄付金に思いを馳せると
references: ['Think of the donations.']
hypothesis: Thinking back to the donation...

source: 聴取しようと思ってたが "人類 の危機に思いを馳せる" とか言ってた
references: ['Oh, I tried to talk to him, but he said he needed a minute to "muse upon the fragile nature of human life."']
hypothesis: I was going to listen, but then he said something about "pondering the crisis of humanity."

source: 未来に思いを馳せ 旅を続けてたんだろう
references: ['And may fortune... guide her journey.']
hypothesis: I guess he was traveling with thoughts of the future.

source: 魔術師の思う壺です
references: ["That's what the warlock wants."]
hypothesis: It's what the sorcerer wants.

source: まさに奴はこれを望んでた　我々２人が ポータルに向かえば あいつの思う壺だ
references: ['This is precisely what he wants. Us together heading for the portal.']
hypothesis: This is exactly what he wanted, and if the two of us head for the portal, that's exactly what he'll get.

source: それこそサイロンの思う壺じゃない お互いに向き合わせたいのよ
references: ["That's exactly what the Cylons want. For us to turn on each other."]
hypothesis: That's exactly what the Cylons want. They want us to face each other.

source: 急いては事を仕損じる
references: ['Haste makes waste.']
hypothesis: Haste makes waste

source: 急いては 事を仕損じるぞ
references: ["And you can't just rush into danger, either."]
hypothesis: Haste makes waste.

source: 妹も武器が要るそうだ 個性に合うやつを作ってくれ
references: ['My sister needs a weapon. Something that suits her personality.']
hypothesis: My sister needs a weapon, too. Make one that fits her personality.

source: 隠居生活は性に合わなかったか ゴルフに飽きた？
references: ["Clearly, retirement doesn't suit you. You got tired of shooting golf?"]
hypothesis: Retirement didn't suit you, or you got tired of golf?

source: 一度 試したが性に合わない
references: ["On the grounds that I tried it once and I didn't like it."]
hypothesis: I tried it once, but it just wasn't for me.

source: 性に合わない
references: ["Yeah, it's not my thing."]
hypothesis: incongruous

source: - 性懲りも無く...
references: ['- Any busybodies']
hypothesis: - I'll never learn...

source: そして性懲りもなく再度 5年後にこれだ
references: ['And then you did it again five years later.']
hypothesis: And again, five years later.

source: "性懲りもなく又寝たのか？ - 黙って聞いてくれ"
references: ['What, did he sleep with her again?']
hypothesis: "You slept with her again, like a little bitch. - Shut up and listen to me."

source: 恐れをなしたのか？
references: ['Out of fear?']
hypothesis: Are you afraid of them?

source: これらの少年の中から... 名をあげれば 全軍の兵士が恐れをなす 戦士の中で育った一人...
references: ['From among these boys, one grew into a warrior so fierce that entire armies would retreat in terror with the mention of his name.']
hypothesis: Of these boys... One who grew up among warriors whose names would make every soldier in the army fear...

source: 恐れをなして 逃げるとでも思うか
references: ['It seems no one has ever had the privilege of leaving, either.']
hypothesis: You think I'm going to run away in fear?

source: 恨みを買って ソイツガ巨人化したらどうする
references: ['What if he gets mad and turns into a Titan?']
hypothesis: What if he gets mad and turns into a Titan?

source: もしくはただ単に− 彼女が誰かの恨みを買っているかだ たくさん居そうだがな
references: ["Or just inept, but the way Sofia treats people, it's no stretch to believe that someone wants her dead."]
hypothesis: Or she's just-- she's got somebody holding a grudge, and there's gonna be a lot of them.

source: ヴァンパイアの恨みを買う
references: ["The vamps don't take kindly to the juice dispenser."]
hypothesis: Vampire resentment.

source: 恩に着ます
references: ['And thank you.']
hypothesis: I'm in your debt.

source: すまない ビリー 恩に着る
references: ["Sure. It's nice of you, Billy, thank you."]
hypothesis: I'm sorry, Billy. I owe you.

source: 『本当にその仕事がもらえたら　ありがたい 恩に着るよ』
references: ['I could really use the work. Thanks, buddy."']
hypothesis: I'd really appreciate it if I could get that job, and I'd be in your debt."

source: 恩を仇で返すのか？ 報道生命を賭けるのか！ イギリスが終わるんだぞ！
references: ["You know how much help you're getting hereon in?"]
hypothesis: Are you going to return the favor? Are you risking your press life? It's the end of England!

source: 恩を売ろうとしているのかもしれない... 新たな〈金貨の主〉に
references: ["Maybe they're trying to curry some favor with the new Master of Coin."]
hypothesis: Maybe he's trying to ingratiate himself... To the new Master of Coin.

source: 何をするにも息が切れる
references: ['Doing anything makes breathing difficult']
hypothesis: I'm out of breath no matter what I do.

source: - 息が切れてるように聞こえるけど -
references: ['You sound winded.']
hypothesis: - You sound like you're out of breath.

source: 息が切れる 頼むから飛ばすな
references: ["I'm out of breath! Not so fast, for Christ's sake!"]
hypothesis: I'm out of breath. Please don't let me go.

source: お前達二人は 随分息が合ってるんだな？
references: ["You realize you two are finishing each other's sentences, right?"]
hypothesis: You two are quite in sync, aren't you?

source: いい コンビじゃないか 息が合ってる
references: ['You know, for being new partners, you guys are pretty good together.']
hypothesis: You guys make a great duo. You guys work well together.

source: お前の部下に 息が掛かってる マローニのな
references: ["Assuming, of course, that they are still your people and not Maroni's."]
hypothesis: Your men are breathing down Maroni's neck.

source: 兜は息が詰まる
references: ['His helmet is stifling.']
hypothesis: The helmets are stifling.

source: 息が詰まるまで 締め上げるからな
references: ['I wrap the scarf around your neck and strangle you. I promise.']
hypothesis: I'm gonna squeeze you till you can't breathe.

source: かゆいし 息が詰まります
references: ["It's itching. It's choking me."]
hypothesis: It's itchy and choking me.

source: そのランプコードで 彼の息の根を止める
references: ['Just choke him out with that lamp cord, then.']
hypothesis: That lamp cord will choke him to death.

source: 胸を刺し 息の根を止めた
references: ['Finished them off with a single stab to the chest.']
hypothesis: I stabbed him in the chest. I choked him out.

source: - 息の根を止めるぞ
references: ["We'll just have to finish him."]
hypothesis: - I'm gonna kill you.

source: 王が帰還し 都が息を吹き返し... 滅びを免れるのではないかと...
references: ['That a king will come and this city will be as it once was before it fell into decay.']
hypothesis: The king will return, the city will come to life... And the city will be spared from destruction.

source: 息を吹き返してレバンダー！
references: ['Come back, Levander!']
hypothesis: Levander with a breath of fresh air!

source: 私は息を吹き返した
references: ['He came and I came... Back to life.']
hypothesis: I came up for air.

source: 息を呑むような女性との出会いは?
references: ['Or saw a woman who literally took your breath away?']
hypothesis: How did you meet this breathtaking woman?

source: 彼は息を引き取った シュレッダーの計画を破壊しようとした
references: ["His last breath was taken trying to destroy Shredder's plan."]
hypothesis: He drew his last breath, trying to destroy Shredder's plan.

source: デーヴ・スカイラーク 息を引き取る
references: ['This is Dave Skylark signing off.']
hypothesis: Dave Skylark, drawing his last breath.

source: だから私の友人であり 良き指導者でもあった彼が ベッドで安らかに息を引き取ったと 電話を受けた時
references: ["And that's why, when they called me and told me that my, uh, friend, my mentor had passed away peacefully in his bed,"]
hypothesis: So when I got the call that my friend and mentor had passed away peacefully in his bed.

source: 彼等は閣下の子息を殺しました
references: ['These people murdered your son, madam president.']
hypothesis: They killed your son.

source: 弟の殺人犯は 息を潜めてる
references: ["My brother's killer. Still breathing."]
hypothesis: My brother's killer is still out there, hiding.

source: 震えて・・・息を潜めながらは
references: ['Cowering. Clawing for breath']
hypothesis: Shivering... and gasping for breath is not...

source: こうして父は死んだ あの小さな化け物は 今もどこかで息を潜めている
references: ['And now our father is dead and that little monster is out there somewhere drawing breath.']
hypothesis: And so my father died, and that little monster is still out there, somewhere, hiding in the shadows.

source: -　ステリオス　息を継げ
references: ['- Stelios, catch your breath, boy.']
hypothesis: - Stelios, take a breath.

source: ウィスキーを飲みながら 悦に入ってますが
references: ["You're very comfortable here with your glass of scotch,"]
hypothesis: I'm just sipping a whiskey and enjoying myself.

source: - 悪いようにはしない　な？
references: ['- they might go easy on you, okay?']
hypothesis: - I'm not going to hurt you, am I?

source: 《言うことを聞いてくれたら 悪いようにはしない》 《だが もし誰かに話すというなら》
references: ["you won't be sorry."]
hypothesis: If you do what I say, I won't make you feel bad, but if you tell anyone...

source: 誰の仕事を手伝ってるのか 名前が知りたい　そうすれば 悪いようにはしない
references: ["Those are the people that we want, so if you give us their names, this won't be so bad."]
hypothesis: I want the name of who you're helping with the job, and I won't make it any worse.

source: そうだな．．． 悪態をつく必要はない カール
references: ["Well... You don't have to swear, Carl."]
hypothesis: Well ... No need to swear, Carl.

source: 時々悪態をつくの
references: ['I swear sometimes.']
hypothesis: He swears sometimes.

source: 悪態をつくな 話し合いが必要だ
references: ['You really got a bad attitude. We need to talk.']
hypothesis: Stop swearing. We need to talk.

source: 倒れて悲鳴を上げてた あいつの血や肉が俺の体に
references: ['He lay there and screamed... I have all these pieces of him on me! Just like that.']
hypothesis: He was screaming. His blood, his flesh, on my body.

source: ケリー・レイダーを訪問し 悲鳴を上げさせた
references: ['Goes and visits Kelly Reider. Sent her into a screaming fit.']
hypothesis: Visited Kelly Reider and made her scream.

source: 悲鳴を上げさせてやる
references: ['Make him scream.']
hypothesis: I'll make you scream.

source: 中に入ってみると 倒れていて えー 目を見て 悲鳴を上げました
references: ['I went in, and when I got inside she was laying on the ground, uh, rubbing her eyes and screaming.']
hypothesis: I walked in and saw him lying there, uh, eyes, and I screamed.

source: 海藻が顔に触れ 悲鳴を上げる 完璧、完璧です！
references: ['wind blows out your candles, seaweed touches your face; You scream.']
hypothesis: Seaweed touches her face, she screams. Perfect, perfect!

source: 情けは人の為ならず
references: ['What you put out into the world comes back to you.']
hypothesis: the good you do for others is good you do yourself

source: 停戦の間に 情けを掛けたのに
references: ['I just added sparing him to the terms of our cease fire.']
hypothesis: I offered you mercy during the ceasefire.

source: 情け容赦もなく な
references: ['Her life is not yours to take.']
hypothesis: No mercy. No mercy at all.

source: ドレンは 想像を絶する神秘の... 化学の "大なべ" に変わったわ
references: ['Your Dren turned out to be a cauldron of unimaginable chemical mysteries.']
hypothesis: Dren has turned into the most mysterious... She's turned into a chemical cauldron.

source: 外せば想像を 絶するす痛みが襲う
references: ["Without these, I'm in pain you can't imagine."]
hypothesis: If you remove it, you will feel unimaginable pain.

source: 「林檎を持った少年」の価値は 想像を絶するの、分かってる？
references: ['That picture, Boy with Apple, is priceless.']
hypothesis: The value of "Boy with Apple" is unimaginable.

source: 誰の指図も意に介さない人だと
references: ["I expected him not to acquiesce to anyone's words."]
hypothesis: He said he's a man who doesn't care what anyone tells him to do.

source: もはや車座にならず－ 孤独に机に向かい 他人を意に介しない
references: ["They no longer sit in a circle... but rather sit apart... and one doesn't know anything about the other."]
hypothesis: No longer sitting in a circle, alone at a desk, not caring about others.

source: 意中の人は最後にしない
references: ['You put your first choice in the middle.']
hypothesis: The person you love won't be the last.

source: なぜ意地を張るのですか、お父さん もう少し錫を加えなければいけない
references: ["I don't know why you object it? We should include more tin."]
hypothesis: Why be stubborn, father? We need to add a little more tin.

source: 意地を張るなよ
references: ["Have it your way. Let's go."]
hypothesis: Don't be stubborn.

source: 意地を張ってないで認めたら？
references: ['Be honest, your heart was never really in it.']
hypothesis: Why don't you stop being so stubborn and admit it?

source: 私たちの意地を通す
references: ['We have our ways.']
hypothesis: We'll do what we mean to do.

source: 意気地がないね
references: ['You are weak.']
hypothesis: You've got no backbone.

source: 意気投合したよ
references: ['We hit it off.']
hypothesis: We hit it off.

source: 娘がお昼食べに来るんだけど あなたとなら意気投合するかもって思って
references: ["My daughter's meeting me for lunch. I think you two just might hit it off."]
hypothesis: My daughter is coming over for lunch, and I thought you might hit it off.

source: 意気投合してたよ
references: ['Yeah, they really hit it off.']
hypothesis: We hit it off.

source: 意表を突かれたと思ったよ
references: ['We were, like, caught off by surprise.']
hypothesis: I thought I'd caught you by surprise.

source: 意表を突いた
references: ['Alone? I took them by surprise.']
hypothesis: surprising

source: 意表を突くってことを 君は学ぶ必要がある
references: ['You need to learn the element of surprise.']
hypothesis: You need to learn to expect the unexpected.

source: 愛の鞭を打ってやれ ベイビー
references: ['Hit them with the long arm of love, baby.']
hypothesis: Give her the love whip, baby.

source: あのチームには愛想が尽きた
references: ["I'm sick and tired of carrying all the weight."]
hypothesis: I have no love for that team.

source: 地球にはほとほと愛想が尽きた
references: ["And I've decided ... screw earth."]
hypothesis: I've had enough of the earth.

source: ママに愛想を尽かされた
references: ['and your mom got sick of me.']
hypothesis: My mom gave me the love of her life.

source: 愛想を尽かして出て 行ったんでしょ？
references: ['I guess I thought you were... humiliated. You did run away, after all.']
hypothesis: You left him because you were fed up with him, didn't you?

source: そんな夫に愛想を尽かすのは当然です
references: ['You would be fed up, too.']
hypothesis: It's only natural that you'd fall out of love with a husband like that.

source: 態度が大きいぞ
references: ["I don't like your manner."]
hypothesis: You've got a big attitude.

source: なぜいつも憎まれ口を叩くの
references: ['Why are you always so hateful?']
hypothesis: Why are you always so hateful?

source: 文明の成れの果てだ
references: ['- The decline of Western civilization.']
hypothesis: It's the end of civilization.

source: 成れの果てまで 行きそうだぜ
references: ["I mean, you screw like the world's gonna end."]
hypothesis: I'm going to the end of the world.

source: コロンバスサークルの 成れの果てだ
references: ["So this is what's left of Columbus Circle."]
hypothesis: It's the end result of Columbus Circle.

source: ああ　怒りで我を忘れて その辺の物をつかんで 殴ったんだろう
references: ['Whoever did this got angry, grabbed the first thing they could find and attacked.']
hypothesis: Yeah, he must have lost his temper, grabbed something from the street and punched it.

source: 我を忘れたグリムは 殺しやすい
references: ["Easier to kill a Grimm when he's emotional."]
hypothesis: Grimms are easy to kill when they're out of control.

source: 社会が生き残り 繁栄する唯一の方法は 各々が正しい所属場所を 得ることいあるのです
references: ['And the only way it can survive and thrive... is for each of you to claim your rightful place.']
hypothesis: The only way for a society to survive and thrive is for each of us to find our rightful place in it.

source: 別の場所を得るのに 争う必要はないはず
references: ["I said we didn't have to fight for another place."]
hypothesis: We shouldn't have to fight to get another place.

source: こんな立派な女性は 所帯を持つがらじゃない
references: ['This is not the type of establishment for a respectable woman.']
hypothesis: A woman of this stature should not have a family.

source: 所帯を持つのに 餌食が必要なのか？
references: ['- You start your families by killing two innocent victims?']
hypothesis: You need prey to have a household?

source: - 所帯を持つ時期なので
references: ['- It was time to start our families.']
hypothesis: - It's time to start a household.

source: 打つ手がない　作戦変更だ
references: ['Arsenal running dry. Adjust strategy.']
hypothesis: We're out of options. Change of plans.

source: もう打つ手がない
references: ["I'm all out of moves, Finch."]
hypothesis: There's nothing left to do.

source: 手が無いぞ
references: ['Nothing but dead ends.']
hypothesis: We're out of moves.

source: 助手が付くの 信じられる？
references: ["I'll have my own assistant. Can you believe that?"]
hypothesis: I'll have an assistant. Can you believe that?

source: あなたの家に買い手が付きそうなんです お若い夫婦らしいんですけど
references: ['The most darling young couple just made an offer on your house.']
hypothesis: I've got a potential buyer for your house. A young couple, apparently.

source: だが　彼が３６人目を殺した頃までに 僕の中毒は　手が付けられなくなって
references: ['By the time he had claimed his 36th life, however, my addiction was out of control.']
hypothesis: But by the time he killed his 36th, my addiction had gotten out of hand.

source: 君の想像以上に 奴には 手が付けられない面がある
references: ["He's a greater danger to himself than you know."]
hypothesis: There's more to him than you know.

source: 警察の手が入った
references: ['Cops closed it.']
hypothesis: The police got their hands on it.

source: 内部調査室の手が入った 俺たちは　奴を釈放するしかなかった
references: ['We had no choice but to cut Bradshaw loose.']
hypothesis: I.A. got their hands on him. We had no choice but to let him go.

source: まだ編集の手が入る前のものだ
references: ['Before film makers figured out all the tricks.']
hypothesis: It's still in the hands of the editors.

source: ブルックリンの物件には 手が出ない
references: ["I don't think I can afford a place in Brooklyn."]
hypothesis: I can't afford a property in Brooklyn.

source: 麻薬と手が切れたかどうかを 時間の単位で計るのは　馬鹿げてる
references: ['It is absurd to measure sobriety in units of time.']
hypothesis: It's ridiculous to measure whether one is clean or not in units of time.

source: さもないと　あなたの喉元に手が回る
references: ['WHEN I HAVE MY HANDS AROUND YOUR THROAT.']
hypothesis: Or I'll have my hands around your throat.

source: やっと2人きりになったわ 仕事の時間よ それで、ジョン、ついに 昔の事に手が回ったというわけだ
references: ["So, John, your past finally caught up with you. Whatever the circumstances, it's lovely to see you again. Relax."]
hypothesis: Now that we're alone, it's time to get to work, so, John, you're finally getting around to old business.

source: きっと忙しくて手が回らな かったんでしょう
references: ["He probably just hasn't gotten around to it yet."]
hypothesis: I'm sure they were too busy to do anything about it.

source: 手が回らなかったので
references: ["I haven't gotten around to mine yet."]
hypothesis: I didn't get around to it.

source: 選挙で手が回らなかった
references: ["I was on the campaign and I wasn't there for him."]
hypothesis: I didn't get around to it during the election.

source: 地平線には手が回らなかったようだけど could have done ～したかもしれないのに（実際はしなかった） 警備は大変そうね
references: ["They could've done a better job with the horizon, though."]
hypothesis: Sounds like you didn't get around to the horizon when you could have done ~(actually you didn't) Security sounds like a lot of work.

source: 手が塞がってるようだな
references: ['Sounds like you got your hands full here.']
hypothesis: Looks like you've got your hands full.

source: ファスナーお願い 手が届かなくて...
references: ['Could you just give me a hand with this zipper? I always have such a hard time --']
hypothesis: Zipper, please. I can't reach it...

source: それに手が届かなかったわ 私を切れるぐらい近づくまで
references: ["I couldn't reach it till you got close enough to cut me."]
hypothesis: And I couldn't reach it until I was close enough to cut me.

source: - 手が届かない
references: ['- Way out of reach.']
hypothesis: - (within reach)

source: そのお金は強奪の手が掛かりだ 誘拐　麻薬
references: ['The money that leads to extortion, kidnapping, and drugs.']
hypothesis: That money is up for grabs, kidnapping, narcotics.

source: もう 手が掛かるわね ハイ ラヴァー
references: ["He's so high-maintenance. Hey, lover."]
hypothesis: Oh, my God, you're a handful. Hi, lover.

source: お前は 頭の回転より手が早い
references: ["But you're a guy who shoots first and thinks afterward."]
hypothesis: You're quicker with your hands than your mind.

source: 女に手が早いから用心を
references: ['Watch where he puts his hands.']
hypothesis: He's quick with the ladies, so beware.

source: 手が早いわね
references: ["You didn't waste any time."]
hypothesis: You're fast.

source: - 手が焼けるな
references: ['-This is so stupid.']
hypothesis: - You're a handful.

source: 思ったより手が焼けるな
references: ['Our job just got harder.']
hypothesis: You're more of a handful than I thought.

source: 手が込んでいる
references: ['And it just got complicated.']
hypothesis: be elaborate

source: 手が込んでますね？
references: ['Care to elaborate?']
hypothesis: Very elaborate, isn't it?

source: すごい手が込んでますね
references: ['Nice graphics.']
hypothesis: That's very elaborate.

source: 彼が近づいてきて言ったの "もう少し手が長くならないかって..."
references: ['He came up to me and I said, "Well, you have to extend your hand..."']
hypothesis: He came up to me and said, "I was wondering if your hands could be a little longer..."

source: 何か手が離せないことでも？
references: ["Unless you're in the middle of something."]
hypothesis: Something you can't get your hands on?

source: - ちょっと手が離せないんだ！
references: ['- A little busy back here. Okay?']
hypothesis: - I'm a little out of my depth!

source: 今 手が離せないの
references: ['tied up, right now.']
hypothesis: I'm kind of in the middle of something.

source: それで 誰を相手にする？
references: ['But he is coming all the way. So who am I getting within there?']
hypothesis: So who are we dealing with?

source: 一度あの者達を手にすれば彼らは...
references: ['Once I own them, these men...']
hypothesis: Once you have those people in your hands, they will...

source: でも次女は　相手にしなかった
references: ['Her sister was having none of it.']
hypothesis: But my second daughter didn't take kindly to that.

source: 技術者に相手にされず 手に入るのは石だけ
references: ['In your hands, they go back to being nothing but rocks.']
hypothesis: No one will take me seriously. All I can get are rocks.

source: あの女は自分の手を汚さず 勝利を手にする気だ
references: ['She wants you to do her dirty work for her. You do this, and she wins.']
hypothesis: That woman wants to win without getting her hands dirty.

source: 欲しいものを手にするのに 手段を選ばない
references: ["And I know you don't care who you hurt to get what you want."]
hypothesis: I'm not afraid to use any means necessary to get what I want.

source: 一族はカギを全て手にするまで 手段を選ばない だから君だ
references: ["And the families, they'll stop at nothing until they get their hands on those keys."]
hypothesis: The family will stop at nothing until they have the key to everything, which is you.

source: 親父が言っていた "人類はもっと─ 能率的になる　指でなく ハンマーとドライバーを─ 手にしたなら " と
references: ['My father said, "men would be more efficient if they had hammers and screwdrivers instead of fingers."']
hypothesis: My father used to say, "Mankind would be more efficient if we had hammers and screwdrivers instead of fingers."

source: 人の中には獣が眠っています 剣を手にした時 目を覚ますのです
references: ["There's a beast in every man, and it stirs when you put a sword in his hand."]
hypothesis: There is a beast sleeping inside each man, and it will awaken when the sword is in his hand.

source: 僕は彼の助手になる 彼の傑作を 手伝うんだ 有名になる前にね
references: ['My scheme is to persuade him to hire me as his amanuensis, and aid him in the creation of a masterpiece, before shooting up through the musical firmament, eventually obliging Pater to admit that yes, the son he disinherited is none other than Robert Frobisher,']
hypothesis: I'm going to be his assistant, and I'm going to help him create his masterpiece before he becomes famous.

source: 初キスの相手になったり...
references: ['I can become your first kiss...']
hypothesis: Or be the recipient of your first kiss...

source: 血を見たいのか 相手になるぜ
references: ['You want blood, I get it.']
hypothesis: You want to see blood? I'm your man.

source: その手に乗るか！
references: ["So that's how it is."]
hypothesis: Let's play into that hand!

source: いくらお前でも 手に余るぞ
references: ["It's too big, even for you."]
hypothesis: I don't care how much you know. You're in way over your head.

source: 君は、その怪力で、 僕は、驚くべきスピードで、 大抵の問題は、 解決してる。 だから、僕たちに 手に余る問題は戸惑う。
references: ["When you're used to fixing things with brute strength, or in my case, amazing speed, it's hard to accept that there are things out of our control."]
hypothesis: You solve most problems with your monstrous strength, and I solve most problems with amazing speed. So I'm baffled by problems that are out of our control.

source: - そうなんだが" "俺の手に余るというのが..."
references: ['I know, but see, that\'s where the "in over our heads" part comes in, \'cause, uh...']
hypothesis: - I know, but I'm afraid I'm in over my head..."

source: 無理強いはしませんが 500ドル足せばー 威力のある銃が手に入ります
references: ["Look, I'm not trying to give you the hard sell, but $500 more, you can get yourself a gun with real stopping power."]
hypothesis: I don't want to pressure you, but for an extra $500, you can get a gun with a lot more power.

source: ルドゥーの情報が 手に入った
references: ["You hear me, Marty? I got a line on Ledoux. I got it right fuckin' now."]
hypothesis: I got some info on Ledoux.

source: 今の時間は 砂糖菓子が手に入らなくて
references: ['Thanks. I can handle labor, but not sugar withdrawal.']
hypothesis: I can't get sugar candy this time of night.

source: - ちょっとした金が手に入ったんだ
references: ['We came into some money.']
hypothesis: - I got a little bit of money.

source: 手に入れろ
references: ['Claim it.']
hypothesis: Get it.

source: 言え　どこで ニセおしめを手に入れた
references: ['-find out what he knows.']
hypothesis: Tell me where you got the fake diaper.

source: ご主人が手に入れられなかった心の平穏を ご主人に与えるには あの晩あなたが見た男が ウォレス・ロークだと　言い張るしかなかった
references: ["And the only way you could give your husband the peace that he'd never had was to insist that Wallace Rourke was the man that you saw that night."]
hypothesis: The only way to give your husband the peace of mind he never had was to insist that the man you saw that night was Wallace Rourke.

source: - ちょっとした物を手に入れた
references: ['- I got a little something up my sleeve.']
hypothesis: - Got a little something for you.

source: お前は強い 何としても手に入れよ
references: ['But you, you are strong. And our need is great.']
hypothesis: You're strong. Do whatever it takes to get it.

source: 食料は私達に依存しています 燃料も・・・ その代わりに 水を手に入れるのに力を貸すと
references: ["They're totally dependent on us for food, fuel... and they've agreed to organise the workforce for the water detail on the moon."]
hypothesis: They depend on us for food, fuel... and in return, we help them get water.

source: あなたの考えが 手に取る様にわかるわ
references: ["I can hear you thinking. It's like this crunching noise."]
hypothesis: I know exactly what you're thinking.

source: 困惑が手に取るようだ
references: ['I see their trouble...']
hypothesis: The embarrassment is palpable.

source: "手に取るようにわかるんだぜ"
references: ['At your fingertips!']
hypothesis: "I can see it in your hand, man."

source: グリーヴァスの手に掛かって 何回も惨敗してから、 共和国のアウター・リムでの足場が 危うくなってる
references: ["After suffering a series of disastrous defeats at the hands of General Grievous, the Republic's foothold in the Outer Rim is in jeopardy."]
hypothesis: After several disastrous defeats at the hands of Grievous, the Republic's foothold in the Outer Rim is in jeopardy.

source: 私の手に掛かるとこうなる...
references: ['My version is this.']
hypothesis: This is what happens when I get my hands on something...

source: だが、それには サイラスを釈放する事になる そうなれば、その装置が 悪人の手に渡る恐れがある
references: ["But first, we've got to put this snake back in the pit and give him the real tech-- risk it falling into the wrong hands."]
hypothesis: But that would mean releasing Cyrus, which could put the device in the wrong hands.

source: フィルムはヤクザの手に渡りました
references: ["The film's been taken by the Yakuza."]
hypothesis: The film ended up in the hands of the Yakuza.

source: せっかくの裏帳簿も 向こうの手に渡っちまったし
references: ['And they got the account book back. Damn.']
hypothesis: And now they've got the back books, too.

source: "すでに悪魔の手に落ちているぞ"
references: ["Man, you're already sewed up tight in the devil's pocket."]
hypothesis: "You're already in the hands of the devil."

source: （ついに怪力のチューバッカも 我が手に落ちたか ）
references: ['At last we have the mighty Chewbacca.']
hypothesis: （At last the mighty Chewbacca has fallen into my hands.)

source: もし俺たちより先に 奴らの手に落ちたら・・
references: ['Man, if they get to him before we do...']
hypothesis: If they get to him before we do...

source: もしリンダがミニドームを 手に入れて 悪い奴の手に落ちたら・・
references: ['If Linda takes the mini-dome, and it ends up in the wrong hands...']
hypothesis: If Linda gets her hands on that mini-dome and it falls into the wrong hands...

source: あなたが去って間もなく 技術が犯罪者の手に渡った 機を伺っていた 連中の手に落ちたのよ
references: ['Shortly after you left your time, technology found its way into the hands of criminals who saw only opportunity.']
hypothesis: Shortly after you left, the technology fell into the hands of criminals who were waiting for the right moment.

source: この巨大な毛むくじゃら 俺一人じゃ手に負えない
references: ['I need help with this giant hairy thing!']
hypothesis: I can't handle this giant hairy thing on my own.

source: トラビス あなたに彼は 手に負えないわ
references: ['Travis, you cannot enable him.']
hypothesis: Travis, you can't handle him.

source: 僕の手に負えないと思って 勝手な事を
references: ["You thought I couldn't handle something, so you took over."]
hypothesis: He thought I was out of control. He took over.

source: センスがあれば 気が付くはずだ 自分の手に 負えなくなってる事に
references: ['You are too clever, you have no room in your head for intelligence.']
hypothesis: If you had any sense at all, you'd realize that you're in over your head.

source: - 君に手の内を見せろと？
references: ["What, I'd show you my hand?"]
hypothesis: - I'm supposed to show you my hand?

source: 君は手の内を見せないように 感情を抑える そう 強い
references: ["You keep your emotions close to the vest, that's good, that's strong."]
hypothesis: You suppress your emotions so as not to show your hand, so strong.

source: 「一瞬 手の内を見せた」 「彼は見逃さなかった」
references: ['I showed my hand for the slightest second, and he saw.']
hypothesis: For a moment, he showed his hand, and he didn't miss."

source: 手の施しようがなくなり 気づくころには遅すぎる 飲酒が命取りであったのだと
references: ['Too late, he had learned that drinking, when it gets out of hand, can be fatal.']
hypothesis: By the time you realize you're out of control, it's too late, that your drinking was fatal.

source: 手の施しようがない...
references: ['Nothing they can do, so...']
hypothesis: There's nothing we can do...

source: 手の施しようがなかったようです
references: ["Doc couldn't do anything for him."]
hypothesis: There seemed to be nothing they could do about it.

source: 分析したいが 頼れる相手もなく 御手上げの状態でね
references: ["The police doesn't know what to do with it... and I am not getting any help from ROC."]
hypothesis: I would like to analyze it, but I have no one to turn to and no one to rely on, and I can't get any help.

source: ジェイミーには片手もないし仲間もいない
references: ['Jaime has one hand and no allies,']
hypothesis: Jamie doesn't have one hand and no friends.

source: 手も足も出なかった
references: ['I must admit we were out of skill.']
hypothesis: I couldn't get a hold of him.

source: 誰も手も足も出ない
references: ["There's nothing anyone can do about it."]
hypothesis: No one can do anything about it.

source: リンカーン・バロウズとマイケル・スコフィールド、 手を上げて出てきなさい！
references: ['Michael Scofield and Lincoln Burrows, You need to exit with the hand in the air.']
hypothesis: Lincoln Burroughs and Michael Scofield, come out with your hands up!

source: 排除する時は 喜んで私が手を下す 勝手な殺し合いは――
references: ['As much as I would have enjoyed eliminating him myself, native-on-native killing cannot stand.']
hypothesis: I'll gladly take care of them when they're eliminated, and I'm not afraid of their own selfish killing spree.

source: カットニスを抑え込めないなら 私が手を下すしかない
references: ['If you cannot contain Katniss Everdeen, then I will have to terminate her.']
hypothesis: If I can't keep Katniss in check, I'll have to do something about it.

source: 次が最後の取引だ 用済みになる前に手を下す
references: ["This is providing he doesn't decide to waste us before then."]
hypothesis: This is our next and last deal. We'll get it done before it's spent.

source: すまん　マルティネス 君のものに手を付けて ぼくを荒涼とした惑星に 置いていったばかりに
references: ["I'm sorry, Martinez, if you didn't want me to go through your stuff, you shouldn't left me for dead on a desolate planet."]
hypothesis: I'm sorry, Martinez, for getting my hands on your stuff and leaving me on a desolate planet.

source: それで全部だ 少しばかり手を付けた
references: ["It's all there. Except for what we spent."]
hypothesis: That's all I did. I did a little work.

source: キャットは甘いものから手を付けるのよ
references: ['Cat always went straight for the sweetest thing.']
hypothesis: Kat starts with the sweet stuff.

source: 何から手を付けるか 判らないが たぶん 手段を選ばない
references: ["I don't know when or where, but they will make a move."]
hypothesis: I don't know where to start, but maybe I'll take any means necessary.

source: ハハ、手を休めるな
references: ["Ha, ha. Don't quit your day job."]
hypothesis: Haha, don't rest your hands.

source: 手を休めないで！
references: ['Get on with your work.']
hypothesis: Don't rest your hand!

source: 君が誰であろうと 何をやっていおうと 作業しているなら手を休めて
references: ["And whoever you are, whatever it is you're doing, if you're working, put down your work."]
hypothesis: Whoever you are, whatever you're doing, if you're working on it, take a break.

source: そして 手を伸ばした
references: ['And I have.']
hypothesis: And he reached out his hand.

source: そうだ かつての暗殺者の 手を借りたい
references: ["Yeah, I was hopin' to let that old assassin sit this one out."]
hypothesis: Yes, I need the help of a former assassin.

source: 村の人に手を借りましょう
references: ["T'would be better to go to the village to raise up help, I cannot--"]
hypothesis: Let's get help from the villagers.

source: オヤジの手を借りる 君さえ良ければね
references: ["W-With my father's help, if you're willing to let me get him involved."]
hypothesis: I'll take my dad's hand, if that's all right with you.

source: 奴が娘に手を出しやがった
references: ['All over her, he was. Touching her.']
hypothesis: He put his hands on my daughter.

source: ベンジャミンは自分で手を出し 警察を超えた こいつがどうやって クソCLAYを作ったか話すんだ！
references: ['Benjamin could go to the police and tell them he set up this shitty CLAY by himself!']
hypothesis: Benjamin took it upon himself to go over the police and tell them how this guy made a fucking CLAY!

source: ヨ　俺のチップに手を出すな
references: ['Yo, get your hands of my chips.']
hypothesis: Yo, don't mess with my chips.

source: 麻薬と手を切りたいんだ　ジョニー
references: ['I want to get clean, Joanie.']
hypothesis: I'm trying to get clean, Johnny.

source: ネルソンとは　手を切る
references: ['We gotta cut loose from Nelson.']
hypothesis: Nelson and I will cut off our hands.

source: お前が小切手を 切ってる夢を見てな
references: ['You were there handing out checks. "One for you, one for you... "']
hypothesis: I dreamed you were cutting me a check.

source: 麻薬と手を切ったからといって 男を選ぶ目が肥えたとは言えないわ
references: ["I can't say I got any better at picking men just because I got clean."]
hypothesis: Just because I'm clean doesn't mean I'm any more discerning in my choice of men.

source: -　死体に何か手を加えたか？
references: ['YOU have changed nothing to the body?']
hypothesis: - Did you do anything to the body?

source: 手を加えたという 物的証拠は出なかった
references: ["There's no physical evidence suggesting the ride was tampered with."]
hypothesis: No physical evidence of tampering was ever produced.

source: フランス料理に 手を加えた物だ
references: ["A modified Boudin Noir from Ali Bab's Gastronomie Practique."]
hypothesis: It's French food with a French twist.

source: 実習だけど... ちょっと手を回した
references: ['Well, you know, let me make it a little better.']
hypothesis: Practice... I've got a little hand in it.

source: 父さんが裏から手を回して いくつか特別扱いしてもらってる どうでもいいけど
references: ['My dad pulled a few strings, got me some extra privileges.']
hypothesis: My dad's been pulling some strings behind my back, getting me some special treatment, whatever that means.

source: 少女達を誘拐した人物が手を回したんでしょう
references: ['Whoever abducted these girls must have gotten to them.']
hypothesis: Whoever abducted the girls must have had a hand in it.

source: （徳井）だから アーマンが 割と自然と手を繋ぎに行ったり 腰に手を回したり
references: ['So Arman, rather naturally, holds her hand and puts his arms around her.']
hypothesis: （So, Arman naturally goes to hold hands with her, or puts his hands around her waist.

source: 手を変え品を変え あたしを支配しようとするのは...
references: ['That you want me to be yours. That you wanted to possess me, but no this is so much simpler than that.']
hypothesis: You're trying to control me. You're trying to...

source: あらゆる手を尽くすわ
references: ['Well, leave no stone unturned.']
hypothesis: I'll do everything I can.

source: 俺なりに最善の手を尽くす
references: ["I'll make sure of that."]
hypothesis: I'll do what I do best.

source: なぜ 手を尽くさなかった？
references: ["Why didn't you do more?"]
hypothesis: Why didn't you do everything you could?

source: ロイを助ける為に 今手を差し伸べる...
references: ['That could help me reach roy now...']
hypothesis: I'm reaching out now to help Roy...

source: 私はちょうど手を差し伸べる 途中でアンドレのお母さんに。
references: ["I just got to reach out to Andre's mom on the way."]
hypothesis: I just reach out to Andre's mom on the way.

source: - アンタも知っての通り、俺は野球選手だ... ...だが３千万ドル相続したんで 手を広げる必要がある
references: ["- As you know, my business is baseball but since I've inherited $30 million, I have to branch out."]
hypothesis: - You know, I'm a baseball player... I'm a baseball player... But I just inherited $30 million, so I need to branch out.

source: - お前は手を引いた方がいい
references: ['- You better not pull it out.']
hypothesis: - You better back off.

source: もう手を引きたいと言っていました
references: ['Said she wanted me to pull her out.']
hypothesis: He said he wanted to back out now.

source: 手を引くように警告した
references: ['Nah, just warned me to back off.']
hypothesis: I warned him to back off.

source: もし スキュラを返したら 将軍は俺らから手を引く そして俺は 平和に息子と暮らす 時間を手に入れられるんだ
references: ['If I give Scylla back to the General, he leaves me and Michael alone, and I get to spend time with my son in peace.']
hypothesis: If we return Scylla, the General will leave us alone, and I'll have time to live with my son in peace.

source: 15％で手を打とう 妥当な数字だと思うが
references: ["Let's settle on an even 15. That's a nice round number."]
hypothesis: Let's settle for 15%, which I think is a fair number.

source: でも 交渉になるわね 現段階では― 手を打つとしても １億7500万は欲しいところ
references: ["But it's a negotiation, and at this point, we might have to accept as little as... 175."]
hypothesis: But it's going to be a negotiation, and at this point, we're looking at 175 million to get out of this.

source: 1万で手を打つ この状況じゃ いい額だ
references: ["Come on. Listen, we'll take the ten grand. It's generous considering the circumstances."]
hypothesis: I'll settle for 10,000. That's a good deal under the circumstances.

source: これは安物で手を抜いてる
references: ["These are cheaper variations. He's been cutting corners."]
hypothesis: This is cheap and skimpy.

source: いいえ 彼女は 手を抜いたりしない
references: ['No,she is most thorough.']
hypothesis: No, she doesn't cut corners.

source: 手を抜いてた
references: ['They cut corners.']
hypothesis: I was cutting corners.

source: ポケットの中の 弾が込めてある銃に 手を掛けるのは危ない癖だ
references: ["It's a dangerous habit, to finger loaded firearms in the pocket of one's dressing gown."]
hypothesis: It's a dangerous habit to have your hand on a loaded gun in your pocket.

source: 自分の権利を人に乱暴する ことにまで拡大しないでくれ 他の誰かに手を掛けて見ろ
references: ["Your rights don't extend to roughing people up."]
hypothesis: Don't extend your rights to roughing people up, look what you did to someone else.

source: トリガーに手を掛け 引く
references: ["You don't pull the trigger..."]
hypothesis: Put your hand on the trigger and pull.

source: それを検討してる {a1pos(126,268)} 血で手を染めずに 生きられると？
references: ['Making it now, do you really think you can do that without getting blood on your hands?']
hypothesis: I'm considering it. You think you can live without blood on your hands?

source: 大量殺人に手を染め 世間から恐れられている
references: ["SHE IS A PUBLIC THREAT. SHE'S ON A KILLING SPREE."]
hypothesis: He's a mass murderer, feared by the world.

source: 意図的、積極的に手を染めた 中毒性薬物に・・・ 脳破壊や平衡感覚を失なうものに
references: ['You knowingly and willingly took an addictive drug brain-destructive and disorienting.']
hypothesis: Intentionally and aggressively tainted with addictive drugs ... brain-destroying and off-balance substances.

source: 敵を倒すためなら 手を汚してもかまわない ためらわないで殺す
references: ["I've never been too shy to dirty my hands with the enemy, and if need be, would do it right now."]
hypothesis: I'm willing to get my hands dirty to bring down my enemies, and I won't hesitate to kill them.

source: クウィンが自ら手を汚したとは思えない そのために人を雇うような奴だからな
references: ['I never took him for a triggerman. He pays others for that.']
hypothesis: I don't think Quinn got his hands dirty himself, because he's the kind of guy who would hire someone to do that for him.

source: この人は自分の手を汚さないよ
references: ["Not with those hands, you certainly didn't."]
hypothesis: This guy won't get his hands dirty.

source: 手を焼くので有名だものね
references: ["I know, I know. He's famous for tinkering, right?"]
hypothesis: You're famous for being a handful.

source: 彼のタフぶりには手を焼いてるがね
references: ['We were pretty tough on him.']
hypothesis: He's got a tough act to follow, though.

source: 手を焼かせてくれた 一味の一人のようだな
references: ["He's someone who was with a whole lot of someones who didn't listen."]
hypothesis: Sounds like one of the gang that got their hands burned.

source: 手を煩わせるな！
references: ["Don't you tell me about me getting my hands dirty!"]
hypothesis: Don't bother!

source: 君の手を煩わせることはない
references: ["Oh, you needn't trouble yourself over her."]
hypothesis: I won't bother you.

source: あなたを柔和させます あなたを神の光の中に入れるのに 神のお手を煩わせない為に
references: ["We're going to soften you up so God doesn't have to work so hard to enter you with His light."]
hypothesis: I will soften you, so that you will not trouble God's hand in bringing you into His light.

source: 両手を着け！
references: ['I said "hands on the ground"!']
hypothesis: Wear both hands!

source: 床に手を着け
references: ['On the ground!']
hypothesis: Hands on the floor.

source: クワイ＝ガン･ジンが 貴様と手を組むはずがない
references: ['Qui-Gon Jinn would never join you.']
