hypothesis: Qui-Gon Jinn would never join forces with you.

source: シャベールとラングロワとマクサンスは 手を組み　ラシャンの虐待を暴露した
references: ["Chabert, Langlois and old Maxence joined forces to expose Rachin's abuse,"]
hypothesis: Chabert, Langlois and Maxence teamed up to expose Rachin's abuse.

source: 悪魔と手を結んでしまうと 神に思い知らされる
references: ['"Let the devil take your hand and God will make you pay."']
hypothesis: God reminds us that when we join hands with the devil

source: 君と私は マルコムと手を結んだ この街を 悩ます解決策を目的として
references: ['You and I got in bed with Malcolm to cure what ails this city.']
hypothesis: You and I have joined forces with Malcolm for a solution to what ails this city.

source: 死ぬまで手を緩めない！
references: ["He won't rest until you're dead!"]
hypothesis: We will not relent until we die!

source: 理論的には　検察官が わざと捜査の手を緩めることは可能だ 特に　状況証拠しかない事件はな
references: ['Well, theoretically, a prosecutor could throw an investigation, especially one with circumstantial evidence.']
hypothesis: Theoretically, it's possible for a prosecutor to deliberately slow down an investigation, especially in a case where the evidence is circumstantial.

source: ペリーズがベガのコカインを盗むのに あなたが　手を貸したのね
references: ["So... you're the one who helped the Perrys steal Vega's cocaine."]
hypothesis: You helped the Perrys steal Vega's cocaine.

source: この野郎を捨てるのに 手を貸してくれよ
references: ["Why don't you help me might as well dump this mother fucker."]
hypothesis: Help me dump this son of a bitch.

source: なぜ彼と話して　力を貸そうとしないの？ 僕はずっと彼に手を貸してきた
references: ["If you knew about it, why didn't you try and talk to him, try and help him?"]
hypothesis: Why don't you talk to him and try to help? I've been helping him my whole life.

source: どうかな 僕らに手を貸す気にならないか？
references: ["So are you sure you don't want to help us?"]
hypothesis: I don't know. You don't mind giving us a hand, do you?

source: 手を離れて一人立ちしていくなんてな. . - 父さん.
references: ['Going out to handle the world on its own.']
hypothesis: I can't believe they're leaving my hands and going out on their own. Dad. - Dad.

source: - 指輪はもう我らの手を離れた
references: ['- The ring is beyond our reach now.']
hypothesis: - The ring is no longer in our hands.

source: 我々の手を離れた
references: ["It's now in Special Activities' hands."]
hypothesis: It's out of our hands.

source: この三人にできたんだ 少なくとも俺達にできることは 他の独房区画を手中に収めることだ
references: ['If these three pussies can do all this, the least we can do is take out another cell block.']
hypothesis: These three could do it, and the least we could do is take possession of the other cell blocks.

source: 私の軍が国境で紛争を解決するや否や シルクロードを その全長に渡って手中に収める
references: ['As soon as my army settles in at the borders the entire Silk Road region belongs']
hypothesis: As soon as my army settles the dispute at the border, I will have the Silk Road for its entire length

source: シルクロード全体を手中に収められる 中国でさえ
references: ['He can take over the entire Silk Road even China']
hypothesis: You can have the entire Silk Road in your hands, even China.

source: マックパパが手取り足取りで 教えてやるぜ
references: ['All those girls are going to need some hands on help from the Mac Daddy.']
hypothesis: I'll show you how it's done. I'll show you how it's done.

source: 俺がメンクを見つけられるよう 手取り足取り手がかりを教えてくれた
references: ['He spoon-fed me the clues so I could find Menck.']
hypothesis: He gave me all the clues I needed to find Menck.

source: シマのすべてを返してもらえるなら 手心を加えてもいい... ペンギン以外は
references: ["He just told me I could have all my territories back, and all I have to do in return... is give him Carmine's head."]
hypothesis: If you give me back all of my territories, I'll do anything I want... Except the penguins.

source: あれは手段を選ばないぞ 絶対戻らない！
references: ["- and it's gonna do everything it can- - we're never going back."]
hypothesis: That thing is a means to an end. It will never go back!

source: 俺が去る前に 手段を選ばなかった
references: ['Before I left, you played hard.']
hypothesis: You didn't have a choice before I left.

hypothesis: I still can't believe that Wu was hand-picked.

source: 数百のサーバーを 手玉に取っていますが

source: この女は私の権威を手玉に取って

hypothesis: It doesn't mean that Emotion is ready to take on that battlefield.

source: 根に持ってるのか？

hypothesis: No, she's just putting the word out.

source: 根絶やしにするのは困難だ 内皮腫瘍患者の生存率は低い さらなる手立てを講じなければ
references: ['The survival rate of patients with severe endothelial growth... decreases exponentially the more the condition advances.']
hypothesis: Eradication is difficult, survival rates for patients with endothelial tumors are low, and further steps must be taken.

source: 兄貴はおまえらとは桁が違う...
references: ['Lawrence is better than all you lot...']
hypothesis: My brother is not on the same level as you...

source: - 桁が違う
references: ["I'll meet you on the other side."]
hypothesis: - be off by a digit

source: お前らの桃源郷に行けと？
references: ['So we just should follow you to your Shangri-la?']
hypothesis: You want me to go to your peachy paradise?

source: 案ずるより産むが易し、だよ
references: ['Doing it is the easy part.']
hypothesis: It's easier to do something than worry about it.

source: 自分を棚に上げて？
references: ["You're being pretty kind to yourself now, aren't you?"]
hypothesis: Putting yourself on the shelf?

source: 信じられない　自分たちのことは 棚に上げる気？
references: ['Am I dreaming? You were secretive too! Why should I give up?']
hypothesis: I can't believe it. You're putting yourselves on the back burner?

source: 自分のことを棚に上げて？
references: ['Did you even hear what you just said?']
hypothesis: Putting yourself on the shelf?

source: "しかし君と私には約束があったし" "君は終了を棚上げにしたからね"
references: ['But you and I had a bargain, and, uh, you held up your end.']
hypothesis: "But you and I had an agreement, and you shelved the termination."

source: モローは、彼のプロジェクトを棚上げに された為、レーンに復讐を望んでいる。
references: ['Morrow wants revenge on Lane for mothballing his project.']
hypothesis: Morrow wants revenge on Lane for shelving his project.

source: 彼女が棚卸しをする
references: ['She should inventory what we have.']
hypothesis: She takes inventory.

source: 殺人のあった夜　彼は棚卸しをしていたわ
references: ['He was doing inventory the night of the murder.']
hypothesis: He was doing inventory the night of the murder.

source: 槍玉に上げる誰かよ
references: ['All that judge is looking for is someone to make an example of.']
hypothesis: Someone to spearhead it.

source: おばあちゃん まず横になって
references: ['Grandma, just lie down.']
hypothesis: Grandma, lie down first.

source: しばらく横になって...
references: ['But you should lie back down in case of another--']
hypothesis: I just lay there for a while...

source: まずは横になって
references: ['If you want to lie down.']
hypothesis: First, lie down.

source: 彼はベッドに横になって 汗をかくのよ
references: ['He lies in bed and sweats.']
hypothesis: He'd lie in bed and sweat it out.

source: 機を逸する前に 事態を収めるのだ
references: ["It's important you remedy things before the situation can get out of hand."]
hypothesis: We have to contain the situation before it gets out of hand.

source: 我々が機先を制したようだ
references: ['Looks like we beat you to the punch.']
hypothesis: Looks like we got the jump on them.

source: あなたはパティの機嫌を 取りたいだけ
references: ['No,ellen,all you ever wanted was to impress patty hewes.']
hypothesis: You're just trying to impress patty hewes.

source: ジョフリーは父を鎖に繋いだ上に 俺にご機嫌を取りに来いというのか？
references: ['Joffrey puts my father in chains, now he wants his ass kissed?']
hypothesis: Joffrey has my father in chains and now he wants me to come over to his place to curry favor?

source: 彼女は機嫌を取ってる でも　それも本当だ
references: ["She flatters me, but it's also true."]
hypothesis: She's in a mood, but it's also true.

source: 奴の機嫌を損ねる
references: ['To him, something will be off.']
hypothesis: It puts him in a bad mood.

source: 何か機嫌を 損ねることでもした？
references: ['Have I done something to you to upset you?']
hypothesis: Did I do something to offend you?

source: 一族には気をつけて すぐに機嫌を損ねる種族だから
references: ["Careful what you say around these folks. They're easily offended."]
hypothesis: Be careful with that family. They are easily offended.

source: ミスター・ワイズ 君は本当に機知に富んでいる
references: ['Mr. Wise, you are as resourceful as promised.']
hypothesis: Mr. Wise, you are truly resourceful.

source: 明らかに、パパは彼女がどれだけ賢くて 機知に富んでいるか、考えてもいなかった。
references: ['Clearly, he did not take into account how resourceful she is.']
hypothesis: Obviously, Dad had no idea how smart and resourceful she was.

source: 犯人は 常に機知に富み... 追い手を 惑わす発想で... 理想的な 逃走路を発見した
references: ['The killer, always resourceful... always thinking along lines that would baffle his hunters... had discovered an ideal avenue of escape.']
hypothesis: The killer is always resourceful... He always had a knack for deception... He found the perfect escape route.

source: 機転が利くわね　オリー
references: ['Ah... good initiative, Olly.']
hypothesis: Very tactful, Ollie.

source: 彼の歓心を買うように
references: ['- Keep him happy.']
hypothesis: As if to his delight.

source: 止めを刺したんだな
references: ['Probably executed.']
hypothesis: You put a stop to it.

source: 良いハンターは獲物の跡を 注意深くつけて 好機にのみ 止めを刺すものだ
references: ['A good hunter stalks his prey with care, and only strikes when the time is right.']
hypothesis: A good hunter follows his prey's trail carefully, only stopping when the opportunity presents itself.

source: 正鵠を射るねえ グスタフさんよ
references: ['You hit the nail on the head, Mr. Gustave.']
hypothesis: You hit the nail on the head, Mr. Gustave.

source: ''武士は食わねど高楊枝''って やつですか
references: ["Eagles don't eat flies... is that it?"]
hypothesis: Is this the ''samurai don't eat, but they do eat'' type of thing?

source: 健康器具を捨て去り 青空のもとへ歩を進める
references: ['We are the morning you got off the treadmill and ran under the open sky.']
hypothesis: I leave my health equipment behind and walk towards the blue sky.

source: 歯が立たないよ
references: ["We're in over our heads."]
hypothesis: You're not gonna stand a chance.

source: 今まで 歯が立たなかった敵に
references: ['Against an enemy that, to this point, has been unstoppable.']
hypothesis: To an enemy that has been so far unbeatable.

source: 警察も渋滞には歯が立たない
references: ['Cops are stuck in the traffic, like everyone else.']
hypothesis: Even the police can't stand the traffic.

source: じゃ"歴史は繰り返す"、ってな
references: ['- Well, I guess history does repeat. - Okay.']
hypothesis: Well, history repeats itself.

source: 歴史は繰り返すのよ ダイアナの力を借りて
references: ['Diana is going to help us make sure that history repeats itself.']
hypothesis: History repeats itself, with Diana's help.

source: 歴史は繰り返します？
references: ['History will repeat itself?']
hypothesis: History repeats itself?

source: 死の商人だ 汚い仕事の為に 傭兵とB. O.
references: ["He's a merchant of death using mercenaries and B.O.W.s to do his dirty work."]
hypothesis: Merchants of death, mercenaries and B.O.'s for their dirty work.

source: それは私の役割が死の商人としての 情報将校であることだ
references: ["It's my job to be the merchant of death as an intelligence officer."]
hypothesis: That is, my role as an intelligence officer as a merchant of death.

source: 死人に口なし
references: ["They couldn't risk her knowing or finding out."]
hypothesis: dead men tell no tales

source: それで　デルは 別の毛色の変わった 興行を打った
references: ['So, Dell arranged a different kind of command performance.']
hypothesis: So Dell put on another unusual show.

source: わかるわ そんな女の気が知れない
references: ['I know. What kind of cheap woman could ever do something like that?']
hypothesis: I know what you mean. I don't know what kind of woman would do that.

source: デカフェなど飲むヤツの 気が知れない
references: ['What kind of idiot drinks decaf anyway?']
hypothesis: I don't know what kind of person drinks decaf.

source: あれで納得する人の気が知れない
references: ["Who'd believe it?"]
hypothesis: I don't know how anyone could be convinced by that.

source: 気が乗っているんでね
references: ["I'm in a generous mood."]
hypothesis: I'm in a good mood.

source: 女の子を集めて 来なくちゃ、気が乗らねぇ
references: ['Maybe we should get some girls to watch this stunt, huh?']
hypothesis: I gotta go get the girls. I don't feel like it.

source: 何かしら 気が乗ってないのかもしれんよ
references: ['He might not be into getting back together with her.']
hypothesis: Maybe he's not in the mood for it somehow.

source: 気が乗らなくて...
references: ["Doesn't seem right."]
hypothesis: I wasn't in the mood...

source: 気が乗らないわ, ブライトン
references: ["I'm not in the mood, Brighton."]
hypothesis: I'm not in the mood, Brighton

source: 気が乗らなくて
references: ["Wasn't feeling the vibe."]
hypothesis: I'm not in the mood.

source: 気が付かなかった
references: ['- It was so obvious. - Glucose levels.']
hypothesis: I didn't notice.

source: 頭を撃ち抜けば 死んだと気が付くのに
references: ["You should've shot her in the head so they could hear her die."]
hypothesis: You could have shot him in the head and he would have known he was dead.

source: 多分　気が付かなかったんだろう しかし　ダンピアではそんな 楽しいサーカスはない、だろ？
references: ["Maybe you haven't noticed, but Dampier's no three-ring bloody circus, is it?"]
hypothesis: Maybe you didn't notice, but there's no such thing as a fun circus in Dampier, right?

source: いくらかの市民に 気が付いたが 私に背を向けている
references: ['I noticed some of your townsfolk turned their backs towards me.']
hypothesis: I've noticed some citizens turning their backs on me.

source: 気が休まる
references: ['It helps.']
hypothesis: feel at ease

source: ライブワイヤーが逃走中で あなたを残して帰ったら― 気が休まりませんから
references: ["And I don't really feel comfortable leaving you here alone with Livewire on the loose."]
hypothesis: I'd feel a lot worse if Livewire left without you, since you're still on the loose.

source: 気が休まらないだろ？
references: ["And... you're not comfortable with that?"]
hypothesis: It's not comforting, is it?

source: これぞ 気が利くってもんだ
references: ["Now, that's what I call making yourself useful, love."]
hypothesis: Now that's what I call witty.

source: 本当に　もう 気が利かないんだから。
references: ['Seriously, you are so dense.']
hypothesis: I really don't care anymore.

source: お前はホントに気が利かないんだから 夫人は千歳以上で執念深いのよ
references: ['You are really a clumsy flatterer filled with severe grudge']
hypothesis: You're really not very bright, and Mrs. Hartley is more than a thousand years old and very vindictive.

source: わたしとならきっと気が合う
references: ['And definitely the most fun.']
hypothesis: I'm sure we'll hit it off.

source: 昔よ 気が向いたら またやろう
references: ['And I will again, once inspiration strikes.']
hypothesis: We'll do it again when we're ready.

source: - いつもジンジャーの回りのことは気が咎めるわ...
references: ['I always feel so guilty around Ginger.']
hypothesis: - I always feel bad about what goes on around Ginger...

source: すみません 気が回らなくて
references: ["I know. I'm sorry. I should have said that."]
hypothesis: I'm sorry. I haven't gotten around to it.

source: 元カノには気が回らなかった
references: ["There's nothing you can say that changes that."]
hypothesis: I never got around to my ex-girlfriend.

source: 他の人はそこまで気が回らない?
references: ["They couldn't be couriered?"]
hypothesis: Others don't care that much?

source: アルメニア人は 血の気が多いと言われる
references: ['We are all said to be fiery.']
hypothesis: Armenians are said to be bloodthirsty.

source: 気が大きくなるから 実際そうでした
references: ['Because it takes courage to think for yourself. She did.']
hypothesis: I was. I was.

source: 親父に嫌気が差して 家出したんだと言われた
references: ['Said she probably ran to escape her jerk of a father.']
hypothesis: He told me he ran away from home because he was fed up with my dad.

source: ここの奴らに 嫌気が差したのさ
references: ["Because, man, I-- I'm just-- I'm done with this group, man."]
hypothesis: I'm sick and tired of these people.

source: 逃げることに嫌気が差した
references: ["You're sick of running."]
hypothesis: Sick of running away.

source: 答えるのに気が引けるが
references: ["Alas, the answer's not so excellent."]
hypothesis: I'm not comfortable answering that question.

source: さすがに気が引けるけど
references: ['And that was a dick move. Even for me.']
hypothesis: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that.

source: ジェナー博士 うっとおしいのは分かってる 俺も質問を投げかけるのは 気が引ける...
references: ['Dr. Jenner, I know this has been taxing for you and I hate to ask one more question, but...']
hypothesis: Dr. Jenner, I know this is annoying, and I don't feel comfortable asking questions either...

source: 独りで歩いて来るなんて 気が強いのも考えものね
references: ['It seems to me to show an abominable sort of conceited independence.']
hypothesis: I can't believe you walked all the way out here by yourself. You must have been strong-willed.

source: 女性は皆、気が強い
references: ["I know. It's just, you seem like a strong lady, is all."]
hypothesis: All women are feisty.

source: ちっこいのは気が強い 持ち上げとけ
references: ['Oh, little people are mean.']
hypothesis: Little guy's got a strong heart. Lift him up.

source: あなたは気が散ってた
references: ["You've been distracted."]
hypothesis: You were distracted.

source: 気が散らないから 落ち着いて仕事ができる
references: ["You're lucky... no distractions. You have your work and you do it."]
hypothesis: No distractions, so I can work calmly.

source: 生まれつきすぐに気が散って 病的なほど疑い深い気質だ
references: ['Distractible and paranoid by nature.']
hypothesis: He was born with an easily distracted and morbidly suspicious temperament.

source: 「気が早いな．．．」
references: ['Can you still?']
hypothesis: You're getting ahead of yourself..."

source: 気が早いな メキシコの祝日か？
references: ['Holy crap. -What, is it Cinco de Mayo already?']
hypothesis: You're getting ahead of yourself. Is this a Mexican holiday?

source: 私が父親と住みたがるんじゃないかと 気が気じゃないみたい
references: ["She's all freaked out that I'm gonna want to live with him or whatever."]
hypothesis: He's not too crazy about the idea that I might want to move in with his father.

source: でも 入試がね 気が気じゃないもんね
references: ["With the exams, you're probably not in the mindset."]
hypothesis: But the entrance exam... I'm not so crazy about it.

source: あなたを見つけようとして 気が気じゃなかったのよ
references: ["I've been out of my mind trying to find you."]
hypothesis: I've been out of my mind trying to find you.

source: どんだけぶっ飛ばされれば 気が済むって言うの？ さらにレベルアップして見ようか
references: ["How many of these guys' butts do we have to kick?"]
hypothesis: How much more of this do you have to take before you're satisfied? Let's take it to the next level.

source: 骨が砕ける音がしたぞ　ディアズ もうやめろ　気が済んだだろ
references: ["You hear the bones cracking, Diaz. Come on, that's enough."]
hypothesis: I heard bones cracking, Diaz. That's enough. You've made your point.

source: 小屋を調べれば 気が済むだろう
references: ['Maybe we ought to check the shed just to quiet him down.']
hypothesis: I'm sure you'll feel better once you check out the cabin.

source: いや　何も掛かってないと 気が滅入るだけだ
references: ['There are few things more depressing than empty coat hangers.']
hypothesis: No, it's just depressing when there's nothing on the line.

source: まあまあだ 家にいても 気が滅入るだけだし
references: ["After a certain point, time off doesn't help so I figured I'd rather be here."]
hypothesis: It's all right. I'm just home. It's depressing.

source: 気が滅入った時に 探索してたの
references: ['Sometimes I get a little stir-crazy and go exploring.']
hypothesis: I've been out exploring when I'm feeling down.

source: 気が短いのはよすのだぞ？
references: ['That temper of yours is a dangerous thing.']
hypothesis: Don't be short-tempered, okay?

source: いい人だけど気が短いわ
references: ["Baby, you're sweet, but you've gotta mellow out."]
hypothesis: He's a nice guy, but he's got a temper.

source: 雇い主は気が短いんだ こいつを使え
references: ['My client is getting impatient. Take these.']
hypothesis: Your employer has a temper. Use this guy.

source: あなたは今気が立ってるだけよ
references: ["You're just a passing phase."]
hypothesis: You're just in a temper right now.

source: 気が立ってたよね
references: ['He seems pretty pissed.']
hypothesis: You were in a temper, weren't you?

source: 気が立っているんだ そうさ
references: ['It can happen.']
hypothesis: You're upset. Yes, I am.

source: 気が紛れてる。
references: ["I'm distracted."]
hypothesis: Distracted.

source: 死後があるから― エリーゼが死んでも 気が紛れる
references: ["You think all the ghosts we've seen would somehow make me feel better that Elise is gone."]
hypothesis: I have an afterlife that will make me feel better about Elise's death.

source: 気が紛れるわよ
references: ['Helps take the edge off.']
hypothesis: It'll take your mind off things.

source: 私はただ気が緩んでいるだけだった
references: ["I just wasn't paying attention."]
hypothesis: I was just loosey-goosey.

source: つい気が緩んで
references: ["I'm not very focused tonight."]
hypothesis: I got a little carried away.

source: 当然だな　気が若いから
references: ["Well, that's not surprising. I was always young at heart, you know."]
hypothesis: Of course not. He's young at heart.

source: 気が触れぬのは幸運だ
references: ['It is mere luck we are not all insane.']
hypothesis: It's lucky I'm not crazy about it.

source: 気が触れた人間の集まりだろうかと
references: ["You think we're crazy."]
hypothesis: I wondered if it was a bunch of crazy people.

source: 気が触れたか？
references: ['Not yet. Are you crazy?']
hypothesis: Are you out of your mind?

source: 老人を痛めつけるのは気が進まなかったので 打ちのめすのは留まったのさ
references: ["I could've beaten him, but I didn't want to hurt the old man."]
hypothesis: He didn't feel like hurting the old man, so he stayed away from beating him up.

source: ソファで寝ないと 気が重いわ
references: ["Please, Lucas, let me sleep on the couch. I'll feel bad."]
hypothesis: I need to sleep on the couch. I'm so heavy.

source: 気が重い
references: ["No, you're not right."]
hypothesis: down

source: 仕方ないじゃない　無理して病気が 重くなったら困るでしょ。
references: ["There's nothing we can do. You don't want her to get worse, do you?"]
hypothesis: It can't be helped. You don't want to force yourself to become too sick, do you?

source: タイタスが　じきここに来る やつが俺ほど 気が長くないのは知ってるよな
references: ["Well, Titus is gonna be here soon, and we both know that he's not gonna be as patient as I am."]
hypothesis: Titus is gonna be here soon, and you know he's not gonna be as patient as I am.

source: いいんだ 気にするな
references: ['No worries. No worries.']
hypothesis: It's okay. Don't worry about it.

source: また衣装か　そんなの 誰も気にしないってばよ
references: ["Again with the costumes. No one cares what we're wearing."]
hypothesis: Another costume. Nobody cares about that.

source: お前がこの事を、、気にする必要はないよ.
references: ['Never mind that. You heard the man. Come on.']
hypothesis: You don't have to worry about this.

source: 気にしないわ・・・いい気味よ
references: ["I don't care. It's what he deserves."]
hypothesis: I don't care... it's a nice touch.

source: いや　気にしないで　飲ませて お世話になったんだから
references: ["N-No, it's okay. I can drink. It's a thing about me."]
hypothesis: No, don't worry about it. I'll let you have it. I've been indebted to you.

source: 斜面は小さくなるが 牛は気にしない
references: ["The chute gets smaller, but the cattle won't mind."]
hypothesis: The slopes get smaller, but the cows don't care.

source: 息を潜めて... 仮面の裏側は気にすることもない.
references: ['We keep our heads down, never bothering to look behind the masks.']
hypothesis: Under your breath... Never mind what's behind the mask.

source: ノートパソコンを渡せ どうやって手に入れたかは　気にしない
references: ["Just give me the laptop. How it got there, I don't really care."]
hypothesis: Give me the laptop. I don't care how you got it.

source: 人間の手に渡ったところで、 「ソー」は気にしそうに無いですけど。
references: ["Wouldn't mind getting my human hands on Thor."]
hypothesis: Thor doesn't seem to mind when it is in human hands, though.

source: 気にするな ４年間休暇を取ってないんだ
references: ["Who cares? He hasn't taken a vacation in four years..."]
hypothesis: Never mind, I haven't taken a vacation in four years.

source: 君が気にしているのに ふと気が付いてね
references: ["I've noticed how you stroke it."]
hypothesis: It just occurred to me that you care.

source: 彼が死んだことは　気にしてないけど 殺されたことは　気になってるね
references: ["And you don't care that he's dead, but you do care that he was murdered."]
hypothesis: You don't care that he's dead, but you do care that he was murdered.

source: （ｱﾙﾏﾝ）別に もし本当に １週間とか経って気になったら 俺のこと気にしないで ドンドン バンバン...
references: ["If you're still interested in her after a week, don't worry about me."]
hypothesis: （If you're really concerned about it after a week or something, don't worry about me.

source: "費用は気にせず 知恵を絞り"
references: ["I don't care what it costs. Dig up whatever you can."]
hypothesis: "Don't worry about the cost, just use your wits."

source: 数人の脱走兵が 顔を見せる勇気もなく 湿地に隠れてることは 気にしてない
references: ["Well, I'm not gonna concern myself with five or six deserters hiding' out in the swamp who don't have the courage to show their face."]
hypothesis: Never mind that a few deserters are hiding in the swamps, not daring to show their faces.

source: お前は幽霊だから、 首の骨を折っても、気にしないだろう
references: ["Since you're a ghost, you won't mind if I break your neck."]
hypothesis: You're a ghost. You wouldn't mind if I broke your neck.

source: 一つでも汚点を作れば すぐに出向だ お前みたいに なりたくもない病気になっても 周りのやつらから
references: ["you get transferred out immediately. there isn't a single word of apology from those guys around you. they hand you a one way ticket to no man's land."]
hypothesis: You make one more stain on my reputation, you'll be transferred out in a heartbeat, and if I get a disease I don't want to get, like you did, the people around me will be all over me for it.

source: 関係を持つなら 本気にならないと
references: ['If we do this we really did this.']
hypothesis: If you're gonna have a relationship, you're gonna have to get serious.

source: ちょっと気になって→
references: ['It bothered me a little so']
hypothesis: I was just curious.

source: え？ レイチェルとつき合えて いい気になってるんじゃない？
references: ['Greg, you hung out with Rachel once.']
hypothesis: What? I think you're just happy to be seeing Rachel.

source: いい気になるな
references: ["Don't let it go to your head."]
hypothesis: Don't get too comfortable.

source: 《フッ｡ なんて いい気になってるのかな？
references: ['As if. Am I getting ahead of myself?']
hypothesis: How nice... How nice is that?

source: その気になっても子供たちのせいで、 やる気を失うそうよ。
references: ['She said they were up all night, they were both exhausted all the time, the kids just took every sexual impulse they had outta them.']
hypothesis: He says that even when he feels like it, the children make him lose his motivation.

source: 皆病気になり暴力的になる
references: ["People are gettin' sick, they get sick and they get violent."]
hypothesis: They all get sick, they all become violent.

source: 銀行を目の敵にしてるってわけか しかし気にならないか？
references: ["huh? But isn't it odd?"]
hypothesis: So you're making an enemy of the banks, but doesn't it bother you?

source: 少ししてから 目を覚ますと 少し狂気になり 非常に暴力的になっていて
references: ['And when you wake up a little bit later, you are a little crazed and very violent.']
hypothesis: A little while later, I wake up, a little crazed, very violent.

source: 格好いいと思います 気に入りました
references: ["I think it's bad-ass. I like it."]
hypothesis: I think it's cool. I like it.

source: 俺を睨み付けて 返事が気に入らなければ 俺を壁に叩きつけるんだな
references: ["You get in my face,tighten your jaw,then if I say something you don't like, you slam me against the wall."]
hypothesis: You glare at me, and if I don't like your answer, you slam me against the wall.

source: 恐らく お前の若い魔女娘は 奴を次第に 気に入ったのだろう
references: ['Maybe your young witch has grown partial to his company.']
hypothesis: Perhaps your young witch girl has taken an increasing liking to him.

source: 色々気に入ってる 肉も手に入るし 他のだって
references: ['I like the variety and availability of meats and other goodies...']
hypothesis: I like it a lot. I can get meat. I can get other things.

source: うちの社長は 気に入らない仕事だからって 手を抜くような人じゃ ないですよね？
references: ["Our boss isn't someone who wouldn't do her best just because she doesn't like the product."]
hypothesis: Our president isn't the kind of person who cuts corners just because he doesn't like a job, is he?

source: あなたの手段を選ばないところ 気に入っている
references: ['I like this "by-any-means" approach of yours.']
hypothesis: I like that you are a man of means.

source: 少し気に掛かるだろう 爆弾は作動してる
references: ["This is gonna make you a little bit anxious. It's ticking."]
hypothesis: It'll be of little concern. The bomb's working.

source: この余白が気に掛かる
references: ['I hate this margin.']
hypothesis: I'm curious about these margins.

source: 聞くことで 気に掛けてくれるとの 貴方への満足感を 与えたく無かった
references: ["I didn't want to give you the satisfaction of thinking I cared enough to ask."]
hypothesis: I didn't want to give you the satisfaction of knowing that I care.

source: お気に 掛けないで下さいね ハンサムな方と話が出来るだけでも もう嬉しくて
references: ["I hope you don't mind, but I don't get many handsome young men visitors anymore."]
hypothesis: I hope you don't mind, but I'm already happy just to be able to talk to a handsome man.

source: それで今日　彼女を救う あなたは手伝う事になる たとえあなたが 誰も気に掛けないとしても あなたの娘ジュリアでさえ
references: ["So today, I'm saving hers, and you're gonna help, even if you care about no one, not even your daughter Julia."]
hypothesis: So today, you're going to help save her, even if you don't care about anyone, not even your daughter Julia.

source: 俺が目に付くのは 両方を気に掛ける誰かだ 苦難の連続だった
references: ['What I see is somebody that both of us care for having a rough go of it.']
hypothesis: All I see is someone who cares about both sides, and it's been a struggle.

source: - おやおや もう気に病まなくても いいですよ
references: ["You don't need to worry about me anymore."]
hypothesis: - Well, well, well. You don't have to worry about it anymore.

source: 君は気に病むたちだからな もう忘れろ
references: ['Well, you always worried too much, Jim. The past is the past, my friend.']
hypothesis: You're the one who's obsessed. Forget about it.

source: 気に病む事はない
references: ["I wouldn't bother, laddie."]
hypothesis: Don't worry about it.

source: 先に使ってしまって お気に障ったかしら
references: ["I hope you don't mind that I tried it first."]
hypothesis: I hope you don't mind that I used it first.

source: 気に障ったかな？
references: ['Mind if I sit?']
hypothesis: Did I offend you?

source: 何が気に障った? ん? 最後ぐらい一
references: ['At least die like a honourable man.']
hypothesis: What's wrong? Hmm? One last thing.

source: １回は"イエス"の意味だ 気に食わないとさ
references: ["One ding. That means yes. Tio don't like you."]
hypothesis: One "yes" means you don't like it.

source: 破られたのが 気に食わないんだ
references: ["- I don't think you like the fact that I beat your test."]
hypothesis: I don't like the fact that they ripped it up.

source: 僕が吹っ切れてるのが 気に食わないんだ
references: ["She just can't stand that I got over it."]
hypothesis: He doesn't like that I'm blowing off steam.

source: ちょっとした 協定が気に食わない・・ 毎月第2週目の火曜・・
references: ["I'd hate for our little arrangement, every second Tuesday of the month..."]
hypothesis: I don't like the little arrangement... the second Tuesday of every month...

source: 同性愛って... 病気のようなもので 病気は心配です
references: ["Homosexuality is like... is like disease, and I'm afraid of disease."]
hypothesis: Homosexuality is... It's like a disease. I worry about diseases.

source: 「特に気を付けて頂きたいのは 交換した鍵が漏洩したり」
references: ['"I would like to confirm out of email that the keys we exchanged']
hypothesis: I want you to be especially careful that the locks you replace are not compromised."

source: - 了解 気を付けろ
references: ['I know you know.']
hypothesis: - Copy that. Be careful.

source: 「足が速いから気を付けろ」と 父に言われたが
references: ["Our dad had warned us how fast that dog was, but we couldn't resist."]
hypothesis: My father told me to be careful because he's fast.

source: 気を使うな
references: ["Don't mind me."]
hypothesis: Don't worry about it.

source: あー 本当はいろいろ進んでんのに （勇気）うん 知らないふりして 気を使って
references: ["You mean how even though things are progressing between them, we have to pretend we don't know."]
hypothesis: You're really making progress, but you're pretending like you don't know.

source: 気を使った言い方してくれても いいんじゃない？
references: ['Er, yeah, nicely put, John.']
hypothesis: You could have said it in a more considerate way.

source: よく判らない グリムに戻らないでいる為に ジュリエットや皆に 何かにつけ 気を使わせたくない
references: ["You know, I just don't want Juliette to constantly have to worry about something bad happening to me, or to her, or to one of our friends."]
hypothesis: I don't know, I don't want Juliette or anyone else to have to worry about anything just so I don't have to go back to being a Grimm.

source: キミは僕の手を煩わせないように気を使うだろ？
references: ['Just try and do your best To keep your hands off me, yeah?']
hypothesis: You're just trying to keep me out of trouble, aren't you?

source: 気を付け そして 互いに気を使い続ける様に
references: ['Be safe out there, look out for each other and keep charging.']
hypothesis: Take care and keep looking out for each other.

source: 気を利かせてくれて... ありがとう
references: ['Thank you for your... efficiency.']
hypothesis: You're very thoughtful... Thank you.

source: 気を取り直して働け
references: ['Now pull the cobwebs out of your ass and move.']
hypothesis: Pull yourself together and get to work.

source: 「ダズリングス」に 人気を取られると思って... 悪いウワサを流してるのでは？
references: ["Perhaps you're all just worried that the Dazzlings will steal your spotlight."]
hypothesis: I thought the Dazzlings would take over. I think you're spreading a bad rumor.

source: それとも手に気を取られたか？
references: ['Or you been too busy watching the hand holding the deck?']
hypothesis: Or were you distracted by the hand?

source: ああ, だがあの時は 食べ物に気を取られてたんだ
references: ['Yeah, but they were feeding. They were distracted.']
hypothesis: Yeah, but I was distracted by the food at the time.

source: 俺が夜の王に気を取られているのは それを目にしたからだ
references: ["I'm consumed with the Night King because I've seen him."]
hypothesis: I'm distracted by the Night King because that's what I see.

source: 離婚してから ヤツは物に気を回さなくなった 何か夢中になるものを 探してたように見えます
references: ["Ever since his divorce, he didn't really care much about stuff."]
hypothesis: Since the divorce, he's stopped paying attention to stuff, like he was looking for something to get into.

source: 気を回さないで　あなたに... 話が...
references: ['I just came by to... talk.']
hypothesis: Don't worry about me. I'm here to tell you... I need to talk to...

source: た たぶん 気を失ったのだと思います
references: ["I - I don't know, I think I passed out for a while."]
hypothesis: I think I might have blacked out.

source: ガソリンを入れている時に 蒸気を吸って それでまた気を失ったんだ
references: ['You were pumping gas, and the fumes, they made you pass out again.']
hypothesis: He was pumping gas, inhaled some fumes, and that's when he passed out again.

source: ホントにあなたの気を 引いちゃったのね
references: ["I really got to you, didn't I, Walter?"]
hypothesis: I really got your attention, didn't I?

source: 気を引きたいのか 嫌なヤツだぞ
references: ['You girls throw yourselves at any douche bag who happens to be Moroi and royal.']
hypothesis: You're just trying to impress me. I don't like him.

source: だったら 教えてちょうだい 万引き癖のある最悪の妹に かかわって 私に何の得が？ あの子は周りの 気を引きたいだけ
references: ['Now I\'m supposed to go, "Hank, please what can I possibly do to further benefit my spoiled, kleptomaniac, bitch sister who somehow always manages to be the center of attention?"']
hypothesis: Then tell me, what's in it for me, if I'm going to help my sister, the worst kind of shoplifter? She's just trying to get people's attention.

source: 謝りに来た 君の気を悪くしたから... 仲直りしよう
references: ['To apologize for anything I said that hurt your feelings and sort things out between you and me.']
hypothesis: I came to apologize. I didn't mean to offend you. Let's make up.

source: みんな気を悪くしている 臨機応変に対応してくれよ？
references: ['A lot of people would just suck it up, you know, rise to the occasion?']
hypothesis: People are getting upset. Be resourceful, okay?

source: 分かったよ 若旦那 気を悪くせんでくれ
references: ['All right young sir, I meant no offense.']
hypothesis: All right, young master. Don't be offended.

source: -8 気を抜くな 頼むから
references: ['Concentrate, please!']
hypothesis: -8, don't let up. I'm begging you.

source: 気を抜くな
references: ['Stay sharp.']
hypothesis: Stay sharp.

source: よし 気を抜くなよ
references: ['OK, stay sharp.']
hypothesis: All right. Stay sharp.

source: アニーに気を持たせて 何もしない気なのか？
references: ["May, you can't give Annie all this hope and then not deliver on anything at all."]
hypothesis: Are you trying to get Annie's attention and do nothing?

source: あの夜は気を持たせちゃって...
references: ['I know I left you hanging the other night and I just wanted...']
hypothesis: I'm sorry I put you on the spot that night...

source: 気を持たせるだけだなと思って 言えなかったのね
references: ['I figured that would just lead him on.']
hypothesis: You didn't want to tell me because you thought it would only make me uncomfortable.

source: 気を確かに持つんだ！
references: ['Stay awake! Stay awake!']
hypothesis: Be sure you're on your toes!

source: 気を落とすな 覚えてる
references: ["Be brave I'll remember you"]
hypothesis: Don't lose heart. I remember.

source: 気を落とさずに
references: ['God bless.']
hypothesis: don't lose heart

source: 気を落とさないで　ヴィクター
references: ['Take care,victor.']
hypothesis: Don't lose heart, Victor.

source: 僕は本当に彼女に気を許していた
references: ['I really let her in.']
hypothesis: I really let her get to me.

source: ジュリエット 気を許すな
references: ["Juliette, you can't trust her."]
hypothesis: Juliette, don't let him get to you.

source: 白状させるには 信用できる誰かが要る 気を許してしいる誰かだ
references: ["Look, if we're gonna get him to confess, it has to be with someone that he truly trusts, someone that he'll genuinely let his guard down with."]
hypothesis: To get him to confess, you need someone you trust, someone you're comfortable with.

source: 健康には気を遣わないと
references: ["We're watching our cholesterol, I guess. Not me."]
hypothesis: We need to take care of our health.

source: これは特に気を遣うの　注意して
references: ["That one's very fragile. Be careful."]
hypothesis: This one is especially sensitive. Be careful.

source: あなたのお父さんは 色々と気を配るのよ
references: ['Your dad, he is so thoughtful, to the end.']
hypothesis: Your father takes care of a lot of things.

source: あなたと違い 気を配ってるので 好きな時間や 相棒を迎えに来る時間など
references: ["Yes, I, unlike you, pay attention to details, like what time it is and what time you're supposed to pick up your partner for shift."]
hypothesis: Unlike you, I pay attention to things like favorite hours and when to pick up my partner.

source: 細かいところまで　気を配らないと
references: ["It's an attention to detail."]
hypothesis: You have to pay attention to the details.

source: 落ち着くんだ　気を静めろ
references: ['Okay, McFly. Get a grip on yourself.']
hypothesis: Calm down. Calm down.

source: 気を静めて入りなさい
references: ['So you better pull yourself together and get in there.']
hypothesis: Calm down and come in.

source: まあ奥様 気を静めてください
references: ["Please, don't get upset, Princess. It's just your imagination, because, I assure you..."]
hypothesis: Well, ma'am, you need to calm down.

source: 全然　気合が入ってない
references: ["There's absolutely no commitment."]
hypothesis: You don't seem at all enthusiastic.

source: 鳥井教授　今日は 一段と気合が入ってますよ　ええ。
references: ['Professor Torii is certainly fired up today.']
hypothesis: Professor Torii, you're even more enthusiastic today, yes.

source: 気合を入れろ！
references: ['Put some spunk into it!']
hypothesis: Get fired up!

source: チアリーダーたちが劇で 気合を入れてくれるようだ
references: ['The cheerleaders have put together a skit to help get us in the spirit.']
hypothesis: Looks like the cheerleaders will be putting on a play to get us in the mood.

source: もっと気合を入れて練習を始めろ ニーマン
references: ['Start practicing harder, Neiman.']
hypothesis: Start practicing with more enthusiasm, Neiman.

source: 君よりも、私のほうがずっと気味が悪いと 思われてるよ、マーゴ。
references: ["I'm much weirder than you will ever be, Margot."]
hypothesis: They think I'm much creepier than you, Margot.

source: 気味が悪くて広い場所だ
references: ["I know it's spooky, big guy."]
hypothesis: It's a spooky, wide open place.

source: 気味が悪いな
references: ['Spooky.']
hypothesis: That's creepy.

source: 謝罪するなら すべてを水に流すそうよ
references: ["He says he'll drop the whole thing if you apologize."]
hypothesis: He says if you apologize, he'll let bygones be bygones.

source: まさか水に流すよ
references: ['Live and let live, man.']
hypothesis: No way. I'll let bygones be bygones.

source: ジュニア　赤ん坊を渡せ すべて水に流そう
references: ["Junior, look, hand over the baby, and we'll let bygones be bygones."]
hypothesis: Junior, give me the baby. Let's let bygones be bygones.

source: だが言い終わる前に あの光に水を差された 話の続きを期待してるんだが
references: ["But before he could finish, we were interrupted by that flash of light and I'm hoping we can pick up where we left off."]
hypothesis: But before I could finish, I was interrupted by that light, and I'm hoping we can continue the story.

source: 水を差すようだが 操ってはならん
references: ['I hate to interrupt, But glamour is not permitted.']
hypothesis: I hate to interrupt, but you can't manipulate them.

source: チャドが生活体験者の名簿を 持って来なければ 全て水の泡
references: ["If Chad doesn't get back with that list of live-aboards, it was all for nothing."]
hypothesis: If Chad doesn't bring the list of live-aboards, all bets are off.

source: 私が捕まれば全てが水の泡
references: ['If they arrest me, this mission is blown.']
hypothesis: If they catch me, all bets are off.

source: 今を逃せば水の泡
references: ["It's a needle in a haystack after this."]
hypothesis: If you miss it now, you're dead in the water.

source: 水火も辞せずついて行きます"
references: ['To the bitter end."']
hypothesis: Water and fire are also not to be resigned."

source: パン工房は ほんの氷山の一角ね
references: ["The bakery's just the tip of the iceberg."]
hypothesis: The bakery is just the tip of the iceberg.

source: 歴史教科書から氷山の一角にしか学べない 自分の手で直接体験した方がよい
references: ["Archive texts can only teach you a part of the picture, my young Padawan. You'll learn a lot more through some hands-on experience."]
hypothesis: You can only learn the tip of the iceberg from history textbooks. It's better to experience it first hand yourself.

source: 心をなくしてた　それが彼女 スポーツして汗を流すこともなく ただひたすら研究してた
references: ["You're losing your mind, and there she is, working just as hard, not even breaking a sweat."]
hypothesis: She was losing her mind, and that's why she never played sports, never worked up a sweat, just studied.

source: そうです　食事はビーガン 走って汗を流します
references: ["Yeah, I actually did. I'm a vegan. And I started working out, and running, and working out, and running..."]
hypothesis: Yes, the food is vegan. We run and sweat.

source: 共に血と汗を流し 弾の雨をくぐって来た
references: ["We've shared blood, sweat and precious metal together."]
hypothesis: Together, we've shed blood and sweat, we've walked through a hail of bullets.

source: 決を採ろう
references: ['We should vote.']
hypothesis: Let's take a vote.

source: この場で決を採ろう
references: ['On behalf of custodial services,']
hypothesis: Let's take a vote right here.

source: 決まりが悪いわ。
references: ["He'd be embarrassed."]
hypothesis: It's not a good rule.

source: - ちょっと 決まりが悪いな
references: ["- Yeah, but it'd be pretty awkward."]
hypothesis: - It's a little awkward.

source: キャット・グラントは、Catcoの ハックについて沈黙を 破ろうとしています。
references: ["It seems Cat Grant's silence regarding the Catco hack is about to be broken."]
hypothesis: Cat Grant is trying to break his silence about the Catco hack.

source: その一帯に囮貨物船が到着次第 無線で沈黙を破ります
references: ["Soon as the decoy freighters arrive in the system, they'll break wireless silence."]
hypothesis: As soon as the decoy freighters arrive in the area, we will break the radio silence.

source: 夫が沈黙を破ります 妻の失踪に― 彼の不倫や噂の事を
references: ["A husband breaks his silence, not just on his wife's disappearance... but on his infidelity, and all those shocking rumors."]
hypothesis: A husband breaks his silence over his wife's disappearance, his infidelity, rumors.

source: 油が切れてるな
references: ["Transmission's dry."]
hypothesis: You're out of oil.

source: よう なんだ 一体どこで油を売っていた?
references: ["Hey, man, where'd you run off to?"]
hypothesis: Hey, what's up? Where the hell have you been selling oil?

source: 冬が来るまでずっと ここで油を売ってるつもりか？
references: ['Do you plan on sitting here scratching your balls till winter?']
hypothesis: Are you going to be here selling oil all winter?

source: 油を売るために 電話した訳じゃない
references: ["I don't make the call about which, if any, of these charges hold water."]
hypothesis: I didn't call you to sell oil.

source: 私の頭に油を注いでくださる 私の杯は 溢れています
references: ['"You anoint my head with oil. My cup overflows.']
hypothesis: He anoints my head with oil, my cup overflows.

source: 波風が立たないよう　友達のように接する 貴方の態度の事よ
references: ["It means that you're still acting like you're everyone's best friend."]
hypothesis: I'm talking about the way you treat me like a friend, like you don't want to cause any trouble.

source: "泣きを見る" 君は言ってくれた
references: ['" It will end in tears. " You\'ve warned me.']
hypothesis: "I'll cry," you said.

source: この件が蒸し返して 泣きを見なければいいんだが
references: ["As long as this doesn't come back and bite us in the ass."]
hypothesis: I hope this doesn't come back to bite them in the ass and make them cry.

source: 分かってるだろう 土下座して 泣きを入れる奴も居れば その一方で 英雄然として
references: ["Well, you know as well as I do, there's guys who roll over and beg and mercy, and then there's those other guys who get all heroic, and are willing to die for the cause."]
hypothesis: You know, there are those who get down on their knees and cry, and then there are those who, on the other hand, are heroes.

source: 泣きっ面に蜂ですよ
references: ['Took us completely by surprise.']
hypothesis: It's a crying shame.

source: ♪別々に暮らす 泣き出しそうな空を
references: ["I don't have enough strength anymore"]
hypothesis: We live separately The sky is about to cry

source: 泣くに泣けなかったよ
references: ['It was very, very sad.']
hypothesis: I couldn't cry.

source: 彼の注意を引いて下さい
references: ['Distract him.']
hypothesis: Get his attention.

source: 確かに誕生日会はしなかった 周りの注意を引くからな 警察の目も光ってた 目立たない方がいい
references: ["Well, you didn't have birthday parties, because that would draw attention to us and with the police looking for us, that's not a good thing."]
hypothesis: I certainly didn't have a birthday party, because that would draw attention to the area around me, and the police had their eyes on me, and the less conspicuous I was, the better.

source: 念じて物を動かしたり 少しでも父の注意を 引こうとして
references: ['Or that I was moving stuff around with my mind, hoping it might get him to pay a little more attention.']
hypothesis: I've been trying to get my father's attention... by moving things around with my mind.

source: 本当にそれは注目に値します 本当に驚異的です CIAにとっては大成功ですね 貴方が作戦統制を管理して以来
references: ['I must say, it is remarkable, really astounding, the success that the CIA has had since you have taken operational control, and so the President has asked me to ask you to ask him, to invite you both']
hypothesis: It really is remarkable, really phenomenal, and a huge success for the CIA since you took operational control.

source: 注目に値する
references: ['Remarkable.']
hypothesis: be noteworthy

source: 科学者で鑑定家としてそう思った こりゃ何だ？ 注目に値する
references: ['And as a scientist and a connoisseur, I have I have no idea the contents of this remarkable potion.']
hypothesis: As a scientist and connoisseur, I thought so. What is this? It's remarkable.

source: 頭は低く, つねに目を見張れ, 注目を浴びたい衝動に打ち克て.
references: ['Keep your head down, keep your eyes up, resist the urge to be seen as important or special.']
hypothesis: Keep your head down, keep your eyes on the prize, and resist the urge to be noticed.

source: 彼らは隊で侵入 メディアと国家からの注目を浴び 人質の命を盾に
references: ['they enter with force, drew the attention of the media and law enforcement using human hostages as collateral for their demands.']
hypothesis: They invaded in force, drawing media and state attention and using the hostages' lives as a shield.

source: やっとボスの 注目を浴びるチャンスが 来たかと思った
references: ['I saw a chance to step up for you, get noticed.']
hypothesis: I thought I finally had a chance to get the boss's attention.

source: だが彼は市の裏の部分 残忍さ暴力を浮き彫りにさせる
references: ['What that man does is carry out a dark reckoning for his city. It is a brutal, violent vision of justice, one we do not share.']
hypothesis: But he brings to light the underbelly of the city, the brutality, the violence.

source: 自慢じゃないがこの齢になるまで 一回も浮いた噂はない
references: ["I've had no romance in my life."]
hypothesis: I don't mean to brag, but until I reached my age, I've never heard of a single fling.

source: そう娘を探してる時は いつもこんなよ 娘が消息を絶ってから...
references: ["Yes, he stays out this late when he's looking for my daughter, since my daughter has been gone -- yes!"]
hypothesis: Yeah, it's always like this when I'm looking for my daughter, ever since she disappeared.

source: レバノン内戦にキリスト教徒側で参戦して その後消息を絶ったが
references: ['Fought with the Christian Phalangists in the Civil War, then disappeared.']
hypothesis: He fought on the side of the Christians in the Lebanese Civil War and then disappeared.

source: 教授はラングーンに到着後 消息を絶っています 妻であるアウン・サン・スー・チー氏 を訪ねる目的だった模様
references: ['It has not been seen since his arrival in Rangoon where he came to visit his wife.']
hypothesis: The professor has not been seen since his arrival in Rangoon, apparently on a visit to his wife, Aung San Suu Kyi.

source: お前の母親はどう？ 醜悪な精神病院で 涎を垂らしながら死なせたいかい？
references: ['And what about your mother? Huh? You want her to die drooling in some hideous asylum?']
hypothesis: What about your mother? Would you want her to die drooling in some hideous asylum?

source: 彼女の甘い香水が 俺の涙を誘う
references: ['Her perfume a sweet promise that brings tears to my eyes.']
hypothesis: Her sweet perfume brings tears to my eyes.

source: ただ、私の歌はよく子供の涙を誘うがね
references: ['Yeah. On the other hand, my singing would often drive my children to tears.']
hypothesis: But my songs often bring children to tears, though.

source: どんな時も 涼しい顔してたよね？
references: ["How'd you always make it look so easy?"]
hypothesis: You've always had a cool head, haven't you?

source: 彼女は涼しい顔で人生を乗り切ってきた
references: ['She handled life like it was easy.']
hypothesis: She's gotten through life with a cool face.

source: 竜巻の中に歩いて入り... 涼しい顔で出て来る男
references: ['We need someone who can walk into a tornado, and come out the other side like it was a damn gentle breeze.']
hypothesis: Walking into a tornado... Man comes out looking cool

source: 彼女の血が強く君に訴えてる... それで私は渇きを覚えている。
references: ['Her blood appeals to you so much it makes me thirsty.']
hypothesis: Her blood appeals to you so strongly... That makes me thirsty.

source: 渡りに船さ
references: ['Janitors go anywhere, everywhere, nobody pays any attention to them.']
hypothesis: It's a good thing I'm not.

source: 向こうにとっても 今回の提案は渡りに船だ
references: ['This proposal is a godsend to them as well.']
hypothesis: For the other side, this proposal is a godsend.

source: 滅相もない... ！
references: ['Oh no!']
hypothesis: Oh, my God...! !

source: 私は　その場しのぎの 一時的な謙虚さを潔しとしない
references: ['Well, I will not allow false modesty to tarnish the moment.']
hypothesis: I have no grace for temporary, stopgap humility.

source: Vが濡れ衣を着せたのは二度目
references: ["- It's the second time V's framed you... for something you didn't do. - Anything you wanna tell us?"]
hypothesis: This is the second time the V's have framed me.

source: まぁ... 教会の金庫を空にする目的で 会計係に濡れ衣を着せ 自分が着服したと考えている
references: ["Well, we think he framed the church accountant for clearing out the church's coffers and took the money for himself."]
hypothesis: Well... He thinks he falsely accused the treasurer of emptying the church's coffers, and he thinks he's the one who took the fall.

source: 社長に殺人犯の濡れ衣を着せれば 事業計画を妨害できると言うのは わかるけど えらく回りくどいやり方ね
references: ["I get that framing the head of a company for murder could throw a hitch in his business plan, but it's a hell of a long way to go."]
hypothesis: I can see how framing the CEO as a murderer could thwart his business plans, but that's a very roundabout way of going about it.

source: 濡れ衣を着せられた じゃリストを盗んだ人物は　まだ逃走中か
references: ['So the person who stole the list is still at large.']
hypothesis: So the person who stole the list is still at large.

source: あなたを破滅させたがってる人物に 濡れ衣を着せられたように見せかけた
references: ['You were being framed by someone who wanted to destroy you.']
hypothesis: You were made to look like you were being framed by someone who wanted to destroy you.

source: 濡れ衣を着せられるのはごめんだ
references: ["I ain't going down on some trumped-up murder charge."]
hypothesis: I don't want to be framed.

source: 任務を与えたら 火に油を注ぐ事に
references: ['We have enough race troubles as it is without these sons of bitches in the press throwing fuel on the fire.']
hypothesis: If I give you a mission, I'm adding fuel to the fire.

source: 誰かが気づくべきだった 露骨なまでに目の前にあるんだ perfectly obvious 火を見るより明らか
references: ['Any one of us should have seen the perfectly obvious staring us in the face.']
hypothesis: Someone should have seen it coming, it's blatantly right in front of us, perfectly obvious.

source: チキンはちゃんと火を通して
references: ['Make sure those chickens are cleaned properly.']
hypothesis: Make sure the chicken is properly cooked.

source: ゆっくり火を通す
references: ["-It's all about slow roasting."]
hypothesis: cook slowly

source: 火中の栗を拾う性分
references: ['You never could keep yourself out of trouble, either.']
hypothesis: (a tendency to) pick up chestnuts by the fire

source: 火中の栗を拾うなら そうなるだろう 奴らは我々をも 普通の人間扱いするだろうか？
references: ['Not if we risk our lives doing so.']
hypothesis: If we were to pick chestnuts out of the fire, would they treat us like normal human beings, too?

source: 彼らは海洋で仕事を 火中の栗を拾っている それを了解なしに引き上げようと
references: ["They're out there in the freakin' ocean risking their lives for us, and you raise their taxes without asking me?"]
hypothesis: They're picking up jobs in the ocean, they're picking up chestnuts in the fire, and they're going to pull them out of the water without a word of warning.

source: 俺は 5歳か、そこらかな、小さい町で、ワイルドバーグって、 ブラックフォレストにあったんだが、 ちょうど爆撃されて灰燼に帰したんだ、知ってるか？
references: ['I was five years old, or something, in a little town, Wildberg, in the Black Forest, and it was just bombed to ashes, you know?']
hypothesis: I was five or something, a small town, Wildberg, in the Black Forest, and it was just bombed to ashes, you know?

source: ダミーコ一味が すべて灰燼に帰すまで―
references: ["Not 'til D'Amico and his whole damn operation are burnt to ashes."]
hypothesis: Until all of D'Amico's crew is burnt to ashes.

source: "灸を据える"って言ったろ
references: ['But you prayed for me to get punished!']
hypothesis: You said, "I'm going to give you moxa."

source: 後ろから弱点を打つ
references: ['I must strike the weak spot from behind.']
hypothesis: Strike the weak spot from behind.

source: 点数を稼ぎたいのよ
references: ['I need a win.']
hypothesis: I'm just trying to score some points.

source: 古いゲームの所為にしてると マスコミに知れたら
references: ['If this gets out to the press that we are pinning this on some old video game...!']
hypothesis: If the press finds out I'm blaming it on old games.

source: 俺がした事は全て君の為に さようなら
references: ['Everything I ever did was for you. All board. All board.']
hypothesis: Everything I did was for you. Goodbye.

source: 自分にもっと度量があったら アナタに応えられた アナタの為になる事を
references: ["I just keep wishing that I'd been bigger somehow, able to give you... what you needed to be okay again after you got back, but I couldn't."]
hypothesis: I wish I had the strength to respond to you, to do what's best for you.

source: 沈黙が君の為に なるとは思えない
references: ["I don't believe the life of the Silent Sisters is for you."]
hypothesis: I don't think silence will do you any good.

source: お前がしっかりしなきゃ ヤツの為にならないぞ
references: ['You oughtta lock him up for his own good.']
hypothesis: You're not doing him any favors if you don't get your shit together.

source: 当てはないが 為せば成る
references: ['Just go for it.']
hypothesis: It's not a given, but if you do it, you can do it

source: その烏合の衆の中に 交渉権を持つ者は？
references: ['Is there any in this rout with authority to treat with me?']
hypothesis: Who among that crowd has the right to negotiate?

source: 烏合の衆のクソ週末兵士に 穴に埋められた
references: ['Buried in a hole by a bunch of weekend warriors!']
hypothesis: Buried in a hole by a bunch of weekend fucking soldiers.

source: 烏合の衆のままでは いさかいが絶えぬだけで
references: ["If we work separately, we'll just end up fighting."]
hypothesis: If we remain as a mob, we will only end up fighting each other.

source: 特に　自分の父親を殺した子と 烙印を押されるのはね
references: ["Especially when you're branded the kid who killed your dad."]
hypothesis: Especially to be branded as the child who killed her own father.

source: 悪党は全て テロリストの烙印を押され
references: ['This new law, where if you\'re a bad enough, bad guy they stamp "Terrorist" on your jacket.']
hypothesis: All the bad guys are branded as terrorists.

source: 人生の烙印を押されたんだ
references: ['I was branded for life.']
hypothesis: I was branded for life.

source: 防毒マスクは 水素には 無用の長物になるのです
references: ['Gas masks will be useless against hydrogen.']
hypothesis: The gas masks would be useless for hydrogen.

source: 無辜の民か それが次のターゲットだ
references: ['I-it could be an innocent of some kind, but I think that could be his next kill.']
hypothesis: Blameless people. That's the next target.

source: むやみに無辜の民を殺さないなら
references: ["As long as you don't kill the innocent"]
hypothesis: If you don't kill innocent people unnecessarily.

source: 新米の君たちへの忠告だ よく観察して 無駄口を叩くな
references: ['Now, a few words of advice as newbies on the job... eyes open, mouths shut.']
hypothesis: A word of advice to all you newbies out there, watch closely and don't waste your breath.

source: じゃ、無駄口を叩くな
references: ["Then don't waste time talking about it."]
hypothesis: Then don't waste your breath.

source: 考えておるわい 焦点を合わせろ
references: ['I said I would think about it. Now focus.']
hypothesis: I'm thinking. Focus.

source: 焦点を合わせるのか。 私は、彼らの正体と、 組織の仕組みを知る価値があると考えました。
references: ['We decided it is worth knowing who these people are and how their organizations operate, because on the other side of the rage and the sadness are clarity and strength, the power we have to focus our efforts effectively,']
hypothesis: Focus. I figured it was worth knowing who they were and how their organization worked.

source: 焦点を合わせて 押すんだ
references: ['You just take it, point it, and shoot it.']
hypothesis: Focus. Push.

source: これらの一つに焦点を絞りましょう
references: ['I want to focus on just one of them.']
hypothesis: Let's focus on one of these

source: 焦点を絞りましょう
references: ["Let's narrow the window of incident."]
hypothesis: Let's narrow our focus.

source: 焼け石に水なんだよ！
references: ['- is just a drop in the bucket!']
hypothesis: It's a burning stone!

source: 北の我が軍は 煙幕を張り こっそりと、少し後退した 一方、爆撃機は３回にわたり
references: ['Our troops in the north put down a smokescreen and under cover they withdrew a little while our bombers went in in three deadly waves to deliver a large aerial bombardment and one of the heaviest of the whole campaign.']
hypothesis: Our troops in the north put up a smokescreen and stealthily pulled back a bit, while the bombers went back in three times.

source: 煮え湯を飲まされた
references: ['But to be betrayed by him...']
hypothesis: I've been boiled.

source: 銀行さんには 今まで どんだけ煮え湯を飲まされたか
references: ["I don't know how many times I've been burned by banks."]
hypothesis: I can't tell you how many times I've been burned by the bank.

source: 熱が冷めるように
references: ['Like the passing of a fever.']
hypothesis: as the heat dies down

source: 結婚すると熱が冷めるって おまえ　言ってたけど 俺たち夫婦は　反対だな
references: ["You'd think that marriage would just cool things off, but for us, it's just the opposite."]
hypothesis: You said marriage cools things off, but we're the opposite.

source: 彼のことは　完全に熱が冷めたの
references: ['That guy is completely out of my system.']
hypothesis: I'm completely over him.

source: 誰に熱を上げようと 構わんが...
references: ["I wouldn't give a shit about your pathetic schoolgirl crush."]
hypothesis: I don't care who you're into.

source: 熱を上げた最近の 女がすることよ
references: ["It's what us modern girls do when we have a crush."]
hypothesis: That's what women do these days when the heat is on.

source: もっと熱を入れて
references: ['Come on, give me some heat...']
hypothesis: More heat.

source: プレイに熱を入れろ！
references: ['Play with some energy now!']
hypothesis: Put the heat on play!

source: さて最近　この中の誰かが 少し熱くなってます
references: ['Now, one of you has been coming in a little hot lately.']
hypothesis: Well, one of these guys has been a little hot lately.

source: プライスレスのライフワークです」 って　このコメント→ 実に素晴らしくて 胸が熱くなりました！
references: ['To me, surgery is priceless life work." That comment was so very touching, I was fraught with emotion!']
hypothesis: This comment, "This is priceless life work," was so wonderful that it touched my heart!

source: Who'd have ever thought that this could be? 胸が熱くなるの
references: ["Who'd have ever thought that this could be"]
hypothesis: Who'd have ever thought that this could be? 胸が熱くなるの

source: 会場の空気は熱気を帯びて来ています
references: ['Enjoy your day.']
hypothesis: The air in the hall is getting hotter and hotter.

source: 彼女はロマンチックなんだと思う 彼女の好きな詩人の 爪の垢を煎じて飲むわ
references: ['I mean, knowing Jess, she probably just thought it was romantic, following in the footsteps of her favorite poet.']
hypothesis: I think she's a romantic, and I'd drink the toenails of her favorite poet.

source: - 車で片を付けるか
references: ["I'm gonna keep it about the cars"]
hypothesis: - I'll just take the car and clean up.

source: 片を付ける ここに居ろ
references: ['I got business to finish. You stay here.']
hypothesis: I'll take care of it. You stay here.

source: 俺は片を付けようと言ったんだ
references: ["I told you we're finishing this."]
hypothesis: I said let's get this over with.

source: あの建物が分かるか？
references: ['You recognize building, yes?']
hypothesis: Do you recognize that building?

source: - 探してる物が分かったら教えるよ
references: ["It'd help if I knew what the hell I was looking for."]
hypothesis: - I'll let you know if I find what you're looking for.

source: 君の所有物を調べれば 君が持ち出した物が分かるかな？
references: ['Are they gonna be able to go into your stuff and figure out what you took?']
hypothesis: If we go through your property, do you think we can find out what you took out of it?

source: 判った 物は試しだ
references: ['Okay.']
hypothesis: All right, let's try this.

source: 物は試しと言うだろ
references: ['-All right. It was worth a try at least.']
hypothesis: It's like they say, you never know what you're gonna get.

source: 君がはっきり物を言うから 推薦したのだ
references: ["I recommended you to the President because you're not afraid to speak up."]
hypothesis: I recommended you because you speak up.

source: お気に召さない? じゃこれだ デカさが物を言う
references: ['Let me tell you something, Size does matter.']
hypothesis: Don't like it? Then this is it. Bigger is better.

source: キャロル、相手を 見て物を言えよ
references: ['Carol, you got to start listening to yourself when you talk.']
hypothesis: Carol, look who you're talking to.

source: ねぇ, この事件は犬も食わないわ.
references: ['I mean, this case is a dog.']
hypothesis: Hey, this case is dog eat dog.

source: 犬猿の仲ね
references: ['He hates the man.']
hypothesis: They're like dogs and monkeys.

source: - イラク人を誘い込んで狙いをつけるか...
references: ['- Either we call the Iraqis and level with them...']
hypothesis: - Or lure the Iraqis in and take aim...

source: だから俺の顔に 完璧に一致したマスクを見つけてくれ 俺が逃走中狙いをつける能力に 影響を与えないこと
references: ["So find me a mask that conforms perfectly to my face and doesn't affect my ability to aim while I'm on the run."]
hypothesis: So find me a mask that perfectly matches my face and doesn't affect my ability to aim on the run.

source: 狙いを定めて
references: ['Set your sight.']
hypothesis: Aim.

source: 狙いを定めたら 気を付けて
references: ['And be careful where you point that thing.']
hypothesis: When you get a clear shot, be careful.

source: 狭き門だからね
references: ["Yeah, but it's hard to become one."]
hypothesis: It's a narrow gate.

source: 狸寝入りするってのか？
references: ["Will you stop crying about this? Let's go."]
hypothesis: Are you saying you're going to raccoon them?

source: 私たちは悪人になる為に参加してない 猫の手も借りたいくらいよ
references: ["We didn't join up to be in a gang. We did it so we could help people."]
hypothesis: We're not in it to be the bad guys, we're in it to be the cat's paw.

source: 猫の手も借りたい、行くぞ
references: ['We need all the help we can get.']
hypothesis: Let the cat out of the bag. Let's go.

source: 俺を玩具にして
references: ["You're fucked up, you know that?"]
hypothesis: You toyed with me.

source: 憶えてるさ 人を玩具にしやがって
references: ["I know he remembers me! He's just messing with my head!"]
hypothesis: I remember you. You're a fucking toy.

source: もしあなたが気違いなら 理に適う事はないわよ
references: ["Well, if you were crazy, they wouldn't make sense to you."]
hypothesis: If you're crazy, you're not being reasonable.

source: この法律を遡って適用 すべきでないのは理の当然 更に、私が 困惑しているのは アルトマンさんの弁護人が この事実を知らせていない
references: ["It seems to me obvious that the FSIA rulings cannot be retroactively applied, and I'm bewildered that Mrs. Altmann's counsel has not advised her of this fact."]
hypothesis: It stands to reason that the law should not be applied retroactively, and furthermore, I am puzzled that Ms. Altmann's counsel has not informed her of this fact.

source: なぜこんなことに夢中になるのか 理解に苦しむわ
references: ['What got into you? Why did you do it?']
hypothesis: I just don't understand why people get so worked up about this.

source: だから理解に苦しむ なぜ妻に不死身だと言った？ 分別ある人間なら 不死身など信じてない
references: ['Which makes it all the more difficult to understand why you would tell your wife that you are immortal, why you would believe, in that moment, something that any sane man would know is impossible.']
hypothesis: That's what I don't understand. Why did you tell your wife you were immortal? No sensible man would believe in immortality.

source: 事故以来のお前って ほんとに理解に苦しむ
references: ['That night of the crash, you started getting all weird. What? What are you talking about?']
hypothesis: I really don't understand you since the accident.

source: お客様の琴線に触れるような イメージを 作り出していきたいと 思っています
references: ['We would like to create products that reflect this desire.']
hypothesis: I hope to create an image that strikes a chord with our clients.

source: ハロー 瓜二つ
references: ['Hello, doppelganger.']
hypothesis: Hello, two melons.

source: お父上に瓜二つだ
references: ['You look like your father.']
hypothesis: You look just like your father.

source: 君は瓜二つだな
references: ["You're like a clone."]
hypothesis: You're a melon.

source: 貧乏 甘く見るんじゃないわよ （繭子）え？
references: ["Don't underestimate the poor."]
hypothesis: Don't underestimate poverty. -What?

source: 老人だと思って 甘く見るな 究極に極めた力がある
references: ["That old man finally has the power that he's always yearned for."]
hypothesis: Don't underestimate the old man. He has the ultimate in power.

source: 自然の力を甘く見て 思いあがるとこわいぞ
references: ["The lack of humility before nature that's being displayed here staggers me."]
hypothesis: You underestimate the power of nature, and your hubris will get you in trouble.

source: 人生はそんなに甘くない 甘い汁を吸う奴もいるんだ
references: ['Life is full of disappointments for some people.']
hypothesis: Life isn't that easy. Some people take the easy way out.

source: 甘い汁を吸う会社だ
references: ['How about that big, fat Soylent Corporation?']
hypothesis: It's a sweet-sauce company.

source: 大統領はＴＶに出て話をし カネ持ちは甘い汁を吸う
references: ['Hell, even the President gets on TV and tells corporations and the rich to suck eggs.']
hypothesis: The president goes on TV to talk, and the rich get the sweetest deals.

source: 生き血を吸わない バンパイアなんて...
references: ["A vampire who doesn't feed is like a... like a..."]
hypothesis: I mean, what kind of vampire doesn't suck the blood of the living?

source: フェンスの生ける屍達が... ここを守ってるが
references: ['You see, I have a lot of free labor here at the fence... living dead pricks that help keep the riffraff out.']
hypothesis: The living dead on the fence... Protecting this place.

source: むしろ抗生物質を貰う代わりに 歩き回ってる生ける屍みたいね
references: ["He'd rather walk around like the living dead instead of just get antibiotics."]
hypothesis: More like the living dead walking around instead of getting antibiotics.

source: 生ける屍ね
references: ['We are the dead.']
hypothesis: The living dead.

source: 生みの苦しみはきつく
references: ['Her agony was awful!']
hypothesis: The pain of birth is tight

source: "産みの苦しみ" ね
references: ["She's having some growing pains."]
hypothesis: "Birth pains."

source: ハイテクとは言えんが 十分用が足りる
references: ["(monroe) it's not very high-tech, but we think it'll work."]
hypothesis: It's not exactly high-tech, but it's good enough.

source: 用を足す機会が 与えられねばならない" もうそのぐらいの 時間は経つだろう
references: ["And I do believe we're creeping up on that time."]
hypothesis: I must be given a chance to do my business." That much time has already passed.

source: だれも家の中で用を足さない
references: ['- Vikings. Well, none of them are house-trained.']
hypothesis: Nobody does their business in the house.

source: ワインを飲み過ぎれば 用を足したくもなる
references: ['I drank too much wine, I must take a piss.']
hypothesis: If you drink too much wine, you'll need to go to the bathroom.

source: 劣った男が立っているのを 前にして 「神は人間を平等に創造した」 だなんて 信じられるわけがない
references: ['impermeable to reason, with cold, pallid slime in their veins instead of hot, red blood!']
hypothesis: How can anyone believe that "God created men equal" when there are inferior men standing before him?

source: 驚かすつもりはないが 君の後ろに 変な男が立ってる
references: ["Um, I don't want to alarm you right now, but there's a fucking creepy dude standing right behind you."]
hypothesis: I don't mean to alarm you, but there's a strange man standing behind you.

source: 時にはもやしっ子が強大な男になることもある
references: ['And sickly little boys sometimes become powerful men.']
hypothesis: Sometimes a brittle boy can become a mighty man.

source: 男を上げる しかも誰も彼もの良心が 晴れやかになる
references: ['He looks good, and everyone feels better about themselves.']
hypothesis: It raises a man's spirits, and it clears everyone's conscience.

source: 男を磨いてるの
references: ["I'm making you look pretty."]
hypothesis: I'm polishing my man.

source: しかし 異を唱える声も
references: ['Though the day is not without controversy.']
hypothesis: But there are those who disagree.

source: 彼はロバート王の弟と共謀し ジョフリー王子の王位継承に 異を唱えたらしい
references: ["They say he conspired with Robert's brothers to deny the throne to Prince Joffrey."]
hypothesis: It is said that he conspired with King Robert's brother to challenge Prince Joffrey's claim to the throne.

source: リコンの生きている限り 総督の座に異を唱えられる 生かしておくわけがない
references: ["As long as he lives, Ramsay's claim to Winterfell will be contested, which means he won't live long."]
hypothesis: As long as Rickon lives, he can challenge the Governor's seat, and there's no way they'll let him live.

source: 異彩を放っていて ステキだわ
references: ['It makes you very different.']
hypothesis: It's so unique. I love it.

source: 疑わしきは罰せずにね
references: ['I gave you the benefit of the doubt over and over.']
hypothesis: When in doubt, don't punish.

source: "疑わしきは罰せず" だよ
references: ['Hey, innocent until proven guilty, Jess.']
hypothesis: "When in doubt, don't punish."

source: 白状しないと 痛い目に合うぞ
references: ['This can be as painless as you want it to be.']
hypothesis: You better come clean or I'm gonna hurt you.

source: 痛い目に遭うか？
references: ["I'm going to kick your ass."]
hypothesis: Will it hurt?

source: 他社に移って 痛い目に遭わせる
references: ["Yeah, that man lives in fear. I'll go across town. Hell, I could go anywhere."]
hypothesis: I'm going to move on to another company, and I'm going to hurt you.

source: え　いや 君は痛い目に遭う事になる
references: ["Eh, no, you're gonna get hurt."]
hypothesis: Uh, no, you're going to be in a lot of pain.

source: リンダを送りたいが 仕事があるし 癇に障る面もある
references: ["I'd send Linda, but there's so much work for her to do here, and, well, she can be abrasive at times."]
hypothesis: I'd love to send Linda, but I have work to do, and there are aspects of her that make me nervous.

source: その NETFLIXさんが 日本に上陸するにあたって ちょっと このテラスハウスに 白羽の矢が立ったと
references: ['Netflix came to our shores and showed their interest in Terrace House.']
hypothesis: Netflix, the company that brought Terrace House to Japan, has been looking at Terrace House for a while now.

source: 誰だっていいさ お前は的が外れてる
references: ["It doesn't matter, you know, you're missing the point."]
hypothesis: I don't care who you are. You're missing the point.

source: 私達の事に的を絞ると とやかく言われる
references: ['And focusing on us and not on the affair.']
hypothesis: They'll say anything if you focus on us.

source: - 標的を絞ってる
references: ["I think it's targeting people."]
hypothesis: - He's narrowing his focus.

source: だから 標的を絞ると
references: ['So you focus on the highest value target.']
hypothesis: That's why we have to narrow down the target.

source: 君は、見る目があるよ
references: ["Trust you've had a chance to take a look around, huh?"]
hypothesis: You're a good judge of character.

source: なかなか見る目がある
references: ['A man of taste.']
hypothesis: have an eye for people with discerning eyes

source: 人を見る目があるな
references: ["You're a good judge of character."]
hypothesis: You have a good eye for people.

source: ほら　あの目がいい
references: ['Aw! Aw! Look at his eyes.']
hypothesis: Look, I like her eyes.

source: お前の目がいいな
references: ['Yeah, buddy, look at your eyes.']
hypothesis: I like your eyes.

source: 彼らは目が利く
references: ['Well, they know a winner when they see one.']
hypothesis: They have good eyesight.

source: 我々は尊い金鉱夫だったんだ 闇の中でも目が利くのでね
references: ['We were noble gold miners because we could see the light in the darkness.']
hypothesis: We were precious gold miners, for we could see in the dark.

source: あぁ 目が回ってるさ
references: ['- Yeah, we do. We sure do.']
hypothesis: Yeah, I'm spinning my wheels.

source: 目が回るか？
references: ['Quickly, quickly, quickly. Do you feel dizzy?']
hypothesis: Are you dizzy?

source: なんか... すごく... 目が回る
references: ['I... feel... awfully... dizzy!']
hypothesis: It's just... I'm so... I'm dizzy.

source: ５通目が届いた後　返事を書き始めたよ
references: ['I began to reply after the fifth one.']
hypothesis: I started writing back after the fifth letter arrived.

source: 私たちを 守るためだって... 目が届くからって
references: ['She said it was to protect us, so she could patrol things.']
hypothesis: He said he was protecting us. Just because he can see us.

source: よりいっそう細部にまで目が届き より本質に迫れる
references: ['I prefer to work on the originals.']
hypothesis: More attention to detail and more insight into the essence of the product

source: - 目が眩む 何も見えない
references: ["- I can't see. I'm blind. - Me too."]
hypothesis: - I'm dizzy. I can't see a thing.

source: 本物の職人の技で 目が眩むわよ
references: ["You'll be blinded by the sheer craftsmanship."]
hypothesis: You'll be dazzled by the true craftsmanship.

source: 鎮静剤を打つ 家で目が覚めるだろう
references: ["I'm gonna give you a sedative. You'll wake up back at home."]
hypothesis: I'll sedate you. You'll wake up at home.

source: 原因爆弾はそれらの束を目が覚めました。
references: ['Cause bombs woke up a bunch of them.']
hypothesis: Cause bombs woke up a bunch of them.

source: それは脅し方次第じゃなくって 殺せば目が覚めるだけ
references: ["That depends on what you're threatening. Killing him will just wake him up."]
hypothesis: It depends on how you threaten them. If you kill them, they'll just wake up.

source: 気を失って 三日前に目が覚めた
references: ['I blacked out, then I woke up three days ago.']
hypothesis: I blacked out and woke up three days ago.

source: - ファスコ刑事から目が離せない
references: ['Keep an eye on Detective Fusco.']
hypothesis: - Keep an eye on Detective Fusco.

source: もう目が離せない 並外れた動き
references: ["I can't take my eyes up off it moving so phenomenally"]
hypothesis: I can't take my eyes off it now. Extraordinary movement.

source: お前から目が離せないからな
references: ["I'm keeping an eye on you, you slippery little mutt."]
hypothesis: I'll be keeping an eye on you.

source: 目が飛び出て　拷問の証拠だ
references: ['Eyes blown out, evidence of torture.']
hypothesis: Eyes popping out, evidence of torture.

source: 目が高いぜ　世界最強の 助っ人を選ぶとは
references: ["You were wise to seek help from the world's most deadly weapon."]
hypothesis: You've got a good eye for picking the best helpers in the world.

source: お目が高くていらっしゃいます
references: ['You have a keen eye.']
hypothesis: You have very good eyes, sir.

source: お 目 が高いですな
references: ["Boy, you sure know how to pick 'em."]
hypothesis: You've got a good eye, sir.

source: 目と鼻の先で暴動になったら
references: ['What if we set your backyard on fire?']
hypothesis: If a riot breaks out right under our noses.

source: そんなところの目と鼻の先で働いているんだ
references: ["I can't believe you work right across the street from there."]
hypothesis: I work right under the nose of a place like that.

source: 怒りは人を盲目にする... 関わらないのが最良だが
references: ['When fighting angry, blind men... best we just stay out of the way.']
hypothesis: Anger blinds people... Best not to get involved.

source: 想像できるだろ 家柄も何もない子供が 伝説の人物たちを目にするんだ
references: ['You can imagine what it was like for me, a boy from nowhere, with nothing to his name, watching these legendary men, tilting at the lists.']
hypothesis: You can imagine, a kid with no family background and nothing to show for it, seeing these legendary figures.

source: アーノルドは 息子の誕生日を目にしーー そして　この世を去るのを 目にした
references: ['Arnold had watched his son come into this world, and then he had watched that light extinguished.']
hypothesis: Arnold saw his son's birthday, and he saw him leave this world.

source: 自分の目を疑う光景を目にすることだろう
references: ['You will see things that will make you doubt your eyes.']
hypothesis: You'll see sights that will make you doubt your own eyes.

source: 耳にしたことは まったくないわけでもない 目にしたこともまったくないわけじゃない ごめん
references: ["I can't unhear things I've heard, unsee things I've seen."]
hypothesis: It's not that I haven't heard about it, or seen it, or even heard of it, but I haven't seen it.

source: "ニック 目には目を 歯には歯をだろ？" あれで
references: ['I think the time for being careful is over, Nick.']
hypothesis: "Nick, an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, right?" You know what I'm saying?

source: いや、ただ中で目に付いて、思ったんだ ほら、持っておくべきだって
references: ['No, I just saw it inside and thought I, you know, should bring it along with me.']
hypothesis: No, I just saw it in there and thought, look, I should have it.

source: ロビー・ボーイは全く目に付かず かつ何時でも見つけられなければならない
references: ["A Lobby Boy's completely invisible, yet always in sight."]
hypothesis: Lobby boys must be completely invisible and be found at all times.

source: どうしても目に付く 医者にも行かないのか 私が勧めた
references: ["But I can't help noticing that you are nowhere near the doctor that I recommended."]
hypothesis: I can't help but notice it. You're not even going to see a doctor? I recommended it.

source: わしの価値以上に─ 態度が目に余って 辞めるべきなら...
references: ['If I should cease to be useful, if my behaviors are outweighing my value, well...']
hypothesis: If you think I'm worth more than I'm worth... and if you think I should quit because of my attitude...

source: 目に余るほどの虚偽 これまでに見た事がない
references: ["A sorrier pack of deck wallopers I don't think I've ever seen."]
hypothesis: Blindingly false. I've never seen anything like it.

source: 勤務中この二人が目に入っても、
references: ["From time to time, you're gonna see these two."]
hypothesis: Even if I see these two people while I'm on duty,

source: その目に映るもの全て
references: ['All the things I see in your eyes.']
hypothesis: Everything you see in those eyes

source: 君の目に映っているのは 本当の僕じゃない
references: ["What you're looking at-- that's not who I am inside."]
hypothesis: What you see in your eyes is not the real me.

source: 寝入る姿が目に浮かぶ
references: ['With one of his lucky strikes in his hand,']
hypothesis: I can see you falling asleep.

source: 目に浮かぶよ 巨大なネオンに君の名
references: ['- Straight to the top. Why, I can see your name in lights, lights six feet high.']
hypothesis: I can see it in my mind's eye. Your name in giant neon lights.

source: まざまざと目に浮かぶね
references: ["That's a vivid image."]
hypothesis: I can see it vividly in your eyes.

source: 見てしまったら 目に焼き付いて離れない
references: ["Once you see it, you can't unsee it."]
hypothesis: Once you see it, it's burned into your eyes and won't go away.

source: この犯人も目に焼き付かれて いる様ですね
references: ['It seems this Ouroboros killer was also obsessed with eyes.']
hypothesis: It seems this killer has been burned into his eyes as well.

source: 目に焼き付いてます
references: ["It's so clear in my mind."]
hypothesis: It's burned into my eyes.

source: 目に物見せるわ
references: ['Show me something.']
hypothesis: I'll show you something.

source: 目に物見せてやる！
references: ["I'll show you what I've got! This!"]
hypothesis: I'll show you something for your eyes!

source: 何か これっていう目標がさ 目に見えてあって 入ってきたわけじゃないから
references: ["I didn't gain any insight on what I want to work towards."]
hypothesis: I didn't come here with a clear goal in mind.

source: ひざに座らされた子供達が 身もだえするのは目に見えてる
references: ["Kids are squirming in his lap all day. It's bound to happen sooner or later."]
hypothesis: I can just see those kids squirming in my lap.

source: 死体を目に触れやすい屋外に捨てるのは ギャングの仕業らしい気もします
references: ['Dumping the body out in the open like that feels like a gang hit.']
hypothesis: Dumping a dead body outdoors where it can be easily seen seems like the work of a gang.

source: 死体写真を 持ってても デクスタの机でやれば ハリソンの 目に触れない
references: ["And maybe you could keep the photos on Dexter's desk, so Harrison won't see them."]
hypothesis: Even if I had a picture of the corpse, if I did it on Dexter's desk, Harrison wouldn't see it.

source: 仰々しい演出だ 目に触れるよう 人や物を引用している
references: ["It's a theatrical term referring to a picturesque grouping of people or objects."]
hypothesis: It's an ostentatious production, citing people and things for your eyes to see.

source: 目の前が真っ暗になったとき
references: ['And just as everything was going dark,']
