hypothesis: When it's pitch black in front of your eyes

source: 密売人や臓器カルテルにとって 私は目の敵です
references: ['Traffickers, cartels.']
hypothesis: I am the apple of the eye for traffickers and organ cartels.

source: 魔法省はなぜ僕を目の敵に？
references: ["I don't understand. What has the Ministry of Magic got against me?"]
hypothesis: Why does the Ministry of Magic have such a hard-on for me?

source: おれを目の敵だ
references: ["He was just tryin' to bait me."]
hypothesis: You're looking at me like I'm the enemy.

source: 何で哀れなスメアゴルを 目の敵にする？
references: ['Why does he hates poor Sméagol?']
hypothesis: Why do you turn your back on poor Sméagol?

source: 山口の一件で花岡先生を 目の敵にしてるんですよ （蒲生） 裁判所の呼び出しに　応じない場合
references: ['Kuryu has been targeting him ever since Yamaguchi!']
hypothesis: He's been eyeing Dr. Hanaoka because of the Yamaguchi incident.

source: 何ヶ月も彼を目の敵にしてきたと言っている
references: ['Monroe and Clennon had it in for him for months.']
hypothesis: They say they've had him in their sights for months.

source: - 目の毒だな
references: ["- Well, you shouldn't look like that."]
hypothesis: - You're a sight for sore eyes.

source: 目も当てられない
references: ['This looks terrible.']
hypothesis: not to be sniffed at

source: マーシーに関わると 皆 目を付けられる
references: ['Because anybody associated with Marshy is a marked man.']
hypothesis: If you get involved with Marcy, you'll be on everyone's radar.

source: 祈りなさい 目を付けられたぞ　アーサー
references: ["Pray on it. Hello. They're on to you, Arthur."]
hypothesis: Pray for me. He's got his eye on you, Arthur.

source: ♪人を傷つける事に目を伏せるけど
references: ['"Tolerance to do harm to others"']
hypothesis: Â I'm not going to look down my nose at hurting people, but I'm going to

source: もし、マホーンがそこにいったら、 これ以上目を伏せることができない
references: ["What if he's in there? I can't keep avoiding him."]
hypothesis: If Mahone goes there, I can't keep my eyes down any longer.

source: 両親の話をする度に 目を伏せる
references: ['Every time I mention my parents, your eyes go down.']
hypothesis: Every time I mention my parents I get a look in my eye.

source: 目を凝らすと 今までの人生が見える
references: ['If you look hard enough, you can see your whole life from up here.']
hypothesis: If you look hard enough, you can see your whole life up to this point.

source: 貴方は目を凝らして 耳を澄まして 王子との契約期間を過ごすだけ
references: ['Lynne, all you have to do now is keep your eyes and ears open for the remainder of your contract with the prince.']
hypothesis: All you have to do is keep your eyes and ears open for the duration of your contract with the prince.

source: 遠くに目を凝らしても かすんで消えていく
references: ['♪ And when you look too far away ♪ It all but disappears']
hypothesis: I stare into the distance, and then I glaze over and fade away.

source: カーターに電話した時に お前は一線を超えた デビッドソンの殺人で 私に目を向けさせようとした
references: ['You crossed a line when you made that call to Carter, pointing her towards me in the Davidson murder.']
hypothesis: You crossed the line when you called Carter and tried to get him to look at me for Davidson's murder.

source: ゲームに目を向けながら. . 老人の複雑な心境で
references: ['Making the tour of the prison before he left and looking on at a game of skittles with the mixed feelings of an old inhabitant who had his private reasons for believing that it might be his destiny to come back again."']
hypothesis: With an eye on the game . . . with the complexities of an old man's mind.

source: まぁ 今は君達２人に 疑いの目を向けている
references: ['Well, he did find that book, and he is paying attention to her and to you.']
hypothesis: Well, now I'm starting to have my doubts about you two.

source: 真実に目を向けるために 目を開かせるのだ
references: ["That's why I have to open your eyes to the truth."]
hypothesis: Open their eyes to see the truth.

source: コサックは目を塞がれてきた その結果彼らの大部分は 俺達に反対している
references: ["If we don't arrest the most active enemies now, they'll rebel again."]
hypothesis: The Cossacks have been blindsided, and as a result, most of them are against us.

source: すぐに、君の目を奪う 盲目の女が地下で 生存することは出来ない
references: ['We take your eyes now... and see how long a blind girl can survive in the basement.']
hypothesis: Soon, you'll be blind, and no blind woman can survive underground.

source: 部門の防犯カメラの の映像を引き出した メタモルフ薬品のバンが 私の目を引いた
references: ["I pulled up the department's security camera footage, and a van from Metamorpho Chemical caught my eye."]
hypothesis: I pulled up the department's security camera footage of the Metamorpho Chemicals van that caught my eye.

source: 警官殺しは　とても注目を引く クーパーが不正をしたことに
references: ['The murder of a cop draws a lot of heat, so dirtying Cooper up is one way to deflect it.']
hypothesis: Killing a cop draws so much attention to the fact that Cooper went rogue.

source: それで絵の構成に 彼を中心に据え 見る人の目を 引きたいと思っています
references: ["So just like this spider, I built my web, hoping to catch the viewer's eye."]
hypothesis: So, I'm trying to put him at the center of the composition and draw the viewer's eye to him.

source: ♪人目を引いて 注目を浴びるの
references: ["# I'm gonna make a scene I'm gonna make a fuss"]
hypothesis: Â We're going to stand out from the crowd, we're going to get noticed.

source: お前に目を掛けている
references: ['He cares about you.']
hypothesis: I'm looking at you.

source: 私、私の目を欺くか？
references: ['Do my eyes deceive me?']
hypothesis: Do I, deceive my eyes?

source: 俺の目を欺くことは出来ないぞ お前が化けても
references: ["You can't bluff my eyes with your disguise"]
hypothesis: You can't pull the wool over my eyes, even if you turn out to be you.

source: びっくり仰天 わが目を疑う出し物
references: ['...is presenting to you something you will absolutely refuse to believe!']
hypothesis: Surprised and amazed, I can't believe my eyes!

source: - いや、もう自分の目を疑ったよね。
references: ['I was like, pinching myself while I was hooking up with her. -No!']
hypothesis: - No, I couldn't believe my eyes anymore.

source: 目を疑いたくなるような 不可解なものを
references: ["I mean, hell, half the stuff, we wouldn't have believed it ourselves had we not seen it together."]
hypothesis: Something so inexplicable that you can't believe your eyes.

source: 僕の目を盗んでは 古い地図に見入ってる
references: ["He spends hours and hours poring over old maps when he thinks I'm not looking."]
hypothesis: He's been poring over old maps, trying to get me to look at them.

source: 君のママがその指を見て 手を洗いなさいって言うけど それでもママの目を盗んで その指舐めたりしてさ
references: ["And your mom probably told you to wash your hands, but I bet you'd just lick it off when she wasn't looking."]
hypothesis: Your mom looks at your finger and tells you to wash your hands, but you still steal her attention and lick it off.

source: 下女ごときが　人目を盗んで
references: ['A servant secretly lighting lanterns in her room!']
hypothesis: A servant girl, stealing from the public eye.

source: 兄弟の罪に目を瞑った
references: ["She turned a blind eye to her brother's sins."]
hypothesis: I meditated on the sins of my brothers.

source: 俺は職務を果たすぞ 目を瞑って　奴がシアトルで捕まるのを 期待するのが最善とは思えん
references: ["I'll do my job myself, instead of praying they catch him in Seattle!"]
hypothesis: I'm gonna do my job, and I don't think it's in my best interest to meditate and hope he gets caught in Seattle.

source: うしろめたさから逃れるために そのことから目を背け
references: ['And every time I walked away from something I wanted to forget']
hypothesis: To escape the guilt, we turn our backs on it.

source: 目を背けるな
references: ["Don't turn away."]
hypothesis: Don't turn away.

source: 問題から目を背けさせるため 民衆の注意を引くのが仕事だ
references: ['From now on, your job is to be a distraction. So people forget what the real problems are.']
hypothesis: It's my job to get the public's attention so they turn away from the problem.

source: 目を覆うんだ　ナンシー 見てほしくない
references: ["Cover your eyes, Nancy. I don't want you watching this."]
hypothesis: Cover your eyes, Nancy. I don't want you to see this.

source: 目を覆って ♪ welcome to the machine ♪ ♪ where have you been ♪
references: ['Cover your eyes. _ ?']
hypothesis: 目を覆って ♪ welcome to the machine ♪ ♪ where have you been ♪

source: 目を覆っても 見えるって分かる?
references: ['You do know I can see through this?']
hypothesis: Do you know what I see when I cover my eyes?

source: 自伝を書かせてるが これは 目を見張るほどの 出来だ
references: ["It's a simple autobiography and then I get this amazing piece."]
hypothesis: I'm having him write his autobiography, and it's a remarkable piece of work.

source: 目を見張った！
references: ['It is spectacular!']
hypothesis: It was an eye opener!

source: 目を見張る忍耐力だ
references: ['You show remarkable grit for a teacher.']
hypothesis: Remarkable patience.

source: booを開く場合、クソ彼と一緒に座って目を覚ます。
references: ['Boo wakes up, you fucking sit up with him.']
hypothesis: If you open boo, fucking sit down with him and wake up.

source: グレゴリーが目を覚ました 話がしたいって
references: ["Gregory's up."]
hypothesis: Gregory's awake. He wants to talk to you.

source: 目を覚ますまで 壁を揺すってやる
references: ['And I will shake your walls until you wake.']
hypothesis: I'm gonna shake your walls until you wake up.

source: 毎晩、私は目を覚ました、 冷や汗をかいて 怯え、そして孤独だった
references: ['Every night, I would wake up in a cold sweat, frightened and alone.']
hypothesis: Every night I woke up in a cold sweat, frightened and alone.

source: - これに目を通したら、
references: ['- Look through that,']
hypothesis: - If you look through this,

source: 目を通して　たのむよ
references: ["Come on, you'll see. Please."]
hypothesis: Please look it over. Please look it over.

source: 「我々は、報告書に全て目を通し、 頭に叩き込んだ」
references: ["We've done a briefing book, so read up."]
hypothesis: We went through the entire report and put it in our heads.

source: - 目を逸らすな
references: ["- Don't look away."]
hypothesis: - Don't look away.

source: 目を逸らさなかった。
references: ["I didn't look away."]
hypothesis: I didn't look away.

source: だが今は、誰か死ぬのに目を逸らすか、 解決するか選ぶんだ。
references: ['But you can look away now when someone else dies, or you can help solve this.']
hypothesis: But now you have to choose whether to turn a blind eye to someone dying or solve the problem.

source: 盗みに目を配らなきゃならないけどね
references: ["You've gotta watch out for the stealing."]
hypothesis: You have to keep an eye out for theft, though.

source: 財務を建て直し 研究にも目を配っている
references: ['Not only in keeping our finances in order, but overseeing a good amount of product research.']
hypothesis: Rebuilding our finances and looking into research.

source: ダリルと外出するから― ハーシェル達に 目を配ってくれ
references: ["When I'm out with Daryl, help Hershel keep an eye on things around here."]
hypothesis: I'll be out with Daryl, so keep an eye on Hershel and the others.

source: 目を開かせるのです 足ではなく・・
references: ['- We opens their eyes not their legs.']
hypothesis: Open their eyes, not their feet...

source: 遅かれ早かれ目を開くわ
references: ['Sooner or later, you will open those eyes.']
hypothesis: Sooner or later, he'll open his eyes.

source: おぃ、彼から目を離すな、 ここを去ろうとするなら、私に知らせろ
references: ['Hey. Watch him well. let me know.']
hypothesis: Hey, keep an eye on him. Let me know if he tries to leave.

source: 彼から絶対に目を離さないで下さい ミセスドレークの後を追う間
references: ["I'll keep an eye on him while you follow Mrs. Drake."]
hypothesis: Never take your eyes off him while he follows Mrs. Drake.

source: おい　お前もだ 目を離すな
references: ['Hey -- you, too. Keep an eye on him.']
hypothesis: Hey, you too. Keep an eye on him.

source: 私はスターラボが地域・社会のために、何が出来るか考えていた。 多分、もう人々はDr. ウェルズに対して それほど目くじらを立てていないだろう。
references: ["I thought if Star Labs could do something nice for the community, maybe people wouldn't be so angry at Doctor Wells anymore."]
hypothesis: I was thinking about what Star Labs could do for the community and society. Maybe people aren't so uptight about Dr. Wells anymore.

source: - なんで、そんなに目くじらを立てる
references: ['Do you understand that?']
hypothesis: - Why are you so blindsided?

source: 実に目先が利くな
references: ['Astute, actually.']
hypothesis: That's very astute.

source: 目先を変えて お互いに親切にしても 良かったかもね
references: ['Maybe we could be kind to one another for a change, huh?']
hypothesis: Maybe we could have been kind to each other for a change.

source: 選挙のことから 少し目先を変えて― かぼちゃ大王の話をします
references: ["And, as a change of pace, rather than campaign talk I've decided to say a few words about the Great Pumpkin."]
hypothesis: I'm going to change the subject of the election for a moment and talk about the Great Pumpkin.

source: どうして黙って目先を変えないの？
references: ["Why don't you just shut up for a change?"]
hypothesis: Why don't you just shut up and change your perspective?

source: 目処が付くまで捜査する 私が疑われる つまり私達全員が
references: ['Until they close it, their focus could turn to me, which means us.']
hypothesis: They're gonna keep digging until they find something that makes me look guilty, which means all of us.

source: ナンシー パリで目星を付けた女
references: ['Nancy, okay, you know the woman I spotted in Paris, the bomber?']
hypothesis: Nancy, the woman I spotted in Paris.

source: 目玉が飛び出るほど高かったけど 18の誕生日だったから...
references: ['It was outrageously expensive, but it was her 18th birthday, so...']
hypothesis: It was eye-poppingly expensive, but it was my 18th birthday, so...

source: なるほど ったく相変わらず頑固だな
references: ['Still the same old Frank, huh?']
hypothesis: I see. Well, you're stubborn as ever.

source: 相変わらず兄上は 権力の掌握が大事なのね 兄弟の救出よりも
references: ['As usual, your power grabs are more important than rescuing your brother.']
hypothesis: As usual, your power grab is more important to you than rescuing your brothers.

source: でも彼は相変わらず 時計のネジを巻き続けている
references: ["But there's you every day winding that stupid watch."]
hypothesis: But he still keeps winding the clock.

source: 相変わらず口が悪くて よかった
references: ["I'm glad to see you still have your twisted sense of humor."]
hypothesis: I'm glad to see he's still as foul-mouthed as ever.

source: 僕らの血液の相性が悪いと 君は死ぬことになる
references: ['If our blood is incompatible, you could die.']
hypothesis: If our blood is incompatible, you will die.

source: 相性が悪いと言われて... 里親にね。
references: ["- Said I wasn't a good fit."]
hypothesis: They say it's not a good match... In foster care.

source: - 中佐、ウィルスは炭素ベースの生命体とは相性が悪いんです
references: ['Commander, the virus is incompatible with carbon-based life.']
hypothesis: - Commander, viruses are incompatible with carbon-based life forms.

source: そりゃ　相談に乗ってもらったり 力を借りることはあるけど→ できる限り　自分でやらなきゃって 思ってるの。
references: ['That is, by consulting with you, I enlist your help but as much as I can, I believe I must do it myself.']
hypothesis: That's right, I do ask for advice and help, but as much as possible, I think I have to do it by myself.

source: あの　ドレスについて相談に 乗ってくれるって言ってたわよね
references: ['Hey, you said you wanted to help me with my dress.']
hypothesis: You know, you said you'd help me with the dress.

source: 相談に乗ると電話番号を俺に
references: ['Why you slipped me your number in case I ever need to ask anything?']
hypothesis: If you want to talk to me about it, give me your number.

source: あの人ったら 固まって眉一つ動かさないの
references: ["He didn't dare raise an eyebrow."]
hypothesis: He just froze and didn't move an eyebrow.

source: 真に受けていない
references: ["Don't be an ass."]
hypothesis: I'm not taking it seriously.

source: あの女の言うことなど 真に受けるな
references: ["Oh, for christ's sake. How many times I got to tell you, that woman is crazy, Larry."]
hypothesis: Don't take her word for it.

source: 奴らの言うことを 真に受けちゃだめだ... 地獄みてぇに 狂わされるからな
references: ['They say they try to get you straight... but they make you crazier than hell.']
hypothesis: Don't take their word for it... They'll make you crazy as hell.

source: そうさ... 教皇の話は 真に迫る
references: ['Yeah, well, the Pope tells it like it really is.']
hypothesis: Well... The Pope's story gets to the heart of the matter.

source: そして　完全な被害者だ 私　真に迫っていたわよね？
references: ["I was so believable today, wasn't I?"]
hypothesis: And a total victim. I was getting close, wasn't I?

source: それは真っ赤な嘘だった
references: ['It was a big lie.']
hypothesis: It was an outright lie.

source: 入局して 真っ赤な嘘だと分かったよ
references: ['I wish someone had told me it is a total lie.']
hypothesis: When I joined the Bureau, I found out it was all a big fat lie.

source: それは真っ赤な嘘だ
references: ['That is an outright lie.']
hypothesis: That's an outright lie.

source: だがホッブズさんよ 俺達は "眠れる獅子" なんだよ
references: ["But I can assure you, Mr. Hobbes, we're a sleeping giant."]
hypothesis: But, Mr. Hobbes, we're a sleeping lion.

source: 時間の不変性を冒せば 矛盾が生じるでしょ？
references: ['Well, if you mess with the consistency of time, you create a paradox, right?']
hypothesis: If you violate the immutability of time, then you create a contradiction, right?

source: ですがキャリー マティソンの 補記と矛盾
references: ["Yet Carrie Mathison's addendum to your file contradicts that."]
hypothesis: But it contradicts Carrie Mathison's addendum.

source: お前は矢面に立ってる... しかし　そうすべきではない
references: ['Putting yourself in the firing line is no way of dealing with it.']
hypothesis: You're standing in the line of fire... But you shouldn't be.

source: 私はお前の馬鹿さの矢面に立つ
references: ['I have to bear the brunt of your idiocies.']
hypothesis: I bear the brunt of your stupidity.

source: お前が 矢面に立ってくれた
references: ['You were more often in the line of fire.']
hypothesis: You're the one who put me in the line of fire.

source: 知らぬが仏だよ
references: ["What they don't know won't hurt 'em."]
hypothesis: Ignorance is bliss

source: 知らぬが仏って事もある
references: ["Well, sometimes what we don't know doesn't hurt us, right?"]
hypothesis: Sometimes, ignorance is bliss.

source: 知らぬが仏 だ
references: ['Ignorance is bliss.']
hypothesis: Ignorance is bliss.

source: 知らぬ存ぜぬでもいいが まだまだ先は長いぞ
references: ['I can play this game All day long.']
hypothesis: You can keep your ignorance to yourself, but you still have a long way to go.

source: 知る人ぞ知る ルイス・ル・プリンスは 悪魔だったという話しさ
references: ['The legend is only something people in the know would know... that Louis Le Prince was the Devil.']
hypothesis: Some people in the know say that Louis Le Prince was the devil.

source: 孫は　知る由もない 白人貧困層が　父であること
references: ['My grandson will never know that piece of white trash is his father.']
hypothesis: His grandchildren will never know that their father was a poor white man.

source: ２人だと知恵が回る
references: ['When working, it gets us nothing!']
hypothesis: Two people can be wise.

source: 犯罪者の誰もが　知恵が回るわけじゃない
references: ["Not everyone's a criminal mastermind."]
hypothesis: Not every criminal has their wits about them.

source: みんなが問題を 解決して欲しくて... あなたの知恵を借りに来るって 誇らしい気分でしょうね 何かトラブルを起こすんじゃないかと 思われてるよりも
references: ['It must be nice to have everyone always looking to you for answers to their problems instead of waiting for you to cause a problem.']
hypothesis: Everyone wants you to solve their problems... Must make you feel proud to come here to ask for your wisdom, instead of wondering if you're going to cause some trouble.

source: 戦争に勝利した今 先人の知恵を借りる時だ
references: ['Now that the war is won, we should all find time for wisdom.']
hypothesis: Now that the war is won, it's time to borrow from the wisdom of our forefathers.

source: 兄さんも父さんも 知恵を絞ったけど――
references: ["No! Steve and Dad wracked their brains, - but they said it's impossible."]
hypothesis: You and dad tried to figure it out, but...

source: 知恵を絞るんだな
references: ['I have faith in your resourcefulness.']
hypothesis: You've got to keep your wits about you.

source: 何 怒ってんだよ お前 短気は損気だよ お前
references: ["What're you getting all pissed off about?"]
hypothesis: What are you mad at me for?

source: 一石二鳥だ
references: ['All in one fell swoop.']
hypothesis: Two birds with one stone

source: 机を叩けば一石二鳥です
references: ['Tapping the table kills both birds with one stone.']
hypothesis: If you hit the desk, you kill two birds with one stone.

source: 一石二鳥と 言う事で
references: ["I've always wanted to visit Disneyland. Two birds with one stone, as they say."]
hypothesis: Two birds with one stone, you might say.

source: 破天荒な人生を送ってきた.
references: ['I lived my wild life.']
hypothesis: He has lived a life of a maverick.

source: 分離主義者の戦艦マレヴォレンス 共和国の領域に破竹の勢いで進んで、 どんな船に出会っても、 引っかきまわす
references: ['The Separatist battleship Malevolence advances unopposed to Republic space, tearing apart any ship that stands in its path.']
hypothesis: The Separatist battleship Malevolence, advancing at breakneck speed into Republican territory, will claw its way through whatever ships it encounters.

source: 彼が近くに来るといつも 君の態度が少し硬くなる
references: ["Your posture stiffens subtly whenever he gets close. I'm pretty sure it doesn't."]
hypothesis: Whenever he comes near, your demeanor stiffens a bit.

source: その日、ヤツが 埋葬した死体が 現在の我々の基礎を 築いたのだ
references: ['The bodies he buried that day laid the foundation of what we are now.']
hypothesis: The bodies he buried that day laid the foundation for what we are today.

source: 彼女は数ヶ月の間に、今回の買収の 基礎を築いていました
references: ["She's been laying the foundation for this takeover for months."]
hypothesis: Within months, she had laid the groundwork for this acquisition.

source: ソフトウェアデザインチームの リーダー その人のお父上もまた ＥＮＣＯＭ社に多大な貢献をし 本日の基礎を築きました
references: ["The head of our software design team, a man whose father's own notable history with ENCOM helped make this company what it is today."]
hypothesis: The leader of the software design team, whose father also made significant contributions to ENCOM and laid the foundation for what we have today.

source: あなたは少し礼を失している
references: ["For the same reason you're not. It's the way I was brought up."]
hypothesis: You're being a little disrespectful.

source: 礼を失する
references: ['It means rude, disrespectful.']
hypothesis: fail in one's social duties

source: 礼を失するのでは? お前の家で眠っている男を撃つために
references: ["You know, it's not considered polite to shoot a man who's sleeping in your house."]
hypothesis: You don't think it's polite... To shoot a man sleeping in your house.

source: 奴を捕らえたら祝杯を上げよう
references: ["There'll be plenty of time for celebrating after we get Nazir."]
hypothesis: We'll celebrate when we catch him.

source: 祝杯を上げよう
references: ['I want to make a toast.']
hypothesis: Let's celebrate!

source: 君はホードーの精神に入った
references: ["You got inside Hodor's mind."]
hypothesis: You've entered the spirit of Hodor.

source: ジマーマンは 神経が高ぶってた
references: ['Zimmerman was a man on the edge.']
hypothesis: Zimmerman was a nervous wreck.

source: 神経が高ぶってるのかも
references: ["Maybe I'm getting all worked up over nothing."]
hypothesis: Maybe it's nerves.

source: 神経が高ぶるか？
references: ["Is it the trip? It's got you nervous?"]
hypothesis: Nerves raring to go?

source: 神経を使わないのだろう
references: ["Maybe she's just asleep."]
hypothesis: I guess they don't have nerves.

source: 私としたことが...
references: ['What I am doing?']
hypothesis: What I did...

source: コウノトリが巻きついてるなんて クソにも程がある
references: ["I hate that fucking thing too. A stork wrapped around a tree branch. That's the stupidest thing I've ever seen."]
hypothesis: I can't believe there's a stork wrapped around that thing. It's a piece of shit.

source: 誰でもいいわ 冗談にも程がある
references: ["Okay, whoever's in there, this is majorly unfunny."]
hypothesis: I don't care who you are, this is a joke.

source: 私とジョフリーが結婚し次第　種を蒔く
references: ["I'll plant the seed as soon as Joffrey and I are married."]
hypothesis: As soon as Joffrey and I are married, we will sow the seeds.

source: おぃ　アナルに穴が空くだろ！
references: ['Ow! Asshole, that hurt! - Yeah, that was the point!']
hypothesis: Oy, you're going to get anal retentive!

source: あんな天才はいない 心に大きな穴が開いたようだ
references: ["He had such life, you know? Such a talent. It's a big hole."]
hypothesis: There's no genius like that. It's like a big hole in my heart.

source: 外装に穴が開いてしまいー
references: ['It could cause a hole to be melted into the exterior.']
hypothesis: There was a hole in the exterior.

source: 穴が開いてる
references: ['Holes. Hmm.']
hypothesis: There's a hole.

source: 心の穴を埋めて...
references: ['Fill some crater in your soul?']
hypothesis: Fill the hole in your heart...

source: 私の心の 穴を埋めてくれる何かが
references: ['♪ Something to fill this hole inside.']
hypothesis: Something to fill the hole in my heart.

source: 皆も気付いていたが 昨晩　バリーの従妹が 穴を埋めてくれて はっきりしたよ
references: ["We all noticed it, and it got real clear last night after Barry's cousin filled in."]
hypothesis: As we all noticed, Barry's cousin filled in the holes last night, and that cleared things up.

source: ニックはプライベートジェットを使う 私は民間航空を使う
references: ["Nick's taking a small plane. I'm flying commercial."]
hypothesis: Nick uses private jets, I use commercial airlines.

source: 私と彼との経緯は　ご存知でしょう そして　彼の導き出す推理が 突拍子も無いことも
references: ["You know my history with the guy, and now you see that some of the theories he comes up with can be pretty out there, and I just don't think he'll be a good fit around here."]
hypothesis: You know my history with him, and you know that the deductions he draws are far-fetched.

source: 突拍子もないとは思うけど 時間差の説明は　つくわね
references: ['It sounds crazy, but it would explain the time gap.']
hypothesis: I know it sounds crazy, but it would explain the time difference.

source: 突拍子もないニュースが沢山ある
references: ['There is all kinds of crazy news people out here.']
hypothesis: Lots of outlandish news.

source: サイロンの攻撃から隠れるための 窮余の策だ、違うか？ last -ditch effort　窮余の一策
references: ['Last ditch effort to hide from the Cylon attack, right?']
hypothesis: A last-ditch effort to hide from the Cylon attack, no? Last ditch effort. A last ditch effort.

source: 私は立往生していた...
references: ['I felt stranded...']
hypothesis: I was stuck ...

source: ( 国境が閉鎖され航空機は飛べず 旅行者は立往生しています)
references: ['Borders are closed and flights have been grounded, stranding millions of travelers.']
hypothesis: ( The border is closed and planes are not allowed to fly, leaving travelers stranded)

source: しかし 大勢のアメリカ人が 立往生している
references: ['But there are a lot of Americans stuck there.']
hypothesis: But a lot of Americans are stuck.

source: 立ち往生してる様だから 兄を見つけたい
references: ['You seem to be stuck with this place and I want to find my brother.']
hypothesis: I need to find my brother because he seems to be stuck here.

source: 立ち往生された
references: ['Weesa going nowhere.']
hypothesis: We're stranded.

source: 彼は、メロンの立ち往生した。
references: ["He's got his melon stuck."]
hypothesis: He got stuck in the melon.

source: 我々としても立つ瀬がない
references: ['We feel humiliated.']
hypothesis: We are at our wit's end.

source: 私の立場がなくない？
references: ["You're kind of making me look bad."]
hypothesis: Don't you think I'm in no position?

source: 避けてたのに 立場が無いよ
references: ["I don't know, maybe this is my fault. Maybe I'm missing something here."]
hypothesis: I've been avoiding you. You're out of your depth.

source: 君は21歳のはずだ 奴らは立場がなくなる
references: ["You gotta be 21. They'll lose their license."]
hypothesis: You're supposed to be 21. They'll be out of position.

source: 最高議長 元老院の方々 悲劇が起きました 交易ルートの関税問題に 端を発し...
references: ['Supreme Chancellor, delegates of the senate, a tragedy has occurred... which started right here with the taxation of trade routes... and has now engulfed our entire planet... in the oppression of the Trade Federation.']
hypothesis: Supreme Chancellor, members of the Senate, a tragedy has occurred, stemming from a tariff dispute on trade routes...

source: これは 俺が端を発している
references: ['This is on me.']
hypothesis: This one originated with me.

source: 毒ベリーに端を発した
references: ['A problem that began the moment you revealed those poison berries in the arena.']
hypothesis: originated in poison berries.

source: わたしはラマ・ブラックバーンの竹馬の友だぞ
references: ["I'm Lamar Blackburn's oldest friend."]
hypothesis: I'm Lamar Blackburn's friend on stilts.

source: - 笑いが止まらなかったよ
references: ['He kept making me laugh.']
hypothesis: - I couldn't stop laughing.

source: 笑いが止まらないって 経験ある？
references: ["Have you ever had that feeling when you can't stop smiling?"]
hypothesis: Have you ever had that feeling of not being able to stop laughing?

source: パレスチナの問題は 笑い事ではない
references: ['We do not consider the issue of Israel and Palestine a laughing matter.']
hypothesis: The Palestinian issue is no laughing matter.

source: 今のところ、しかし笑い事ではないの cuz我々は我々は彼を忘れてしまった。
references: ["It's not so funny now, though cuz we forgot where we put him."]
hypothesis: For now, though, is no laughing matter cuz we we have forgotten him.

source: お前はラニスター軍の誰よりも筋がいい
references: ['You have better instincts than any officer in the Lannister army.']
hypothesis: You make more sense than anyone in the Lannister army.

source: お前は筋がいい
references: ['You have good instincts.']
hypothesis: You make good sense.

source: なぜ筋を通さなかった？
references: ["Show him what's what?"]
hypothesis: Why didn't you make sense?

source: 俺たちは筋を通す
references: ["You see, we're reasonable people."]
hypothesis: We make sense.

source: そこで 私が筋を通し 和解を申し出れば 伯父上も受け入れて 下さることでしょう
references: ['I flatter myself that my overtures of goodwill are highly commendable, and will not lead you to reject the offered olive branch.']
hypothesis: So, if I were to be reasonable and offer a settlement, I am sure your uncle would accept it.

source: 筋金入りの人達がいるから
references: ["There's some hardcore haters out there."]
hypothesis: There are some hardcore people out there.

source: 君の勇気は筋金入りだ
references: ['Your courage is legendary.']
hypothesis: Your courage is hardcore.

source: 「これ以上話す前に、以下の予防策を 講じる様、どうかご同意ください」
references: ['"extremely high-risk, and you are willing to agree "to the following precautions before I share more.']
hypothesis: Before I say any more, please agree to take the following precautions

source: 質問は どのような対策を 講じるか です
references: ['My question is, what do you plan there to do?']
hypothesis: The question is, what measures will you take?

source: 私は安全策を講じる マスコミを利用する すべて仕組まれたことだと
references: ['And when you do, I will read about it from a secure location, and I will reintroduce myself to society at that time.']
hypothesis: I'll play it safe, use the media, make sure it's all a setup.

source: 小男の下で精を出して 働く意味は分かる
references: ['I know what it is to toil beneath lesser men.']
hypothesis: I know what it means to work hard for a little man.

source: 明らかに 財産作りに精を出している
references: ['Trying to make a legacy for herself.']
hypothesis: Obviously, he's busy making a fortune.

source: 地域の表看板役に 精を出してる
references: ['Takes that job very seriously.']
hypothesis: He's been working very hard as a community staple.

source: 糞食らえ　ドワーフ
references: ['Eat shit, dwarf.']
hypothesis: Eat shit, Dwarf.

source: 伝統なんて糞食らえだ
references: ['Fuck kneeling and fuck oaths.']
hypothesis: Fuck tradition.

source: - 数など糞食らえ
references: ['Fuck the math.']
hypothesis: - fuck your numbers

source: 糠喜びさせたくは無いが かなり良い所まで来たと思う
references: ["Now, I don't want anyone living in a fool's paradise, but I would say we're in pretty good shape for our first preview tonight."]
hypothesis: I don't want to make you feel bad, but I think we're in a pretty good place.

source: 糸を引く者が居る筈よ
references: ['Castle, whoever is behind this,']
hypothesis: There's got to be someone pulling the strings.

source: 裏でVが糸を引いてる気が
references: ["I got a feeling the V's are somehow in the middle of all this."]
hypothesis: I have a feeling the V's are pulling strings behind the scenes.

source: ボスは上層を守るために 糸を引いている所だ
references: ['My boss is pulling strings right now to save the upper management.']
hypothesis: The boss is pulling strings to protect the upper levels.

source: 覚えておいて カワイイ子とキモい子 その差は紙一重
references: ["Just remember, there's a fine line between cute and creepy."]
hypothesis: Remember, there's a fine line between cute and creepy.

source: 雑談どころか 議論と紙一重です
references: ['Do you call that a debate? Since the beginning your comments have been controversial !']
hypothesis: It's not just a chat, it's an argument.

source: 人種差別者と紙一重
references: ['On the verge of being racist!']
hypothesis: Racist and paper-thin.

source: まぁ　終わりよければ　すべてよし　だろ？
references: ["Hey, all's well that ends well, though, right?"]
hypothesis: Well, all's well that ends well, right?

source: 「終わりよければ　すべてよし」でしょ？
references: ["All's well that ends well, right?"]
hypothesis: All's well that ends well, right?

source: そうするくらいなら お前は終止符を打つ
references: ["If you did, you'd put a stop to all this."]
hypothesis: You'd rather put an end to it than let that happen.

source: (記者)いやー｡ 絵になりますね｡ さすが チョコレート王子｡
references: ["- Yes. Wow, it's as pretty as a picture. As expected of the prince of chocolate."]
hypothesis: (Reporter) Wow, it's very picturesque. As expected of the prince of chocolate.

source: 絵になる場面だぜ ベイビー " 神様 いる？
references: ["There's the money shot, baby."]
hypothesis: It's a picture-perfect scene, baby.

source: 絵に描いたような妻は？ 幸せそうに笑う 俺のかわいい子供たちはどこだ？
references: ["Where's my gift-wrapped Norman Rockwell wife, and my beautiful, happy, smiling children?"]
hypothesis: Where's my picture-perfect wife? Where are my beautiful, happy, smiling children?

source: 僕はギリギリの綱渡りをしているんだ、
references: ["But I'm walking a fine line right now."]
hypothesis: I'm walking a tightrope on the edge,

source: シマンスキーは操作網を張ったわよ そろそろ何してるか教えて
references: ["Szymanski's got a dragnet out for your hit man. I suggest you steer clear for a while."]
hypothesis: Szymanski has set up an operating net, it's about time you told me what you're doing.

source: 線を引いてそれに制限を設けると 小便とばし大会を開くことになると主張するよ。
references: ['I would argue drawing a line might encourage a pissing contest.']
hypothesis: I would argue that if you draw a line and put a limit on it, you're opening yourself up to a pissing contest.

source: 親子の縁を切るの
references: ['A full parental divorce.']
hypothesis: Severing the parent-child relationship.

source: またあんな格好したら 縁を切るぞ
references: ['I will disown you if you ever don those tie-dyed pants again.']
hypothesis: You dress like that again, I'll cut you off.

source: お前との縁を切るぞ。
references: ['I will cut you off.']
hypothesis: I'm cutting ties with you.

source: 縁起でもないこと言うなよ
references: ["Don't talk like that!"]
hypothesis: Don't be an omen.

source: 縁起でもない　そんなに長生きして　どうする
references: ["Nonsense! I don't want to live that long."]
hypothesis: What's the point in living that long?

source: まだ10: 35だ 私は縁起を担ぐのでね
references: ["It is now 10:35 p.m. and I'm very superstitious."]
hypothesis: It's only 10:35, and I'm a lucky charmer.

source: このホテルの最上階に 政権移行チームと缶詰になり 書類を読み、打ち合わせを 行っており...
references: ["The top two floors of the Intercontinental, where she's huddled with her transition team poring over briefing books, taking meetings..."]
hypothesis: I'm stuck on the top floor of this hotel with the transition team, reading papers, holding meetings...

source: 僕と違って 妹には罪がない
references: ["I'll die. I should. But my sister never did anything to you."]
hypothesis: Unlike me, she's innocent.

source: ええ テロリストが 秘密の通路を作って― こっちに罪を着せようとしたのよ 引っ越しくらいしないとね
references: ["Yeah, well, when a terrorist builds a secret passageway into your apartment and frames you for mass murder, burning a little sage doesn't really cut it."]
hypothesis: Yeah, well, if the terrorists built a secret passageway and tried to frame us for their crimes, we should at least move.

source: 私に罪を着せないで
references: ["Don't yöu blame this on me."]
hypothesis: Don't frame me.

source: 彼女を殺した後　自分の技能を使って カール・レズニックに罪を着せようとしたのか？
references: ["And after you killed her, that's when you decided to use your skills to frame Carl Resnick?"]
hypothesis: Did he kill her and then try to use his skills to frame Carl Resnick?

source: あんた美人局か？
references: ['Are you her pimp?']
hypothesis: Are you a beauty pageant?

source: 羽を伸ばすか
references: ['Think i might stay a while.']
hypothesis: Or stretch your wings.

source: シスコに来ると みんな羽目を外すから
references: ['Why does everybody come to San Francisco and tear loose?']
hypothesis: People get their hair cut when they come to Cisco.

source: 習うは一生ですか？
references: ['How I need to live and learn?']
hypothesis: Is learning a lifetime?

source: 習うより慣れろ それしかないわ
references: ["Wake him up and dress him, Miss Evans. There's no better way to learn than by doing."]
hypothesis: You learn by doing, not by learning. That's all I can say.

source: 習うより慣れろよ
references: ['Practice makes perfect.']
hypothesis: Better get used to it than learn it.

source: 老婆心ながら言わせてもらう
references: ['Let me give you a little advice, Eileen.']
hypothesis: Let me tell you something, old woman.

source: 見たところ 育ちが良くて あこがれたんでしょうけど 老婆心で言うと
references: ["Look, you seem like a nice girl, and I'm sure joining a carnival looks like a lot of fun, but let me just tell you right now, you do not want to be here."]
hypothesis: From the looks of him, he must have had a good upbringing, and I'm sure he admired him, but let me speak from an old woman's point of view.

source: 耳が早いな
references: ['Already?']
hypothesis: You're quick on the ear.

source: 耳が痛いよ
references: ["Don't gloat."]
hypothesis: You're hurting my ears.

source: 今じゃすっかり 耳が遠くなってね カーソン宅って聞こえたが
references: ["Now, my ears aren't what they used to be, but I swear I could have heard you say something about the Carson place."]
hypothesis: I'm so deaf now, I could have sworn I heard "Carson's house.

source: 父は内気でね 同郷の人がいれば 耳が遠くても うまくやれるかと...
references: ["My dad's kind of shy and it'd be nice to have people around with something in common, besides hearing loss."]
hypothesis: My father was very shy, and I thought if he had someone from his hometown, he'd do better, even though he was hard of hearing...

source: そうよ　悪魔よ 耳が遠いの？
references: ['Yes! Demons. Are you deaf?']
hypothesis: Yes, the devil. Are you deaf?

source: ケヴィン いろんな話を耳にし― 俺に関するデタラメを 山ほど読むだろう
references: ["Kevin, you're gonna hear and you're gonna fuckin' read a lotta bullshit about me."]
hypothesis: Kevin, you're going to hear all kinds of stories, you're going to read a lot of bullshit about me.

source: さて　此奴の事を何か 耳にしたら
references: ['Well, if you hear of anything about this guy, just...']
hypothesis: Now, if you hear anything about this guy.

source: そういうことなら, 私がふと耳にしたとても面白いちょっとしたゴシップを あなたに伝えることができなくなりますね。
references: ["Then I couldn't tell you the juicy bit of gossip I overheard."]
hypothesis: If that is the case, I will not be able to tell you a very interesting bit of gossip that I overheard.

source: 我が君 あなた様のご消息が ちらとでも耳に入っていれば―
references: ['My Lord, had I detected any sign, a whisper of your whereabouts...']
hypothesis: My Lord, if I had heard even a whisper of your whereabouts...

source: ある話が耳に入り始めた スターリング市の自警団
references: ['I started hearing tales of the Starling City vigilante.']
hypothesis: A story started to come to my ears about the Starling City Neighborhood Watch.

source: それ自分で言うから いい話が 耳に入って来なくなるのよ
references: ['When you say it like that, I become deaf to any good parts of your story.']
hypothesis: You say that to yourself. That's why I don't hear anything nice about you.

source: 私には何のことだか クレア・ウィリアムズが無事だったことを お耳に入れておいた方が
references: ["Well, I don't yet know you well enough to ask this but you haven't seemed yourself lately."]
hypothesis: I don't know what you're talking about, but I think you should know that Claire Williams is safe.

source: 一つお耳に入れておきたい事が
references: ["Sir, there's something you should know."]
hypothesis: One thing I'd like to bring to your attention.

source: ストイック 今　小耳に挟んだ 一部の連中が "策は　あるのか?"と
references: ["Listen, Stoick, I was overhearing some of the men and, well, some of them are wondering what it is we're up to here."]
hypothesis: Stoick, I just overheard some people asking, "Do you have a plan?" And...

source: でも　彼が誘因だと小耳に挟んだ あなたが最高だと話してる
references: ["But I overheard him on plenty of occasions telling other people that you're the best."]
hypothesis: But I overheard him talking about your inducements and how you're the best.

source: お前が言った事で 俺の耳に残ったのは お前が死ぬと言うことだけだ
references: ["Yeah, you see, the only thing you've said that went into my ear was that you die."]
hypothesis: The only thing you said that made any sense to me was that you were going to die.

source: 耳に残る曲だな
references: ['I think the tune is rather catchy.']
hypothesis: That's music to my ears.

source: 耳を傾けろ、よく聞け
references: ['So you listen to me and you listen well.']
hypothesis: Listen to me. Listen carefully.

source: サム･ワトソン ヘイモン･ボクシング サム･ワトソン ヘイモン･ボクシング ヘイモンの話に耳を傾け 彼と相談しながら
references: ['He listens to Al Haymon.']
hypothesis: Sam Watson, Haymon Boxing, Sam Watson, Haymon Boxing, listening to Haymon, consulting with him.

source: あなたの言うことに 耳を傾けてよかった
references: ["I really did listen to you, so I'm happy to hear that it"]
hypothesis: I'm glad I listened to you.

source: 私が君だったら 耳を塞ぐだろうな。
references: ["I think I'd cover my ears if I were you."]
hypothesis: I would cover my ears if I were you.

source: 耳を澄ますんだ
references: ['I keep my ears open.']
hypothesis: Listen carefully.

source: 国民国家が まだ考えるとは耳を疑う 彼らはどんな影響でも与える 協力においてさえ
references: ['Hard to believe that Nation States still think they have any influence, even in cooperation.']
hypothesis: I still find it hard to believe that nation-states still think they have any influence, even in cooperation.

source: まるでヤクザね 耳を疑うわ
references: ["You're just like a yakuza. I can't believe what I'm hearing."]
hypothesis: You're like a gangster. I can't believe I'm hearing this.

source: 彼らも同様に耳を疑っていました
references: ['I gave them your reason for calling off the air strike, but I must warn you, they were skeptical as well.']
hypothesis: They couldn't believe their ears as well.

source: - 耳を貸さないのです
references: ["- doesn't always listen."]
hypothesis: - They don't listen.

source: これは耳を貸さなくていい
references: ['Now, that is you being stubborn.']
hypothesis: You don't have to listen to this one.

source: 俺に耳を貸したことか？
references: ['Was it straying from Gellar and listening to me?']
hypothesis: Have you ever listened to me?

source: 聞き捨てならないことを
references: ['I was distracted by the sound of good police work.']
hypothesis: let me ask you something that I don't want to hear

source: - 聞き捨てならないですな！
references: ['- Now, see here...']
hypothesis: - I can't hear you out!

source: 聞き捨てならないね
references: ['Excuse me.']
hypothesis: I can't hear you over my shoulder.

source: 小鳥が聞き耳を立てている では　こちらが笛を吹く！
references: ["No sound! He's waiting for me. Well, here goes!"]
hypothesis: A little bird is listening. Then I'll blow my whistle!

source: 散歩ですよ　若い女性に 聞き耳を立てながらね
references: ['Oh, just wandering the streets and eavesdropping on lovely young ladies.']
hypothesis: I'm just going for a walk, listening to the young ladies.

source: 私の合図を待て 聞き耳を立てて
references: ['Be ready to move on my signal, and stay sharp.']
hypothesis: Wait for my signal. Keep your ears open.

source: 肌身離さず
references: ["It's all I managed to save."]
hypothesis: always carry

source: こいつは 肝が据わってんだよ （馬場園）そうなんですよ
references: ["She gets what's going on."]
hypothesis: This guy's got some balls. -He does.

source: お前は肝が据わってる
references: ["You're a badass. You're not scared of shit."]
hypothesis: You've got guts.

source: 肝を冷やしたぜ！
references: ['Cold, my ass!']
hypothesis: It's chilling, man!

source: 肝に銘じるんだ
references: ['Careful.']
hypothesis: Keep it in mind.

source: 肝に銘じる
references: ['- I will, definitely.']
hypothesis: engrave on one's heart

source: 肝に銘じるよ
references: ['I gotta work on that.']
hypothesis: I'll keep that in mind.

source: 王子は世界を股に掛けてる
references: ['The prince is a global guy.']
hypothesis: The prince has the world at his feet.

source: 我々が立ち上がるか倒れるかは お前の肩に掛かっているんだ
references: ['We rise or fall on your shoulders.']
hypothesis: Whether we rise or fall rests on your shoulders.

source: ♪肩と肩を並べて 立ち上がるんだ
references: ["♫ Shoulder to shoulder, we're gonna stand"]
hypothesis: Â Stand shoulder to shoulder.

source: パイクの紋章です あの日、肩を並べて戦いましたな
references: ['The siege of Pyke. We fought side by side one afternoon.']
hypothesis: Pike's sigil. We fought shoulder to shoulder that day.

source: 我々みんなの事です 一緒に肩を並べて立っていた
references: ['We stood together, shoulder to shoulder, like a town should in times like these.']
hypothesis: I'm talking about all of us, standing shoulder to shoulder together.

source: まあ　肩を持つ訳じゃないが つまり　そのコードは...
references: ["I mean, look, I'm not defending the man or nothing like that, it's just, those codes, they..."]
hypothesis: Well, I'm not taking sides, but I mean, that code is...

source: けじめをつけないとね キミは肩を持つべきだ
references: ['You have to draw a line, you have to back it up.']
hypothesis: You have to draw a line in the sand. You have to have a shoulder.

source: もっと私の肩を持って 失望ばかりしてないでよ
references: ["Uh, I'd like you to have my back and stop being so goddamn disappointing like everybody else."]
hypothesis: You should be more on my shoulders. Don't be disappointed all the time.

source: ‐無茶よ ‐肩を貸すよ
references: ["- What? Babe, no! - Come on, I'll help you."]
hypothesis: -No way. - I'll give you a shoulder.

source: 肩を貸すよ。 泣いても舐めてもいい。
references: ['You know, if you need a shoulder to cry on or just to nibble on...']
hypothesis: I'll give you a shoulder to lean on. You can cry or lick me.

source: いつも そばにいて― 優しい言葉と温かい食事 泣く時は肩を貸してくれました
references: ['She was always there with a kind word and a hot meal and a shoulder to cry on.']
hypothesis: She was always there, with a kind word, a hot meal, and a shoulder to cry on.

source: 判事は　どっちに肩入れすると思う？
references: ["Guess we'll find out in the morning."]
hypothesis: Which side do you think the judge will side with?

source: 何で そこまで 羽根専務に肩入れするんだ？
references: ['Why is he going that far to back up Director Hane?']
hypothesis: Why are you so devoted to Director Hane?

source: それから　こんなふうに 柵を背にして撃ったのか？
references: ['Got up against the railing like this?']
hypothesis: Then you shot him against the fence like this?

source: 抜け出せない 再びロープを背にした
references: ["It doesn't seem to help, because Atom is backed up against the ropes again."]
hypothesis: I can't get out. I'm up against the ropes again.

source: 初心に戻り 前を向くのか 背を向けるのか ハッキリしろよ
references: ['Here is your chance to kick open that closet door... and do some of that world changing.']
hypothesis: I want you to go back to the drawing board and decide whether you're going to look forward or backward.

source: エーブルは　ユダヤ人 つまり　彼女は結婚する時に 自分の一族に背を向けた
references: ['Abel there is Jewish, which means she turned her back on her entire clan to get married.']
hypothesis: Abel is Jewish, which means she turned her back on her own family when she married.

source: そして僕は逃げ出した 昨日までのすべてに背を向けて まるで転げ落ちるみたいに
references: ['And then I ran away, turning my back on my entire past, as though tumbling down']
hypothesis: And I ran away, turning my back on everything that had happened yesterday, like I was tumbling down a hill.

source: この惑星に背中を向けて... 彼方に ...去って行くしかない
references: ["Only that I've got my back against the planet... and I'm on my way away."]
hypothesis: With our backs to this planet... Beyond... We have to go away.

source: 背水の陣だな
references: ['- A precipice in front, and wolves behind.']
hypothesis: It's a backwater.

source: ああ　そう 胸が一杯になりませんでした？
references: ["Oh, yeah. Who didn't get choked up at that?"]
hypothesis: Oh, yeah, didn't that fill you up?

source: 胸が張り裂ける
references: ["It's heartbreaking."]
hypothesis: break one's heart

source: 胸が張り裂けそう
references: ['Heartbreaking.']
hypothesis: one's heart is about to burst

source: ［容疑が晴れて　ほっとしましたが］ ［ネル・ソランジュを失くして 胸が張り裂けるような思いです］
references: ['As, uh, relieved as I am that the charges were dropped, my heart breaks for Nell Solange.']
hypothesis: ［Although I am relieved to be cleared of all charges, the loss of Nell Solange is heartbreaking.

source: でも 胸が痛まないのか?
references: ['But does it hurt you?']
hypothesis: But doesn't it hurt?

source: 驚くほど胸が痛まない
references: ['I feel surprisingly Okay about it.']
hypothesis: It's surprisingly heartbreakingly painless.

source: 打ち明けるまで 胸が痛んだ
references: ["My stomach's been in knots just thinking about telling you."]
hypothesis: My heart ached until I confided in him.

source: 胸が裂けそうだ
references: ['My lungs are on fire.']
hypothesis: My heart is breaking.

source: 本当に胸が詰まった
references: ['Man, it was, like, emotional.']
hypothesis: Really choked up.

source: - 胸が躍るね
references: ['- Interesting.']
hypothesis: - That's exciting.

source: レイモンド・タスクは... 胸が躍る妙案です
references: ['I think Raymond Tusk is an exciting, bold idea.']
hypothesis: Raymond Tusk... It's an exciting, strange idea.

source: どれ程胸が高鳴ってるか あなたが持って来たもの関して
references: ["I can't tell you how excited I am about what you've brought to us."]
hypothesis: I can't tell you how excited I am about what you've brought.

source: そりゃいい　胸が高鳴るな！
references: ['Holy shit! That would be so uplifting.']
hypothesis: That's great. That's exciting!

source: 思い出を胸に刻み 我々の友を讃えよう セドリックは思いやりに溢れ
references: ["You remember that and we'll celebrate a boy who was kind and honest and brave and true, right to the very end."]
hypothesis: Let us remember and honor our friend Cedric, who was so thoughtful, so kind, and so generous.

source: 皆がその言葉を胸に刻んだ
references: ['Exactly what these people needed to hear.']
hypothesis: We all took those words to heart.

source: 胸に秘めた夢が－ 最も切実なー
references: ['You must know that your innermost wishes will be made real here.']
hypothesis: The dream in my heart... the most sincere dream of all...

source: そうであっても 胸に秘めてるんだ
references: ["If they are, they're keeping it to themselves."]
hypothesis: Even so, I keep it close to my chest.

source: 自分の胸に秘めて でも 死ぬほど苦しくなった
references: ['I just... swallowed it, all of it, until it filled me up, and I was drowning in it.']
hypothesis: I kept it to myself, but it hurt me to death.

source: ダービーに勝って 胸を張って帰ろう
references: ["Can't wait till you win this Derby, so we can go home."]
hypothesis: Let's win the Derby and go home with our heads held high.

source: 君が死を前に胸を張ろうと 泣き叫ぼうとー
references: ["Whether you're gonna walk like a man or cry like a pussy on your way to the death house."]
hypothesis: Whether you are beating your chest or crying before your death...

source: 胸を張って家に帰れる
references: ['You can enter your house fully justified.']
hypothesis: I can go home with my chest out.

source: 母さんが 最も胸を打たれるだろう
references: ['Your mother would have been most impressed.']
hypothesis: Your mother would be most impressed.

source: 私は胸を打たれた　このバカとは 永遠に親友だと思った 私は やっとの思いで 感情を抑えた
references: ['I felt like embracing him as family... but then I controlled my emotions']
hypothesis: My heart was pounding in my chest, and I knew I would forever be best friends with this moron, and I barely managed to hold back my emotions.

source: 歌の意味がこの胸を焦がす！
references: ['Sweet tidings! Joyful anguish sears my heart!']
hypothesis: The meaning of the song burns this chest!

source: 山の向こうの息子について語るとき 胸を痛めた
references: ['His heart hurt when he spoke about a boy beyond the Great Mountains.']
hypothesis: My heart ached when he spoke of his son beyond the mountains.

source: 他の人間だったら 私達は来ることに胸を痛めて いないだろう
references: ["If it were anyone else, we wouldn't have troubled ourselves to come."]
hypothesis: If it were anyone else, we wouldn't be heartbroken at what's coming.

source: 期待に胸を躍らせていた―
references: ['Full of promise.']
hypothesis: I was so excited about the prospect...

source: 奴等は 胸糞が悪い
references: ['They are fucking disgusting.']
hypothesis: They're disgusting.

source: 分かっていることはドブネズミを見ると、 胸糞が悪くなるということだけです。
references: ['All you know is you find them repulsive.']
hypothesis: All I know is that the sight of a rat makes me sick to my stomach.

source: 脇が甘く悪人だと気づけなかった兄弟に 自分の国民を渡してしまうのは？
references: ['To abandon his subjects to an evil that he was too gullible to recognize?']
hypothesis: What about giving your own people to a brother who was too naive to realize that he was a bad guy?

source: 脇目も振らずあの娘の元へ．．．
references: ['She went straight for him.']
hypothesis: I went to her without looking aside ...

source: 動脈を取ってください。
references: ["You must've nicked an artery."]
hypothesis: Take the arteries.

source: その30分後に、 あなたはニックの動脈を取ることになる
references: ['30 minutes after that, you will nick his left anterior descending artery.']
hypothesis: Half an hour later, you'll be taking out Nick's arteries.

source: ヘイゼルとリチャードは ２人にふさわしい脚光を浴びるのよ
references: ['Hazel and Richard are gonna get the attention they deserve.']
hypothesis: Hazel and Richard get the limelight they deserve.

source: 脚光を浴びるのが嫌らしい
references: ["Why? I think she's afraid of being in the limelight."]
hypothesis: They don't like being in the limelight.

source: どうも腑に落ちない
references: ["Something's off."]
hypothesis: something that doesn't quite add up

source: 腑に落ちない
references: ["I don't know, Castle."]
hypothesis: doesn't make sense

source: 何か腑に落ちない ヘリコプターは着陸しようとしてる どうするの？
references: ["Something doesn't add up. We're dealing with a copycat. What do you mean, the chopper's about to touch down?"]
hypothesis: Something doesn't add up. The helicopter's about to land. What do we do?

source: それでこそ 我々の腕が上がる
references: ['And that is where our training kicks in.']
hypothesis: That's how we get good at what we do.

source: 腕が立つな
references: ["You're a capable man."]
hypothesis: You're good.

source: 奴ら腕が立つから 放っといたら大変な事になる
references: ['It would have created a huge problem just to let those skilled men run around freely.']
hypothesis: They're good at what they do, and if we don't do something about it, we're in big trouble.

source: よく腕が立つもんだ
references: ["How'd you get so good?"]
hypothesis: How can you be so skillful?

source: で　復讐のために ハッキングの腕を磨いたのか？
references: ['So, did you ever consider using your hacking skills to get revenge?']
hypothesis: So you honed your hacking skills for revenge?

source: どうやって腕を磨いた？
references: ["So how is it that you wind up where you've ended up?"]
hypothesis: How did you hone your skills?

source: 違う　腕を磨いてるんだわ
references: ["No... they're gonna put their skills to work."]
hypothesis: No, he's just honing his skills.

source: 結婚すると、腰が据わる」
references: ['Married guy is more stable.']
hypothesis: When you get married, you buckle up."

source: 給油所でなんか始めた さあ　腰を上げろ
references: ['Activity at the petrol station. Come on, get your arse up.']
hypothesis: They started something at the gas station. Come on, get up off your ass.

source: 先週　ケイ・アルフォンソは 階段から落ちて腰を折ったの
references: ['Last week Kay Alfonso fell, and she broke her hip.']
hypothesis: Last week, Kay Alfonso fell down the stairs and broke her hip.

source: 腰を抜かすわ
references: ["You'd run from here in terror."]
hypothesis: I'm going to get off my back.

source: 水の上まで歩けたら、奴らも腰を抜かすだろうな。
references: ["If we can walk on the water, they wouldn't dare shoot at us."]
hypothesis: If they could walk to the water, they'd sit up and take it.

source: しっかり腰を据えて 働いておくれ
references: ['Sit your ass down and get yourself to work.']
hypothesis: You're going to have to work hard.

source: 腰を据える
references: ['Settle in.']
hypothesis: settle down (and deal with something)

source: 諜報部からの連絡では 夜のうちに 北ベトナム軍は撤退 川向うに腰を据えたらしい
references: ['Intelligence passed the word down that during the night the NVA had pulled out of our area to positions across the Perfume River.']
hypothesis: Intelligence reports that during the night, the North Vietnamese withdrew and settled down across the river.

source: 誰もがディナーのために腰を落ち着ける。
references: ["Everybody's settling in for dinner."]
hypothesis: Everyone sits down for dinner.

source: ゆっくり腰を落ち着けて デザートを食べる時間もあるじゃないか？
references: ['So does this mean that you can actually sit down and have some dessert?']
hypothesis: You have time to sit back, relax, and have some dessert, don't you?

source: どの星に 腰を落ち着けるかな
references: ['Any thoughts on where I should set up shop?']
hypothesis: On which planet would you like to settle down?

source: （吉森） 一人前に扱われないのは 腹が立つが それはいつものことだ 今に始まったことじゃねえー
references: ["Not being able to handle an adult makes one angry but... That's normal., It's not the first time..."]
hypothesis: （I'm angry that I'm not treated like one, but that's just the way it's always been.

source: あなたは　腹が立って 裏切られたとさえ思ったでしょうね
references: ['You must have felt angry, betrayed, even.']
hypothesis: You must have felt angry, even betrayed.

source: 〈腹が立った〉
references: ['Mostly pissed off.']
hypothesis: [Claire] I'm so angry.

source: ふいに悲しくなって―― 自分に腹が立って 気が付いたらこんな事を
references: ['Suddenly I just got so sad, so mad at myself, I just wanted it to end.']
hypothesis: And then I got sad, and then I got mad at myself, and then I found myself doing this.

source: お互い腹を割って本音を明かす ことなんかできるのか...
references: ["Can you reveal each other's true intentions in a heart to heart...?"]
hypothesis: I don't know if we can ever be open and honest with each other...

source: 腹を割って話そう
references: ['Perhaps a more visceral demonstration.']
hypothesis: Let's have a heart-to-heart talk.

source: 腹を割って話しに来た
references: ['You... you came here to lay the cards on the table.']
hypothesis: I'm here to have a heart-to-heart talk.

source: でも腹を抱えて笑ったよ
references: ['Yes, but it was hilarious. We laughed like drains.']
hypothesis: But it did give me a belly laugh.

source: その頃 俺様は... . はるか遠くの土地で 腹を抱えて大笑い
references: ['Meantime, Roland Turner is a thousand miles away, laughing his ass off.']
hypothesis: And I was... . I was in a land far, far away, laughing my head off.

source: 私は信用出来そうな者の腹を探る
references: ['I will sound out our most trusted officers.']
hypothesis: I probe the bellies of those I think I can trust.

source: 君が腹を痛めたジェイコブだ
references: ['The Jacob that you carried in your belly.']
hypothesis: You're the Jacob with the stomach ache.

source: 猛ふぶきで ランタンを持ち 腹を立てていた
references: ['He was holding a lantern and he was in the blizzard, and I knew he was gonna be angry.']
hypothesis: He was holding a lantern in a blizzard, and he was angry.

source: 腹を立てたのね
references: ['and took offense.']
hypothesis: You got angry.

source: 気が動転したり 腹を立てた時だけで 何かで興奮状態になった時だ
references: ["Only when they're upset, pissed off, you know, emotional in some way."]
hypothesis: Only when I'm upset or angry, or agitated about something.

source: 私腹を肥やすのに忙しいのさ
references: ["They're lining their pockets as fast as they can."]
hypothesis: They're busy lining their own pockets.

source: 自分の私腹を肥やす事しか 考えていないだろ
references: ['All you ever think about is fattening your own coffers.']
hypothesis: All you care about is lining your own pockets.

source: あんたが私腹を肥やすことも...
references: ['And that pretty little nest you feathered for yourself.']
hypothesis: You can line your own pockets...

source: 腹黒い奴はいた。
references: ['But there was someone black-hearted.']
hypothesis: There were black-hearted people.

source: つまり　腹黒い毒島よりも １０倍　もっと腹黒い。
references: ["Meaning he's 10 times more black-hearted than the black-hearted Busujima."]
hypothesis: In other words, he is 10 times more black-hearted than the black-hearted Poison Island.

source: ３人は綺麗でした でも心は腹黒く汚かった
references: ['All three were beautiful of face, but vile and black of heart.']
hypothesis: The three of them were beautiful, but their hearts were black-hearted and dirty.

source: 膝を折るから
references: ['Bend at your knees.']
hypothesis: I'll break your knees.

source: しかし傷の膿を出して もう一度包帯しなければなりません
references: ["- Okay. But I'll have to drain the wound and repack it."]
hypothesis: But the wound must be drained of pus and bandaged again.

source: 臆病風に吹かれたか！
references: ["If it's a fight you want, you've met your match!"]
hypothesis: Did the winds of cowardice blow?

source: 今日戦わなかった為に、敵は 我が臆病風に吹かれたと思うかもしれません
references: ["They may think we are discouraged because we're not fighting today."]
hypothesis: Because we did not fight today, our enemies may think we have been cowed by the winds of cowardice.

source: 臆面もなく でたらめを言える奴だ
references: ['Someone who can bullshit their way out of anything.']
hypothesis: He's an unabashed bullshitter.

source: 臆面もなく嘘を？
references: ['No, no, no. You lie to my fucking face?']
hypothesis: Lying unabashedly?

source: ここに私達が堂々と 座ってられるなんて信じられる 臆面も無くよ?
references: ["Can you believe we're sitting out here in the open bold as brass?"]
hypothesis: Can you believe we're sitting here with our heads held high, unabashedly?

source: いいや 自業自得だ
references: ['No, I earned what I got coming to me.']
hypothesis: No. He got what he deserved.

source: ウォルシュは 気の毒に見えるが 自業自得なんだ
references: ["And I know it seems a bit rough on Walshy, but don't forget he made this rod for his own back."]
hypothesis: I feel sorry for Walshy, but he got what he deserved.

source: 自業自得よ
references: ['Paid the ultimate price.']
hypothesis: You got what you deserved.

source: ありがとう、ボス 至れり尽くせり
references: ["Level five's too damn easy, but, uh, we're tweaking it."]
hypothesis: Thank you, boss. You've been very helpful.

source: 勘で当てるのは至難の業だ
references: ['We have no idea which one.']
hypothesis: It's extremely hard to guess on a hunch.

source: （肇）よく舌が回るわ。
references: ['-I can never win.']
hypothesis: （Your tongue rolls well.

source: 意図を感じますね （山里）舌が肥えすぎとる
references: ['-Yes, I sense an ulterior motive.']
hypothesis: I sense an agenda. -He's got too discerning a palate.

source: - レミ 舌を巻いて
references: ['- Remi, please roll your tongue.']
hypothesis: - Remi, roll your tongue.

source: 君がここの実権を握り舵を取るべきだ。
references: ['I have no doubt this D.O. would be well served with you at the helm.']
hypothesis: You should be the real power here and take the helm.

source: 君のいる狭い小部屋から 大会社の運命の舵取りをするのは さぞ愉快だろうな
references: ['Must be quite a feeling-- steering the fate of a giant company from your tiny little cubicle.']
hypothesis: It must be a pleasure to steer the fortunes of a large company from your tiny little room.

source: 少し色を付けておいた
references: ['There is a little bit of extra there.']
hypothesis: I added a little color.

source: それは皆言うの 「お互いに色目を使う」？
references: ['Is that what people say, to "make eyes at each other"?']
hypothesis: Is that what people call it, "making eyes at each other"?

source: 色目を使ってくる男を あしらうのは簡単なのよ
references: ["See, it's really easy to get over with the testosterone at work, you know?"]
hypothesis: It's easy to deal with men who make advances on you.

source: 最後の曲はアレックスに 花を持たせよう
references: ['All right, all right. We let Alex shine a little bit on that last one.']
hypothesis: For the last song, let's let Alex have the flowers.

source: - 彼女に花を持たせて
references: ['- Let her have this.']

source: 惨めな俺の人生に花を添えられる
references: ["In my brief, miserable life, there's the truth in it."]

source: 君のライトセイバーが コレクションに花を添える
references: ['Your lightsabres will make a fine addition to my collection.']
hypothesis: Your lightsaber will add to the collection.

source: うるさくしすぎると 成長の芽を摘むかと
references: ['The thing is, constant warnings are maddening for anyone aspiring to be an overlord.']
hypothesis: I thought if we were too loud, we'd stunt their growth.

source: - 早く芽を摘まないといけない -　やめろ!
references: ['- I can put her out of her misery.']
hypothesis: - We need to nip this in the bud quickly.

source: 彼等が力を持ち始める前に 芽を摘むのよ
references: ["It's time to eliminate them before they grow any stronger."]
hypothesis: We have to nip this in the bud before they start to gain power.

source: 若気の至りが バッチリ写ってます
references: ['The height of youthful folly']
hypothesis: It's a perfect picture of youthful indiscretion.

source: 最後の若気の至りだ
references: ['Making peace with past indiscretions.']
hypothesis: Last youthful indiscretion.

source: 若気の至りを俺もしたぜ クライドはまだガキか？
references: ['Made the same mistake when I was a kid. So is Clyde still your dude?']
hypothesis: I've had my share of youthful indiscretions. Is Clyde still a kid?

source: ヘプタポットは複雑な文を 苦もなく２秒で書く
references: ['A heptopod can write a complex sentence in two seconds, effortlessly.']
hypothesis: Heptopots write complex sentences in two seconds, effortlessly.

source: 彼らは漫然と生きる 苦もなくね
references: ['They drift through life effortlessly.']
hypothesis: They live in idleness, painlessly.

source: ［彼は対立や逆境を］ ［苦もなく処理できると言うけれども］
references: ['He says he deals with conflict and adversity easily, though.']
hypothesis: ［Though he claims to be able to handle conflict and adversity without pain.

source: 出てきて自由になったから 英気を養ってるんだな
references: ["So, Jake, you're out. You're free. You're rehabilitated."]
hypothesis: Now that you're out and free, you're building up your courage.

source: これ、英気を養うよ
references: ['Here. It will restore your energy.']
hypothesis: Here, I'll give you some energy.

source: え ええ... 英気を養わなきゃ
references: ['- Uh, yeah, uh, sleep is good.']
hypothesis: Yeah, yeah... I need to get my strength back.

source: いいか小僧 人生は茨の道だ
references: ["You know what? Life's rough, kid."]
hypothesis: You know, kid, life is messy.

source: そして、私 人生を目茶目茶にされて...
references: ['And me. We ruined her life.']
hypothesis: And I've had my life turned upside down...

source: 出入り不能にしている 茶番劇だな
references: ['No radio or satellite transmissions. Nothing but trust.']
hypothesis: They're in and out. It's a farce.

source: これは茶番だわ　茶番！
references: ['This is a travesty. A travesty!']
hypothesis: This is a travesty. A travesty!

source: - どうぞ 方の荷が下りる
references: ["I'm relieved."]
hypothesis: - Please. You're free to go.

source: 肩の荷が下りたんだ 次の数日は もっと凄い体験を
references: ["A weight has been lifted off his shoulders, and I can't wait for the next couple of days, because things are gonna get even crazier."]
hypothesis: It's a weight off my shoulders, and the next few days will be an even greater experience.

source: 一人でドロイドを片づける のは荷が重いからな
references: ['Very well. The burden is on me not to destroy all the droids until you arrive.']
hypothesis: It's a lot of work to clean up the droids all by yourself.

source: 年寄りには荷が重い
references: ["I'm getting too old for this sort of thing."]
hypothesis: Old people have a lot of work to do.

source: 荷が重いから渡したいのに
references: ["If you did, I'd be tempted to give it to you."]
hypothesis: I'm trying to give it to you because you're carrying too much.

source: 積荷を下ろすんだ
references: ['Take everything off the wagon.']
hypothesis: Unload the cargo.

source: 積み荷を下ろして 中へ運ぶぞ
references: ["Okay, boys, let's get this haul unloaded and inside."]
hypothesis: Let's unload it. Let's get it inside.

source: そうしなければいけないんだ 君も重荷を下ろした方がいい
references: ['And you alone, Mary, you alone may lighten this burden.']
hypothesis: I have to. You should unburden yourself, too.

source: 落とし前をつけるつもりか?
references: ['Were you planning to clean up the place?']
hypothesis: You're going to pay the price?

source: 蓋を開けてみると 攻撃が始まった時 ジョフは城壁に残ることに決めた
references: ['As it turned out, when the attack came, Joff insisted on remaining at the battlements.']
hypothesis: When the lid was lifted and the attack began, Joffe decided to stay on the ramparts.

source: 薄気味悪いほど
references: ['Well, they do bear an uncanny resemblance to the ears in the photograph.']
hypothesis: eerie

source: まったく薄気味悪いんです
references: ["- I don't know, man, he's been acting really weird lately."]
hypothesis: It's totally creepy.

source: このバーガーを投げ入れて 薬が効くのを待つんだ
references: ["We'll toss these burgers over the gate, wait for the Demerol to kick in."]
hypothesis: Throw this burger in there and wait for the medicine to kick in.

source: 薬が効いて来た とにかく急ごう!
references: ["Let's get that drip going and move out. Come on."]
hypothesis: The meds are kicking in. Let's just hurry up!

source: 薬が効くまで時間がかかる
references: ['We need longer for the sleeping potion to work.']
hypothesis: It takes time for the medicine to work.

source: ジメチル・スルホキシドと 混ざった場合 麻酔薬になる
references: ['Hey, if sophorine is mixed with dimethyl sulfoxide, it becomes an anesthetic.']
hypothesis: When mixed with dimethyl sulfoxide, it becomes an anesthetic.

source: 狂気は現代では 薬になり得る
references: ['Madness can be a medicine for the modern world.']
hypothesis: Madness can be a medicine in this day and age.

source: ずっと彼の研究をしてるんだ 適切に希釈さえすればその毒は... とても有効な薬になる
references: ["I've been studying him, and I'm pretty sure that his venom could be quite useful if properly diluted."]
hypothesis: I've been studying him for some time now, and I believe that the poison, if properly diluted... It can be a very effective medicine.

source: これが藪から棒に聞こえるのは知ってるけど 僕は今売り出し中の身だ
references: ["I know this may sound farfetched, but I'm on the market now."]
hypothesis: I know this sounds far fetched, but I'm on the market right now.

source: 藪から棒のオファーで
references: ["I can't believe you gave up your mop for this suit."]
hypothesis: With an offer out of the bush.

source: 藪をつついて蛇を出すってこと
references: ['Yeah. Let it rest.']
hypothesis: I mean to poke around in the bushes and bring out the snakes.

source: そして遂に大海の藻屑となる。
references: ['And then you will be dropped into the ocean.']
hypothesis: And finally, it becomes a piece of debris in the ocean.

source: 虚仮にしている
references: ['He honeydicked the shit out of me. - Sucks.']
hypothesis: He's making a fool of himself.

source: 彼は虚勢を張ってると思うの
references: ["I think he's bluffing."]
hypothesis: I think he's bluffing.

source: いや　トレメイン・アレクサンダーは 虚勢を張らない
references: ["No, Tremaine Alexander don't bluff."]
hypothesis: No, Tremaine Alexander is not bluffing.

source: 彼女は虚勢を張っている
references: ["She's bluffing."]
hypothesis: She's bluffing.

source: だから 虫が好かなかった
references: ["I knew there was a reason I didn't like you."]
hypothesis: That's why I didn't like bugs.

source: 今日はずっと虫の居所が悪いな
references: ["All right something's been bugging you all day."]
hypothesis: You've been bugging me all day.

source: 今日は虫の居所が悪いのよ
references: ['Short fuse today I guess.']
hypothesis: I'm having a bad day.

source: 虫の居所が悪かっただけ
references: ["Look, I had a bad moment. That's all."]
hypothesis: I was just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

source: 虫の息で捨てられていた
references: ['Abandoned, suffering, left to die.']
hypothesis: It was thrown away with the breath of a bug.

source: -虫の知らせだけど
references: ["I'm telling you, Chad."]
hypothesis: -I've got a bit of a bug up my sleeve.

source: 虫の知らせの為に 私のキャリアを危険に晒せと?
references: ['And you expect me to risk my entire career on a hunch?']
hypothesis: You want me to put my career on the line just to give you a heads up?

source: 貴方にも 何か 虫の知らせがあったはず
references: ["You already have a hunch something's wrong, Chad."]
hypothesis: You must have had some kind of a bugbear.

source: 虫酸が走る男ね
references: ['You disgust me.']
hypothesis: You're a disgusting man.

source: 蚊帳の外に放り出すなよ
references: ["Promise me that you'll let me be there."]
hypothesis: Don't throw me out of the mosquito net.

source: 組合は蚊帳の外さ
references: ["The association wasn't consulted."]
hypothesis: The unions are out of the picture.

source: 裁判官と主席弁護士が密談を 我々は蚊帳の外だ
references: ['Only the judge and the lead attorneys were privy, and our honorable D.A. is staying mum.']
hypothesis: The judge and the lead attorney are talking in secret, and we're not part of it.

source: なんというか 心の蛇の生殺しだ
references: ["It's like, uh... blue balls in your heart."]
hypothesis: What can I say? A live snake of the mind.

source: 近々この街は蜂の巣をつついたような騒ぎになる
references: ["This town's about to buzz like a bee hive poked with a stick."]
hypothesis: Soon this city will be like a beehive poked with a bee's nest.

source: あなたは、融通が利かなく なってきています、フレイア
references: ["You've become quite literal, Freya."]
hypothesis: You're becoming inflexible, Freya.

source: 融通が利かないな
references: ['I thought you said he was cool.']
hypothesis: You're not very flexible.

source: 大統領は融通が利かない
references: ["The president's bulldog."]
hypothesis: The president is inflexible.

source: 彼を考えるたび 血が滾る
references: ['Every time I think about him, my blood boils.']
hypothesis: Every time I think of him, my blood boils.

source: - 血が引く思いだ
references: ["Oh, I think I'm bleeding somewhere."]
hypothesis: - It's like a bloodbath.

source: （徳井）まあ 血が繋がってなければ いいんじゃないですか？ そんなものは
references: ["As long as you're not related."]
hypothesis: （Well, it's okay if they're not related. That kind of thing.

source: " 血が通っている " と 思いたい
references: ['I like to think of it as a living system.']
hypothesis: I like to think of it as a living blood.

source: 「血が騒ぐとき、心が痛むとき」
references: ['＃When the blood creeps, and the nerves prick,＃']
hypothesis: When the blood rushes, when the heart aches."

source: 血が騒ぐよ
references: ['Gets blood pumping.']
hypothesis: It's in my blood.

source: 血と汗の結晶よ
references: ['With our sacrifices and our blood.']
hypothesis: All that blood and sweat.

source: 血の巡りが悪くなってるわ
references: ["- Yeah. The blood's having a hard time getting back to your heart."]
hypothesis: Your blood circulation is slowing down.

source: そして「絞首刑の男」を見た時 君の顔から血の気が引いたね
references: ['And then when you saw the hanged man, the blood drained from your face.']
hypothesis: And when you saw "The Hanged Man," the blood drained from your face.

source: 彼の目を見て 血の涙が
references: ['Now, if you look into his eyes, you can see him tearing blood.']
hypothesis: I looked into his eyes and I cried tears of blood.

source: 妙よね 血の涙なんてある？
references: ["I'd say bad day all around. I mean, can-- can someone actually cry blood?"]
hypothesis: Strange. Is there such a thing as tears of blood?

source: -　そして彼らの妻達は 血の涙を流すでしょう"
references: ['"... and their wives will weep tears of blood."']
hypothesis: - And their wives will weep tears of blood."

source: 正確に言うと 血は水よりも濃くないだろ？
references: ["Hasn't exactly been thicker than water, has it?"]
hypothesis: Well, to be precise, blood isn't thicker than water, is it?

source: 血は水よりも濃い
references: ['And blood is so much thicker than water.']
hypothesis: Blood is thicker than water

source: 血も涙もない
references: ['A cold blooded setup.']
hypothesis: cold-blooded

source: ドラゴ・ブラッドビストは いかれた奴だ 血も涙もない
references: ['Because Drago Bludvist is a madman... without conscience or mercy.']
hypothesis: Drago Bludvist is a madman... without blood or tears.

source: あんたらは、スタークと血を分けた仲だろ？
references: ["Your people share blood with the Starks, don't they?"]
hypothesis: You and Stark share blood, don't you?

source: 血を分けた娘...
references: ['My flesh and blood.']
hypothesis: Daughter by blood...

source: これは私の血を分けた兄弟だ
references: ['This is my blood brother.']
hypothesis: This is my blood brother.

source: 前に輸血を受けたのは ５月１８日
references: ['My last platelet transfusion was May 18th.']
hypothesis: The last time I received a blood transfusion was May 18.

source: ジークフリートを作ったのは 彼ら二人だ ヴェルズングの血を引いた最強の 男子を
references: ['Siegfried was born of their union, a youth of invincible strength.']
hypothesis: They created Siegfried, two of the strongest men in the Wälsung blood.

source: ウィリアム・ターナーの血を引く 本当の子供はどこだ？
references: ['The child in whose veins flows the blood of William Turner? Where?']
hypothesis: Where is the real child of William Turner's blood?

source: 一族の人がオオカミの血を 引いてるって知ってた？
references: ['Did you know Quileutes are supposedly descended from wolves?']
hypothesis: Did you know that your family has wolf blood?

source: 血眼になって探してる
references: ["This piece that's falling caused us bloody problems."]
hypothesis: They're looking for you with all their eyes.

source: あの谷では袋の鼠じゃ セオデンは罠に踏み込んどる
references: ['There is no way out of that ravine. Théoden is walking into a trap.']
hypothesis: In that valley, you're a rat in a bag, and Theoden is walking into a trap.

source: 俺達は袋の鼠だ
references: ["We're trapped."]
hypothesis: We're rats in the sack.

source: 袋の鼠だ
references: ["We're trapped."]
hypothesis: A rat in a bag.

source: 180人の選手達 20のステージ たった一人だけが イエロー・ジャージに袖を通す
references: ['One hundred and eighty riders, 20 stages, and only one gets to wear the Yellow Jersey.']
hypothesis: 180 athletes, 20 stages, and only one wears the yellow jersey.

source: あんたが裏で糸を引いてんの？
references: ['Are you the one who did this?']
hypothesis: Are you the one behind this?

source: サーセイが裏で糸を引いている 知ってるだろ
references: ['Cersei has manipulated everything and you know it.']
hypothesis: Cersei is behind this. You know that.

source: 裏で糸を引き 凶悪犯を創り上げる
references: ['You simply rule from behind the scenes.']
hypothesis: They're behind the scenes, creating the thugs.

source: 私は　裏に回った
references: ['I went around back.']
hypothesis: I went around back.

source: 裏に回ろう
references: ["Let's go in the back."]
hypothesis: Let's go around back.

source: 5分待ち 裏に回り 裏口を包囲
references: ['Wait five minutes. Go around and block the side entrance.']
hypothesis: Wait five minutes, go around the back, surround the back door.

source: レンタカーだけでなく 彼は何とか人の裏をかいてる
references: ["He's got to get around somehow, just not by rental car."]
hypothesis: Not only does he rent cars, he somehow manages to outsmart people.

source: 裏をかくことができる 前にもやった
references: ["I can outwit them, I've done it before."]
hypothesis: I can outwit them. I've done it before.

source: 俺は銀行に当たって 裏を取る
references: ["I'll talk to the bank, make sure it wasn't a mistake."]
hypothesis: I'm gonna hit the bank, get a line on them.

source: 私もそう思いたくない 私が裏を取ります
references: ["Paul, I don't like it any more than you do, but I'll prove it."]
hypothesis: I don't like to think so either. I'll back it up.

source: 引っ張って来い 裏を取ろう
references: ['Bring her in. See what you get.']
hypothesis: Go ahead and pull it. Let's get the back of it.

source: 裏を返せば もし侵攻を続ければ デュバクは間違いなくデバイスを悪用するでしょう
references: ['On the other hand, if you authorize the invasion, dubaku will undoubtedly engage the cip device.']
hypothesis: On the flip side, if the invasion continues, Dubaku will undoubtedly exploit the device.

source: 裏を返せば 失敗は許されないということだ
references: ['it means failure is not an option.']
hypothesis: The flip side is that failure is not an option.

source: 君に2つの顔があるなら 裏目に出るぞ
references: ["The problem is when you're two people at the same time, one of them is bound to trip the other."]
hypothesis: If you're two-faced, it can backfire.

source: もし話して裏目に出たら？
references: ['What if Joe is right, and I tell them, and it backfires?']
hypothesis: What if talking backfires?

source: 互いに対してそれらをピットにあなたの策略 だから、資格でした 完全に裏目に出たようです。
references: ['Your ploy to pit them against each other seems to have backfired completely so that could qualify, yes.']
hypothesis: So your ploy to pit them against each other was qualified seems to have backfired completely.

source: ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの
references: ['She is just a bird flying.']
hypothesis: Laura has no flaws. She has the same attitude towards everyone.

source: 自由だから ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの
references: ["She doesn't have an attitude repertoire, she doesn't have anything."]
hypothesis: Because she's free, because she's the same to everyone, because she's the same to everyone, because she's the same to everyone, because she's the same to everyone.

source: 汚い利益の２０００万ドルを 寄付したからと言って 襟を正した事にはならん
references: ["But even giving away $20 million of her company's ill gotten profits hasn't humbled Ms. Sherman much."]
hypothesis: Just because I donated $20 million of my dirty profits doesn't mean I've changed my collar.

source: 襟を正さないと
references: ['Yeah, actually, this is really, really nice.']
hypothesis: I need to straighten my collar.

source: 警官は確かに要領がいいな まずい時に現れたな
references: ['You cops sure have a knack for showing up at the wrong time.']
hypothesis: The cops sure have a knack for showing up at the wrong time.

source: でも君は見所がある
references: ["They sent a nice kid, you'll be a good worker."]
hypothesis: But you're something to behold.

source: 見果てぬ夢と言っていた。
references: ['She said it was a lost cause.']
hypothesis: He called it a lost dream.

source: 見果てぬ夢に見えると言っていた。
references: ['She said she could see it was a lost cause.']
hypothesis: He said it looked like a lost dream.

source: 見果てぬ夢という像は、サンタ・リタにある。
references: ['The patron saint of lost causes is saint rita.']
hypothesis: The statue called "Unseen Dreams" is located in Santa Rita.

source: 見栄を張るのは あまり好きじゃない
references: ["Ostentation is not something that I'm accustomed to."]
hypothesis: I'm not a big fan of pretentiousness.

source: あの方は美しいわ　あなたは見栄を 張らないようにすればいいの　虚栄心は罪よ
references: ["She is beautiful. You shouldn't be vain. Vanity is a sin."]
hypothesis: She's beautiful, you just have to try not to be vain. Vanity is a sin.

source: 見栄を張ることは決して賢くないというね わかったかい？
references: ["This is a good lesson on why you never wanna lie about your ability to do things you clearly can't do, okay?"]
hypothesis: It's never wise to be vain, is it?

source: 私は、メール室で90分間 郵便の仕分けを待ってたのよ。 胸元に視線を浴びながら。 だから、私がキャットに これを渡します。
references: ['I spent the last 90 minutes in the mail room letting a glorified postal worker stare at my chest, so I could be the one to give this to Cat.']
hypothesis: I spent 90 minutes in the mailroom waiting for my mail to be sorted. With eyes on my chest. So I'll give this to Cat.

source: 彼はみんなの視線を浴びてる
references: ["Everyone's staring machine guns at him."]
hypothesis: He's got all eyes on him.

source: - 俺も息子も　視線を浴びるんだ
references: ['People would look at me and see him. That must have been very difficult for you.']
hypothesis: - I get a lot of stares. I get a lot of stares. My son gets a lot of stares.

source: 私は覚悟の上で参った 首を刎ねられる事も ドラゴンに焼かれる事も
