references: ['And I came here knowing that you could have your men behead me or your dragons burn me alive.']
hypothesis: I came prepared to have my head chopped off and my dragons burned.

source: 彼らは覚悟の上だ！
references: ['They know that going in!']
hypothesis: They are prepared!

source: まあ　やるとしても 親身になって話を聞く人が必要だ
references: ['Well, if ever you need a friendly ear.']
hypothesis: Well, if we do this, we'll need someone who's willing to listen.

source: デイブは親身になってくれてる
references: ['I think Dave is really helping you.']
hypothesis: Dave is being accommodating.

source: 誰が親身になってくれる？
references: ['Who in your estimation is that sympathetic ear?']
hypothesis: Who will be accommodating?

source: 受け入れるべきだよ。 言い得て妙じゃないか。
references: ['Well, you do have to admit, it is catchy.']
hypothesis: You should embrace it. That's an odd thing to say, isn't it?

source: 一緒にやれたら　言うことなしだ
references: ["And if you do it together, it's fantastic."]
hypothesis: If we could do it together, it'd be great.

source: 言うことなしよ
references: ["It just couldn't have gone any better."]
hypothesis: There's nothing to say.

source: - 言うなれば...
hypothesis: - I'll say it...

source: 言うなれば、 災い転じて、福となる
references: ['What a, what do you call it, a poetic turn of events.']
hypothesis: As the saying goes, "disaster turns into blessing.

source: 彼女は、言うなれば 気晴らしの叱責の提供者 好きな連中は 喜んで金を払う
references: ['She provides, shall we say, recreational scolding for those who enjoy that sort of thing and are prepared to pay for it.']
hypothesis: She's a purveyor of, shall we say, distracting scolding, and those who like it are willing to pay for it.

source: 撃たれた銃弾が あなたを殺さないなら あなたが持ち込んだ この人生の嵐が殺さないなら 言わずもがな
references: ["If them bullets don't kill you, and this storm you somehow brought upon us don't kill you, goes without saying..."]
hypothesis: If the bullet that shot you doesn't kill you, and the storm of this life you brought with you doesn't kill you, I don't have to tell you.

source: 言うは易く行うは難しだ
references: ['Easier said than done.']
hypothesis: easier said than done.

source: 言葉が過ぎるぞ
references: ["You're going too far!"]
hypothesis: That's too wordy.

source: 言葉が過ぎる
references: ['You do not even think something like that.']
hypothesis: go too far (by saying something rude)

source: お言葉に甘えて
references: ['He convinced me.']
hypothesis: I'll take your word for it.

source: お言葉に甘えます
references: ['If you insist.']
hypothesis: I'll take your word for it.

source: お言葉に甘えたいけど悪いわよ
references: ["Oh, that's really sweet of you to offer, Rarity, but I can't let you do that."]
hypothesis: I wish I could take your word for it, but I'm sorry.

source: 我々全員を子供と呼んだのです 言葉の綾です
references: ["I believe he's calling all of us children. Figure of speech."]
hypothesis: He called us all children. It's a figure of speech.

source: 言葉の綾というやつなのね？
references: ['So, it was a figure of speech?']
hypothesis: It's called a figure of speech, isn't it?

source: それは言葉の綾か？
references: ['Is that another figure of speech?']
hypothesis: Is that a figure of speech?

source: お父上も言葉を濁すことはなかった
references: ['Your father never minced words either.']
hypothesis: Your father didn't mince words either.

source: お言葉を返すようだが 失せろ
references: ['All due respect, screw you.']
hypothesis: With all due respect, get lost.

source: 言葉を返せば 相手が消えても 反応する
references: ["That also means you notice when they're not there."]
hypothesis: If you say something back to them, even if they're gone, they'll still respond.

source: どう言葉を飾ろおと 奴の目的は この世界の破壊だ
references: ['And whether or not he admits it, his mission is global destruction.']
hypothesis: Whatever his words may be, his goal is the destruction of this world.

source: おまえは冷ややかで 計算高いよ
references: ['You were cold and calculating.']
hypothesis: You're cold and calculating.

source: 計算高い　恐いんだ
references: ["She's insanely jealous, she's irrational, and I'm frightened of her."]
hypothesis: He's calculating. He's scared.

source: 計算高く 特に 犠牲を厭わないことが必要なのだと
references: ['calculating, and most of all... willing to sacrifice.']
hypothesis: It is necessary to be calculating and especially willing to make sacrifices.

source: バービーの身の証を 立てられるのは私だけよ
references: ["I'm the only one who can exonerate Barbie."]
hypothesis: I'm the only one who can vouch for Barbie.

source: それでお前を送って 詫びを入れてるわけか？
references: ['The man sends you to make his apologies?']
hypothesis: So they send you over to make their apologies?

source: 詰まる所 これは仕事さ
references: ["And that at the end of the day, it's a job as most jobs are."]
hypothesis: After all, it's my job.

source: 詰まる所 ジョンは 君をとても愛してるんだ この世の何よりも 君を失くして バラバラになっている
references: ["(SIGHS) Look, John loves you very much, more than anything in the world, and he's falling to fucking pieces without you."]
hypothesis: The bottom line is that John loves you very much, more than anything in the world, and he's falling apart without you.

source: 君は 話が分かりそうだ
references: ["Maybe you can talk some sense into these people's."]
hypothesis: You seem like you know what you're talking about.

source: 話が合うよ
references: ["For you, I think they'd make an exception."]
hypothesis: We'll talk.

source: 話が合ってきましたね
references: ["Now you're speaking my language."]
hypothesis: I think we're getting to the point.

source: ここから数マイルの所でね 君たちと話が合うかもしれん
references: ['Yeah, he lives a few miles from here. He may be able to help you.']
hypothesis: It's just a few miles from here. I think you and I might be on the same page.

source: 思いがけなく会えた母親と 話が弾んでいたのだろう
references: ["I'm sure he's just... Spending a little quality time with his mother."]
hypothesis: He must have been talking with his mother, whom he never expected to see.

source: その通り 話が早いですね
references: ['Yes. We understand each other very well.']
hypothesis: That's right. You're talking fast.

source: 話が早くていい
references: ['We appreciate your discretion, as always.']
hypothesis: I like to talk fast.

source: プリンスさんのおかげで 話が早い
references: ['Their presence has been decisive, Mister Prince, to encourage her.']
hypothesis: Thanks to Mr. Prince, we're talking fast.

source: 話が違います あのとき全ての...
references: ["That's not what you said. you said all..."]
hypothesis: No, that's not what I'm talking about.

source: 鳥と人間は話が違うよ
references: ["Recently dead bird? That's one thing. Dead person?"]
hypothesis: Birds and people are not the same story.

source: 話にならない 私は・・・
references: ["That's ridiculous. I can't be expected to..."]
hypothesis: I can't talk about it. I'm not...

source: あなたじゃ話にならない 腹ペコよ
references: ["You won't let me do anything and I'm so hungry."]
hypothesis: You're not helping. I'm starving.

source: 正気じゃない それは話にならない
references: ["You're out of your mind. No way. That's out of the question."]
hypothesis: That's insane. That's not what I'm talking about.

source: ...テレビを見ているようなら ここには世話にならない
references: ["If he's gonna be sitting around... we're taking him out of here."]
hypothesis: ... If you're watching TV, you won't be taken care of here.

source: よし　話に乗る
references: ["OK, I'll bite."]
hypothesis: All right, I'll take you up on it.

source: デネットは話に乗った
references: ["Dennett's on board."]
hypothesis: Dennett was on board.

source: もっと大きな声で そしたら話に乗ろう
references: ['A bit louder, my dear, and we can dance to it.']
hypothesis: Louder, and then we'll talk.

source: 伺って 話を詰めてきてください
references: ['Go talk to them and finalize the deal.']
hypothesis: Go and talk to them and finalize the story.

source: （仲谷）お２人には もう少し 話を詰めてから お伝えします
references: ["I'll let you know after we've talked more."]
hypothesis: （I'll let you know after we've talked a little more.

source: 実は今 ﾌｫｽﾀｰの極東ｴﾘｱﾏﾈｰｼﾞｬｰと 会って話を詰めてるんだが
references: ["I'm meeting with Foster's Far East Area Manager and working out some details."]
hypothesis: Actually, I'm in the process of meeting with Foster's Far East Area Manager to finalize the deal.

source: - 調べがついたところじゃ 家族を失って　彼はひどく荒み
references: ['- Well,based on we could find, he was so devastated losing his family,']
hypothesis: - From what I've been able to find out, he's had a rough time of it, losing his family.

source: 奴が自分じゃ買えない物を全部買うために 君から金を借りたことは　２分で調べがついた
references: ["Well, it took us all of two minutes to find out he borrowed money from you, to buy all that stuff he really couldn't afford."]
hypothesis: It took me two minutes to find out that he borrowed money from you to buy all those things he couldn't afford himself.

source: 調子がいいサインだよ ジェームスにとってはね
references: ["Good sign, actually. Means he's stoked."]
hypothesis: It's a good sign that things are going well, for James.

source: 今夜は調子がいいな オレはちょっとトイレまで
references: ["You're having a good night. Mm-hmm. Okay, I am now gonna take the long walk to the little boy's room."]
hypothesis: You're looking good tonight. I'm just gonna go to the bathroom.

source: 僕は　君と一緒にいた方が　調子がいい
references: ['I am... better with you, Watson.']
hypothesis: I'm in better shape with you.

source: 席は１つだけだ 調子に乗るなよ マリア
references: ["You get one of those as captain, but don't push your luck, Maria."]
hypothesis: There's only one seat. Don't get carried away, Maria.

source: 証拠はない 調子に乗るな
references: ["No proof, but you're not innocent yet! So let me defend you and stay quiet..."]
hypothesis: There's no proof. Don't get carried away.

source: 2,3分は調子を合わせるんです でも... すぐに仕事に戻りました
references: ["And he'd play along for a few minutes, but... then he'd leave for work."]
hypothesis: We'd set the tone for a few minutes, but... I went right back to work.

source: それで なんで調子を合わせる フィンチ?
references: ["So why'd you even play along, Finch?"]
hypothesis: So why even tune in, Finch?

source: 君と私は長い間友情をもってやってきた、 触れることなく、だが音のように、 いつも君に心の調子を合わせていると感じていた。
references: ['You and I went so long in our friendship without ever touching, yet I always felt attuned to you.']
hypothesis: You and I have had a long friendship, untouchable, but sound, and I have always felt in tune with you.

source: とにかく... 論より証拠だ
references: ['Anyway, the proof is in the pudding.']
hypothesis: Anyway... Proof is better than argument.

source: 諸刃の剣だよ
references: ["Perception's a tool that's pointed on both ends."]
hypothesis: It's a double-edged sword.

source: 張り込みでの水分補給は どっちみち諸刃の剣だ
references: ['Hydrating on a stakeout is a double-edged sword anyway.']
hypothesis: Hydrating on a stakeout is a double-edged sword anyway.

source: 我々は諸手を挙げて賛成する
references: ['None of us had any problems with that.']
hypothesis: We agree unanimously.

source: 豹変したのだと　もっぱらの噂だ
references: ["People say he's changed."]
hypothesis: Rumor has it that he's changed.

source: 彼の目が 瞳が豹変して
references: ['His eyes were different.']
hypothesis: His eyes, his eyes, they changed.

source: 今、多くの軍は有るが その兵の 財布を握る者がいるので
references: ["Now we've got as many armies as there are men with gold in their purse."]
hypothesis: Now, there are many armies, but there are those who hold the purse strings of those soldiers.

source: - 上層部はあなたに責めを負わせたの？
references: ["They're letting you take the fall?"]
hypothesis: - Did upper management place the blame on you?

source: 爆破を仕掛けるのは　君だが 責めを負うのは　ＥＬＭだ
references: ['You get the blast, they get the blame.']
hypothesis: You set the bomb, but it's the ELM that's to blame.

source: 身代わりに　責めを負うこと
references: ['A scapegoat.']
hypothesis: To take the blame instead.

source: 君は責めを負う覚悟でいる 理由は 飛んで火に入る夏の虫の アダリンド親子を 逃がしたからで
references: ['You feel awful and take full responsibility for failing to stop Adalind and her child from slipping from your grasp and getting away, despite the fact that we had intercepted communications from Resistance agents, which gave you sufficient time to disrupt their plans.']
hypothesis: You're prepared to take the blame because you let Adalind and her son, the summer bugs, fly into the fire.

source: 汚れ役を買って出なきゃ いけなかったりもすると思うの
references: ['I think it means you might have to take on the dirty job at times.']
hypothesis: I think sometimes you have to play the dirty.

source: 会社が買って出た？
references: ['Harbinger sponsored that?']
hypothesis: Did the company buy it?

source: 金のためなら　患者を どんな危険な目に遭わせようと→ オペを買って出る。
references: ['She volunteers to take on any operation for money, no matter how great the risk to the patient.']
hypothesis: For the sake of money, he would go out of his way to perform operations, no matter the risks to the patient.

source: 顔が赤くなるわ・・・
references: ["You got me blushing' 'til I..."]
hypothesis: I'm blushing...

source: 赤子の手をねじるようなもの
references: ["It's child play."]
hypothesis: like twisting a baby's hand

source: 赤子の手を捻るが如く 神がルシファーを倒したように 皆あなたに復讐するのよ
references: ["They will seek a vengeance on you that will make God striking down Lucifer seem like child's play."]
hypothesis: Like twisting the hand of a baby, they will all take their revenge on you, just as God took down Lucifer.

source: 今までにない 趣向を凝らしている
references: ['It is a spectacle unlike most have ever witnessed.']
hypothesis: It's a new twist on a classic.

source: 僕は趣向を凝らしてるんだ。
references: ["I'm trying different things."]
hypothesis: I'm trying to be quaint.

source: 相対性理論と量子論の 融合には不足があった
references: ["The equation couldn't reconcile relativity with quantum mechanics. You need more. More?"]
hypothesis: The fusion of relativity and quantum theory fell short.

source: リードのお嬢様は堅苦しくて冗談が通じない 地に足が付いてるのかしら
references: ["Lady Reed here's got a stick so far up her ass, it's a wonder her feet touch the ground."]
hypothesis: Reid's daughter is uptight and joking. I wonder if she has her feet on the ground.

source: あなたは足が付いている
references: ['They might be able to trace the reset signal back to you.']
hypothesis: You have legs.

source: だが 君から俺達に足が付くんじゃ？
references: ["Hang on. Wouldn't it be awful if it was traceable back to us?"]
hypothesis: But I thought you were going to trace it back to us.

source: ? ) 足が出て当然だ
references: ['No wonder he has issues.']
hypothesis: ? ) No wonder you have a leg up.

source: 足が出ない
references: ["But my feet wouldn't move."]
hypothesis: There's no foot out of place.

source: - 足が早いのは誰だ？
references: ["Whoever's the fastest runner. - Who is that? - I am."]
hypothesis: - Who's the fastest on his feet?

source: ケスラーみたいな輩は 逃げ足が早いんだ
references: ['The quieter we are, the better chance we have in getting him.']
hypothesis: People like Kessler, they're quick on the run.

source: 雷に撃たれて 足が早くなった青年よ
references: ['Struck by lighting? Was in a coma for nine months? Woke up being able to run faster than the speed of sound?']
hypothesis: He's a young man who was struck by lightning and became very fast.

source: 足が速い以外に、何か 特技があるといいけど。
references: ["I hope you're bringing more to the table than just quick reflexes."]
hypothesis: I hope he has some other skills besides being fast.

source: 逃げ足が速い！ ！ ？
references: ["They're getting away!"]
hypothesis: Fast on the run! ! ?

source: 我々にはある言い伝えがあった 足が速く．．． 雪のように白い．．．
references: ["There's a prophecy that tells of a creature, swift of foot white as snow."]
hypothesis: We had a legend, fast on our feet ... white as snow ... White as snow...

source: 海岸は　完全に開放され 世界でも有数の美しい景色が楽しめます この痛ましい事件ひとつのために 人々の足が遠のかないことを願っています
references: ["The beaches are fully opened, it's a beautiful part of the world and... we hope people aren't put off coming by this... tragic, yet isolated event."]
hypothesis: The coast is completely open and offers some of the most beautiful scenery in the world, and I hope this one tragic incident doesn't keep people away.

source: あぁ... 足が重いわ...
references: ['Fuck, my feet are killing me.']
hypothesis: Oh... My legs are so heavy...

source: それぞれに足を入れろ　エリック
references: ['One for each leg, Eric.']
hypothesis: Put your foot in each one, Eric.

source: 彼が足を入れた場所に 薬の痕跡が残ってたから
references: ['There are still tiny traces of it in the trainers from where he put the cream on his feet.']
hypothesis: I found traces of drugs where he'd put his foot.

source: 封筒には ウサギの足を入れた
references: ["So I put my rabbit's foot in that package."]
hypothesis: I put a rabbit's foot in the envelope.

source: 奴が絨毯に足を取られて
references: ['His foot got caught in the shag throw.']
hypothesis: He got his feet caught in the carpet.

source: 僕の足を引っ張りに 席のあるうちに行かなきゃ!
references: ['Daniel brought in Chad to backstab me-- oh, I mean help me-- and I gotta get to work before he helps me out of a job.']
hypothesis: You're pulling my leg. I gotta go while there's still seats available!

source: 足を引っ張るな
references: ["To me you're dead weight."]
hypothesis: Don't drag your feet.

source: ゲームがこの子の 足を引っ張ってるね
references: ['Because of this gaming, it pulled him right down.']
hypothesis: I see the game is dragging this girl down.

source: 私は書斎から出てきたことはないし 彼女も階段で足を止めたことなどない
references: ['I never left my study. Never stopped her on the stairs.']
hypothesis: I never came out of my study, and she never stopped on the stairs.

source: バギンズ殿 足を止めるんじゃない
references: ['Master Baggins... I suggest you keep up.']
hypothesis: Mister Baggins, don't stop.

source: 足を止めろ
references: ['You got to stop tapping.']
hypothesis: Hold your feet.

source: 足を洗うんだ 友達は殺された
references: ["Don't do the job."]
hypothesis: Get out of the way. They killed my friends.

source: 俺は汚いビジネスから 足を洗うよ
references: ["I'm gonna wash my hands of our dirty little business."]
hypothesis: I'm getting out of the dirty business.

source: １週間前は 足を洗うと言ってただろ
references: ['A week ago you talked like you were all ready to hang it up.']
hypothesis: A week ago, you said you were going to wash your feet.

source: 多くの吸血鬼が自分の領土に足を踏み入れたように 多くのクイートも戻ってきた
references: ['As more vampires set foot in their territory, more Quileutes turned.']
hypothesis: Just as many vampires have stepped into their territory, many quiets have returned.

source: このアントンは うんざりする男だ 地獄の王国に足を踏み入れた
references: ['This Anton... he may have been a skeevy bloke, but he had a toe in the nether realm, all right.']
hypothesis: This Anton is a disgusting man who has set foot in the kingdom of hell.

source: 可愛い天才君が 足を踏み入れたんだろ 役員会の連中は 歓迎したか？
references: ['Did you walk in there, do your adorable boy genius thing, and the board of directors was less than impressed?']
hypothesis: I'm sure you're a cute little genius, you put your foot down, and the board of directors welcomed you with open arms, huh?

source: 「ヴィン、こんなはした金のために、 オレにここまで足を運ばせないでくれ」
references: ["Vin, don't make me have to come down here again for this."]
hypothesis: "Vin, don't make me travel all this way for a pittance.

source: ブログでフラッシュの 活躍を読んでー 今まで事件現場に足を運んだ
references: ["I read your friend Iris' blog post on The Flash, and I visited all the crime scenes you fought at."]
hypothesis: I've been reading about The Flash's exploits on your blog, and I've been to the crime scene.

source: 彼にこれ以上足元を見ることを許さず 自分の好意を証明した
references: ['You demonstrated your goodwill without allowing him to take further advantage.']
hypothesis: I proved my goodwill by not allowing him to find his feet any further.

source: 足元を見て歩いて
references: ["Woman: How 'bout, this time, you watch where you're going?"]
hypothesis: Watch your step and walk.

source: 足元を見な
references: ['Thanks for dropping by.']
hypothesis: Watch your step.

source: ロビーが足場を固め バッターボックスに入ります
references: ["- That's the name. Robby digs in and we're under way."]
hypothesis: Robby gets his footing and steps into the batter's box.

source: この国はその足場を 失う危険があった
references: ['This country has always been in danger of losing its footing.']
hypothesis: This country was in danger of losing its foothold.

source: 気を付けて 馬が足場を失う
references: ['Careful. Your horse could have lost its footing.']
hypothesis: Careful, the horse is losing its footing.

source: 私の隊を送ったが ドイツ軍に足止めを食らっている
references: ['Jerry took them out.']
hypothesis: I sent my troops, but the Germans are holding us up.

source: うちらがアウター・リムで足止めを食らった
references: ['We have been stranded out here without any help at all.']
hypothesis: We were stranded on the Outer Rim.

source: 船が故障して 直るまで 足止めを食らってるのよ
references: ["Our ship was damaged, and we're stranded here until we can repair it."]
hypothesis: The boat broke down and we're stranded here until it's fixed.

source: 謙譲と美徳を足蹴にしているのだ
references: ['Violating and humiliating Charity and Virtue.']
hypothesis: They're kicking humility and virtue in the foot.

source: 6ドルじゃ路頭に迷う
references: ['Six dollars an hour puts my family on the street.']
hypothesis: Six bucks will put you on the street.

source: 俺がいなきゃ姉一家は路頭に迷ってた ―そうなの？
references: ["If I wasn't there, they'd be on the street."]
hypothesis: Without me, my sister and her family would be on the street. - Really?

source: 我々 メガバンクは 絶対に つぶれてはいけないんだ それだけは死守せねばならない もし つぶれでもしたら 何百万人 何千万人が 路頭に迷うか 分かってますか？
references: ['Our mega-bank cannot collapse. do you know how many millions of people will be out in the cold? some sacrifice is inevitable.']
hypothesis: We, the mega banks, must not go under, and we must defend that to the death, because if we do, do you know how many millions and tens of millions of people will be out in the cold?

source: 誰かがすでに盗んでた たぶん 誰かが 捕まえるのに躍起になってる
references: ["Someone had already jacked it, perhaps someone who's out to get him."]
hypothesis: Someone's already stolen it, and maybe someone's out to get them.

source: 小さな町で行方不明の女の子 皆が躍起になって探す
references: ['Missing girl in a small town would throw up all kinds of red flags.']
hypothesis: A missing girl in a small town, and everyone's on the prowl to find her.

source: あんたの部下が　この電話を辿ろうと 躍起になってるなら 落ち着くように言ってくれ
references: ['If your men are scrambling to trace this call, you can tell them to relax.']
hypothesis: If your man is scrambling to trace this call, tell him to calm down.

source: 俺は不死身になり 強大な力を得た
references: ["Now I'm immortal and supercharged!"]
hypothesis: I became immortal and powerful.

source: 身に余るご紹介を　どうも
references: ['My thanks, Mr. McCabe, you are too kind.']
hypothesis: Thank you very much for the uninviting introduction.

source: 身に余る光栄です 違う。
references: ["We don't deserve this honor."]
hypothesis: I am honored beyond measure.

source: 身も蓋もないが 仕方が無い
references: ["There's no great way to say this, so I'll just say it."]
hypothesis: It's a little blunt, but it's what we do.

source: "穏やかな夜に 身を任せるな"
references: ['Do not go gentle into that good night']
hypothesis: "Don't let the calm of the night take hold of you."

source: 気高い貴方に恥知らずに身を任せた
references: ['Flee from the corpse of one who unworthily gave herself to a man of honour']
hypothesis: I gave myself shamelessly to you, the noble one.

source: 見知らぬ者は二月初めに来た... ある冬の日... 身を切るような風と 雪が降る中
references: ['"The stranger came early in February... one wintry day... through a biting wind and a driving snow.']
hypothesis: The stranger came in early February... One winter's day... With a biting wind and falling snow.

source: （吉森） 岩崎先生が身を削って 作りあげたものは お前たちそのものだ ！
references: ['The thing that Iwazaki created at his own expense... Is YOU people!']
hypothesis: （What Iwasaki Sensei has devoted himself to creating is you people!

source: 〈身を削ってる〉
references: ['[Seth] ...for better or worse.']
hypothesis: He's cutting himself thin.

source: ついにジェイソンも 身を固めるか？
references: ['So is this it? She the one gonna take jason stackhouse Off the market for good?']
hypothesis: Is Jason finally going to take a stand?

source: 長男がついに身を固めた
references: ['My elder son is finally taken!']
hypothesis: My oldest son finally settled himself.

source: どこに身を寄せた
references: ["Where'd you go? Who took you in?"]
hypothesis: Where did you find shelter?

source: 各地から逃れたドゥネダインが- タウアディルに身を寄せた
references: ['Taurdal filled as many of the Dúnedain fled their homes and sought safety in numbers.']
hypothesis: The Dúnedain, who had fled from various places, took refuge in Tauadir.

source: 私に身を寄せなければ 安全じゃない
references: ["And now I know my son is not safe unless he's by my side."]
hypothesis: You're not safe unless you huddle with me.

source: 人というのは　自分が許してしまえば ここまで深く 身を沈めてしまうのだと 思い出させるために
references: ['It reminds me of the depths to which a man can sink if he lets himself.']
hypothesis: To remind us that people can sink so deep into themselves if they allow themselves to.

source: これは議論じゃあない まるでグリルで身を焼かれるようだ
references: ["No, this isn't a discussion, it's a grilling."]
hypothesis: This isn't an argument, it's like being roasted on a grill.

source: お前自身を焼き尽くすのだ
references: ["It's gonna burn you out."]
hypothesis: Burn yourself.

source: 大変だな・・ 男社会で身を立てて行くのは
references: ["Amazing... what one has to do to get ahead in a man's world."]
hypothesis: It's tough... to make it in a man's world.

source: しかし　あんたが消えた後も 俺は舞台にいて 演劇で身を立てて 情熱を燃やし 複雑な感情と闘う それが演劇ってもんだ
references: ["But long after you're gone, I'll be on that stage... earning my living, baring my soul, wrestling with complex emotions, 'cause that's what we do."]
hypothesis: But after you're gone, I'll still be on stage, making a living at it, fighting my passions, fighting my complex emotions, and that's what theater is all about.

source: 家族のために 身を粉にしてる
references: ["You're slaving away so you can give us a good life."]
hypothesis: I'm willing to put my life on the line for my family.

source: どこで犯罪者に 身を落としたのかな
references: ['I mean, what do you think it is that makes them who they are?']
hypothesis: Where did he stoop to becoming a criminal?

source: もう依頼人でも無い人のために あなたが身銭を切る 義務も無いのよ
references: ["Nor are you obligated to spend your savings on behalf of someone who's no longer your client."]
hypothesis: You're no longer obligated to spend your money on behalf of someone who's not even your client.

source: どのように奇妙な 私はルシファーが軌道に乗ることができない
references: ["How strange I can't get Calcifer going"]
hypothesis: How strange I can't get Lucifer to stay on track

source: ラグランジュポイントを越えて軌道に乗るよ、 無事に、ハーシェル(火星のクレーター)へ。
references: ["The trajectory will take it beyond the Lagrange point so that it doesn't hit Herschel."]
hypothesis: I'll orbit past the Lagrange point, safe and sound, into Herschel (a crater on Mars).

source: 一連のすべてが軌道に乗ってるか... 評価したいだけだ
references: ['I am merely trying to assess just how close this train is hugging the tracks.']
hypothesis: Is everything in the series on track or... I'm just trying to evaluate.

source: おい 軽口を叩くな
references: ['Hey, Earl, have some fucking respect, okay?']
hypothesis: Hey, don't talk so easy.

source: アーノルドと同じ轍を踏むな
references: ["You mustn't make Arnold's mistake."]
hypothesis: Don't make the same mistake as Arnold.

source: 導かれる答えは一つ... だが 昨夜と同じ轍を踏まないように より多くの情報を収集した― ゆえに 遅れたわけだ
references: ["The clues point in one direction, but to avoid repeating last night's debacle I was obliged to collect more sufficient data, hence my tardiness."]
hypothesis: Which can only lead to one answer... But to avoid making the same mistake I made last night, I gathered more information, hence the delay.

source: まるで -- 辻褄が合わない
references: ["It looks like-- It doesn't add up."]
hypothesis: As if -- it doesn't add up.

source: 辻褄が合わないわ
references: ['And it makes no sense.']
hypothesis: It doesn't add up.

source: "そうか" じゃ無い 辻褄が合わない
references: ["No, no, not okay, it doesn't make sense."]
hypothesis: No, it doesn't. It doesn't add up.

source: もしそうなら、どのように辻褄を合わせますか あなたの医師兼トレーナーが ドーピングに関わっていることについては？
references: ['And if so, how do you reconcile that with your doctor/trainer being so associated with doping?']
hypothesis: If so, how do you reconcile that with your doctor/trainer's involvement in doping?

source: 返す言葉がないね
references: ['Well, what can I say to that?']
hypothesis: I don't know what to say in return.

source: そう言われたら 返す言葉がないわ そういうことさ
references: ["- Then there's nothing I can say."]
hypothesis: I don't know what to say to that. That's what I meant.

source: 迷える羊の捜索は あんたに任せるよ
references: ["I'll leave you to track down your lost sheep."]
hypothesis: I'll leave it to you to find the lost sheep.

source: 迷宮入り事件を調べるように言え
references: ['Tell him to go over cold cases.']
hypothesis: Tell them to look into cold cases.

source: 無線を切って　その迷宮入りの件の調査を 俺のとこに送ってくれ
references: ['Sign off on the cold cases, and have them sent to me. Right.']
hypothesis: Turn off the radio and send that cold case investigation to me.

source: 全部迷宮入り事件だ
references: ['Cold cases.']
hypothesis: They're all cold cases.

source: つまり 悲しみに打ちひしがれる家族に 追い討ちを掛ける訳だ
references: ["So he returns to feed off the grief he's caused by blinding his victims."]
hypothesis: I mean, it's a way to catch up with a grieving family.

source: 逃がした魚は大きいですよ
references: ["You don't know what you're missing."]
hypothesis: The fish that got away are big.

source: あっ そうか　悪かった 逃がした魚は大きいぞ
references: ['Oh. Yeah, okay, yeah. Too bad.']
hypothesis: Oh, yeah. My bad. You missed a big fish.

source: 逃がした魚は大きいわ
references: ['The one that got away.']
hypothesis: The fish that got away is big.

source: きっと　逃げるが勝ちと 考えたんだろう
references: ["Guess he figured discretion's the better part of valor."]
hypothesis: They probably thought that running away was the way to go.

source: 私は逃げも隠れもしない
references: ["I don't believe in the hidden ball trick."]
hypothesis: I will not run and hide.

source: 俺は逃げも隠れもしない
references: ["I won't run and hide, you understand?"]
hypothesis: I won't run and hide.

source: 逃げも隠れもしない
references: ["I'm right here."]
hypothesis: There is no running away or hiding.

source: 私が笑いかけても 逃げ腰になるの
references: ['He starts backing away if I even smile at him.']
hypothesis: I try to smile at him, but he just runs away.

source: 逃げ腰にならなくてもいいよ ワイリーがセキュリティー面は
references: ["Don't be defeatist."]
hypothesis: You don't have to be a runner. Wylie has the security aspect.

source: いざ愛を告白されると 逃げ腰になる
references: ['I mean, why is it that we all need to be loved but then when somebody finally says, "I love you," people just run scared.']
hypothesis: When it comes time to confess your love, you run away from it.

source: ゴルゴ13じゃねえんだから 逆立ちしても お前には無理だ
references: ["Riggs, there ain't but three shooters in the whole damn world who can make that shot, and you ain't one of 'em!"]
hypothesis: I ain't Golgo 13. I don't care if I stand on my head, you can't do it.

source: 途方に暮れてる
references: ['clueless on the floor.']
hypothesis: I'm at a loss.

source: 俺は 見たくない お前が イラつき 途方に暮れる姿を...
references: ["I don't wanna see you wake up one day all old and pissed off realising you're lost."]
hypothesis: I don't want to see you frustrated, confused...

source: 息子のことで途方に 暮れてるシングル・マザーだった 彼は何度も逃げて 学校から追放され内向的になっていた
references: ["A single mother at her wits' end about her son, a thieving introvert expelled from school because he kept running away,"]
hypothesis: She was a single mother at her wits' end about her son, who had run away a lot, been expelled from school, and had become an introvert.

source: 明るい見通しを持てないというのなら 心臓を調べてもらったほうがいいでしょう。 なぜなら、途方もない見事な素晴らしい猛然と突き進む、 この世界の人々の集団が、何とかしようと 取り組んでいるのですから。
references: ['because there is an extraordinary, beautiful, gorgeus, fierce group of people in this world, who are taking this on.']
hypothesis: If you say you don't have a bright outlook, you might want to have your heart checked. Because there is a tremendous, brilliant, wonderful, furious group of people in this world who are working to do something about it.

source: やっぱり全世界一 セクシーなのは... 途方もない銃を 持つ美女だな
references: ['There is nothing more sexy in the whole world than a beautiful woman with an incredible gun.']
hypothesis: I knew it. The sexiest woman in the whole world is... The sexiest woman in the whole world is a beautiful woman with a tremendous gun.

source: -　サットンは途方もない悪だった
references: ['- Sutton was a much greater evil. - Was?']
hypothesis: - Sutton was tremendously evil.

source: これは途轍もない大きさです ここ、カリフォルニアで 東海岸でも感じられるでしょう
references: ["It will be so big that even though it's happening here in California you will feel it on the East Coast."]
hypothesis: It's a tremendous magnitude, and you can feel it right here in California, right on the East Coast.

source: ミュージカルへの投資には危険が伴う だけどヒットすれば 見返りは途轍もなく大きい
references: ["Investing in a musical can be risky, but when a show hits, there's literally no limit to the return."]
hypothesis: Investing in a musical is risky, but if it's a hit, the payoff can be tremendous.

source: ジョージ・ラズレ エイリアン ハンター 通りがいいのは UFO研究家です
references: ['George Lazure, alien hunter. Or if you prefer, ufologist.']
hypothesis: George Lazure, alien hunter, and, more conveniently, UFO researcher.

source: 遅かれ早かれ彼らは 正面を向くだろう
references: ["Oh, they'll swing around to the front sooner or later."]
hypothesis: Sooner or later, they'll turn to face the front.

source: 遅かれ早かれ したくない事でも やることになるわ
references: ["You know, sooner or later, you're gonna have to do something for them you don't want to."]
hypothesis: Sooner or later, you're gonna have to do something you don't want to do.

source: 私たちはビルに居て静かにできるわ でも　遅かれ早かれ私たちは彼らを 引っ張りだすつもりよ
references: ["We can stay close to the buildings and keep quiet, but sooner or later, we're gonna be drawing 'em."]
hypothesis: We can stay in the building and be quiet, but sooner or later we're going to pull them out.

source: 運が向いてきたようね
references: ['- You ready for me to make your day?']
hypothesis: Looks like your luck is turning.

source: 俺を欲しがってる 運が向いてきたぜ！
references: ["They want me. We're going to the big time!"]
hypothesis: They want me. I'm getting lucky, man!

source: - 続けてれば運が向くかも
references: ['- Stay on it. We might get lucky.']
hypothesis: - Keep at it, and maybe you'll get lucky.

source: 運を天に任せるなんて したくないの...
references: ["I DON'T LIKE TO LEAVE MUCH TO CHANCE..."]
hypothesis: I don't want to leave anything to chance...

source: 隠し口座 見つけたとしても 全部 国税に持ってかれんで やるだけのことは やりました こうなったら後は 運を天に任せるしかありません
references: ["the Taxation Bureau's gonna snatch everything away. we'll have to leave the rest to fate."]
hypothesis: Even if they find the hidden account, the tax authorities will take it all away, so we've done all we can, and now we just have to leave the rest to chance.

source: 別動隊のおかげで道が開いた
references: ["Weaver's team has bought us a window. The road to the power plant's wide open. We're going in."]
hypothesis: A separate unit paved the way.

source: [遠くへの道が　開かれる]
references: ['Can possibly know how far they can go. "']
hypothesis: [a path to faraway places opens up]

source: 遺書を捜し出す そこから道が開けるでしょう
references: ["I'm gonna try to find the will, and then we'll take it from there."]
hypothesis: We'll find the will, and that's where we'll start.

source: 音を聞いて 本を読めば 僕らの道が開ける
references: ["Sort some sounds and read the books, and we'll be on our way."]
hypothesis: Listen to the sounds, read the books, and we'll be on our way.

source: あそこまで道を付けるのに ２人で必要だ
references: ['- I need two bodies to help clear a route over there.']
hypothesis: It's gonna take two of us to clear a path up there.

source: 還暦ですか
references: ['-Otherwise... -Retired?']
hypothesis: Is it the 60th birthday?

source: 郷に入っては郷に従えだ
references: ['I prefer to work with people who know the area.']
hypothesis: When in Rome, do as the Romans do.

source: 『郷に入っては郷に従え』よ！
references: ['do as the Romans do!']
hypothesis: When in Rome, do as the Romans do!

source: 人のニーズに 重きを置いてます 鎮痛薬 Pain relief.
references: ['What we like to focus on is what people really need, pain relief.']
hypothesis: We focus on the needs of people with pain relief.

source: あなたが映画に重きを置くのが 気掛かりで・・・
references: ["I am a little concerned at the importance you're placing on movies."]
hypothesis: I'm concerned that you're putting so much emphasis on the movies.

source: ヤツとキャリーが安全な場所で うまくやる可能性より そっちの方に重きを置いた方が いいと思う
references: ["I guess I'd weigh that against the likelihood of him and Carrie making it to the safe house at all."]
hypothesis: I think we should focus more on that than the likelihood that he and Carrie will make it to the safe house.

source: 大金が得られる
references: ['Access billions.']
hypothesis: You get a lot of money.

source: もし、こんな事をしてお金が 得られると思ってるんだったら とんでもない考え違いだわ
references: ["If you think you'll take this money, terribly wrong."]
hypothesis: If you think you're going to get paid for doing this, you're sorely mistaken.

source: 金に糸目を付けず、 修理中だ... ...メジャー並みの 設備になるぜ... ...何せ、ヤンキースとの 特別試合だからな
references: ["I'm gonna spare no expense in fixing it up and making it look like a big-league stadium because we're gonna play an exhibition game with the Yankees."]
hypothesis: They're repairing it... ... It's gonna be a major piece of equipment... ... It's a special game against the Yankees.

source: 彼はあなたがお金のある ロックスターだと知っていた お金のなる木だと
references: ['He knew you were a rock star with money and endless resources.']
hypothesis: He knew you were a rock star with money, a money tree.

source: ところで 金の成る木は育つかも知れないが まず見つけるのが難しいのでは？
references: ["Yeah, well money might grow on trees where you're from but it's a little harder to come by here."]
hypothesis: By the way, a golden tree might grow, but wouldn't it be hard to find one first?

source: ハッチは金のなる木でした
references: ['Hutch was the golden goose. He brought in hundreds']
hypothesis: Hatch was a money tree.

source: 金の切れ目が縁の切れ目だ
references: ['You run out of money, you run out of friends.']
hypothesis: money talks

source: もしも... 金回りがいいことを 怪しまれたら?
references: ['What if... they suspect you using money like crazy?']
hypothesis: What if... What if they suspect you have a good money situation?

source: だからこう言う資格があると思う そのイヴとは　金輪際　関わっちゃいけない
references: ["So I'm qualified when I say, you must cut this Eve out of your life entirely."]
hypothesis: So I think I'm qualified to say that you should never, ever have anything to do with that Eve.

source: あなたは このつまらぬ一座を 解散し 金輪際　魔女を
references: ['You disband this little merry troupe of assholes, vowing never to harm another witch from now until the end of time.']
hypothesis: You will disband this troupe of witches and never, ever again...

source: 金輪際、あの子はいない。
references: ['She most certainly is not.']
hypothesis: There's no golden goose, there's no girl like her.

source: 彼らは金魚の糞も同然で 彼女の"視た"解釈を そのまま受け止めるのよ
references: ["They're totally open to interpretation."]
hypothesis: They're like goldfish in the sand, they'll just take her interpretation of what they "see."

source: 誰が相手か 釘を刺しただけだ
references: ["I'm just saying they got to know that they're working for you."]
hypothesis: I'm just trying to nail down who we're dealing with.

source: しかもそれが具体化する事のないよう 念入りに釘を刺しておいた
references: ['Furthermore, I was given every assurance it never passed the planning stage.']
hypothesis: And I made sure it was nailed down so that it would never materialize.

source: 鉄のカーテンの向こう側と 同じような
references: ['THINKS SOMEONE DRESS BEHIND THE IRON CURTAIN.']
hypothesis: Like behind the Iron Curtain.

source: 鉄のカーテンの 内部を受け持つ 衛星４号と呼ばれる セクションにいた
references: ['He was also a planner in the section called Satellites 4, which operates behind the Iron Curtain.']
hypothesis: I was in a section called Satellite 4, which was responsible for the interior of the Iron Curtain.

source: あなたが暗殺者へ鉄槌を下すのを手伝えば エリアの正義を勝ち取ることを手伝う
references: ["You help me serve justice to the king's assassins and I will help you serve justice to Elia's."]
hypothesis: Help us bring down the hammer on the assassins, and we'll help you win justice in the area.

source: 僕は　悪魔のようなサイコパスに 正義の鉄槌を下したんだ
references: ['I gave an evil psychopath justice.']
hypothesis: I brought an evil psychopath to justice.

source: スジーマンスキー刑事は 事件の鍵を握ってる
references: ['Detective Szymanski is key to your case.']
hypothesis: Detective Szymanski is key to the case.

source: 誰にしろその人が― この試験の鍵を 握ってるのね 名乗り出てよ
references: ['Okay, whoever is holding out could be the key to cracking this exam, so you better speak up now.']
hypothesis: Whoever it is, he or she is the key to this test, so come forward.

source: （テレビの音声） では続いて次のニュースです ルモンド社 贈収賄事件を 捜査中の東京地方検察庁特捜部は 一連の事件の鍵を 握っているとみられる―
references: ["The Tokyo District Attorney's office special task force, investigating the Lumondo Corp. bribery has announced that they have questioned Sakichi Konuma president of Konuma Industries as a key witness"]
hypothesis: (TV sound) And now for our next story, the Tokyo District Public Prosecutor's Office special task force investigating the Le Monde bribery case is believed to hold the key to a series of events that could lead to the death of a man who has been accused of bribery.

source: 長い目で見れば全然
references: ['I mean, in the long run, at all; at all.']
hypothesis: Not at all in the long run.

source: 長い目で見れば 傷つけたくない　だから -
references: ["I don't want to hurt you in the long run, so--"]
hypothesis: I don't want to hurt you in the long run, so--

source: 誓って　長い目で見れば 君はこのことで僕に感謝するよ
references: ["I swear, in the long run, you're gonna thank me for this."]
hypothesis: I swear, in the long run, you'll thank me for this.

source: 新聞売店に君の写真が出て以来... 入隊の長蛇の列ができている。
references: ['The enlistment lines have been around the block since your picture hit the newsstands.']
hypothesis: Ever since your picture appeared on the newsstands... There is a long line of people waiting to enlist.

source: この"獣"には門外漢ゆえ
references: ["- I don't know what beast this is!"]
hypothesis: I'm not familiar with this beast.

source: ビジターに門戸を開くのは 良い事だな
references: ['Establishing ties with the Visitors is a good thing, Jack.']
hypothesis: It's good that you're opening your doors to the Visitors.

source: だからそう言うビジネスをやる予定なんだ 門戸を開いてね
references: ["I'm gonna form this business and I want everybody to get a shot."]
hypothesis: So that's the kind of business we're going to do. We're going to open our doors.

source: 興奮は冷めやりません 想像を超えた新しい世界へ 門戸を開くのです
references: ['Nothing can take away from the excitement... as we open our doors to a nation from beyond our imagination.']
hypothesis: The excitement never dies down as we open our doors to a new world beyond our imagination.

source: 店は閑古鳥が鳴いてる 連中はビルをすぐ手放すさ
references: ["It's like a ghost ship around here. They're gonna be begging to sell this place within a month."]
hypothesis: The place is deserted. They'll sell the building soon enough.

source: 学校には 閑古鳥が鳴いています 子供達を家庭に 保護するための 登校拒否が 急増しているからです
references: ['Schools stand like mausoleums, their attendance drastically declined, as parents keep their children safely home.']
hypothesis: Schools are deserted because of a sharp increase in the number of children refusing to go to school because they are being kept at home.

source: 閑古鳥が鳴いていた
references: ['A pretty rough drought this past year.']
hypothesis: It was deserted.

source: 今この瞬間がいいんだ
references: ['Best to take the moment present']
hypothesis: I just want this moment right now.

source: バリでの2週間がいい！
references: ['I want two weeks in Bali!']
hypothesis: Two weeks in Bali is good!

source: 間が悪かったか？
references: ['This a bad time?']
hypothesis: Bad time, huh?

source: お前の墓石には、 こう刻め、 "いつも場違いで、間が悪い"
references: ['On your tombstone it should read, "Always in the wrong place at the wrong time."']
hypothesis: On your tombstone, you will write, "Always in the wrong place, always in the wrong time."

source: 間が悪すぎる " Ｃ " に踊らされてるみたいだ
references: ["Not great timing for us, we're rather playing into C's hands."]
hypothesis: Too bad the timing is so bad, it's like being played by a "C".

source: ここの人間が 悪いと思ってると思うか？ 祖父母や曽祖父母が 手を汚したおかげだ
references: ["Their grandparents and their great grandparents, they're the ones who got their hands dirty."]
hypothesis: You think people here feel bad? It's because our grandparents and great-grandparents got their hands dirty.

source: 「終身刑になるのが関の山だ」
references: ['You get a life sentence for it.']
hypothesis: "You're looking at life in prison."

source: - オレみたいな男は... せいぜい成功者の下で 働くのが関の山なんだ 皆から愛されている 分かるだろ
references: ["- Guys like me... work their whole lives to be in something that's successful, that people like."]
hypothesis: - Guys like me... Men like me, we work for the best, the most successful people in the world, and they love us, you know what I mean?

source: 私を撃って真実を闇に葬るのか
references: ['Or you can shoot me and never know.']
hypothesis: You shoot me and leave the truth in the dark.

source: 君とウォルデンは隠蔽工作を 無人爆撃の件を闇に葬った
references: ['Only that you and Walden... went to great lengths once before to cover up the drone strike.']
hypothesis: You and Walden covered up the drone strike. You kept the drone strike a secret.

source: ２年前― この船の真実が 闇に葬られた
references: ['Well, two years ago, the elephant in the room was this scow.']
hypothesis: Two years ago, the truth about this ship was buried in the shadows.

source: 博物館じゃ、"阿吽の呼吸"だった
references: ['You and I had some pretty good teamwork back there at the... Whaling Museum.']
hypothesis: At the museum, it was "A-Un."

source: 可能な限りを尽くす
references: ['Whatever you can.']
hypothesis: to the best of one's ability

source: 持てる力の限りを尽くす
references: ["I'll do everything in my power to keep Nick away from my family."]
hypothesis: to the best of one's ability

source: 慈悲深き主よ 力の限りを尽くし アギーのテレビ受信を 改善したまえ
references: ["Dear merciful Lord, please do what you can to get a better reception for Aggy's TV."]
hypothesis: Lord in your mercy, do all in your power to improve Aggie's television reception.

source: 彼が誰が陰で糸を引いたか 知ってるか確認してくれ
references: ['Make sure he knows who pulled the strings.']
hypothesis: See if he knows who pulled the strings behind the scenes.

source: 誰かが陰で糸を引いてるなら
references: ["If someone's pulling their strings,"]
hypothesis: If someone is pulling strings behind the scenes.

source: 陰口を叩く者共はお前のおかげで助かった
references: ['You defend these men who insult you behind your back.']
hypothesis: Those of us who talk behind your back, you've saved the day.

source: 俺の陰口を叩いてくれてありがとう
references: ['Thanks for talking about me behind my back.']
hypothesis: Thanks for throwing my shade.

source: まるで紙上演習みたいに 額のシンボルまで 隅から隅まで酷似してる
references: ["It was like a-a dry run on paper, all the way down to the weird symbol that we found on the victim's forehead."]
hypothesis: It's like a paper exercise, down to the symbols on the forehead, every inch of it is exactly the same.

source: 隅から隅まで調べたが 何も・・・
references: ['Nothing. Our guys went over it from the last bit and pixel.']
hypothesis: I've been over every inch of this place. There's nothing...

source: 隅から隅まで調べるの
references: ['Leave no stone unturned, Dr. Hodgins.']
hypothesis: I'm going over every inch of it.

source: クックは鉱工業を隠れ蓑にして アジアをコントロールしてた
references: ['Cook used his mining empire as a cover to control the Asian franchise.']
hypothesis: Cook used the mining industry as a cover to control Asia.

source: 彼らを強くする秘訣― 「雨降って地固まる」
references: ['In order to make our agents stronger, we have to break them down to build them back up again.']
hypothesis: The secret to making them stronger - "When it rains, the ground hardens."

source: だけど雲泥の差!
references: ['But what a difference.']
hypothesis: But there is a difference!

source: 雲行きが怪しい
references: ['That storm on the horizon that I mentioned,']
hypothesis: things don't look good

source: 雲行きが怪しくなると 決まって入院するんだ
references: ['When the going gets rough he always checks into the hospital']
hypothesis: Whenever things get a little sketchy, he's admitted to the hospital.

source: 雲行きが怪しいな
references: ['Okay, this is getting a little weird.']
hypothesis: The clouds are getting thicker.

source: 雲行きが怪しいと 口にしたから-
references: ['That storm on the horizon that I mentioned--']
hypothesis: I said something about a cloud hanging over our heads.

source: ついてると思ってるか青二才？
references: ["the boy's pheromone level suggests he wants to mate with the female."]
hypothesis: You think you're lucky, greenhorn?

source: あなたが青写真を描いたとき、我々はかろうじて理解できる年齢でした。
references: ['We were barely old enough to drink when you sketched the blueprint.']
hypothesis: We were barely old enough to understand when you drew the blueprint.

source: 校長先生が青くなってる
references: ['I wonder why the principal looks so pale.']
hypothesis: The principal is turning blue.

source: 面が割れたのは　わたし
references: ['Nobody saw your face and I shot that dumb prick.']
hypothesis: I'm the one who cracked.

source: 面が割れたんだ
references: ["You've been compromised."]
hypothesis: I've lost face.

source: お前の面が割れてる
references: ['Oh, with your face being all over the news,']
hypothesis: Your face is cracked.

source: 小物なら一発だ 面の皮が 厚くなければね
references: ["It shouldn't damage the bastard unless its skin is thinner than ours."]
hypothesis: A small one would have a shot, if he wasn't so thick-skinned.

source: 後ろに戻って、クローンの 面倒を見て
references: ['Just get in the back and take care of the clones.']
hypothesis: Get back in there and take care of the clones.

source: 泊まりに来て欲しい時は　言ってね シャーリーンの面倒をみるわ
references: ['If you need me to stay over,keep you company... I can babysit charlaine.']
hypothesis: Let me know if you want me to come stay the night, and I'll take care of Charlene.

source: -　子供の面倒を見るべきです
references: ['- Is doing what children do best.']
hypothesis: - You should take care of your children.

source: お前の面倒をみるのは俺の仕事だ だから望む事に腹を立ててる
references: ["It's my job to get you through it. So you can be pissed off all you want."]
hypothesis: It's my job to take care of you, and you resent me for wanting to.

source: 閣下が面目を失われることは避けられません フリンク氏は必ずや逮捕され その時には閣下もお困りになることでしょう
references: ['I can do nothing about the loss of face you will suffer in connection with this as and when Mr. Frink is inevitably apprehended.']
hypothesis: It is inevitable that you will lose face, that Mr. Frink will be arrested, and when he is, you will be in trouble.

source: 何度もロブ・スタークに面目を潰されることは時間を消費する
references: ['Being repeatedly humiliated by Robb Stark is time-consuming.']
hypothesis: Being repeatedly humiliated in the face by Robb Stark is time consuming.

source: これで音を上げては 現場では働けないぞ
references: ["But if you think this is pressure, wait until you're out in the field."]
hypothesis: You can't work in the field if you make noises like this.

source: 音を上げさせようとした
references: ["Hoping he'd crack up, and just fuck off."]
hypothesis: I tried to get him to turn it up.

source: 音沙汰が無くなる この世から居なくなったみたいに
references: ['He goes silent like he fell off the face of the earth.']
hypothesis: I don't hear from you. It's like you've disappeared.

source: それにより音沙汰がなくなる
references: ["There's no word for this."]
hypothesis: That way you won't hear from them.

source: あまりにも長い間、音沙汰が無いので、心配していた。
references: ["We were worried when we didn't hear from you for so long."]
hypothesis: I was worried because I hadn't heard from him for so long.

source: 君達のボスとして 乾杯の音頭を取ろう
references: ['It falls upon me as your beloved boss to propose a toast.']
hypothesis: As your boss, I'd like to propose a toast.

source: 頭が上がらないようだな
references: ["Makes you wonder what's going on in that little head of hers."]
hypothesis: I can't seem to get my head around it.

source: 永遠に頭が上がらないわね
references: ['I am indebted to you forever.']
hypothesis: I'll forever be mad at you.

source: 俺は一生、 彼に頭が上がらないな
references: ["I expect I'll be in his debt for the rest of my life."]
hypothesis: I'll never be able to get my head out of his ass.

source: もし彼女がそれほど冷血でないのなら 頭が下がる思いよ
references: ["If she weren't so bloodless, you'd really have to take your hat off to her."]
hypothesis: If she wasn't so cold-blooded, I'd be bowled over.

source: そうだろうな、お前の戦略計画の 広範な経験には頭が下がるよ
references: ['Of course. We bow to your vast experience in strategic planning.']
hypothesis: I bet you do, and I bow to your extensive experience in strategic planning.

source: いいかい・・・ 君は頭が切れる
references: ["Look... you're a bright guy."]
hypothesis: Look... you're smart.

source: このグループは頭が切れる 彼らの行動を彼女は理解できない
references: ['These groups are clever, blinding her to their actions.']
hypothesis: This group is smart, and she can't figure out what they're doing.

source: 鎮痛薬を買いに出ていたんだ 頭が割れるようだった
references: ['I went out for some painkillers, my head was about to explode.']
hypothesis: I was out buying painkillers, my head was cracking open.

source: 彼はただ、ええと、頭が固い。
references: ["He's just, uh, not enlightened."]
hypothesis: He's just, uh, hard-headed.

source: なぜお前はそう頭が固いんだ
references: ['Must you always be so small-minded?']
hypothesis: Why are you so hard headed?

source: いかれて頭が固くなってるあの男を！ ？
references: ['A man whose idea of a romantic nightspot and an impenetrable fortress are the same thing.']
hypothesis: That man who is crazy and hard-headed! You know what?

source: 頭が痛くなりそうだよ
references: ["See, I'm going to get stuck now with that song."]
hypothesis: I'm getting a headache.

source: おととい資料もらってな クラス全員の名前と写真 ぜんぶ頭に入れたー
references: ["I got the teaching material 2 days ago. I have memorized all students' names and photos."]
hypothesis: I got all the information the day before yesterday, and I memorized all the names and pictures of everyone in the class.

source: ベニーの帽子を壊して 頭に来て攻撃しようとしてたら 彼が粉々になっちゃって 僕のせいじゃないけど 追われる事になって・・・
references: ["I was so livid that I attacked Tybalt and he ended up getting smashed, which wasn't my fault, and I was chased out."]
hypothesis: I broke Benny's hat, and I got mad, and I tried to attack him, and he got shattered, and it wasn't my fault, but I got chased, and...

source: 頭に来る 見てもらえるか？
references: ['Give it a rap, will ya? See if you could get it going for me.']
hypothesis: I'm pissed. Can you take a look?

source: ぶん殴ってやりたいよ 頭に来た
references: ["I'm going to blow this shit right off the mountain right now."]
hypothesis: I'd like to punch him in the face. I'm so mad.

source: 私は頭に血が上り 車に飛び乗った
references: ["So I'm pissed. And the clock is ticking, so I jump in my truck."]
hypothesis: I got mad and jumped in the car.

source: 彼女が望んだから あの娘は頭に血が上ってて
references: ["'Cause she wanted to. She lashes out."]
hypothesis: She wanted to. She's a little overzealous.

source: ロデリック なぜ修道士は 頭を剃るのだろう あんな風に？
references: ['Roderick why do you think them monks shave their heads like that?']
hypothesis: Roderick, why do you think the monks shave their heads like that?

source: 頭を剃るかもしれないって
references: ['He said they might have to shave my head.']
hypothesis: He said he might shave his head.

source: よし　頭を剃るアイディアに ついて語ろう
references: ["Now, let's talk about that shaved head idea."]
hypothesis: Okay, let's talk about the idea of shaving your head.

source: - 頭を下げて
references: ['- Bow your head.']
hypothesis: - Keep your head down.

source: 頭を下げてろ 武器を手に入れたらすぐに マウンテンに向かうぞ
references: ["As soon as we have the weapons, we'll make straight for the mountain"]
hypothesis: Keep your head down. As soon as we get our weapons, we're heading for the Mountain.

source: ゆっくり頭を下ろして
references: ['I want you to lay down nice and gently. Nice and gently.']
hypothesis: Put your head down slowly.

source: 頭を下ろして、大丈夫？
references: ['Head on down, okay?']
hypothesis: Put your head down, okay?

source: ただ頭を丸めただけだろ?
references: ['The hell did you shave your head for, fool!']
hypothesis: You just rolled your head, didn't you?

source: 頭を冷やしたほうがいいと 思うので。
references: ["I think it's better (when he's) cooled off. A certain somebody."]
hypothesis: I think we should cool our heads.

source: 頭を切り換えられなかったんだ
references: ["It's me, I couldn't get out of my head."]
hypothesis: I couldn't get my head around it.

source: 頭を切り替えましょう
references: ['You need to disconnect, Boss.']
hypothesis: Let's switch heads.

source: 先ず あなた方が 頭を切り替え "仕分け達人"になるの
references: ['So, first we will be installing and training you on a system that we\'re calling, "The Wizard."']
hypothesis: First, you need to change your mind and become a master sorter.

source: 頭を切り替えようとしても
references: ['I keep turning things around in my mind.']
hypothesis: I'm trying to get my head out of my ass.

source: 君は 王族の人間関係に― 頭を 悩ますべきではない
references: ["But you shouldn't bother your pretty little head about all this royal intrigue."]
hypothesis: You shouldn't have to worry about royal relationships.

source: 考えても見ろ どこに 頭を抱える必要がある？
references: ["Think about it. When I'm studying for the bar and you're writing your thesis this is the shit we're gonna think about."]
hypothesis: Think about it, where do you need to get your head out of your ass?

source: 命を奪うことに ...夢中にっていた、だが僕は、... 命を生み出すという事で頭を抱えて悩んでいる。
references: ["I've been so preoccupied with taking a life, I'm, uh... having trouble wrapping my head around making one."]
hypothesis: I was obsessed with taking a life... I was obsessed, but I ... I'm having trouble wrapping my head around the idea of creating life.

source: 頭を振って？
references: ['Just nod your head? Baby?']
hypothesis: Shake your head?

source: 頭を振るだけでも？
references: ['Can you just nod your head, baby?']
hypothesis: Even if you just shake your head?

source: - 頭を振るな
references: ["Don't turn your head!"]
hypothesis: - Don't shake your head.

source: ２ポンドでも 頭を痛めてるのに
references: ["4 pounds, as if 2 pounds wasn't bad enough."]
hypothesis: I mean, two pounds is a lot to wrap your head around.

source: 頭を痛めるとしたら 長引いてる あなたの捜査よ
references: ["Yours,however,could take a turn for the worse if you don't wrap up this investigation."]
hypothesis: If anyone's head hurts, it's yours for the taking.

source: 今　この国が最も 頭を痛めてる問題は？
references: ['What bugs you the most about this country?']
hypothesis: What's the most vexing issue facing this country right now?

source: スズメバチの巣に 頭を突っ込んだ
references: ['Stoved his head in a hornets nest']
hypothesis: I stuck my head in a hornet's nest.

source: だが その年寄りだけが 頼みの綱なんだろう
references: ["This old man's all you've got. You know that and I know that."]
hypothesis: But I guess the old man is our only hope.

source: 魔法使いの頼みの綱だ
references: ["It's a wizard's bread and butter, really."]
hypothesis: It's what wizards ask for.

source: だといい　頼みの綱だ
references: ['I hope so. My best chance of getting back home.']
hypothesis: I hope so. I'm counting on you.

source: 三十六国に顔が利くだろう？
references: ["Aren't you close to the thirty-six nations?"]
hypothesis: You have a face in all thirty-six countries, don't you?

source: 数学クラブにも新聞部にも 顔が利く　ハッカーのメンバーだし
references: ['I also have my Math Club Card, Hacker Membership, Journalist Pass,']
hypothesis: He's a member of the math club, he's a member of the newspaper club, he's a hacker.

source: VCに顔が利く
references: ["- He's got connections to VCs."]
hypothesis: have a lot of face time with the VC

source: だが奴は顔が売れすぎてる
references: ["There's no way! The guy's too high profile."]
hypothesis: But he's got too much face to sell.

source: 顔が広いから デルグロスに頼まれた
references: ['Delgros knew I had their ear, so he offered me money to push things through.']
hypothesis: Delgros asked me to do it because of my wide face.

source: 中東では顔が広い
references: ['I ran many sorts of parts to all sorts of places in the Middle East.']
hypothesis: In the Middle East, he has a wide face.

source: 飲み屋からボストンまで顔が広い人がいる
references: ["He's got the ear of every captain from Bar Harbor to Boston."]
hypothesis: Someone with a wide face from bars to Boston.

source: 顔が 揃っていません
references: ["Not everyone's here yet. What about Fornay?"]
hypothesis: I don't see all the faces.

source: なぜ顔が潰れてる？
references: ['Why do you think he smashed in the face?']
hypothesis: Why is your face smashed?

source: 私の顔が潰れるまでは 私を利用して
references: ['Yeah, so when this blows up in my face, you can fire my ass.']
hypothesis: Use me until I fall flat on my face.

source: - 顔に出てるぞ
references: ["- It's starting to show."]
hypothesis: - It's all over your face.

source: 今 君は生きているが 内なる汚れは 顔に出ている
references: ['Now in order for you to stay alive we have to match your face with the ugliness of your soul.']
hypothesis: Now you're alive, but the dirt inside you is showing on your face.

source: 動揺が顔に出る、ですね
references: ['They make mistakes. Nice.']
hypothesis: Upset is in your face, right?

source: ♪顔に書いてあるよ♪
references: ["♪ Sittin' right on your face ♪"]
hypothesis: Â It's written all over my face.

source: 顔に書いてある
references: ["I can see that they haven't."]
hypothesis: It's written on his face.

source: 顔に書いてあるだけさ
references: ["Just what's written on your face."]
hypothesis: It's written on your face.

source: 君たちは約束を破って 私の顔に泥を塗った
references: ['- You went back on your word, And then you rubbed my face in it.']
hypothesis: You broke your promise and got in my face.

source: ソンレンも　男の子を産んだら 誰かの顔に　泥を塗ってしまうわね
references: ['If fourth sister has a son someone will be very unhappy.']
hypothesis: And Songlian, if you have a boy, you're going to bring dirt on someone's face.

source: 誰かが手下のネイサンの 顔に泥を塗った！
references: ['Someone chases my boy Nate out of the tick tock and puts one in his face!']
hypothesis: Someone got in Nathan's face!

source: 顔を作っているように 見えたのは以外だった。
references: ["I didn't know your face muscles could make that look."]
hypothesis: Except it looked like he was making a face.

source: 僕が閲覧したポルノサイト情報から エヴァの顔を作った？
references: ["Did you design Ava's face based on my pornography profile?"]
hypothesis: Did you make Eva's face based on the pornographic sites I visited?

source: パンザーの事件のことで FBIが　至る所に顔を出してくる
references: ["FBI's all over us about this, Panzer case."]
hypothesis: The FBI is popping up everywhere over the Panzer case.

source: - その内 顔を出すさ
references: ["- It'll show up."]
hypothesis: - He'll show his face one of these days.

source: クインシー辺りにゃ 顔を出すなよ
references: ['And you better never show your face around Quincy, you hear me? Okay, come on. Ever!']
hypothesis: Keep your face out of Quincy and the surrounding area.

source: んー、いや、直接顔を合わせた方がいい、 そう思うんだ。
references: ["Mm, no, in person's better, I think."]
hypothesis: Hmm, no, face-to-face is better, I think.

source: 親族が顔を合わせる機会は 何度もあったが― 殺したいとは思っても 殺したことはなかった
references: ["Look, buddy, I'm trying to be objective here, but we've had countless family functions before, and even though we wanted to kill one another, we never did."]
hypothesis: I've had many opportunities to see my relatives, but I've never killed anyone, even though I've wanted to.

source: どうやって お互い顔を合わせる？
references: ['What do you say we meet?']
hypothesis: How do we see each other?

source: （南上）セカンドラインを 具体化するなら あなたの顔を売って おきたかったんだけど
references: ["I wanted people to meet you, since you'll be overseeing the second line."]
hypothesis: （If we're going to materialize a second line, I wanted to sell your face.

source: 冗談よ さあ顔を売って
references: ["I'm joking. Go make some friends and don't get into trouble."]
hypothesis: I'm kidding. Come on, sell your face.

source: 判事に顔を売ってきて
references: ['I want the man to know who you are.']
hypothesis: Go sell your face to the judge.

source: お前と俺はこの顔を直すんだ！
references: ['Me and you are headed to fix this butterface.']
hypothesis: You and I are going to fix this face!

source: 大姉様の顔を立てることを 知らないのかしら
references: ['How does that make our Big sister feel?']
hypothesis: I wonder if she doesn't know how to make her big sister look good.

source: ここで顔を立てるんだ
references: ['You gotta make this look good.']
hypothesis: We're trying to save face here.

source: いま ロシアの顔を立てておけば 後で何かと役に立つ
references: ['Helping the Russians save face is an act of good faith.']
hypothesis: If we can put a good face on the Russians now, it will come in handy later.

source: 車で40分のお袋の家に 顔を見せに来るどころか
references: ['He even has a problem with our mother taking Social Security and Medicare.']
hypothesis: Instead of driving 40 minutes to my mom's house to show her face.

source: 億万長者のボスと そんな人はあまりいない 人前で彼らは素顔を見せてる
references: ['Not a lot of people show their real face in public.']
hypothesis: Not many people like that with billionaire bosses show their true colors in public.

source: メアリーのためにも 顔を貸してくださいよ
references: ['Come on. For Mary. Bring me your face.']
hypothesis: For Mary's sake, please lend me your face.

source: それとも 人様に顔向けできないって思ったからですか
references: ["is it because you thought you couldn't bear to look other people in the face?"]
hypothesis: Or is it because you felt you couldn't show your face to others?

source: 君に顔向けできないと
references: ["Didn't want to face you."]
hypothesis: He said he couldn't face you.

source: それは願ってもない話だ オレはバカじゃないから丁度いい
references: ["It's a good thing I'm not a fool, then."]
hypothesis: That's a good thing. I'm not stupid.

source: そうなったら願ってもない事だ。 だが、そうなる前に私のチームが私を救出するだろう。
references: ["Then that's what it'll be, or I hold out until my team comes to find me."]
hypothesis: If that happens, it's something I can only hope for. But my team will rescue me before that happens.

source: 実際 君の様な人は 願ってもないことだ
references: ["I mean, actually, I couldn't have even hoped as much for... Wow. Come on in."]
hypothesis: In fact, someone like you is the last thing I would ever wish for.

source: どういう風の吹き回し？
references: ["Baby, what's gotten into you?"]
hypothesis: What kind of windfall?

source: 一体どういう風の吹き回しだ?
references: ['To what do I owe the pleasure?']
hypothesis: What the hell is going on?

source: どういう風の吹き回しだ？
references: ['You want me to- How am I supposed to do that?']
hypothesis: What kind of windfall?

source: 」 「風を切って走るのだ!
references: ['- Put some zing in it!']
hypothesis: Run with the wind!

source: 彼のキャリアは風前の灯 その件が露見すると―
references: ["Liam's career was already hanging by a thread."]
hypothesis: His career is hanging by a thread.

source: 俺はここで孤立無援で、 それも風前の灯だ！
references: ["I'm out on a limb here, and the limb is going to break!"]
hypothesis: I'm out on my own here, and that's before my time!

source: 我々の命は風前の灯です
references: ["They're blowing it."]
hypothesis: Our lives are in the wind.

source: 士気はもはや 風前の灯火だ
references: ['Their courage hangs by a thread.']
hypothesis: Morale is now a pale shadow of its former self.

source: 風向きが悪い
references: ["That wind isn't good."]
hypothesis: Bad wind direction

source: これは遺伝子医学に風穴を開ける 歴史的な発表になるだろう。
references: ['This will be a historical presentation that may open a new door to genetic medicine.']
hypothesis: This will be a historic announcement that will open a new chapter in genetic medicine.

source: そうですか　お風邪を引かないように 気をつけてくださいね
references: ['I see, well... take care not to catch a cold. Thank you.']
hypothesis: I see. Well, please be careful not to catch a cold.

source: 僕 風邪を引いたので ティッシュはペンで取って
references: ["But I'd push the tissues off with a pen, if I were you, because I've had a cold."]
hypothesis: I caught a cold, so I took a tissue from the pen.

source: 風邪を引くわ 着替えないと
references: ["He should get out of them wet clothes. He'll get sick."]
hypothesis: I'm gonna catch a cold. I have to change.

source: 死人が甦るようになったら 食うか食われるかの世界になるぜ。
references: ['You know, in case the undead come back to life and the world gets all dog-eat-dog.']
hypothesis: When the dead come back to life, it's eat or be eaten.

source: その後 父さんは言った 今は食うか 食われるかの世界だと
references: ['Anyway, after that, dad said this is the world we live in now -- eat or be eaten.']
hypothesis: Then my father told me that now it's eat or be eaten.

source: ♪ 食うや食わずの生活だけど ♪
references: ["# I ain't got much dough#"]
hypothesis: # I'm living on a shoestring #

source: 航空機のエンジンも修理する 食えない物も調理する
references: ['They also fix airplane engines and cook bad food.']
hypothesis: I fix airplane engines. I cook inedible food.

source: ステーキが食えないなら　ハンバーガーで 手を打つしかないさ
references: ["Well, if you can't get steak, you have to settle for hamburger."]
hypothesis: If they can't eat steak, they'll have to settle for hamburgers.

source: 飽きが来るんだよ
references: ["It's like the— the law of diminishing returns."]
hypothesis: I'm getting tired of it.

source: どんなことでも 飽きが来るものよ
references: ["It's diminishing returns and whatever."]
hypothesis: You know, everything gets a little boring.

source: スタンディッシュ、私の首が危ないんだ。
references: ['Standish, the people want my head.']
hypothesis: Standish, my neck is on the line.

source: これで奴らの金庫は空っぽだ 税金で首が回らなくなる
references: ['So that means their coffers will be empty. They will be bled dry.']
hypothesis: Now their coffers are empty and the taxpayers will be out on their heads.

source: ピーターは首が回らなくなって 自衛のためにあなたに 自分を殺させた
references: ['Peter got in over his head and forced you to kill him to defend himself.']
hypothesis: Peter got in over his head and had you kill him to defend himself.

source: 首にした相手をけなすために
references: ['To vilify the boss that fired her.']
hypothesis: To belittle the person who fired him.

source: 継母は使用人を全て 首にしました
references: ["Ella's stepmother dismissed the household."]
hypothesis: My stepmother fired all the servants.

source: 暴力団同士の抗争が続くと 私は首になる
references: ['Brass are gonna fire me just as soon as this gang war cools off.']
hypothesis: If the gang war continues, I will be fired.

source: これで どうにか 首の皮一枚 つながったな
references: ['You escaped by the skin of your teeth.']
hypothesis: Well, we're somehow neck-and-neck now.

source: 良かった　率直に言って 君は首の皮一枚だよ
references: ["Good, because frankly, you're hanging by a thread."]
hypothesis: Good, because frankly, you're neck and neck.

source: 首を振るな
references: ["Don't shake your head at me."]
hypothesis: Don't shake your head.

source: 首を振って去る
references: ['Oh go on, then: shake your head and walk out.']
hypothesis: shake one's head and leave

source: これからは うなずくか、首を振るだけでいいわ わかった？
references: ['So, from now on, just nod or shake your head, okay?']
hypothesis: From now on, all you have to do is nod or shake your head, got it?

source: 何でも首を突っ込む あのオバサンが悪いの
references: ["Don't feel sorry for yelling at that snoopy old bitch. She's been sticking her nose where it don't belong."]
hypothesis: It's her fault. She gets involved in everything.

source: おたくの領域に 首を突っ込むつもりはないんですよ
references: ["We're not looking to horn in on your turf."]
hypothesis: I'm not trying to poke my nose into your business.

source: 首を突っ込みすぎだ
references: ['If you stick your neck out how far?']
hypothesis: You're sticking your neck out too far.

source: お前が首を縦に振らないせいで 廃墟になった場所だ
references: ['Your absolute unwillingness to accept anything less than everything.']
hypothesis: A place that was abandoned because you wouldn't shake your head.

source: 自動化やコストカットを いくら勧めても 首を縦に振らない 立派な職人さんだったが 私の言うことさえ聞いていれば
references: ["He was an admirable craftsman who refused to take my advice no matter how much I tried. he wouldn't have had to commit suicide."]
hypothesis: He was a fine craftsman who wouldn't shake his head no matter how many times I recommended automation and cost cutting, but if only he'd listened to me.

source: 首を長くして　提灯を待ってる人も いるんだよ
references: ['There are others desperate for a foot massage, you know.']
hypothesis: There are people who are waiting for the lanterns.

source: 首を長くして待ってたわ 結局パパはあきらめたけど
references: ['We waited and waited. Finally dad gave up']
hypothesis: I waited so long for it, and eventually my dad gave up on it.

source: エリックとも馬が合う
references: ['She gets along with Eric really well.']
hypothesis: He and Eric get along well.

source: 何所の馬の骨だ　何の話だ？
references: ["I don't fucking know you. What business?"]
hypothesis: What the hell are you talking about?

source: うん　馬子にも衣装
references: ['Right, even a loser can dress for success.']
hypothesis: yes, even a horse's coat is made of fine threads

source: 骨がありそうな男だな
references: ["You look like the kind of man who'd put his mettle to it."]
hypothesis: He looks like a man with a bone to pick.

source: この作業は― 骨が折れそうだ
references: ['The chances of this working... are remote at best.']
hypothesis: This is going to be... a pain in the ass.

source: あそこに骨を埋める気は
references: ['Not left out there to rot.']
hypothesis: I'm not going to bury my bones there.

source: 化学療法だけでなく アリバイ工作も高くつき―
references: ["After completing my first round of treatment and financing the world's most expensive alibi?"]
hypothesis: Not only is chemotherapy expensive, but so is crafting an alibi.

source: ‐クリーニング代は高くつくぞ ‐行くぞ
references: ['- My dry-cleaning bill will be ridiculous. - Come on.']
hypothesis: -Cleaning bill's gonna be expensive. - Let's go.

source: 高くつく・・・
references: ["It's just that he's a fortune to get here and..."]
hypothesis: Expensive...

source: 彼は軍事兵器システムを ハッキングして オークションハウスのように 高く買う落札者順に
references: ['Began selling data to the highest bidder like it was some sort of auction house or something.']
hypothesis: He hacked into the military weapons system like an auction house, in order of highest bidder.

source: 「他にも、もっと高く買ってくれる人がいるかも」
references: ['I bet someone else would pay more.']
hypothesis: Maybe someone else will pay more for it."

source: 高く買うヤツを知ってる
references: ["I know a guy that'll pay premium for this kind of crap."]
hypothesis: I know guys who buy high.

source: でも　私は黙って高みの見物だわ
references: ["But you know I'm still on the fence at best."]
hypothesis: But I'll just sit back and watch.

source: 皆が競争するのを 君は高みの見物してた
references: ['You went high when everyone else stayed on the trail.']
hypothesis: You watched on in awe as everyone else competed.

source: 花火に火をつけて　高みの見物？
references: ['Light the blue touchpaper and then retire?']
hypothesis: Light the fireworks and watch from afar?

source: あきらめろ　高嶺の花だ
references: ["That woman is out of your league. She's just too classy for you."]
hypothesis: Give it up. It's a tall order.

source: おまえには　高嶺の花だ
references: ['You are way out of your league.']
hypothesis: You're too high for me.

source: アンジェラの事は忘れろよ お前には高嶺の花だ
references: ["Will you forget about Angela? She's a bad investment."]
hypothesis: Forget about Angela, she's too high up for you.

source: 髪を下ろしました
references: ['I let my hair down.']
hypothesis: I let my hair down.

source: ♪髪を下ろしてみて♪
references: ['♫ Let your hair hang... ♫']
hypothesis: ♪ Let your hair down ♪

source: 鬱憤を晴らしてるだけよ
references: ["It's just people letting off steam."]
hypothesis: He's just venting his frustration.

source: ＦＢＩは鬼門だったな
references: ['Well, that was when the team made video games, not weapons.']
hypothesis: The FBI was the devil's gate.

source: （男性）鬼門って言われてんだから うちは
references: ["They say it's our fault."]
hypothesis: （It's called "the devil's gate.

source: あの山は鬼門だ
references: ['That mountain is evil.']
hypothesis: That mountain is the devil's gate.

source: 魂が抜けてる！
references: ['No. Her soul has left her body.']
hypothesis: The soul is missing!

source: 魂が抜けたようになった
references: ['I became like a ghost.']
hypothesis: It was like my soul had been drained.

source: 魔が差したの
references: ['And this was such a rush.']
hypothesis: It was an accident.

source: 人は魔が差して 危険を犯すものです
references: ['People are playing with fire and risk everything for nothing.']
hypothesis: People take risks because they're afraid to take risks.

source: 魔が差したんでしょう
references: ['One weak moment, and you saw a way out.']
hypothesis: It must have been the devil's advocate.

source: 鳥肌が立ってます。
references: ["I've got goosebumps."]
hypothesis: I have goosebumps.

source: 鳥肌が立ってきた
references: ["I'm getting goosebumps."]
hypothesis: I'm getting goosebumps.

source: 鳥肌が立ったわ
references: ['I got goose bumps, like.']
hypothesis: I got goosebumps.

source: ４年間 マニラで 鳴りを潜めてたが
references: ['Been out in the Manila Division the past four years, keeping my head down, minding my own business.']
hypothesis: He's been in Manila for the past four years, but he's been off the radar.

source: 何でも鵜呑みにするな
references: ["Jo, just 'cause he says it doesn't make it true."]
hypothesis: Don't believe everything you read.

source: そんな噂を鵜呑みにするな
references: ["Don't believe those rumors, man."]
hypothesis: Don't believe those rumors.

source: 鵜呑みにするか しないかだ
references: ["You just have to believe us or think that we're crazy."]
hypothesis: You either believe it or you don't.

source: 戦いをやり抜くには 信奉者を鼓舞するの
references: ['Kagame knew to inspire our followers is the only way to ensure our fight outlives us.']
hypothesis: To carry a fight through, you have to inspire your followers.

source: リバー８を鼓舞させたのよ
references: ['- He inspired Liber8.']
hypothesis: He inspired Liber8.

source: 貴族たちを萎縮させ民を 鼓舞させる支配者
references: ['A monarch who can intimidate the high lords and inspire the people.']
hypothesis: Rulers who enfeeble the nobles and inspire the people.

source: あなたの期待は、 この珍鳥がネズミに対して 鼻が利くことだ、と言って下さい
references: ['Say what you will, your rare bird has a nose for rodents.']
hypothesis: Please tell me that your expectation is that this rare bird has a nose for rats.

source: 奴はヤバそうなことに　鼻が利く
references: ["Part of him always knew when his clock ran out, it wasn't gonna be pretty."]
hypothesis: He's got a nose for trouble.

source: 鼻が曲がりそうだ
references: ['The smell is rough.']
hypothesis: My nose is about to bend.

source: 鼻が高いわ
references: ['So important.']
hypothesis: You're so proud of your nose.

source: 鼻が高い　これで ワシを食べなきゃな
references: ['So smart, Mary Ann. Ha!']
hypothesis: Oh, my nose. Now you're gonna have to eat me.

source: でもこいつらだけは 鼻を明かして刑務所に送ってやりたいの
references: ['But I sure as hell can catch the bastard behind all of this.']
hypothesis: But these are the only ones I'd like to send to jail with their noses open.

source: 奴らの鼻を 明かしてやればいい
references: ["Don't you want to beat those shitheads in front of everybody?"]
hypothesis: We'll give them a good nose job.

source: ５億損失の全ての原因だった というわけですね？ 私としても まったく いい迷惑です
references: ['I am extremely inconvenienced by all this as well.']
hypothesis: So you are saying that you were responsible for the entire loss of 500 million? I, for one, find that extremely annoying.

source: 俺達はお呼びじゃ無い
references: ['We are not needed.']
hypothesis: We're not wanted.

source: お呼びじゃないんだよ！
references: ["And you're not welcome!"]
hypothesis: You're not wanted!

source: "私はお呼びじゃ無い" それは分かる
references: ["I know I'm not wanted."]
hypothesis: "I'm not wanted." I know.

source: 男の扱いはお手の物だもんな？
references: ["And I think you'll find a way 'cause I think you know your way around men, don't you?"]
hypothesis: You're good with men, aren't you?

source: それはそれは ご立派な心掛けで
references: ["That's quite admirable of you."]
hypothesis: Well, that's a very noble gesture.

source: 一歩進むごとに戦ったわ。 必死に働き、腕を磨き、上に立った。 誰にも迷惑かけずにね。
references: ['Every step of the way, I had to fight, to work hard, to get better, to come out ahead.']
hypothesis: I fought every step of the way. I worked hard, honed my skills, and rose above. I didn't bother anyone.

source: 上に立つため 下で働く事もある
references: ['Sometimes you have to serve in order to lead.']
hypothesis: Sometimes you have to work below to rise above.

source: 人の上に立つのに必要です
references: ['That can be a virtue when it drives us to excel.']
hypothesis: You need to be above people.

source: それに こういうのは あとから世に出たほうが 圧倒的に不利だ
references: ["And since they went public first, we'd be at a great disadvantage."]
hypothesis: Besides, it's overwhelmingly unfavorable for these things to come out later in the world.

source: 何てことないですよ いつも叔父がお世話になってますから
references: ["- It's nothing, compared to your help with Uncle."]
hypothesis: It's nothing. My uncle has always taken care of me.

source: 世話を焼いても 返すのはグチばかり
references: ['She needs my help and then resents me for it.']
hypothesis: I take care of him, and all he does is complain.

source: いつからネスの世話を焼いてるの
references: ['Since when do you care about Renesmee?']
hypothesis: Since when do you take care of Ness?

source: バウアーは、不祥事を起こした薬である インターナショナルと 彼に対して行っ保証します。
references: ['Bauer is a disgraced agent with international warrants out against him.']
hypothesis: Bauer is a scandalous drug that has gone against him with international assurances.

source: お前は町に人狼が 戻ってきてると思うのか 揉め事を起こしに?
references: ['You think the werewolves are back in town trying to start some trouble?']
hypothesis: You think werewolves are coming back to town to cause trouble?

source: 高尚な話をしてる割には あんたは　人を食い物にする 薬物中毒以外の何者でもない
references: ["Yeah, for all your high-minded talk, you're nothing but a predator and a drug addict."]
hypothesis: For all your high-minded talk, you are nothing more than a predator and a drug addict.

source: 孤独な老人を 食い物にした 人でなしよ！
references: ['She was lonely and vulnerable, and you exploited her, you heartless shit!']
hypothesis: He's a bastard who preyed on a lonely old man!

source: でもガブリエルは人を食い物にしていた
references: ['But Gabriel was a predator.']
hypothesis: But Gabriel was preying on people.

source: かなりの人目を引く
references: ["It's quite striking in person."]
hypothesis: Quite eye-catching.

source: 抗争により恋人達が その仲を裂かれる
references: ["It's about two star-crossed lovers kept apart by a big feud."]
hypothesis: Lovers torn apart by war.

source: 体で覚えるんだ
references: ["I'm talking about muscle memory, girl..."]
hypothesis: You have to learn it in your body.

source: 何はともあれ 成功した
references: ["For what it's worth, Colonel, it worked."]
hypothesis: At any rate, it worked.

source: すべてを台無しにして彼の借りを返すの？ それがあなたの応える方法なの？
references: ['This is how you respond, by squandering your life to get even with him?']
hypothesis: You're going to ruin everything and pay him back? Is that your way of responding?

source: 借りを返すために...
references: ['For payback purposes...']
hypothesis: To pay back the debt...

source: 先が見える
