references: ["I know what's gonna happen."]
hypothesis: envision how things will turn out (usu. unfortunate)

source: こういうのって 先が見えてるのよね
references: ["Don't you think I know how this goes?"]
hypothesis: I think I know what's going to happen next.

source: だから先を読まれてた
references: ["That's how they were able to stay ahead of us."]
hypothesis: That's why they were ahead of us.

source: ショーン　君から聞いた話だと 子供が生まれてから　リサが性的な面で 冷たくなったってことらしいね
references: ["Sean, what I'm hearing from you is that Lisa has become sexually cold ever since the baby was born."]
hypothesis: Sean, from what I've heard from you, Lisa has become sexually cold to you since the baby was born.

source: 冷たくなってる
references: ['The bitch is cold, bro.']
hypothesis: It's getting cold.

source: 子供たちを あなたの 原動力にしてください
references: ['Keep going and make your kids the engine of your life.']
hypothesis: Let the children be your driving force.

source: 自分の力にするために
references: ["It's what motivates me."]
hypothesis: To make it your own strength.

source: 限り、私は私の体に力を得たように、私はその命令に従います。
references: ['As long as I got strength in my body, I obey that order.']
hypothesis: As long as I got power in my body, I will obey its commands.

source: アンナはフィフス カラムが 力を付けて来たと考えている
references: ["Anna knows that the Fifth Column's growing stronger."]
hypothesis: Anna believes the Fifth Column is gaining strength.

source: もっと力を付けた
references: ['The more firepower I got.']
hypothesis: More power to you.

source: 在庫を抱えたまま 現金が減ると 途端に身動きが 取れなくなります
references: ['If the cash balance goes down while carrying an inventory, our cash flow will start to suffer right away.']
hypothesis: And when you're sitting on inventory and your cash is down, you're in a real bind.

source: お前のために危ない 橋を渡った
references: ["Listen, I've risked more than I should have for you, Jacq."]
hypothesis: I crossed a dangerous bridge for you.

source: 俺は取るに足りない人間だ
references: ["I'm a nobody."]
hypothesis: I'm an insignificant person.

source: 受けて立つ
references: ['Guns blazing.']
hypothesis: take up the gauntlet

source: 受けて立とうぜ
references: ['I like the action.']
hypothesis: I'll take that as a yes.

source: 殺人は　人の口を封じる一つの手段だが
references: ['Murder is just one way to stop someone from talking.']
hypothesis: Murder is one way to keep people talking.

source: アンダーソン　口を開くな 君はみんなのIQを下げてる
references: ["Anderson, don't talk out loud. You lower the IQ of the whole street."]
hypothesis: Anderson, don't open your mouth. You're lowering everyone's IQ.

source: 口数が多い 黙っていろ、運転を続けるのだ
references: ['Now shut up and keep driving.']
hypothesis: You talk too much. Shut up. Keep driving.

source: ジル　ましな嘘をつけ
references: ["Jill, I'm not buying it."]
hypothesis: Jill, you need to tell a better lie.

source: もし今夜攻撃すれば 我らの人間性は地に落ちる
references: ['If we attack tonight Our humanity is lost.']
hypothesis: If you attack tonight, you will destroy our humanity.

source: あなたは自分に 壁を作ってる
references: ['- Yes. You spend a lot of time building walls, Hannibal.']
hypothesis: You're building a wall around yourself.

source: マトリックスとは 夢の世界 人類を支配し 必要なものとして利用する
references: ['The Matrix is a computer-generated dream world built to keep us under control in order to change a human being into this.']
hypothesis: The Matrix is a dream world, a world where we control mankind and use them as we see fit.

source: 非現実的な夢を見ては それを乗り越えて来た
references: ['I wished for a lot of unrealistic things. - I got over them too.']
hypothesis: I've had unrealistic dreams and I've gotten over them.

source: お前に奈落の底へと...
references: ['I remember you tossing me into an abyss.']
hypothesis: I'm going to send you into the abyss...

source: 完璧なチャーミング
references: ['"Is this perfect Child of heaven"']
hypothesis: Perfect Charming

source: 核戦争回避の為の努力も実を結んでいません
references: ['All diplomatic efforts to avert Nuclear war have thus far failed.']
hypothesis: Efforts to avert nuclear war have been fruitless.

source: どうする？ 俺の尻を叩く気か？
references: ['What are you gonna do?']
hypothesis: What are you gonna do? You gonna beat my ass?

source: あなたは左遷された身でしょう？
references: ["Look who's talking. You're the one who got put out to pasture."]
hypothesis: You are the one who was left behind, aren't you?

source: 店を閉めて
references: ['Close the store.']
hypothesis: Close the store.

source: しかし　それは 弱肉強食によって支配されます
references: ['But this one is governed by the law of the jungle.']
hypothesis: But it is governed by the law of the jungle.

source: 自然界は弱肉強食 適者生存よ
references: ['Nature adds and subtracts. Survival of the fittest.']
hypothesis: Nature is predatory. It's survival of the fittest.

source: 彼はいつも弱音を吐くの？
references: ['Does he always whine this much?']
hypothesis: Does he always sound weak?

source: 君がたむろしているサークルは 多くの臆病者が弱音を吐いている
references: ["Maybe you've just been hanging out with too many timid and whiny people."]
hypothesis: The circle you hang out in, there are a lot of cowards who are weak and whiny.

source: ...景気回復の見通しに 影を落としています
references: ["...we wonder if evoking France's economic downturn might be premature?"]
hypothesis: ... ... casting a shadow over the prospects for economic recovery.

source: 警察は後れを取っていた
references: ['Police are not prepared.']
hypothesis: The police were behind.

source: たぶん心が通じてると 言葉は不要なのかも
references: ["They probably don't have to speak because they're connected."]
hypothesis: Maybe words aren't necessary when you're in touch with your heart.

source: 心を入れ替えた
references: ["He's a whole new man."]
hypothesis: I changed my mind.

source: 平静な表情から 簡単に心を許す人ではないと
references: ['The serenity of her countenance convinced me that her heart was not likely to be easily touched.']
hypothesis: His calm expression suggests that he's not a man who easily forgives.

source: - この地域一帯の 911通報があったら 必ず連絡するよう念を押す
references: ["All right, check with dispatch, make sure they contact us if there's any 911 calls in the area."]
hypothesis: - Remind them to be sure to call us if there are any 911 calls in the area.

source: 私は別の男性に 思いを寄せていますが 理由が判りません
references: ["I am having feelings for another man, and I don't know why."]
hypothesis: I have feelings for another man, but I don't know why.

source: 分析官は性に合ってる
references: ['This seemed like a better fit.']
hypothesis: Being an analyst is in my nature.

source: みんなの個性に合うようにそれぞれデザインしたの
references: ["I made this dress for you and I designed each outfit theme to perfectly reflect each pony's unique personality."]
hypothesis: I designed each one to fit everyone's personality.

source: 破壊は息を呑んだよ
references: ['Destruction was breathtaking.']
hypothesis: The destruction took my breath away.

source: " きっと 愛想が尽きたのよ "
references: ['"I guess he just got tired of all the bullshit. "']
hypothesis: He must have run out of love for her.

source: 軍の余剰物に少し我を 忘れていたんだろう
references: ['I guess I got a little carried away at the Army Surplus.']
hypothesis: I guess I got a little carried away with the military surplus.

source: 彼女の像を建てるために 5年と1000人の人手が掛かったわ
references: ['It took five years and a thousand men to build her temple.']
hypothesis: It took five years and a thousand men to build her statue.

source: 毎年　とても特別な人を指名する 研究室の助手になる人
references: ['Every year, I pick a very special someone to be my lab assistant.']
hypothesis: Every year, I nominate someone very special to be my lab assistant.

source: 私たちには　人手も無ければ 専門知識も無かった
references: ["We just didn't have the people or the expertise."]
hypothesis: We didn't have the manpower or the expertise.

source: 手を上げてろ
references: ["Hands up. What do you think you're doing?"]
hypothesis: Keep your hands up.

source: 盾を捨てて、 手を上げろ！ あきらめろロージャス！
references: ['Drop the shield and put your hands in the air! Give it up, Rogers! Get that door open!']
hypothesis: Drop the shield and put your hands in the air! Give it up, Rogers!

source: 手を伸ばす以外に何をする？
references: ["There's only one way to find out."]
hypothesis: What else is there to do but reach out?

source: 死んだ後 手を入れてくれた
references: ["She's had a little work done."]
hypothesis: He put his hand in after he died.

source: 僕の場合 永久に手を切った
references: ['In my case, I am in it permanently.']
hypothesis: In my case, I cut my hand off for good.

source: 今日は この面接のために 神に祈ったりはしていません 手を合わせて 今ある命に 感謝しただけです
references: ["Today I didn't beg God for this job, just thanked him for this life"]
hypothesis: I didn't pray to God for this interview today, I just put my hands together and gave thanks for the life I have.

source: 手を合わせて悔い改めましょう
references: ['Put your hands together in contrition.']
hypothesis: Let us put our hands together and repent.

source: 手を合わせて フレディ・デントンのために 祈ってください
references: ["Now, you go home, clasp hands and pray for Freddy Denton's poor soul."]
hypothesis: Please put your hands together and pray for Freddie Denton.

source: でも彼は　あなたじゃない あなたの友達よ 彼に手を差し伸べることを
references: ["And I don't think you should be afraid of helping him."]
hypothesis: But he's not you. He's your friend. Reach out to him.

source: 明らかに 手を広げてる
references: ["Well, clearly he's branching out."]
hypothesis: Obviously, he's spreading his arms wide open.

source: まあ　彼が手を広げない事を祈ろう
references: ["Well, let's just hope he doesn't decide to branch out."]
hypothesis: Well, let's hope he doesn't branch out.

source: 貴様となど手を組むものか！
references: ["I'll never join you!"]
hypothesis: I will not work with you!

source: 連中はみんな手を結んでる
references: ['They all work together.']
hypothesis: They're all in cahoots.

source: - 手を貸すわ
references: ['Be happy to take care of it for her.']
hypothesis: - Let me give you a hand.

source: 現実に近づける 指をすり抜ける様に
references: ['Every time we get close to something real, it just slips through my fingers.']
hypothesis: I'm gonna bring you closer to reality. I'm gonna let it slip through your fingers.

source: 持って生まれた物
references: ["It's in their nature."]
hypothesis: one's nature

source: さぁ ここを出て 持って生まれた力を 発揮して来なさい
references: ['Now, you get out there, and you do what you were born to do.']
hypothesis: Now, get out of here and go use the power you were born with.

source: 記録の改竄です
references: ["I didn't know the records could be falsified."]
hypothesis: Falsification of records.

source: 私が言った通りにしないと 彼に関する真実が 明るみに出るわ
references: ['You do everything I say or the truth about him will come out.']
hypothesis: If you don't do what I say, the truth about him will come out.

source: 朝飯前です
references: ['With my eyes closed.']
hypothesis: That's before breakfast.

source: 根に・・・　根に持ってませんよ　私
references: ["I'm not bitter, though."]
hypothesis: I'm not rooting for... I'm not rooting for you.

source: 我々の宗教は この国に根を下ろさなかった
references: ['Our religion does not take root in this country.']
hypothesis: Our religion never took root in this country.

source: 王政復古による 権力構造回帰の為に 民主主義に止めを刺す 彼等の真の狙いが裏にある
references: ["They're disguising what they really want, which is an end to democracy and a return to the imperialist power with all their old privileges restored."]
hypothesis: Their real agenda is to put a stop to democracy in order to restore the power structure through the restoration of the monarchy.

source: 気が合うと良いんだけど
references: ['I hope I can reciprocate.']
hypothesis: I hope we hit it off.

source: 前から気が合って
references: ['Tom and I have always gotten along.']
hypothesis: We've been on the same page for a while.

source: 後で気が向いたらな アミン姉妹は？
references: ['Maybe later.']
hypothesis: Maybe later, when you're ready. Where are the Amin sisters?

source: まぁ 置いておくので 気が向いたらどうぞ
references: ["Well, I'm just gonna leave it there in case you change your mind."]
hypothesis: Well, I'll leave it here for you if you feel like it.

source: すっかり気が抜けて 注意を怠った　それが敗因だ
references: ["You stopped paying attention. And that's where you lost."]
hypothesis: I got distracted, I wasn't paying attention, and that's why I lost.

source: 何か気が抜けちゃったって言うか
references: ['I was discouraged by it, I mean...']
hypothesis: I don't know, I guess I just got distracted or something.

source: そういう種類の友情は 気が抜けないものになるな。
references: ['That kind of friendship can keep you on your toes.']
hypothesis: That kind of friendship can be a depressing thing.

source: それは、気が早い、 まだ時間はある。
references: ["We're not there yet. There's still time."]
hypothesis: It's too soon to tell. There's still time.

source: 飛行機に乗るのは 気が進まなかったろう
references: ["I figure flying can't be too much fun for you."]
hypothesis: I know you didn't like the idea of getting on a plane.

source: ヘレン ウォーカーに会うのは あまり気が進まない
references: ['Not exactly looking forward to seeing Helen Walker.']
hypothesis: Helen, I'm not too keen on meeting Walker.

source: どうも被害者の 家族の事が気に掛かる
references: ['and although my heart went out primarily to the families of the victims']
hypothesis: I'm wondering about the victim's family.

source: - 運転は気を付けて
references: ['- You drive careful.']
hypothesis: - Drive carefully.

source: よく考えろ 君は気を失ったがヨルゲンと君の弟は −
references: ['Think about it. No one else fainted, only you.']
hypothesis: Think about it. You're out cold, but Jørgen and your brother--

source: 私には身体に気を遣わない 貴方って変に思えるわ
references: ["Strikes me as odd that you're not taking better care of yours."]
hypothesis: It seems weird to me that you don't care about your body.

source: パーティに 水を差すのは
references: ["- Well, I don't want to barge in on your party."]
hypothesis: I don't want to ruin the party.

source: 主なる神の霊が わたしに臨んだ 主がわたしに油を注いで
references: ['The spirit of the Lord... is upon me, because he has anointed me... to preach good news to the poor.']
hypothesis: And the Spirit of the Lord God came upon me, and the Lord anointed me.

source: 歩き始めると 戦闘の洗礼を受けた
references: ['From the time he could stand, he was baptized in the fire of combat.']
hypothesis: As soon as we started walking, we were baptized in combat.

source: だが彼は市の裏の部分 残忍さ暴力を浮き彫りにさせる
references: ['What that man does is carry out a dark reckoning for his city. It is a brutal, violent vision of justice, one we do not share.']
hypothesis: But he brings to light the underbelly of the city, the brutality, the violence.

source: これまでお前の為に色々な事を お前を守る為にして来た お母さんが亡くなってから
references: ["Sweetheart, everything that I've ever done was only to protect you after your mother had died."]
hypothesis: I've done so many things for you, to protect you, since your mother died.

source: "アラーは無辜の民を助けてくださる"
references: ['"Allah helps the innocent."']
hypothesis: "Allah helps the innocent."

source: でもあなたと踊ってみて... なんか熱くなって仕方が無くて... だから...
references: ['But dancing with you got me all hot and bothered, so, you know...']
hypothesis: But dancing with you... I got all hot and bothered... So...

source: 明日は熱くなってる必要がある
references: ["I know, it's working. I need to be angry tomorrow."]
hypothesis: Need to be hot tomorrow.

source: 俺の言う事を 信じるしかない... 狙いをつけてたのは 女じゃない
references: ["I mean, I get that you'll just have to take my word for this, but... she wasn't even the one I was aiming for."]
hypothesis: You're just gonna have to take my word for it. She wasn't the one I was after.

source: しかし　わしの心は未だ一度も起こった事が 無いものに狙いをつけている
references: ['But my thoughts dwell on what has never been']
hypothesis: But my mind is set on something that has never happened.

source: シェリーが、彼にがっちり狙いを 定めているって噂よ
references: ["Because rumor has it Sherry's already staking her claim on him."]
hypothesis: Rumor has it that Sherry has her sights set on him.

source: フリーランサーに狙いを定めてる
references: ['Got freelancer in my sights.']
hypothesis: They're targeting freelancers.

source: 登場人物の生の声を
references: ["After all, that's who I wrote it for."]
hypothesis: The real voices of the characters.

source: その間にアメリカで最も 権力を持つ男になった
references: ['Along the way, he happened to become the most powerful man in the state.']
hypothesis: Meanwhile, he became the most powerful man in America.

source: 男になる為に？
references: ['To become a man?']
hypothesis: To be a man?

source: どうかな　どんなふうに 効き目があるか分からない
references: ["I don't know. I don't see how that's gonna work."]
hypothesis: I don't know. I don't know how it works.

source: 俺にはそういう才能を見抜く目があるんだ。
references: ['And I pride myself for having an eye for that kind of talent.']
hypothesis: I have an eye for that kind of talent.

source: シルヴィアって 召使を選ぶ目があるのよ
references: ["Sylvia is so clever. She finds wonderful servants. I don't know how she manages."]
hypothesis: Sylvia has an eye for picking the right handmaidens.

source: 弱そうだから 見た目じゃないよ
references: ["It's about weakness and vulnerability. It's not a looks thing."]
hypothesis: I don't think it's because you look weak.

source: 組織は黒い蓮と呼ばれ ロンドンでも活動してる 君の目と鼻の先でな
references: ['A gang called the Black Lotus, operating here in London right under your nose.']
hypothesis: The organization is called the Black Lotus, and it operates in London, right under your nose.

source: その後２週間の間、我々は 彼を目にすることはなかった
references: ["And then we didn't see him for two weeks."]
hypothesis: For the next two weeks, we never saw him again.

source: 見せろ どうせ目に入る
references: ["Show him. He'll find out soon enough."]
hypothesis: Let me see it. I'll see it anyway.

source: 「一番近くの店に行き．．． ．．．目に入った最初のウォンカ・バーを買うんじゃ」
references: ['Run down to the nearest store and buy the first Wonka candy bar you see.']
hypothesis: I went to the nearest store and .... ... Buy the first Wonka bar you see.

source: 私自身の怖れも 彼女の目に映っていた
references: ['And I could read my own terror in her eyes.']
hypothesis: I saw my own fear in her eyes.

source: その通りだ 我々は海兵隊だ 我々の手で やつらに目に物見せてやろう
references: ["Marines, we are going to make our point, let them know who they're dealing with."]
hypothesis: That's right, we're Marines, and we're gonna show them what we can do with our hands.

source: 君が失敗するのは 目に見えてる
references: ["but I'm afraid you're just gonna have to suffer its failure."]
hypothesis: I can see you're going to fail.

source: 他の魚も目を付けてたしね
references: ['Because a lot of other clownfish had their eyes on this place.']
hypothesis: And other fish had their eyes on it, too.

source: ドローンに役目を 奪われたかな？
references: ['Drones taking all the cool assignments?']
hypothesis: Have the drones taken over the role?

source: あの娘に目を奪われているのでしょ？
references: ["You adore this girl, don't you?"]
hypothesis: You have your eye on that girl, don't you?

source: ドムが神の目を奪ったから レーダーから逃れるためだ
references: ["Because Dom took God's Eye, so we need to stay off the grid"]
hypothesis: Dom took God's eye so he could stay off the radar.

source: わが目を疑うんだが 証拠を...
references: ["I don't believe this. Beatrix, I suppressed evidence."]
hypothesis: I can't believe my eyes. I can't believe my eyes. I can't believe my eyes. I can't believe my eyes.

source: どうしたら目を瞑っていれますか、アンドレ？
references: ['How can you be so blind, André?']
hypothesis: How can I keep my eyes open, Andre?

source: 目を背けていたんだ
references: ["Your eyes were open, but you didn't want to see."]
hypothesis: I had to turn away.

source: - 我々の会話は、ウィル、 君が本当は何者かという真実に、 君の目を開かせるということだけだ。
references: ['Our conversations, Will, were only ever about you opening your eyes to the truth of who you are.']
hypothesis: - Our conversation, Will, is only about opening your eyes to the truth of who you really are.

source: アラーは望む... 最後には目を開いて 敵の顔を直視しろと
references: ['Allah wishes... that we finally open our eyes and look the enemy in the face.']
hypothesis: Allah wants us to... Finally, he wants us to open our eyes and look the enemy in the face.

source: 難しいけど いま話し合って 矛盾点の無いように
references: ["I know it's a difficult subject, but if we could just talk it out, and then we can decide whether or not to bring it up in the hearing."]
hypothesis: I know it's hard, but we need to talk about it now so that there are no discrepancies.

source: そこで何をしていたか 知る由もないよな？
references: ["You didn't even know he was there, did you?"]
hypothesis: You have no way of knowing what he was doing there, do you?

source: 寄宿学校に行ってたら知る由も無かったわ
references: ['I never would have known about it if I was at boarding school.']
hypothesis: If I'd gone to boarding school, there's no way I would have known.

source: 私としたことが ...
references: ['I should have known...']
hypothesis: What I did...

source: 私としたことが 早く気づくべきだったわね
references: ["Can't believe I didn't recognize you earlier."]
hypothesis: I should have realized what I'd done sooner.

source: いやいや、不謹慎にも程があるっしょ、こういうことって。
references: ["No! That's a very serious thing to be kidding about."]
hypothesis: No, no, no, it's not inappropriate, this kind of thing.

source: それは、風穴をあける 唯一の方法だった 我々を田舎の場外取引店と 見なさなくなる
references: ['It was the only way these Wall Street pricks would ever stop thinking of us as some shitkicker bucket shop.']
hypothesis: It was the only way to get wind of the fact that they would no longer see us as a small-town off-the-books dealership.

source: 穴をあける
references: ['We will clear a path!']
hypothesis: cause a loss

source: どこかで 線を引く必要があった
references: ['we had to draw the line somewhere.']
hypothesis: I had to draw the line somewhere.

source: 重要なものとの間に 線を引いたの
references: ['No, I drew a line between the important stuff and that.']
hypothesis: I drew a line between what's important and what's not.

source: 縁起でもない　そんなに長生きして　どうする
references: ["Nonsense! I don't want to live that long."]
hypothesis: What's the point in living that long?

source: - 罪がない？
references: ['- Innocent?']
hypothesis: - Innocent?

source: 彼は罪がない
references: ['He is innocent.']
hypothesis: He is blameless.

source: 彼らが最初 耳にしたのは 北方から近づく嵐の音だった
references: ['The first they heard was a noise like a hurricane... coming down from the North.']
hypothesis: The first thing they heard was the sound of a storm approaching from the north.

source: 記者の耳に入れたくない事でも？
references: ['Do you have something to hide from a reporter?']
hypothesis: Something you don't want a reporter to hear?

source: 天使の会話を耳に挟んだ
references: ["I've picked up chatter among the angels."]
hypothesis: I overheard an angel talking.

source: 俺たちはストリートに並んでいる 軍隊を背にして立っている 俺たちの友人だった奴らだ
references: ['We stood side by side against the dark forces on our streets, especially the ones who used to be our friends.']
hypothesis: We're standing side by side in the street, with our backs to the army, the guys who used to be our friends.

source: 私に背中を向けるな！
references: ["Don't you dare turn your back on me!"]
hypothesis: Don't turn your back on me!

source: 誰にも背中を向けるな
references: ["Don't turn your back on anybody."]
hypothesis: Don't turn your back on anyone.

source: 彼に色目を使ってるなら
references: ["And if she's making those eyes at him,"]
hypothesis: If you're making eyes at him.

source: あんたは血も涙もない上にバカよ
references: ['You are cruel and ignorant.']
hypothesis: You're not only bloodless, you're an idiot.

source: 裏切られ 血を見ることになる！
references: ['When they turn on us -- and they will -- that blood is gonna be on your hands!']
hypothesis: You will be betrayed, and you will see blood!

source: 彼女はその日 多くの血を見た。
references: ['She saw a lot of hurt that day.']
hypothesis: She saw a lot of blood that day.

source: 奴らを俺達に近づけるな さもなくば、血を見ることになる
references: ["You'd better keep them away from us... or there will be bloodshed."]
hypothesis: Keep them away from us, or there will be blood.

source: 現場では常に― こちらの裏を かこうとする敵が相手だ
references: ['In the field, you will face off against enemies who are always one step ahead of you.']
hypothesis: In the field, you're always up against enemies who will try to outwit you.

source: 多少の危険は覚悟の上よ
references: ["To me, that's worth a little risk."]
hypothesis: I'm willing to take some risks.

source: 言葉を返して申し訳ないが　今は 詳細な情報を口にすべき 時期でもないし場所でもない
references: ['With all due respect, this is not the time or the place to share the details.']
hypothesis: Sorry to echo your sentiments, but now is neither the time nor the place to be giving out details.

source: 協力する限り、俺は話が分かる男だ、 一言聞くぜ、リック。
references: ["I'm a very reasonable man as long as you cooperate, so let me ask you a question, Rick."]
hypothesis: As long as you cooperate, I'm a man who knows what he's talking about. I'll tell you what, Rick.

source: 救世主は話が分かるんだ。
references: ['Saviors can actually be quite reasonable.']
hypothesis: The Saviors know what they're talking about.

source: それとこれとは話が違う
references: ["Look, you can't be doing this right now."]
hypothesis: That's not what this is about.

source: 調子に乗りすぎたよ この年頃の小さな子供ってこうだろう
references: ["I shouldn't have encouraged her, but you know what little children are like these days."]
hypothesis: I'm getting a little carried away. That's what little kids are like at this age.

source: このやり方は諸刃の剣だぞ
references: ['This little game cuts both ways.']
hypothesis: This approach is a double-edged sword.

source: だが、豹変するだろう
references: ['You wait till it turns ugly.']
hypothesis: But he will change.

source: 赤くなっちゃった このワインのせいね
references: ["I'm flushed. Must be the wine."]
hypothesis: I'm turning red. It's this wine.

source: 赤くなった
references: ['Are you blushing?']
hypothesis: Reddening.

source: ＜新しい ショコラティエが オープンして 足を運ばないわけがない＞
references: ["If a new chocolatier opens up, there's no way she won't stop by."]
hypothesis: ＜How could I not visit a new chocolatier when it opens?

source: 俺に身を任せろ
references: ['I need you to trust me.']
hypothesis: I'll take care of you.

source: この春　自分　身を固めようと思いまして
references: ["My girlfriend and I, we're thinking of settling down."]
hypothesis: I've decided to make a move this spring.

source: 頼む、同じ轍を踏むな、いいな？
references: ["Please, don't go down this road again, ok?"]
hypothesis: Please, don't make the same mistake, okay?

source: 途方に暮れたよ 子連れで文無し 定職もない
references: ["I didn't know how I was going to manage with a small boy, with no money and no regular job."]
hypothesis: I'm at my wits' end, with a kid, no money, no regular job.

source: 光の中　俺のために道が開いている
references: ['I shall revel in that fire! In that fire I shall find my bride!']
hypothesis: In the light, the way is clear for me

source: いろんな道が開けてきました 両親に教わらなかったことも
references: ["It helped expose me to things that my parents or friends didn't show me."]
hypothesis: It's opened up a lot of avenues for me, things my parents never taught me.

source: あれほど釘を刺したろ
references: ['You did exactly what I told you not to do!']
hypothesis: I told you, I nailed you to the wall.

source: 一度も音を上げなかった
references: ['That not for a single moment did his courage waver.']
hypothesis: Not once did he raise a sound.

source: わかった、じゃあ頭から
references: ['All right. From the top.']
hypothesis: All right, then, from the head.

source: 2003初頭からMIA 戦死者扱いだった だが もう違う
references: ['MIA since early 2003 and presumed dead... until now.']
hypothesis: MIA since early 2003, but not anymore.

source: ３年生の頭から 監督に謝りに行って
references: ['So at the beginning of my third year... I went and apologized to my coach and asked to start all over again.']
hypothesis: From the beginning of my junior year, I went to apologize to the director.

source: あなた方　捜査官には 頭が下がるけれど
references: ['The Agency appreciates everything your people are doing.']
hypothesis: I bow to you and your agents, but...

source: そんなに頭が切れるなら 何故ここに来たの？
references: ["Then why'd you come up here if you're so smart?"]
hypothesis: If you're so smart, why did you come here?

source: "私が頭が痛くても" "痛い顔したり" "声 出したり"
references: ['Even if my head hurts, no one knows until I cry.']
hypothesis: When I have a headache, you don't make a face or a voice.

source: 頭に入れておきます　ありがとう
references: ['I put it on my to do list ". Thanks.']
hypothesis: I'll keep that in mind. Thank you.

source: 地図は頭に入れておけ
references: ["Next time stay put, you won't need a map."]
hypothesis: Keep the map in mind.

source: 俺達が頭を下げたのはドラゴンだ そしてドラゴンはもう死んだ！
references: ['It was the Dragons we bowed to and now the Dragons are dead!']
hypothesis: We bowed to the dragon. And now the dragon is dead!

source: 友よ... 君達は... 誰にも 頭を下げなくていい
references: ['My friends you bow to no one.']
hypothesis: Friends... You don't... You don't have to bow to anyone.

source: 頭を冷やそう　ここじゃ無理だ 名前は？
references: ["Chill out. Can we just talk about this? What's your name?"]
hypothesis: We need to cool down. We can't do that here. What's your name?

source: 頭を冷やしてくる
references: ['I need some air.']
hypothesis: I'm gonna go cool my head.

source: ベイビー　よく顔を見せて
references: ["- Oh my baby! - You're really here. - Let me look at you."]
hypothesis: Baby, you look so good.

source: 2度と顔を見せるなと言ったのに また帰ってきた こいつと こそこそと...
references: ['I told you never to show your face here again but here you are... snooping around with this...']
hypothesis: I told him not to show his face again, and now he's back, sneaking around with this guy...

source: あいつは食えない奴だ
references: ['Well, george is capable of a lot of things.']
hypothesis: That guy's inedible.

source: 君は本当に食えない女だな
references: ['You are so full of shit, Patty.']
hypothesis: You really are an inedible woman.

source: あと 2人の首が 飛ぶのね
references: ['That means two more heads are about to roll.']
hypothesis: Two more heads will roll.

source: 優しいな　どうでもいいが 誰かに首にされたとして
references: ["That's very kind to say. Unless it stopped being a job because someone fired you, in which case..."]
hypothesis: That's very kind of you. Whatever. If someone fired me...

source: −君は私を首にする。
references: ['- You are firing me.']
hypothesis: -You fire me.

source: 「仕事を首になって アパートから追い出された」
references: ['"I got fired from my job. I got kicked out of my apartment."']
hypothesis: I got fired from my job and evicted from my apartment."

source: お前が首になったのは お前自身のせいだ
references: ["I didn't lose your job for you, Wade, you did that."]
hypothesis: It's your own fault you got fired.

source: 急いだ方が良いぞ 副大統領が皆の首を切ろうとしてる
references: ["And it better be soon, because the Vice President's about to fire us all."]
hypothesis: Better hurry up, the Vice President is about to cut everyone's head off.

source: ところが君は生活の為に オマハで人の首を切りに行った
references: ['Instead you went to Omaha to fire people for a living?']
hypothesis: But you went to Omaha to cut people's heads off for a living.

source: 彼は君を首を長くして待っているぞ
references: ["he's been waiting for you a real long time,man."]
hypothesis: He'll be waiting for you with baited breath.

source: どこの馬の骨だ バーニー？
references: ['Who is this bimbo, Barney?']
hypothesis: Where the hell are you from, Bernie?

source: 何所の馬の骨だ　何の話だ？
references: ["I don't fucking know you. What business?"]
hypothesis: What the hell are you talking about?

source: お前は馬の骨だった
references: ["I didn't know you at all."]
hypothesis: You were a horse's bone.

source: 僕の ビジネスパートナーなら 気骨がある所を 見せてみろ！
references: ["If you are to become my business partner, Macduff, you've got to start showing some backbone!"]
hypothesis: If you're my business partner, show me you got backbone!

source: 彼女は鉄の気骨がある
references: ['That girl has an iron backbone.']
hypothesis: She has an iron backbone.

source: 取り調べは徹底的で 骨が折れ 退屈な作業だ
references: ['The checking of the suspects had been thorough, painstaking, and tedious.']
hypothesis: The interrogations are thorough, painstaking, and tedious.

source: 強敵を見つけるには 骨が折れるが
references: ['Though, you know, finding a worthy opponent has been a little challenging.']
hypothesis: It takes a lot of work to find a strong opponent.

source: 僕は移住はしない この国に骨を埋める
references: ['No, I reject this idea of abandoning my country.']
hypothesis: I'm not emigrating. I'm staying here.

source: せっかくですが私は この銀行に 骨を埋める所存でおります
references: ['but I intend to stay at this bank for the rest of my career.']
hypothesis: But I intend to stay here in this bank for the rest of my life.

source: 彼らの為に骨を折った事がある、 法的に言えば、5年の刑のを。
references: ["Oh, I've been pulling their chestnuts out of the fire, legally speaking, for five years."]
hypothesis: I've broken bones for them, legally speaking, of a five-year sentence.

source: 君を弁護するとすれば、 君が何も見えない様に私が骨を折ったのだ。
references: ['In your defense, I worked very hard to blind you.']
hypothesis: In your defense, I broke my bones so you wouldn't see anything.

source: 一つ骨を折ってみよう
references: ['I will see what we can do.']
hypothesis: Let's break one bone.

source: マスター・スカイウォーカーは鼻が高いでしょう
references: ['Master Skywalker should be proud.']
hypothesis: Master Skywalker would have a nose for it.

source: フェニックス 灰の中から生まれ変わる不死鳥だ
references: ['Phoenix. Risen from the ashes.']
hypothesis: Phoenix, a phoenix reborn from the ashes.

source: あんた 人が変わったみたい
references: ['You seem like a changed person.']
hypothesis: You're like a changed man.

source: この２人が　悪い奴で
references: ['Yes. Uh, those two are the bad guys.']
hypothesis: These two are bad guys.

source: 進歩は始まらないよ 夢の意味を認めらないまま
references: ["You won't make any progress... until you recognize your dreams for what they are."]
hypothesis: Progress will not begin without acknowledging the meaning of dreams.

source: 考えてみてくれ 長椅子に寝ていても何も始まらない
references: ["I'm not gonna get over anything by just lying on the couch. It's not a good idea."]
hypothesis: Think about it, lying on the couch won't get anything done.

source: 他の誰かが彼女の手を取っていたらいやだな
references: ["I don't like someone else's hands on my girls."]
hypothesis: I'd hate to see someone else take her hand.

source: だから、ちょうど私から手を取るのだろうか？
references: ['So will you just take your hands off me?']
hypothesis: So will you just take my hand from me?

source: サー・マンドンは王の旗を掲げろ
references: ["Ser Mandon, you will bear the King's banner."]
hypothesis: Ser Mandon, hoist the King's banner.

source: 休暇を取ったと 聞きましたが
references: ['I was told that she requested emergency leave.']
hypothesis: I heard you took a leave of absence.

source: 何を心配してるの 純資産が　標的になるの？
references: ['What, are you worried that your net worth makes you a target?']
hypothesis: What are you worried about, that your net worth will make you a target?

source: 世界刑事裁判所の代表として 標的になるのが私の役目だ
references: ['the head of the world criminal court, it would make sense for me to be a target.']
hypothesis: As a representative of the World Criminal Court, it is my role to be a target.

source: 限界を見失う前に 標的になる前に
references: ['Before you lose your edge, before you become a target.']
hypothesis: Before we lose sight of our limits, before we become targets.

source: 指が硬くなってる
references: ['From here the tension passes on to your fingers.']
hypothesis: My fingers are getting stiff.

source: それ聞いたあと学校に 行く息子の身になってもみろって
references: ['Imagine going to school with that in your head.']
hypothesis: Put yourself in my son's shoes, who's going to school after hearing that.

source: 弁護側は "被告の身になって" と言うでしょう
references: ["The defense would have you walk in his client's shoes."]
hypothesis: The defense will say, "Put yourself in the defendant's shoes."

source: だから 誰かの 身になって考えるなら どうか グロリアさんの 身になって考えて
references: ["So if you are gonna put yourself in anyone's shoes... put yourself... in Gloria Mitchell's."]
hypothesis: So if you're going to put yourself in someone else's shoes, please put yourself in Gloria's.

source: オーディションに落ちたのは 幸いなんだよ パーティーでの演奏なんて 頭が痛いぞ
references: ["Believe me, Marty, you're better off without having to worry about all the aggravation and headaches of playing at that dance."]
hypothesis: It's a blessing I didn't audition, because playing at a party would have been a head scratcher.

source: 最悪の状況で頭が痛いです
references: ["I'm getting a bad feeling about where this is headed."]
hypothesis: My head hurts from the worst of it.
